articles: -igar: to identify, to make identical (N.B. not used for persons: ri-konocar ulu kom ulu). Ex.: Me prestis a B. la sama libro kam ad A. (t.e. libro tote identa, un libro). La du propozicioni esas identa l'una a l'altra.
idiom-o: idiom, language of a people, tribe, etc.; (cf. idiotismo)
-ala: idiomatic, vernacular, relative to a particular language

idiotism-o: idiotism, idiom, an expression peculiar to itself in grammatical construction; an expression the meaning of which as a whole cannot be derived from the conjoined meanings of its elements; (cf. idiomo)
-ala: idiomatic, relating to the grammatical construction of a sentence; (cf. idiom-ala). Dei.: Frazo ne komprenebla per logikal analizo; VI-192. Ex.: "How do you do" esas Angla idiotismo.

ig-ar: (tr.) to make, cause, render (= suffix -ig- used as an independent verb). Ex.: Igar B. dicar ulo ad A. Igar ulu savar ulo = savigar ulo da ulu. Igar ulu facar ulo = facigar ulo da ulu. Lu igis sua flechi (esar) venenoza. La rejo igis la generalo arestar la policestro.

ignor-ar: (tr.) to ignore, to refuse to notice; disregard wilfully; to overlook (ulu, ulo) intentionally. Def.: Ne volar savar; simular nesavar; VI-165. Ex.: Me savas ke altra faktori existas en la problemo, ma me ignoras li. Ignorar la prczenteso di ulu.
ikonoklast-o: iconoclast, image breaker; (fig.) one who attacks cherished beliefs as shams; a determined enemy of image worship.
iktiokol-o: ichthyocol(la), fish-glue, isinglass, a glue prepared from the sounds of fish.
il: (abbr. of ilu; accus. ilun) he
iliterat-a, -o: illiterate, unlettered (person). Def.: Qua savas nek lektar, nek skribar; VI-486.
ilumin-ar: (tr.) to illuminate, decorate with festal lights or bonfires (cf. lumizar); (fig.) to enlighten the mind of (ulu)
ilustr-ar: (tr.) to illustrate, to provide or adorn (as a book with pictures); (cf. enluminar, klarigar, explikar)
iluzion-ar: (intr.) (cf. trompar), to be laboring under an illusion, delusion
imagin-ar: (tr.) to imagine, to form a notion, a mental image
-ajo: that which one imagines, fancy, conceit
-iva, -ema: imaginative. Ex.: On ne povas imaginar ulo plu extraordinara. Il havas vivaca imaginado. Mento imaginema. V. Exp.: vid. fantaziar.

imaj-o: image, a visible representation of something; statue, effigy, picture, idol, etc.; a picture produced by reflection, refraction, etc.; a natural resemblance, likeness; a mental or printed picture. Ex.: La ikonoklasti kombatis kontre la kulto di imaji. Vidar sua imajo en l’aquo. Deo kreis la homo segun sua imajo (E. likeness); Esas bela imaji (E. pictures) en ca libro.
iman-ar: (intr., philos.) to be immanent, to indwell

imbast-ar: (tr., of tailors, seamstresses) to baste, to run or tack together (the different parts of a garment, cloth). Def.: Sutar per longa steburi e (ordinare) blanka filo, por pose probar; IV-167.
imbecil-a: imbecile, weak-minded. (For discussion of scientific meaning of this and related word, cf. VI-243.
imbib-ar: (tr.) to imbue, to permeate, soak in, drench (speaking of liquids)
imbrik-ar: (tr.) to imbricate, to overlap (ulo, per ulo)
imers-ar: (tr.) to immerge, immerse, to dip, plunge (ulo) into (a liquid)
-ajo: the model or object which is imitated
-achar: to ape, mimic. Ex.: Imitar la signaturo, la manieri, la agi di ulu. Juveli imitita (E. imitation jewels) (cf. kontrafaktar).
-vorto: word of command; Ex.: La patrulo imperis a sua filio departar. Devos imperas a me. V. exp.: vid. komandar.
importac-ar: (tr., com.) to import (goods). Ant.: exportacar.
-anta, -iva: imposing, commanding, striking. Ex.: La vinkinto impozas severa kondicioni a la vinkiti. Impozar puniso, taco, respekto. Ceremonio impozanta.
impregn-ar: (tr.) to impregnate, to fecundate; (fig.) to imbue.
imprek-ar: (intr.) to imprecate, to invoke evil on a person, to curse (kontre ulu); (cf. maledikar). EFIS
impres-ar: (tr., materially and morally) to impress, make an impression on (ulo), to move, affect (ulu); (cf. imprimar)
-isto: impressionist. Def.: Artala verko, qua tendencas expresar o reprezentar l'impresi recevita da l'artisto de la naturo o de la temo; VI-323.
imprim-ar: (tr.) to print (a book, paper, etc.)
improviz-ar: (tr.) to improvise, to compose, recite, sing, etc., extemporaneously; to extemporize; to make, do, or provide offhand
impuls-ar: (tr., phys. and moral) to give impetus to, to impel
imput-ar: (tr.) to impute, ascribe; (cf. akuzar, atributar)
inanicion-o: inanition. Del.: Febleso efektigita da manko de nutrivi. DEFIS
inaugur-ar: (tr., all senses) to inaugurate. DEFIRS
incendi-ar: (tr.) to set fire to; to burn down (maliciously)
incid-ar: (tr. phys. and gen.) to impinge upon, fall upon or affect
incit-ar: (tr) to incite, to spur or urge on (ulu, ad ulo); (cf. instigar)
-o: incitement, incentive; (med.) stimulus. Ex.: Incitar la populo revoltar. Ica pensi incitis il a la venjo.
inciz-ar: (tr.) to incise, to cut in or into (cf. tranchar)
-izar: to indemnify, compensate, recoup. Def.: Kompensal pekunio donita pro domajo, e.c.; II-75
index-o: index, table of contents of a book; hand of a dial, etc.: (R.C. church) forbidden books; (of Bible) concordance; (cf. indik-fingro).
indic-o: indication, sign, token, mark, clue; -i tromp-anta: deceitful tokens
indien-o: (fabric) cotton print, printed calico, chintz.

indiferent-a: indifferent, unconcerned, immaterial; (of persons) cold, unmindful, insensible. Ex.: Sive ni selektas ca voyo sive l'altra, to esas indiferent a me. Il esas indiferent a la laudo ed a la kritiko. Indiferenteso pri temi religiala.
indij-ar: (tr) to be destitute and in need of (ulo)

-o, -eso, -ego; indigence, poverty, penury, want, -anto: necessitous, person; pauper. Def.: Indijo esas la stando di homo indiganta la maxim necesa kozi. (fig.) Indijo di idei. (cf. karear). Ant. : (indijanta) richa.
indik-ar: to indicate, to show or point out, denote, designate (ulo ad ulu)
individu-o: individual, single person, animal or thing
-eso: individuality, character peculiar to an individual
-ale: individually, in an i. or distinct manner, (cf. single)
indolent-a: indolent, slothful, sluggish, lazy, nonchalant
-igar: to render i. Def.: Expresas nelaboremeso qua venas de la mental karaktero, de speco di moleso o deskurajo, II-19. Ant. : ag-iva, -ema; vivaca, impetuoza, diligenta.

indukt-ar: (tr., log.) to induce, to reach (a general conclusion) by inference from a number of individual cases; (phys.) to induce, to influence without direct contact; (phys. log.) induction, inference.
indulg-ar: (tr.) to be indulgent to, make allowance for, forbear to inflict, spare; (cf. komplezar, absolvar)
-anta, -ema: indulgent, lenient. Def.: Dispenar de puniso meritita; IV-562. Ant.: (esar) severa.
-o, -uro: coat(ing), a soft or liquid covering
-ala: infinitesimal, relative to an i. quantity
-ajo: infirmily; Def.: Qua ne povas uzar (libere, normale) irga membro od organo: V-95. V. exp. vid kripla.
inflex-ar: (tr., gram.) to inflect; -o: (gram., geom.) inflection, inflexion; (cl. flexiono, modulacar).
influ-ar: (tr., mental., phys.) to influence, sway ,bias
influx-o: (biol.) influx: act of flowing in
inform-ar: (tr.) to inform, apprise, (ulu, pri ulo)
infr-e: down (as opp. to supre); below, at the bottom (point in space; cl. sube)
-a: lowermost, bottom; inferior: lower in space, degree of importance. quality (cl. suba, inferiora); -ajo: lowermost part, bottom part
infuz-ar: (tr.) to infuse: to steep (without boiling); (surg.) to introduce a liquid into veins; (fig.) to instil, inculcate (principles, etc.).

inglob-ar: (tr., chiefly medic., pharm.) to bland together, put together, (in spherical form). Def.: Ne simple unionar, ma mixar en un sola substanco (globo, quale indikas l'etimologio); anke inkluzar ula substanco (farmaciala) en altra (di altra naturo e saporo), qua envelopas e celas olu; VI-244

ingran-ar: (tr., intr., mechan.) to put in (or throw into) gear, to engage; (cf. embragar, kuplar). Ex. Un roto ingranas (kun) altra, kande ol movas (turnigas) ica per sua propra movo, per denti qui pulsas la denti di l'altra; III-87.
-o, -ant-eso: (qual.) inherency. Ex.: Graveso inheras en (esas inheranta ad) materio.
inhib-ar: (tr.) to inhibit: to check, restran (the activity of); (jur.) to phohibit, interdict.
inici-ar: (tr.) to initiate: to introduce by a first act, take the initiative in; to instruct in the rudiments or pronciples; to introduce into a society, club, etc. by formal rites
injekt-ar: (tr.) to inject (a fluid or other substance into something)
-izar: to inject (a person or thing with an injection)
injeni-ar: (tr.) to exercise one's wits, to set one's wits to work; to contrive (tax one's ingenuity)
injenior-o: engineer (civil, military, mining, etc.); (cf. mashin-isto).
-anta, -ita: inclined, sloped; prone, disposed (cf. tendencanta). Ex.: Ca muro inklinas. La vinko inklinas a lia favoro. Il inklinesas a severeso. Inklino vicioza.
-ar la fingro aden vunduro: to insinuate a finger in a wound
-e: insistently, earnestly. Def. : Perservar demandar. V. exp. On insistas en demando prego. On persistas en stando (mem pure materiala). On obstinas en volo, deziro od opiniono; II-648.
-uro: institution. Ex.: Jesu Kristo dicesas institucir la sep sakramenti Instituco (E. appointment) di judiciisto.
-ala: instrumental: relating to i.s. (as in. i. music); conducive to some end, helpful
-e: in full, bodily. Def.: Ne-tushita, ne-lezita, havanta omna sua parti e membri; V-744.
-igar: to integrate. intelekt-ar: (tr., philos. and general) to understand, comprehend, or know (ulo) by the intellect alone (opposite of to know by sensation, feeling)
-o: intellection, cognition, comprehension, intellect, intelligence (cf. kompreno, inteligent-eso)
-ala: intellectual: relating to process of thought

-ebla: intelligible: that can be known by intellection, opp. to sensible. Ex.: On parolas pri la mondo «intelektebla» opozata a la mondo "sentebla". Do on devas dicar «intelektebla» (qua povas esar objecto dil intelekto). intelekto esas l'ago intelektar; IV-231-2. V.exp.: Me intelektas problemo. Me komprenas vua sentivesopri la morto di vua patro.
-eso: intelligence (cf. intelekto, konoco, savo). Ex.: Il esas tre inteligenta employato. Puero di mikra inteligenteso.
-e, kun -o: intentionally, on purpose. Ex.: Me facis lo kun bona intenco. Il esas homo bone intencanta. me intencas irar morge.
-e: for the time being, ad interim, in the mean time
-igar: to internationalize.  inter-nunci-o: (papal) internucio. interogativ-a, -o*: (gram.) interrogative. Def.: La questionala partikli (adjectivi, pronomi ed adverbi); V-279.
-i: intestines, entrails, bowels: -o tenua: small intestine.
intim-a: intimate: inmost, inward; near, close; close in friendship, familiar, bosom
-eso: intimacy, -ajo: inward part, heart (of a subject)

intoxik-ar: (tr.) to poison, drug, envenom; (N.B. not E. to intoxicate with liquor; cf. ebri-igar); V. exp.: Intoxikar expresas ido plu general kam venen-izar. On povas drinkar veneno sen esar intoxikita; IV-517.
intrados-o: (arch.) intrados: interior curve of an arch.
intrig-ar: (intr.)to intrigue: to contrive by secret artifice; make plots; scheme
intrik-ar: (tr.) to tangle, entangle, embroil, implicate (ulu, en ulo); to make (ulo) intricate.
introdukt-ar: (tr.) to introduce (ulu), to bring (ulo) into notice; to preface; (cf. en-duktar, prizent-ar)
-ala: preliminary. Ex.: Me volas introduktar il che vu. Donar introdukto-letro ad ulu. Ca libro servos kom introdukto a la temo. III-71.
intruz-ar: (tr.) to intrude, obtrude, (su en ulo); to interfere, meddle; (geol.) to enter, or cause to enter, by force.
-o: invective. V.exp.: Invektivo esas nek reprimando, nek insulto, ma atako per parolo ; ol povas esar decanta ed eloquenta. La Quousque tandem esas invektivo da Cicero a Catilina; IV-513-514.
-o, -ajo: the reverse, the contrary, opposite; (cf. reverso)
-igar: to invert, reverse, to put upside down
-o: the same thing. Note: Ispa is ordinarily used in connection with a personal pronoun; as: me ipsa: I myself

-o: going; passage. Note: Irar is often compounded, as: ek-irar, mis-irar, ped-irar, etc. It sometimes takes a direct object, as: li iris penigiva voyo: they went a wearisome way. Def.: Diplasar su de un loko ad altra per irga moyeno; IV-464. Ex.: On iras de Paris a London, parte per fervoyo, parte per navo.
-anta, -ema, -oza: angry, irascible, choleric, testy, cross, peevish
-eskar: to become angry, get in a temper
irg-a: any (whatever): relating to something or someone indefinite (cf. ula)
-izar: to give the hues of the rainbow, become iridescent
-e: again anew, once more, over again. V. exp. vid. repetar.
-eto: landing-stage, gang-way. V. exp.: Warfo  esas nek digo, nek kayo, nam ol ne esas masiva, ma speco de eshafodo  formacita ek ligna o fera trabi; II-712.
weld-ar: (tr.) to weld, forge together (iron, steel)

-o, -uro:  a weld, welding. V. exp.: La F. S. havas nur un vorto por soldar e weldar,  a la I. usas ofte la sama por la du diferanta juntamieri. La soldo e la brazo esas fakte du speci di glutino di du metalspeci per konvenanta metal,  qua esas en la soldo soldostano, en la brazo kupro. Pro la tre diferanta  fuz-temperaturo di stano e kupro, on soldas ye cirkume 300° C. ed on brazas ye cirkume  1000° C. On povas soldar e brazar omna metali, anke du diversa. Ma  on povas weldar nur tre poka de li, ex. loro, la fero (se ol ne kontenas  troa karbo), e.c., e nur du peci di la sama metalo. La weldo konsistas en  varmigo til komencanta fuzo e posa kunbato per marteli, de quo rezultas junturo  preske tam forta kam la solida metalo; III-87.
-a, -ala: westerly: of or relating to the w.
ta: (pl. ti) abbreviation of ita, iti.
tabel-o: a flat surface for writing, painting, drawing, etc., hence that which is thereon: table (of contents), list

-eto: tablet, V. exp.: Tabelo esas omna plata surfaco, qua expozesas a la vido e montras ulo; ne nur la tabelo di materii di libro, ma omna kadro, en qua on expozas nomi od irgaspeca objekti; la nigra tabelo, sur qua la matematikisti skribas; do anke la pikturi, segun quante li esas movebla (ne adheranta a muro, ma pendita e kadrizita). Tabulo esas surfaco plana e horizontala, qua dividas armoro, biblioteko, e.c. e servas por suportar kozi. Ol esas generala ek ligno; ma quale sempre, lua skopo multe plu importas kam lua materio. Tablo anke esas plano horizontala, ma suportata da la sulo, kontre ke tabulo esas parto di moblo, e generale diplasebla vertikale; VI-604.
tabernakl-o: (Hebrew hist.) tabernacle, tent for ark of covenant (R.C. rel.) receptacle of the consecrated vessels; (fig.) holy place
taburet-o: stool: small seat without back (cf stulo)
tac-ar: (tr., of persons) to say nothing about, pass (ulo) over in silence, not to say (ulo); (intr.) to be silent: not to speak, to hold one’s tongue
-igar: to silence, hush (ulu), to reduce (ulu) to silence
tag-o: tag: a metallic point at the end of string; tag (of lace)
-izar: to tag (lace, etc.) i.e. fit with a point
tak-o: (nav.) cleat. Def.: korpo T-forma, fixigita per la bazo di la T: ol utilesas ex. por ligar la navi per kordo (amari); VI-603
takigraf-ar*: (tr.) to tachygraph: write in shorthand
-o: tachygraphy: stenography (especially of the ancient Greeks and Romans).
takimetr-o*: tachymeter, tachometer: instrument for measuring velocity, speed-indicator, -meter.
takt-o: (phys.) sense of touch, feeling; (fig.) tact: nice discernment of what is fit, proper
taktism-o*: (biol.) influence exerted by certain substances upon development of unicellular organisms.
tal-a: such, like: of that kind
-maniere: thus, so, in such a way
tali-ar: (tr.) to cut (out), carve, trim, prune (so as to give a certain form to), to shape (cloth, wood, metal, ivory, etc.)
talon-o: heel (of foot, of shoe); (fig.) anything heel-shaped; as, heel of a keel, of a pipe, etc.
-ecitar: to urge (a horse) with the h.s.
talus-o: a slope, declivity; (of R.R.) embankment; (fort.) talus
-igar: to slope (ulo): -a rivo: steep bank, bluff.

talveg-o*: (physiog.) thalweg: a line following the lowest part of a valley, whether underwater or not; a line of continuous maximum descent from any point on a land surface, or that cutting all contours at right angles (Webster), (gen.) river bed.
tam: (adv.) as (much, etc.; comparative sense; followed by adjective, adverb, or kam)
-agar, -plear: (tr., intr.) to d., beat the drum
tamburin-o: tambour: a small and long snare drum. V. exp.: mi-tamburo.
tamen: (conj.) yet, however, nevertheless, still. Ex.: Lu ne esas bona, tamen me helpos lu. Quankam la pueri ne esas sempre jentila, tamen omna bon-kordia homo esas atraktata a li.
tamp-ar: (tr.) to tamp (as with a hammer), to ram (as with a pile-driver, rammer).
tampon-o: stopper, tampon: plug of cotton, wood, metal, etc.; (artil.) tampion; (cf. stop-ilo)
-izar: to plug (ulo) with a tampon, to stopper.
tandem-e: in tandem: in single line (not abreast): -veturo: carriage with horses in tandem
tang-ar: (intr., nav.) to heave, pitch: rising and falling of bow and stern of ship or boat
tank-o: tank; (fig., milit.) tank. Def.: Vazo metala klozita o klozebla hermetike (ne kuvo qua esas apertita a l’aero); III-491.
tanta, -e: so (great, much, good, etc.); indicates an indefinite or great quantity, degree, number; pl: so many; (cf. quanta, tam)
tap-ar: (tr., tech.) to (screw-) tap (for insertion of screw or making thread for putting on a nut), to worm
tapet-o: tapestry: woven hangings for walls
tapis-o: carpet; cover for billiard table
-eto: small c.; rug; cloth for table, etc.
tapot-ar: (tr., tech., med.) to percuss (as in massage); (gen. sense) to tap.
tar-o: (com.) tare: an allowance made for the weight of the container of goods
-mezurar: (tr.) to tare: ascertain the amount of tare in (ulo)
-igar: to retard, delay, put off, protract, spin out
tarin-o: (orni.) tarin: siskin, aberdevine (genus: Fringilla spinus).
tarj-o: targe(t): species of shield or buckler.
tartan-stofo: (fabric) tartan, plaid (as worn by the Scots).
Tartuf-(ul)o: Tartuffe, a hypocritcal priest in Moliere’s «Tartuffe»; a hypocrite
tast-ar: (intr.) to feel one’s way, grope, fumble
-e, -ante: gropingly, tentatively. Ex.: On tastas en l’obskureso. Ciencisto qua tastas, en sua explori.
tautologi-o: tautology. Def.: Ne simpla repeto, ma vana repeto di la sama ideo sub diversa formi; V-90.
tavern-o: tavern, public-house, wine-shop, pot-house, bar

-anto, -isto: assessor. Def.: Fixigar la quanto de imposto o kontributo quan on debas pri ulo; V-221. Ex.: Taxar lux-objekti. On evaluas la revenuo di ta sioro a 10,000 franki; ed on taxas ol a 400 franki, segun la proporciono di 4 po 100. V. exp.: vid. impostar, evaluar.
tay-o: waist: trunk of the body above the hips
tebaid-o: desert, lonely solitude. V. exp.: Nomo (Thebaid) propra (geografiala) diveninta komuna per metaforo.
ted-ar: (tr.) to bore; (fig.) tire, weary (the spirit)

-anto, -ero: tedious person, bore. Def.: Esar desagreabla ad ulu per neoportuna o tro longa agado od asisto (vizitanto tedis me); fatigar per repeto o per neinteresanta kozo (la koncerto, la spektaklo tedis me). (On povas esar jenanta e mem tedanta nevole e nekoncie); III-35.
teg-ar: (tr.) to cover (a bed, a piece of furniture, etc.); to caparison
-ala: technical. Ex.: La tekniko di la pikt-arto. Teknikala termini.
-izar: to mount, paste, sew, put (ulo) on cloth
telefon-ar: (tr.) to telephone (ulo ad ulu); (cf. telegrafar).
telegraf-ar: (tr.) to telegraph; (ulo ad ulu): (cf. radio-telegrafar)
-umar: to drive together trains, etc., so that one or both slides over the other.
temp-o: time: part of duration (cf. foyo); (gram.) tense (of a verb); (mus.) tempo, time
-ope: from time to time, now and then, at times
temper-ar: (tr., also mus.) to temper: moderate, allay, mollify; (cf. hard-igar)
tempest-ar: (intr. of weather and fig.) to storm: blow with violence, blow a gale; (fig.) to make a great noise, rage, bluster (cf. furiar, bruisar)
-o: tempest, gale, violent storm (with noise of elements) (cf. sturmo, uragano)
-oza: tempestuous; (fig.) boisterous. Ex.: La vento tempestas. (fig.) Lu tempestis pri la konduto di sua pueri. Navo batita da la tempesto. Tempesti di pasiono. V. ex.: vid. sturmo.
-ano: member of a t.; (fig.) knight templar.

-ema, -era; -emo, -ero: procrastinating, temporizing (person). V. exp.: La senco ne esas simple ajornar o vartar, ma plu komplexa: ajornar o tardigar ago, vartante okaziono oportuna. La tipo di temporisero esas Fabius Cunctator; V-676.
ten-ar: (tr.) to hold, have hold of, hold on; to keep in a given situation or position
tenac-a: (tech.) tenacious: strongly adhering or cohering; tough; (cf. persist-ema)
-eso: toughness, tenacity. Ex.: Pecho, metalo, e.c. esas tenaca.
-agar: (tr.) to use p. on (ulo); to hold (ulo) with p. V. exp.: vid. pinco.
tenar-o: (anat.) thenar: ball of hand or foot.
tendenc-ar: (intr.) to tend: be directed to an object or purpose; be inclined, lead to; (cf. vizar)
-anta, -oza, -ema: tending, inclined, biassed, prone, disposed. Ex.: La fairo tendencas adsupre, la stono adinfre. Ca malado tendencas a morto. Tendenco ad egoismo.
tenebr-o: darkness, gloom: (pl., R.C. rel.) tenebræ
tener-a: tender, susceptible to love or kindness, loving (person, heart)
tenon-o: (carp.) tenon. Def.: Extremajo di peco ek ligno, metalo, e.c., qua eniras mortezo.
tens-ar: (tr.) to stretch: draw in length; to strain, tense; (a gun) to cock
-o, -eso: (act, state) stretching, strain, tension, tenseness (physical, mental, social)
-ilo: stretching instrument. Ex.: Tensar kordo, la fingri. Tenso di la muskuli, di la mento. Elektrala tenso. (fig.) To tensas la situeso.
tenu-a: tenuous, thin, spare, fine: thin and long
-igo: attenuation. Def.: Desgrosa; qua havas mikra periferio; qua havas nur la du dimensioni: dina e longa. Ex.: Tenua filo, vaporo, kolono, gambi, voco. V. exp.: vid. dika. Ant.: grosa.
teokrat-o: theocrat. V. exp.: Ne partisano di la teokratio, ma chefo di teokratio; (cf. teokratio); IV-643.
teologal-a: divine (virtue). Ex.: Fido, espero, karitato esas la tri teologala vertui.

-eskar: to become t. V. Exp.: La radiko tepida esas necesa por indikar to quo ne esas kolda: varm-eta e kold-eta esas nejusta od neklara. La metaforal uzado di la vorti esas utila en etiko teologio; II-712.
ter-o: earth (as a planet and as ground; cf. sulo, tereno)
-ajo, amaso: piece of e., object made from e., earhtwork
-izar, -plenigar: to cover, to fill (ulo) with e.
-igar, -izar: to t., to arrange in t.s.
terc-o: (astron., math.) 1/60 of a second; (mus., cards, fencing) tierce.
tercet-o: mus., poetry) terzetto, trio; terza-rima.
terebint-o:* (bot.) terebinth, turpentine tree (genus: Pistacia Terebinthus).
teren-o: terrain: small piece of ground, viewed as to its fitness for some purpose, as for a building, a battle, etc.
teriak-o: (pharm.) theriac(a). Def.: Anciena medikamento kontre veneno.
term-o, -i: thermal (or, hot) spring or spa
termin-o: (gram., math., log.) term (cf. periodo); boundary), boundary mark, landmark; (of R.R.) terminus; (gen.) the farthermost point
-aro: terminology; bounds (to which one may go)
-izar: to bound, set bounds, set landmarks
termologi-o*: thermology: science or theory of heat.
ternion-o*: (math.) ternion, ternary: a form having three variables.
teror-ar: (intr.) to be terrified, be frightened (cf. trepidar)
testac-a: testaceous: covered with hard shell
tetan-ar: (intr., med.) to have tetanus, lockjaw
-ala, segun texta: textual, word for word
tez-o: thesis; proposition, theme supported by argument; undergraduate’s essay.
tifoid-o, tifoida febro: typhoid, enteric fever.
tik-ar: (intr.) to have a local and habitual convulsive movement of the muscles (especially the facial muscles); (fig.) to have a bad habit, an ugly knack; (of a horse) to be vicious
-o: wry motion; bad habit. Ex.: Il tikas (od, havas la tiko) rodar sua ungli.
tiktak-ar: (intr.) to go tic-tac, to tick (as a clock)
til: (prep.) (of time) till, until; (in space) (un) to, as far as
tim-ar: (tr.) to fear (or, to be afraid that) (or, lest) something may happen; to dread, be apprehensive
-igar: to cause to dread, make afraid
-inda, -enda: to be feared, dangerous, redoubtable, formidable
timbr-o: (of a clock) clock-bell; a hand bell (such as used on tables, without a loose clapper but struck by a hammer as in a clock).
timid-a: timid: not bold; bashful, shy
-igar: intimidate. Ex.: Timida mulieri, infanto. Ant.: audac-oza, brava.
timon-o: (single) pole, shaft (of a cart). V. exp.: vid. brankardo.
timpan-o: (anat.) tympanum: drum of ear; (arch.) tympanum; (mus.) dulcimer.
tin-o: tub, water-cask; firkin (for butter). Def.: Speco de vazo konstruktita quale barelo, ma apertita; IV-643.
tini-o: (med) ringworm, especially of the scalp; scald-head; favus; tinea capitis.
tinkl-ar: (intr.) -igar: (tr.) (lente) to toll: sound a bell slowly
-etar, tinklar dolce: to tinke, jingle, clink (as small bells, money); to patter (as feet, sleet against the window, etc.).
tint-ar: (tr.) to dye; (fig.) tint, tinge, stain (cf. kolor-izar)
tip-o: (print., med., nat. hist.) type; (of measures, weights) standard, model; symbol
-a, -ala, -atra: typical. Ex.: Lu esas homo segun la Angla tipo. La paskala agnelo esas la tipo di Jesu Kristo. La tipala traiti di la flava raso.
tir-ar: (tr.) to draw, pull, tug; (of chimneys) to draw; (cf. tranar, haular, vindar, tensar, cherpar, extraktar)
tirad-o: (lit. and fig.) tirade. Def.: Teknikal termino di teatro: longa peco (generale brilanta od eloquenta), quan un persono dicas sen interrupto; III-268.
tirali-ar*: (intr.) to engage in desolutory firing; to bang away; to skirmish fire
-ero: (F.army) tirailleur; a soldier placed so as to harass the enemy; sharpshooter.
titr-ar*: (tr., chem.) to titrate: determine the standard, the dosage of (a solution, a substance)
titul-o: title (of a book, article, person)
-izar: to entitle: give a title to (cf. nomizar)
tizan-o: (med.) tisane: diet-drink, infusion, decoction (of herbs).
tok-o: toque: a flat cap; a close fitting bonnet
toler-ar: (tr.) to tolerate, put up with, suffer, allow, bear, endure (ulo, de ulu)
tombol-o: tombola: a kind of lottery.
ton-o: tone, pitch (of voice) (mus.) tone; degree, pitch of sound; (med.) tone: condition of an organ
-izar: (med.) to give tone to; (photog.) to tone: bring as a print, to a required color (colour)
tond-ar: (tr.) to shear: clip from surface with shears, etc. (cf. rekortar)
tondr-ar: (intr.) to thunder; (fig.) to inveigh (against); (cf. sturmo)
tontin-o: tontine. Def.: Sistemo di mutuala asekuro, inventita da Tonti (1653); IV-643.

topik-a, -o: (medicine or treatment) applied to, or used for, a particular spot; (rhet., log.) general head; argument drawn from the several circumstances and places of a fact. Ex.: Remedio topika. Topiki da Aristoteles.
tord-ar: (tr.) to twist, wring, contort; (med.) to strain, sprain; (of wood) to warp
torefakt-ar: (tr.) to torrefy: to dry, parch, roast (by exposure to heat). Ex.: Torefaktar la kafeo-grani.
torent-o: torrent: rushing stream (of water, words, people, etc.)
torid-a: (geog.) torrid; (cf. tropik-ala, varm-ega). Ex.: Torida zono.
torment-ar: (tr. also fig.) to torment: torture.
toron-o: (nav.) strand (of a rope); (cf. brino). Def.: Una de la kordi, qui kuntordita kompozas plu grosa kordo; V-157.
torped-o: (explosive) torpedo; (ich.) cramp-fish, electric ray, torpedo(-fish)
torpor-ar: (intr.) to be benumbed, or in a state of torpor (as from cold)
tors-o: torso: trunk, chest, bust (of a person or statue).
torsad-o: twisted fringe or cord; bullion (as of epaulets).
tortikol-o: (med.) torticollis: rheumatic pain causing wry-neck; (fig.) stiff-neck, crick in the neck.
tost-ar: (intr.) to give a toast (ad ulu), to drink a friend’s health
-o: toast(ing): drinking (ad ulu) the health, the prosperity.
tot-a: entire; whole (of one thing; cf. omna)
tra: (adv. tra-e): through, across (noting passage or motion in crossing)
trac-o: trace: mark left by foot of man or beast; track; footprint; (hunt.) trail
tradicion-ar: (tr.) to transmit, hand down (ulo) by tradition
trafik-o: traffic: movement of persons, goods, etc. Def.: Movado o cirkulado en komunikilo (voyo, telegrafala lineo, e.c.); III-328. Ex.: La trafiko ye ca strad-angulo esas tre densa.
trahiz-ar: (tr.) to betray, be false to
-e, -ante: treacherously. Ex.: Trahizar sua patrio, la fido di ulu.
trait-o: feature (of the face), lineament; trait, characteristic
trak-ar: (tr.)(hunt.) to drive game, to beat up (a wood); (fig.) to ferret out, close in on; hem in; cut off on all sides
trakt-ar: (tr.) to treat: behave to, or toward (ulu); deal with; handle, discourse on (a subject); (chem.) to subject (ulo) to the action of; (N.B. not medical; cf. kuracar)

trampl-ar: (intr.) to stamp (the feet); (of horses) to paw (the ground). Def.: Frapar la sulo per la pedi, sen avancar; VI-115. Agitar la pedi pro nervozeso od altra sentimento: nepacienteso, iraco, e.c.; IV-587.
tran-ar: (tr.) to draw, drag along, trail (ulo, dop su)
-ajo: anything which drags; trail, train (of a dress)
tranc-ar: (intr., hypnotic, epilep.) to be in a trance or in a hypnotic state
-eskar: to go into a t. Def.: Esar en stando nekoncianta dum epilepsio, hipnoto, e.c.
tranch-ar: (tr.) to cut (completely) through, cut off, carve (meat); (cf. de-tranchar)
-ilo: a cutting instrument, as a knife, etc.
tranquil-a: (physical and mental) tranquil, quiet, still, not in motion
-igar: to (make) still. Def.: Qua esas sen agitado. Ex.: Tranquila vicino, strado, infanto. Restez tranquila. V. exp. vid. kalma.
trans: (prep.) on the other side of, beyond, across, over (with or without motion); (cf. tra)
-a: which is on the other side
-ajo: object beyond or on other side; the hereafter
transakt-ar: (intr.) to come to terms, to compound, compromise (kun ulu, pri ulo)
-ema: inclined to compromise. Def.: Konciliar deskonkordo per reciproka konceso. Ex.: Esas plu bona transaktar kam procesar. On devas ne transaktar kun sua honoro.
-o, -ajo: (act, object) transshipment. Def.: (Trans-)portar personi od kozi de un navo (od, altra moyeni di transporto) ad altra.
transfer-ar: (tr.) to transfer (ulo ad ulu); (cf. transportar). Transfero di ula yuro ad altru.
transfigur-ar: (tr., esp. rel.) to transfigure (cf. transformar).
transform-ar: (tr.) to transform (ulo ad ulo): to change the form of
trans-irar: (tr., intr.) to go across (to the other side), to traverse (cf. tra-irar)
transit-ar: (intr.) to be or pass in transit
-ala: transient: relating to transit (cf. provizora, tempala)
-iva: (gram.) transitive. Ex.: Komercaji transitas de una urbo ad altra. La transito de monarkio a republiko. Transitala komercajo. Verbo transitiva.
translac-ar: (tr., intr., mechan. and fig.) to move, shift (ulo) from one place to another
-o: translation: (mechan.) motion in which all points of the moving body have at any instant the same velocity and direction of motion. (Webster).
translucid-a: translucent: transmitting light imperfectly, semi-transparent. Ex.: Vitro despolisita esas translucida. Ant.: opaka.
transmis-ar: (tr.) to transmit. Ex.: la nervi transmisas la impresi. Transmisar impero. Transmiso di lua vertui a lua filii.
transmut-ar: (tr.) to transmute (ulo ad ulo). Ex.: L’alkemiisti probis transmutar matali ad oro.
transpar-ar: (intr.) to shine (through), glimmer, be visible (tra, sub ulo); (cf. lumar)
-anta: transparent; (cf. diafana). Ex.: Brilanta objekti transparas tra la vitro. Sun-radii transparas tra l’aquo. Roki sub l’aquo esas transparanta per la sun-radii (pro ke l’aquo esas diafana).

transpir-ar: (intr.) to transude, transpire, ooze out, exhale; (cf. exudar, sudor-ifar); (fig. of news) to transpire: be divulged, become known, leak out. Ex.: La humori transpiras tra la pelo. Gasi transpiras de korpi mortinta. Pos la recevo di ta telegramo, nula informo nova transpiris.
transubstanci-ar*: (tr.) to transubstantiate; change into another substance
tras-ar: (tr.) to trace, draw: mark out, delineate, chalk out
-o, -uro: (act, result) tracing; laying out (of grounds, etc.); outline, sketch.
trat-ar: (tr., com.) to draw (a bill of exchange) on
trav-o: trave: a frame to confine an unruly horse or ox while shoeing.
trave-o: truss (of a bridge); (arch.) bay (of joists); (of a church) triforium. Def.: Intervalo di du trabi, fosti, koloni, pilasti. (N.B. ne esas sempre apertita quale pordo o fenestro); IV-644.
-eto: bracket. V. exp.: Travers-eto esas stango horizontala, qua suportas tabuli di armoro, di biblioteko, e.c.; IV-644.
travesti-ar: (tr.) to disguise (by assuming the dress of a person of another sex or condition in life); (fig. burleske) to travesty
-ita, -ito: disguised (person); (cf. maskar, deformar, pariodar). Travestiar viro quale muliero, ula soldati quale rurano.
trek-o: trail: footpath, unfinished road; (of race-course) track
trelich-o: coarse sacking, sackcloth; denim, dungaree cloth. Def.: Speco de grosa tolo, qua uzesas nur por facar saki, ma anke (laborala) vesti; IV-644.
trelis-o: trellis-, lattice-work (of wood or metal) plaited wire-work
tremp-ar: (tr.) to soak, steep, drench, wet (thoroughly) (ulo en ulo). Ex.: Trempar la pano en la vino. Trempar la linjaro. Trempado di la sulo per la pluvo.
trepan-o: (surg., instr.) trepan; (gen.) any boring instrument
trepid-ar: (intr.) to shake, quiver, tremble; (cf. tremar). Ex.: La trepidado di korpo-membri, di la nervi. Vapornavo trepidadas pro la movado di sua mashinaro e la ondi.
tresay-ar: (intr.) to give a start, be startled, (feel a) thrill (de, pro)
trest-o: trestle, wooden horse: a horizontal piece with four legs serving as a support; easel
-eyo: treasury: place where t. is found; (R.C. rel.) place for relics and ornaments: (cf. kas-erio)
-ifar (intr.), -igar (tr.) to treasure up, hoard up. Ex.: La trezori di la tero. Ca infanto esas trezoro.
-o: any three things or persons united; trio, triade, triplet, trey
tribon-o: tribune: a Roman magistrate. Ex.: La tribono acensis sur la tribuno.
tribul-ar: (tr.) to cause tribulation to, to distress, afflict. Ta tempo tribulas nia psiki. La tribuli di autoro.
tribunal-o: tribunal, court (of justice), bench, judgement seat
-anta (ad), -anto, -ero: tributary. Ex.: Tributar a Caesar. Ta lando esas tributanta ad Anglia.
«triduum»: (R.C. rel.) prayers continuing for three days.
triftong-o: (gram.) triphthong. Def.: Grupo di tri vokali formacanta un silabo; V-486.
trigram-o: trigram, trigraph. Def.: Grupo di tri literi reprezentanta un sono; V-487.
triktrak-o: tricktrac: a kind of backgammon,
trist-a: (of persons or things) sad, sorrowful, mournful, cheerless, dispirited, doleful, gloomy
-igar: to sadden, throw gloom over. Ex.: Trista informo, vizajo, adio. La morto di mia amiko tristigas me. Ant.: Gaya, joy-oza, kontenta.
-igar: to make banal. Ex.: Trivial expresuro, stilo.
trog-o: trough (as for animals); hod, tray (as for carrying mortar); (cf. vazo), -o-roto: bucket (of a water-wheel)
troglodit-o: (man or animal) troglodyte: cave dweller.
tromp-ar: (tr.) to deceive, impose upon, delude (denotes intention; cf. eror-igar, deceptar, dup-igar)
-iva: fallacious. Ex.: Trompar la fido di ulu per ulo.
-sidar: to sit enthroned; (fig.) to lord it over
-igar: to cause to trot, to trot (a horse).
trotuar-o: sidewalk, pavement: footway of stone, asphalt, etc.
trov-ar: (tr.) to find, discover, come across
-ajo: thing found; (treasure-) trove; (fig.) godsend, windfall. Ex.: Trovar trezoro, kulpo, voyo, amiko.
tru-o: hole, gap (cf. apert-uro, kavo, brecho)
trubadur-o: troubadour. V. exp.: Trubaduri apartenas a Suda Francia, e truvero a Norda Francia (e vicina landi); IV-645.
trubl-ar: (tr.) to trouble, disturb, muddle: throw into disorder; (of liquids) to make turbid or muddy; (cf. konfuz-igar, perturbar)
-izar: to stuff, or cover with t.s.
truism-o: truism. Def.: Verajo evidenta, triviala, di aqua l’enunco esas neutila, do ridinda; V-487.
truk-o: (R.R.) flat-car (cf. var-vagono). Def.: Fervoyala, platformatra var-vagono neklozita.
trumpet-o: trumpet: large, keyless bugle (cf. klariono)
-agar, plear: to play the t.; (fig.) to t. forth, spread abroad
trunk-o: (also geom.) trunk of a tree
trup-o: troop, band: company of persons having same occupation; (theat.) company, troop; (of animals) band, herd, flock

trus-ar: (tr.) to tuck up, put a tuck in; turn up, pin up, tie up. V. exp.: Trusar esas nek levar, nek faldar: on trusas robo, mantelo, maniki, pantalono, bordi di chapelo, mustacho; mem figurale nazo esas trusita; III-471.
truver-o: trouvère, trouveur. V. exp.: vid. trubaduro.
tu: (acc.: tun; pl.: tui ) thou: familiar form of 2nd person singular: you; used in speaking to a child or an intimate friend
tualet-ar: (intr.) to make one’s toilet: wash and dress; careful adjustment of dress, etc.
tub-o: tube, pipe (of lead, iron, etc.)
-izar, -agar: to tube, pipe: put tubes in (ulo)
tuber-o: (anat., bot.) tuberosity; node; (of wood) knot
-ala, -oza: tubercular, tuberculous: relating to the disease
tuberkul-o: (bot.) tubercle; (physiol.) a small tumor (tumour), or tumorlike elevation; (cf. tubero).
tuert-a, -(ul)o: one-eyed (person): blind in one eye.
tuf-o: tuft, bunch, cluster, clump, wisp (of straw: assemblage of things of the same nature: threads, feathers, hair, etc. (cf. penacho)
tuk-o: (a piece of) cloth; (cf. drapo, stofo)
-arboro: t. tree, whitewood, white poplar: liriodendron (Liriodendron Tulipifera).
tumefakt-ar: (tr., med.) to tumefy, cause to swell
tumul-o: (antiq.) tumulus, barrow, cairn, burial mound.
tumult-ar: (intr.) to raise a tumult, disturbance, uproar, hubbub, to (cause a) row, a riot
tunik-o: (coat of soldiers, pupils) tunic, an antique undergarment; (anat.) coat, film, tunic (of the eye); wall (of the stomach); (bot.) coat, integument
turn-ar: (tr., intr.) to turn (from right to left), turn around, to (cause to) move circularly), twist, whirl, wheel around; (cf. jirar, rotacar, renversar, volvar, tornar)
turnir-ar: (intr.) to hold a tournament, to joust, to take part in a tourney.
-etar: to cough: clear one’s throat, to hem
tush-ar: (tr., intr.) to touch, be in contact with.. (N.B. not concern); to put one’s hand, foot, etc. (on); (cf. palpar, kontaktar, kontigua)
-ebla: tangible (cf. palp-ebla). Ex.: Tushar ulo per la fingri. Lua pedi tushis la sulo. Regardez ol, ma ne tushez.
tutel-ar: (tr.) to be guardian of (ulu) -esar da ulu: to be under the guardianship of someone
-igar, ulu: to place someone under the guardianship (of another person)
tuv-ar: (tr., nav.) to warp: move a ship or boat by a rope or cable attached to some fixed object
-eso: ubiquity. Def.: Qua esas omnaloke; IV-270.
ul-a: some, any: indicates a certain, but only partly defined person or object;  (semi-indefinite article) a, an (used only where it is desired to emphasize indefiniteness)
ultr-a: ultra: beyond due limit; further, additional
-e: (prep., adv.) besides, further, moreover, in addition (to this)
ulul-ar: (intr.) to ululate: (of owls) to hoot; (of dogs, wolves, etc.)  to howl.
un: (cardinal) one (for derivative forms, cf. du)
-igar:  to unify: to form into one (cf. uniform-igar)
-esme: first, at first, first of all
unik-a: unique; without another of the same kind; only, single, sole; (fig.) unequalled,  unrivalled, unparalleled, unprecedented (cf. nura)
unikorn-o: (also astron.) unicorn: a fabulous animal.
union-ar: (tr., immaterial sense) to unite (cf. juntar, ligar)
urogal-o: capercailzie: the largest European grouse (Tetrao urogallus).
-ago: (med.) urtication: whipping or  stinging with nettles.
usher-o: usher (judicial courts, etc.). Def.: Ta qua komisesas oficale por konocigar ed  exekutigar la judiciala decidi.
-esar: to be useful (ad); to be used (por)
-igar: to utilize,  turn to good use, turn to account, avail oneself of
uz-ar: (tr.) to use, employ: make use of (ulo); to wear out (clothing, etc.)
uzufrukt-ar: (tr., jur.) to have the usufruct of (ulo).
uzukapt-ar: (tr., jur.) to have the usucaption of (ulo).
uzurp-ar: (tr.) to usurp (ulo de ulu); to encroach upon, trench upon, infringe
-o: usurpation, encroachment. Ex.: Uzurpar la trono, ula yuro, povo, domeno.
macedoni-o: macedoine: a dish consisting of a medley of fruit and vegetables; (fig.) medley, hodgepodge.
macer-ar: (tr., intr.) to macerate: soften by steeping.
«macfarlane»: macfarlane: a kind of overcoat without sleeves and with a mantle.
madelen-o: madeline: a small rich cake.
madon-o: madonna: a picture or statue of the Virgin Mary.
madrigal-o: madrigal: a part song or glee; a little amorous poem.
maestr-o, -ulo, -ino: maestro: a teacher of eminence, or one eminently skilled in some art or science
magnat-o: magnate: a nobleman of Poland or Hungary.
magr-a: lean, meager, lank, spare; (of things) poor, sorry, scant, meager
-ega, -acha: emaciated. Ex.: Magra Homo, vizajo, bovo, karno. (fig.) Magra burso, repasto, sulo, amuzo. Ant.: grasa.
maiflor-o: (bot.) lily of the valley (Convallaria majalis).
maiz-o: maize: (U.S.) corn; (England) Indian corn; (Zea mays).
majest-o: majesty, supreme grandeur, august dignity, stateliness; (cf. Sinioro, la rejo, e.c.)
-o, -ulo, -ino: one who has attained his majority; (mus. and logic) major
majorat-o: majorat; (in France) landed property attached to a title and descending with it; entailed estate.
majoritat-o: majority: more than half of a given number or group; (cf. plu-mult-o).
-izar: to macadamize: cover a road with small broken stones.
makak-o: (zool.) macaque: a genus (Macaca) of short-tailed monkeys.
makaron-o: macaroon: a kind of cake.
makaronik-o: macaronic. Def.: Dicesas pri verki kompozita en Latino barbara e burleska; IV-394.
makul-o: (also fig.) macula: spot, blotch, stain
makulatur-o: (print.) maculature: waste or spoiled paper.
mal-a: bad, evil, ill (quality, acts, writing, condition, weather, news, sense, etc.)
-ajo: (gen. sense) bad object, act, event; hardship, misfortune; mischief
-eta, -ema: poorly, sickly, somewhat unwell, ailing, indisposed

maldicens-ar: (intr., tr.) to speak ill (pri ulo), to disparage, decry (ulu, ulo); (cf. denigrar, difamar, kalumniar). Def.: Dicar malajo pri ulu, ulo, pro mala intenco. V. exp.: La civila lego punisas la difamo, na la maldicenso; ica resortisas nur a la etikal lego.

male-ar: (tr.) to cold-forge. Def.: Form-izar per martelo (en kolda stando). V. exp.: Forjar esas la sama ago, en varma stando. Martel-agar esas nejusta o nesuficanta, nam on povas martel-agar irga kozo, sen malear ol; la kozo povas rezistar, o ruptesar, o deformesar altramaniere; V-493.
maledik-ar: (tr.) to curse, imprecate, damn (ulu, ulo); (cf. blasfemar, imprekar)
malgre: (prep.) in spite of, despite, notwithstanding, against the will of
-ke: (conj.) notwithstanding that (followed by verb; cf. tamen)
mali-o: a mallet or mall used in play

-ajo: malicious or mischievous act. N.B. The sense of this word is by no means always «malice». It is something between evil intention and keen wit with a tinge of each in it, sometimes having more of the one, sometimes more of the other.

malign-o: malicious, pernicious, evil, ill-disposed, malign, baleful. (N.B. Maligna is used in a somewhat less strong sense than the E. «malignant»; and properly means: disposed to take pleasure in the misfortune or suffering of others
malyot-o: bathing-tights, -dress; (tights as for acrobats, cf. kalz-ego).
manch-o: (long) handle, hilt, haft; neck (of musical instr.)
mandat-o: money order (as P.O.; cf. cheko).
mandibul-o: mandible; (zool.) either the upper or lower, part of the beak of a bird; (anat.) lower jaw; (cf. maxilo)
mandor-o: (mus.) mandore: a kind of stringed lute.
mandrel-o: (tech.) mandril, mandrel. Def.: Utensilo por kurvigar plaki, dilatar tubi, e.c.; IV-336.
manekin-o: manikin, lay figure, dummy. Def.: Figuro imitanta la formo di homo o di animalo; ofte artikizita; III-327.
manet-o: (tech.) hand-lever, movable handle or knob.
mani-o: mania, monomania: derangement of the mind especially upon a single subject
-ika, -oza; -iko, -ozo: maniac(al); (cf. monomani-iko). Ex.: Il havas mani(et)o skribar, kompozar. Mani(et)o pri kultivado di tulipi.
manier-o: manner, way of doing anything; or acting; method; mannerism; (pl.) behavio(u)r, deportment, (cf. kustumo, modo)
manifest-ar: (tr.) to manifest, make to appear, make known
-a: manifest, no longer concealed (cf. evidenta, vid-ebla, notora, publika). Ex.: Deo manifestas su per sua laboruri. Manifesta eroro.
manik-o: sleeve (of a garment, or any sleeve-like object)
manipul-ar: (tr.) to manipulate; to treat, work or operate with the hand.
manipulator-o: sounding-key; apparatus used to send messages (telegraphic, etc.) by breaks in the current.
manjar: (tr.) to eat: chew and swallow; (fig.) to eat away; consume
-ajo: something eaten or to be eaten; food, victuals (cf. nutr-iva, disho)
mank-ar: to be lacking, wanting, missing; (cf. indijar)
-o: want, lack, absence, deficiency, shortcoming, need
manometr-o: manometer: a pressure or vacuum gauge; steam gauge.
manovr-ar: (tr., intr.) to maneuver (manœuvre) (troops, ships); (fig.) to manage, or bring about, with skill (an affair, etc.).
mansard-o: garret; story or room under a sloping roof (cf. atiko).
manshet-o: cuff (detachable or not, of shirts, gowns); (cf. ponyeto, paramento). Def.: Parto (ordinare starchita) qua finis maniko di kamizo e cirkondas la karpo; VI-245.
mante-ar: (tr.) to toss (ulu) in a blanket.
mantel-o: (garment) mantle, cloak; (arch.) mantel (as over a fire-place)
manten-ar: to keep fast, hold fast, sustain (in a state of stability)
mantis-o*: the decimal part of a logarithm.
-a, -ala: of or relating to the sea, marine, maritime (cf. nav-ala)
-kolo, stret-ajo: arm of the sea, strait
marabut-o*: Marabout. Def.: Mohamedista kleriko od ermito; VII-280.
maraskin-o*: maraschino: a kind of liquor.
march-ar: (intr.) to walk, step, tread; (of soldiers) to march

-etar: to trip along (of children). Def.: Facar pazi, pozar alterne la pedi sur la sulo, irge qua esas la direciono o la skopo di ta ago (ne rezervata a la militala marcho, o la militala komandi); IV-464.
marchand-ar: (tr.) to bargain for, beat down the price of, haggle about
marcipan-o: marzipan, marchpane: a kind of sweetmeat.
mare-o: tide, ebb and flow (cf. fluxo, refluxo)
-ego: bore, eagre: rush of water up an estuary; wave caused by meeting of two tides.
mariaj-ar: (tr.) to marry; legally unite in wedlock (by an official, priest, minister); (cf. spoz-igar, aliancar)
-anto, -ero: person officiating at a marriage, match-maker

-anunco: banns. V. exp.: L’ago mariajar implikas 3  personi; la homulo e la homino mariajata, e la legal (o religial) oficisto, qua mariajas (unionas) li. Do, segun rigoro, la verbo mariajar povas havar quale subjekto nur l’oficisto. Per extenso, on povas dicar ke la homulo e la homino mariajas su, pro ke lia volo esas ya la kauzo di la mariajo; II-726. La sacerdoto mariajas Maria e me. La patrulo di Maria grantis Maria e me kom spozino. Maria spozuligis me. Me spozinigis Maria, od, me mariajis me kun Maria.
marin-ar: (tr.) to marinate: to salt or pickle, as fish, and then preserve in oil or vinegar
marjin-o: margin (of book, of paper); (fig.) border, edge (of anything)
«mark»: (money) mark; (weight) mark; an old weight: 8 oz. (ounces).
mark-o: mark: token by which anything is known; stamp
-ifar: to produce a mark, leave a trace
markot-ar: (tr., hort.) to layer: bend a shoot or branch to the ground and cover with earth so as to take root
-umar: to stain or vein like marble.
marod-ar: (intr.) to maraud: rove in quest of plunder; (tr.) to plunder.
marquiz-o: marquee: a large field tent; an ornamental verander or penthouse overhanging a balcony, window or door.
marsh-o, -lando: marsh, morass, bog, fen, swamp.
Martin-somero: St. Martin’s summer: warm, damp season in England and southern Europe from November to about Christmas.
marvel-o: wonder, marvel, prodigy. Def.: Ulo qua efikas astoneso od admiro per aparta beleso, grandeso o stranjeso, mem per superhomeso o supernatureso; II-19.
mas-o: mass: body of matter cohering in one body, usually of considerable size; (cf. amaso, bloko, turbo).
masakr-o: (tr.) to massacre. Def.: Mortigar un (od, plu generale) plura personi kruele o senbezone; III-698.
mash-o: mesh, link (as in knitting, etc.)
-isto: machinist: one who runs or constructs m.s
-agar: to use or operate a m.
mashinac-ar: (tr.) to machinate: plan or contrive in secret with evil purpose.
-o: a large solid mass (as of masonry); a block (of flowers, trees, etc.); bulk (of a mountain or hill).
mask-ar: (tr.) to mask (to cover the face with a mask, not travestiar)
maskaron-o: (arch.) carved or moulded face (or figure). V exp.: To ne esas masko, ma vizajo plu o min groteska, skultita IV-336.
mason-ar: (tr.) to do mason’s work on: to build (with stone, brick, etc.); to wall up, seal up (a door, etc.)
-izar: to put m.s on, in (a ship, etc.)
mastic-o: mastic: a resin from the mastic tree; any of the pasty cements, esp. putty
mat-o: mat, matting (of straw or other materials).
materi-o: (also fig. as of discourse, book, etc.) material, matter (out of which something is made)
-igar: to materialize: to make (a spirit) visible in or as a material form
matid-a: dull, hollow (of sound); mat(t), dead, dull, not shiny, glossy (of colo(u)rs, etc.). Ant.: sonora, bril-anta.
matin-o: morning, forenoon: time from dawn to midday
matlot-o*: matelot: a kind of fish-stew; a kind of sailor’s dance, hornpipe.
-aquo: (chem.) mother-liquor. V. exp.: Matro esas la sentimental equivalanto di patrino; VI-535.
matrikul-o: matricula: register in which names are entered consecutively, as for a hospital, prison, society, etc.
matur-a: (also fig.) ripe, mature: having become completely developed
-igar: to cause to ripen or come to maturity
matutin-o: (R.C. Ch.) matins. Def.: «Ofico» di la matino; V-340.
maxil-o: maxilla: upper jaw bone (cf. mandibulo)
mayuskul-o: capital or uncial letter, majuscule. Ant.: miniskulo.

maz-o: mace. Def.: Baston(ego) plu grosa ye un extremajo kam ye l’altra; ica servas kom mancho, e l’enesma havas nodi, o klovi o saliaji; II-709. La mazo moderna esas uzata quale ceremoniala insigno, ex.: en parlamento.
me: I, me; (acc. me, or in case of necessity men)
mecen-o: Maecenas; (fig.) patron of art and science.
mech-o: wick (of lamp, of candle); tinder; (artil.) quick-match
medi-o: (also nat. sciences) environment, surroundings; (of people) circle, set; (cf. cirkum-aji)
mediac-ar: (tr.) to mediate: to intervene, interpose between people or in something to harmonize or reconcile
median-a*, -o: (geom., and fig. in zool., anat., bot.) median (middle), mesial. Def.: Rekto qua juntas somito di triangulo a la mezo dil latero opozita; VII-280.
mediat-a: mediate: intermediate, not direct or immediate, indirect
-igar: to mediatize: to make intermediate, render mediate
-doktoro: doctor of m., -student(ul)o: student of m.

-acho: quack. V. exp.: Per mediko on devas komprenar medicinisto praktikanta, kontre ke medicinisto (segun l’etimologio) esas irgu qua okupas su profesione pri medicino (mem nur teoriale). Profesoro di medicino, exemple, esas medicinisto, ma povas ne esar mediko. Kuracisto signifikas ta qua (profesione) kuracas, sive mediko, sive ne; VI-141.
medit-ar: (tr., intr.) to meditate, think over, ponder (cf. projetar); Ex.: Meditar (pri) ula verajo, la paroli di evangelio-libri. Il pasas sua tempo en meditado. Meno meditema.
mefit-o: mephitis: noxious or foul exhalation, especially from earth; (mines) choke-damp.
megalit-a: megalithic: consisting of large stone

mejis-ar: (tr.) to taw (skins). Def.: Specala maniero preparar la peli, precipue la mikra peli: mikra bovyuno, mutono, mutonyuno, kapro-yuno, por fabrikar ganti, delikata shui, e.c. La mejisado esas specala karakterizata per to ke la tanago di la peli, vice facesar per tanoza extrakturi, quale la tanago propre dicita, esas facata per specala mixuro blankatra kompozita de aluno, vitelo e marala salo; VI-245.
-ala: mechanical; relative to mechanics or the laws of motion (cf. mashin-ala)
-isto: mechanician: one learned in the theories of mechanics (cf. mashin-(if)isto). Ex.: omna movi di korpi esas mekanikal, la libera falo di korpo, same kam la falo di vapor-martelo.

mekanism-o: (philos., mechan, and fig.) mechanism, machinery; structure; mechanical parts. Def.: Ensemblo di la mekanikal relati, kun egardo a la dispozeso di la parti; VII-205. Ex.: La mekanismo do horlojo od altra mashino. La mekanismo esas ulo abstraktita, la strukturo, la dispozeso di la parti di la aparato.
-oza: melancholy, dispirited, gloomy (of mind); (cf. trista). Ant.: gayeso.
mele-o*: melee; a general had to hand fight.
mem: (adv.) even, still, (in comparson); (emphasis) really, indeed (cf. ya)
membr-o: member (of society, community, party, parliament, of an equation); limb (of body)
«memento»: (R.C. ch.) memento: prayers for living and dead.
memor-ar: (tr.) to remember, recollect, have a memory of; (cf. merkar)
-igar: to cause (ulu) to remember, remind, bring to mind, commemorate
memorand-o: memorandum; (of societies, academies); (dipl.) memorial: a note or informal state paper used in diplomacy.
memorial-o: memoir. Def.: Historiala verko, en qua l’autoro naracas l’eventi di sua vivo o di sua tempo; IV-172.
menaj-o: housekeeping: administration, cleaning and general management of a house, especially apart from mere cooking arrangements
-isto, -ulo, -ino, -estro: housekeeper. Def.: Domal (hemala) ekonomio o servado; IV-66.
menajeri-o: menagerie. Def.: Kolekturo de animali rara o sovaja por expozo; III-327.
mencion-ar: (tr.) to mention, make mention of
mens-o*: (of abbeys) revenue; (fig.) table-money, allowance for table.
menstru-ar: (intr., physiol.) to menstruate, have the monthly flow
ment-o: mind: seat of consciousness, thought, volition and feeling; mentality: cast or habit of mind (cf. spirito, psiko, intelekto)
menti-ar: (intr.) to lie, tell a falsehood (pri, per)
menuz-ar: (intr.) to do fine carpenter’s or joiner’s work
-isto: cabinet-worker, joiner (cf. eben-isto). V.  exp.: vid. karpentar.
mercer-o: (Eng.) mercer’s business, haberdasher’s trade. (U.S.) dry-goods business
-isto: mercer, haberdasher: a dealer in textile fabrics, trimmings, and small articles of dress.
mering-o: (cook.) meringue: a kind of icing and cake made of it.
merit-ar: (tr.) to deserve, merit (ulo de ulu)
-o: merit, worth, desert. Ex.: Meritar laudo, puniso, rekompenso.
merk-ar: (tr.) to mark, to impress (ulo) on one’s memory, to retain or remember) a thing, keep in mind, (cf. memorar)
merkat-o: (aslo fig. as in polit. econ.) market: public place for selling. Def.: Vendeyo publika; III-466. Stando di la ofro e demando di vari en un urbo o loko; II-76.
merlon-o*: (fort.) merlon. Def.: Parto (solida) di muro inter du kreneli; VII-280.
merluch-o: (ich.) merluce: the European hake (Merlucius vulgaris).
mesaj-o: message: official communication, diplomatic, parliamentary; (cf. letro, send-ajo).
meskin-a: mean, paltry (person, act); narrow, illiberal (ideas, policy); stingy, niggardly (persons, policy); shabby (room, person)
-ajo: mean or paltry thing or act, shabby trick. Def.: Qua indijas larjeso, alteso (precipue etikala); III-10.
mestic-a, -o: (of persons, animals) half-breed, mixed-breed; mestizo: a peson of mixed Spanish and American Indian blood; (cf. mulato, hibrido); (cf. V-33).
mestier-o: trade, handicraft: occupation or business in which manual or mechanical labo(u)r is necessary, as that of a carpenter or mason
met-ar: to put on , don (clothing, ornaments); (cf. vest-izar)
-ebla: wearable: which can be put on.
metafraz-o: metaphrase: literal translation. Def.: Expliko qua konsistas en tradukar loko (frazo) en plura klara, simpla e vulgara vorti; V-485.
-a, -ala, -oza: metallic: of m., relaing to m., full of m.
-izar: to metallize; to coat or impregnate with m.
metalurgi-o*: metallurgy: science and art of preparing metals from the ores (not the extracting of ores; cf. metal-ifo).
metod-o: method: special or definite system of procedure; (of things) –ala: methodical; (of persons) –oza: methodical
-ale, -oze: methodically. Ex.: Il facas omno segun metodo (od, metodoze). Metodala aranjo.
metonomazi-o: metonomatosis. Def.: Chanjo di propra nomo per traduko, qua celas ol; V-485.
-ala: (measure or verse) metrical. Note: A list of metric abbreviations may be found in IV-608-9.
metropol-o: metropolis: a chief or capital city.
-grada, -valora: (of quantities) average; (math.) mean; (gen.) middling, mediocre, tolerable (cf. pasabla)
mezur-ar: (tr.) to measure (with an instrument), to survey (land)
mi: mi, third note of diatonic scale.
miaul-ar*: (intr.) to mew: to cry as a cat, to caterwaul, miaou.
-mixuro: oxymel: a mixture of vinegar and honey
mien-o: (of the face) look(s), mien, countenance, -acho: affected, lackadaisical, simpering look
migren-o: megrim: a kind of sick or nervous pain affecting one side of the head, hemicrania. ?DeFIR
migrenin-o*: (med.) a kind of remedy for megrim or hemicrania.
-ope: little by little, bit by bit
-igar: to make small, belittle; (cf. min-grand-igar, diminutar), -o-kosmo: microcosm. Ex.: Mikra spaco, chambro, homo, sumo, nombro, merito. Ant.: granda.
mikrograf-o*: micrographer: one versed in micrography.
mikrografi-o: micrography: description of microscopic objects.
mikrozo-o: microzoa: animals of microscopic smallness.
milit-ar: (intr.) to (make) war; (fig.) to militate; (por, kontre)
-igar: to militarize: to bring into a condition of (or imbue with) militarism. Ex.: On dicas, ke la maxim bona metodo kuracar militaristo esas igar lu militisto.
mim-ar: (tr.) to mimic: express by dumb show, as for ridicule
-eso: mimicry; imitative resemblance of one animal to another or to some inanimate object.
min-ar: (tr.) to undermine, to mine: extract ores, etc.; (cf. sub-destruktar) (milit.) to sap
minac-ar: (tr.) to menace, to threaten (ulu, per ulo). Ex.: Il minacis mortigar me. La muro minacis krular (E. the wall totters). Kolero esas minaco.
-igar: to mineralize: transform into a mineral
-izar: to mineralize: to cover or impregnate with mineral.
minestrel-o: minstrel: poet, singer of the Middle Ages.
miniatur-o: miniature; a small and delicate painting, as a portrait; a representation on a much reduced scale.
minion-a: small and dainty, daintily pretty
-ino: a daintily pretty girl or woman; (fig.) darling, pet
ministeri-o: administrative or executive department of a government of which a ministro is the head (cf. V-158)
minium-o: minium: red oxide of lead; (paint) red-lead.
minor-a: (jur.) minor: under age; (logic, music, eccl.) minor
minoritat-o: minority: the smaller number. Ant.: majoritato.
minuci-o: minutia, trifle, minor detail: -i: minutiae
-ema: (person) particular; attentive to detail, fastidious, hairsplitter
minuskul-o: (print.) small letter; (in manuscripts) miniscule. Ant.: mayuskulo.
minut-o: (of time: astron., geom. of degree) minute.
miriad-o: myriad: an immense number; (antiq.) ten thousand.
miriametr-o: myriameter: ten thousand meters (metres); 6.2 miles.
-iero: bilberry plant: European whortleberry plant (Vacinium Myrtillus).
mistifik-ar: (tr.) to hoax, mystify: mischievously deceive someone in sport
-agar, -o-pafar: (tr.) to fire grapeshot, shrapnel at or on.
mix-ar: (tr.) to mix, mingle, blend (ulo kun ulo)
mizer-ar: (intr.) to be in misery (because of poverty, destitution, or unhappiness or pain)
-o: misery, wretchedness, want, sore need, distress.
mnemonik-o: mnemonics: art or system for developing the memory.
mobl-o: a piece of furniture: any movable object serviceable or use or decoration of an apartment
-izar: to furnish (a house, room, etc. with furniture)
mod-o: mode: a passing usage which depends upon taste, caprice; fashion, style; (gram.) mood (indicative, imperative, etc.); (philos., mus.) mode; (jur.) modus
model-o: model (of a machine, etc.): copy or standard to be followed
moder-ar: (tr.) to moderate: keep within bonds (passions, zeal, ardour, etc.); to abate (a price), reduce (one’s expenses); mitigate (a sentence)

modest-a: modest: not bold or presumptuous; not boastful or obtrusive; (N.B. «modest» in the sense of observing sex proprieties is translated by pudor-oza, chasta, dec-anta). V. exp.: vid. diskreta. Ant.: Superba, pretend-ema, arog-ema, vanitat-oza, fatua.
modifik-ar: (tr.) to modify: make partial changes in (cf. chanjar)
-ivo: (gram.) a modifying or qualifying word. Ex.: Modifikar lego, frazo, puniso.
modlar: (tr., sculpt.) to make a model (in clay, wax) of something from which a statue or other work is to be executed or enlarged.
modulac-ar: (tr.) to modulate: pass from one key to another without break in melody; to inflect, vary ( the voice in speaking).
mok-ar: to laugh at: ridicule, deride, mock, rally, gibe, scoff
mol-a: soft: easily yielding to pressure, not hard; (cf. dolca); (of muscles) flabby (cf. laxa); (of meat) tender; (of fruits) mellow

molest-ar: (tr.) to molest, pester, annoy, bother. V. exp.: Molestar signifikas volata tedado per tormenteti o persekuteti. La vorto bone tradukas la F. brimer (E. to play jokes on), qua esas molestado impozita kom probo a la novici en armeo, lerneyo. Anke on povas dicar: «la dogano esas konstanta molestado por la voyajanti»; III-35.
moli-o: mole, jetty (used as a harbor (harbour) breakwater).
molos-o: a species of watch-dog (Canis familiaris molossus); (pros.) Molosian metre.
monet-o: (of gold, silver, copper) coin, cash, change, specie; (fig.) currency; (cf. pekunio)
-papero: paper money: which takes the place of coin (cf. bankobilieto)
-igar: to monetize: put into circulation, give a standard value to in currency
-ifar: to coin, mint into money; to raise money
monoftong-o*: (gram.) monophthong: a single vowel sound; a combination of two vowels pronounced as one.
monokl-o: monocle, single eye-glass. Def.: Unika aparta okulvitro; V-1.
-ajo: (paint) monochrome picture; camaieu. Def.: (monokrom-ajo) Pikturo per un sola koloro, plu o min klara; VI-480.
monomani-o: (med.) monomania: insanity upon one particular subject (cf. manio)
montant-o: upright: piece of any framework, wood or iron; stanchion, beam, post, side-piece (of a ladder).
montr-ar: (tr.) to show, exhibit: make to see or know
moquet-o: moquette: a kind of velvet carpeting; Wilton carpeting.
mor-i: manners, habits, conduct considered from the moral point of view; (cf. etiko)
-ala: habitual, customary: relating to mori (N.B. not conforming to the rules of right conduct, righteousness. A moral man = etikala homulo; cf. IV-233)
morb-o: disease, malady, distemper: the illness itself; (for state, condition, ill person, cf. malad-a, -eso)
morel-o: (bot.) morel: an edible fungus (Morchella esclenta).
morg-e: tomorrow, (la) morga dio, morgo: the next day, day after
mors-o: bit (of a bridle); (fig.) curb, check, restraint.
mort-ar: (intr., lit. and fig.) to die, cease to live, depart this life; (of fire) to go out; (of movement) to come to an end
-igar: to deprive of life; cause to die, kill, execute, put to death (by natural or artificial means); (cf. ocidar, asasinar, sen-kap-igar, masakrar)
-eskar: to be dying, be on the point of death
mortifik-ar: (tr., rel. and fig.) to subdue the passions and appetites by severe discipline; (N.B. for sense of «to humiliate», cf. sham-igar, vexar).
mot-o: motto (of a book, a chapter).
motiv-o: motive: that which excites to action, determines choice; (mus.) motif
-izar: to state the motive or grounds of (an opinion, act); (fig.) to justify
motor-o: (mechanical) motor: moving power, that which imparts motion
mov-ar: (tr., intr.) to move, set in motion, stir, propel
moyen-o: means, medium (through which a thing is done); instrumentality

mu-ar: (intr.) to moult, mew; shed or cast off hair (if dogs), feathers (of birds), horns (of deer), outer layer of skin (of serpents), and the like which are replaced by new growth; to break, change (voice at puberty)
muar-o: moire: a watered fabric, as watered silk.
mucilaj-o: (bot.) (plant-) mucilage; (N.B. for the adhesive substance, cf. gluo). Def.: Humoro vikoza qua trovesas en ula planti; IV-586.
muel-ar: (tr.) to grind, crush (in a mill); (cf. grindar)
mufl-o: (chem.) muffle. Def.: Speco di vazo (ek argilo) en qua on pozas objekti submisenda nedirete a l’efiko di la fairo; III-530.
muflon-o: (zool.) mouflon; species of wild sheep (Ovis Musimon).
muj-ar: (intr.) to bellow, roar (winds, waves, thunder, cannon); (cf. bramar).
-ozo: mucus membrane (cf. pituito, mucilajo). Def.: Humoro normale sekretaca da la membrani dicata mukozi; IV-585.
mulat-o, -ulo, -ino: mulatto; (cf. mestico, hibrido). Def.: Genetito da blankulo e negrino (o negro e blankino); V-33.

muld-ar: (tr.) to form a mold (mould) of, as in sand, in which to make a casting; (fig.) -ar su: to mold, model oneself. V. exp.: En giserio, on unesme muldas: to esas ago donar justa formo ad la sablo o l’argilo en qua on varsos la fuzita metalo. Po la muldo on uzas la muld-ilo ek ligno, fero, e.c. Duesme on gisas la fuzita metalo en la mulduro; III-82.
mult-a: (of number) many, numerous; (of quantity) much
munt-ar: (tr., tech.) to put together, assemble, set up, mount (a machine, a gem). V. exp.: On asemblas planki o peci, on ne muntas li. On muntas mashino o karpenturo, asemblante lua peci; IV-598.
-ego: thick or large wall (as of a city, a fort)
murmur-ar: (intr.) to murmur: make a low, continued noise; (of water) to purl; (of wind) to breathe, whisper, rustle; (of bees) to hum
musl-o: common (or, edible) mussel (Mytilus edulis): (cf. molusko).
muson-o: monsoon. Def.: Vento qua suflas de esto a westo dum duimo di l’yaro, ed inverse dum l’altra duimo; II-643. DeFIRS
must-ar: (intr.) must, to have to, to be under the nesessity of, be obliged; (past tense) had to
mut-a, -(ul)o: dumb, mute: destitute of the power of speech (cf. tac-anta)
mutil-ar: (tr.) to mutilate, maim. Ex.: Mutilar membro di la korpo. (fig.) Mutilar la verseso, la poemo.
-i: sheep; (fig.) small, compact masses of white fleecy clouds (which move across the sky like a flock of sheep)

mutual-a: mutual. Ex.: Societo di mutual sokurso (E. benefit society). Mutuala asekurerio. V. exp.: Mutuala, reciproka: Mutuala aplikesas nur a la sociala institucuri di «reciproka» helpo, sokurso, e.c.; IV-162.
muzel-o: (anat.) snout, muzzle (of animals); (fig.) pout, pouting
-floro: (bot.) snapdragon (Antirrhinum). Def.: La nazo e la boko di bestii, en qui ta du parti esas salienta (hundo, porko, e.c.); III-10.
-isto, -ero: musician. Note: A list of musical terms and abbreviations may be found IV-328-330.
myelit-o: (med.) myelitis: inflammation of spinal cord.
pac-ar: (intr.) to be at (or, in) peace
-eso: patience, calm endurance or waiting, forbearance
-esar: to be patient, have patience, bide one’s time
pad-o: pad, padding; listing (put around doors and windows to keep out cold)
padel-o: frying-pan, skillet: metal vessel with long handle used for frying.
-izar: to padlock, fasten with a padlock.
pag-ar: (tr., lit. and fig.) to pay (ulu, ulo), to pay for (ulo)
-igar: (tr., print.) to make up into pages, to folio
-igar: to bundle up, make (ulo) into a parcel
pakotili-o: (com., nav.) (seaman’s) venture. Def.: Diversa vari (mikra) quin la maristi daras embarkar sen pagar freto; III-141.
pakt-ar: (intr.) to covenant, enter into a compact (kun): (cf. kontratar)
-eskar: to turn, grow, become pale, to blanch.
-isto: paleographer. Def.: Arto dechifrar la anciena skriburi.
palet-o*: paddle-board (of a paddle-wheel); blade (of an oar).
paliat-ar: (tr. med. and gen.) to palliate; mitigate, alleviate, (a disease); to cloak, extenuate (a fault)
-iva, -ivo: palliative. Def.: Alejar maladeso o malajo, sen remediar ol komplete; III-331; Kalmigar provizore. Ex.: Laudano paliatas kelka dolori. Paliatar eroro.
palinodi-o: palinode. Def.: Anciena verso en qua la poeto retraktis sua olima opinioni.
palis-o: stake, pale, picket (as of a fence)
-izar: to cover with stakes; to stake out, make with stakes. Def.: Longa peco ek ligno (ofte) akutigita ye un extremajo.
-celulo: (biol.) p. cell. Def.: Obstaklo (precipue en militarto) ek serio di pintigita palisi o fosti. Anke uzata por la senco biologiala; II-294.
palmiped-a, -o: palmiped. Def.: Speci di uceli quale anadi, cigni, pinguini, qui havas pedi palmata.
palpit-ar: (intr.) to palpitate, throb; (fig.) to tremble, flutter. Ex.: Kande la kordio palpitas, on ne esas mortinta. Palpitar pro pavoro.
paltot-o: paletot: a loose coat or jacket worn by both sexes, an overcoat (cf. surtuto).
pamflet-o: pamphlet (N.B. this refers only to a pamphlet on a satirical or strongly controversial subject; cf. broshuro).
pampr-o: vine-branch (with foliage and fruit). (arch.) pampre.
pan-o: bread (leavened; cf. azimo); loaf (of b.
-igar, -ifar: (tr., intr.) to make, to bake b.
panch-o: paunch (of animals); (fig.) belly, paunch (of persons). Def.: La unesma e maxim granda stomako di rumineri.
pandur-o: pandour; (fig.) marauder, brutal man. Def.: Speco di Hungariana soldati; IV-269.

pane-ar: (intr., nav.) to lie to, be hove to; (fig. esp. automobiling) to be in a state of breakdown or halt (occasioned by accident, misfunction, trouble). V. exp.: Panear: esas en paneo. Paneo ne esas simpla halto, nek avario; ol esas halto koaktata pro avario o pertubo, misfunciono; ol esas verto teknikala di navigado, qua divenis vulgara ed internaciona per l’automobilismo; IV-578.
panel-o: (arch.) panel, wainscot; (gen.) a flat section of considerable size of a garment, wall or other surface
pani-o: waist-cloth, -clout, loin-cloth (of savages or negroes).
panik-a, -o: panic, sudden fright. Ex.: Panika teroro.
pankreatit-o*: (med.) pancreatitis. Def.: Inflamuro di la pankreati.
palmiped-a, -o: palmiped. Def.: Speci di uceli quale anadi, cigni, pinguini, qui havas pedi palmata.
palpit-ar: (intr.) to palpitate, throb; (fig.) to tremble, flutter. Ex.: Kande la kordio palpitas, on ne esas mortinta. Palpitar pro pavoro.
paltot-o: paletot: a loose coat or jacket worn by both sexes, an overcoat (cf. surtuto).
pamflet-o: pamphlet (N.B. this refers only to a pamphlet on a satirical or strongly controversial subject; cf. broshuro).
pampr-o: vine–branch (with foliage and fruit). (arch.) pampre.
pan-o: bread (leavened; cf. azimo); loaf (of b.
-igar, -ifar: (tr., intr.) to make, to bake b.
panch-o: paunch (of animals); (fig.) belly, paunch (of persons). Def.: La unesma e maxim granda stomako di rumineri.
pandur-o: pandour; (fig.) marauder, brutal man. Def.: Speco di Hungariana soldati; IV-269.

pane-ar: (intr., nav.) to lie to, be hove to; (fig. esp. automobiling) to be in a state of breakdown or halt (occasioned by accident, misfunction, trouble). V. exp.: Panear: esas en paneo. Paneo ne esas simpla halto, nek avario; ol esas halto koaktata pro avario o pertubo, misfunciono; ol esas verto teknikala di navigado, qua divenis vulgara ed internaciona per l’automobilismo; IV-578.
panel-o: (arch.) panel, wainscot; (gen.) a flat section of considerable size of a garment, wall or other surface
pani-o: waist-cloth, -clout, loin-cloth (of savages or negroes).
panik-a, -o: panic, sudden fright. Ex.: Panika teroro.
pankreatit-o*: (med.) pancreatitis. Def.: Inflamuro di la pankreati.
pantalon-o: (long) trousers, a pair of pantaloons (cf. bracho)
pantomim-o: pantomime, dumb-show. Def.: La pleado di aktoro qua ne parolas e konseque expresas «omno» (panto) per gesti parte konvencionala; VII-156.
papir-o: papyrus; (bot.) paper-rush. Def.: Egiptiana arbusto sur la kortico di qua skribis la antiqua, e ta kortico ipsa; III-141.
papl-o: pap (for infants); pulp (fopr making paper)
paprik-o: Cayenne pepper (Capsicum). N.B. «paprika», the mildly pungent condiment might be translated by dolca pimento, dolca papriko.

papul-o: papule, (solid) pimple (cf. veruko). V. exp.: Papulo esas normala saliajeto di la pelo o di la mukozi (sur la fingri, sur la lango, e.c.). Pustulo esas tumoreto pusifanta (de qua venas lua nomo) en eruptiva morbi (variolo, skarlatino, e.c.); II-646.
par-a: (arith.) even, equal; of equal footing, of a common level
-o: a pair, a couple (of animals, or objects of like nature), brace
-igar: to put in two’s, pair, couple, match (by two’s); ye par-eso: at par, on a par, on an equality
parad-ar: (intr.) to parade (as troops, or like troops); Ex.: Trupi paradas tra la stradi. Parado di cirko. Parado-placo, -agro (E. paradeground).
-ucelo: bird of paradise. Ex.: La paradizo Mohamedala. (fig.) Ca loko esis terala paradizo.
paraf-o:scrawled initials. paraph: flourish after a signature
-izar: to put one’s initials to (ulo) with an added flourish

parafraz-ar: (tr.) to paraphrase: freely translate, amplify (a text). V. exp.: Perifrazo esas frazo o frazeto uzata por expresar nedirete to quon on povus expresar per un simpla vorto. Ex.: «la flamifanta globo», vice «la suno». Parafrazo esas quaza traduko di frazo o texto en la sama linguo, por klarigar o developar olu. Ex.: La predikero citas verso ek la Biblio, e pose parafrazas olu; VI-248.
paraliz-ar: (tr., lit. and fig.) to paralyse, palsy; render powerless, destroy energy
-esar: to be paralysed, have a paralytic stroke
-ika, -iko: paralytic (person). Ex.: Pavoro paralizis omna lua fakultati.
paralogism-o*: paralogism. V. exp.: Paralogismo esas rezonado nekoncie falsa o kande la premisi ne justifikas la dedukturo. Sofismo esas volata paralogismo o mis-rezonado.
parament-o: cloth cuff, turned-up end of the sleeve of a coat or gown; (cf. mansheto, ponyeto). Def.: Parto (ek drapo o simila stofo) di la maniko di vesto, qua esas trusita; VI-245.
-o: of men, animals, plants, a parasite
Parc-o: (myth.) Parca, one of the three Fates.
parcel-o: parcel, patch (of land): clearly defined and divided portion of gound etc.
pardon-ar: (tr.) to forgive, condone, overlook, pardon (ulu, ulo); (cf. indulgar). V. exp.: vid. exkuzar.
pare-ar: (tr.) to parry, ward off (a blow); (cf. shirmar).
parent-a: of the same family, related, akin
-e: in p.; by the way of (cf. incidente).
parfum-o: (substance and odor) pefume, fragrance, agreeable odo(u)r (cf. odorizar)
pari-ar: (tr.) to bet, lay a wager, stake (ulo, pri ulo)
pariet-o: wall (serving as partition, as in a room); inner surface (of a vase, tube. etc.); (anat.) coat, wall (as of stomach)
-i: walls, coatings; (anat., bot., zool.) paries, parietes
-izar: to put a wall in; chamber off (ulo)
parlement-ar*: (intr., milit.) to parley: confer with an enemy
-anto, -ero: negotiator (of terms), bearer of a flag or truce.
parodi-ar: (tr.) to parody, burlesque, travesty (ulo, ulu).
parol-ar: (intr.) to speak, talk (pri) (cf. konversar, diskursar)
paronim-o, -a: (gram.) paronym(ous). Def.: Vorti di simila formo od etimologio, ma di diferenta signifiki quale: abstraktar, distraktar.
paronomazi-o: (rhet.) resemblance between words of different languages.
parotidit-o: (med.) parotitis (cf. oreliono). Def.: Inflameso neinfektala di la parotido; M. XI-67.
part-o: part, share, portion; part (in games, music, etc.)
-igar: to divide into different shares, portions
-ala: partial: affecting a part only, not total;. Def.: Un porciono de de divebla toto. Ex.: Dividar ulo en quar parti. Partoprenar ula afero.
partener-o: partner (in a dance, in sports; N.B. not in business; cf asoci-ito). Ant.: adverso.
pater-o: (theat.) (Eng.) pit. (U.S.) parquet circle: part of ground floor under balcony.
parti-o: party: collection of people for amusement, play, hunting, fishing, etc.

partikul-o: (gram.) particle, a subordinate word never inflected, a preposition, conjunction, interjection; an affix; (phys.) particle: minute portion of matter; (R.C. rel.) particle, fragment of consecrated bread.

-ismo: (rel., polit.) particularism. Ex.: Planto partikulara ad klimato. Partikulara amiko. Partikularajo (od, singularajo) di parolado esas idiotismo. Partikularigar la mikra detali. Il laboris partikulare (od, specale) bone. V. exp.: Partikulara esas la kontreajo di generala od universala; aparta signifikas quaze separita, izolita, sola; VII-154; kp. VII-476.
partis-o: party, a number of persons united against others of contrary opinion; (in a law-suit) litigant, party
partizan-o: partisan, a kind of halberd or pike.
partur-ar: (tr.) to bear (a child), bring forth, beget, give birth to; to calve, lamb; (fig.) to produce, create; (cf. gravid-igar)
-o: childbirth, delivery, confinement, parturition (cf. akusho, genito)
-benediko: churching (of a woman after a childbirth).
parven-ar: (intr.) to arrive (at destination), to attain (one’s aim, fortune, success in life)
pas-ar: (tr., intr.) to pass (tra, super ulo); to pass (one’s life, time, etc.); to pass away
-into: one who has passed; (fig.) dead, vanished person
-igar: to cause to pass; to cause or allow (a boat, a vehicle) to pass (cf. preter-pasar)
-vorto: password. Ex.: Il pasis avan nia pordo. Pasar de Anglia a Francia. Tempo pasas. Pasar de un temo ad altra. Me preter-pasis lua domo. Pasigez la salo, me pregas!

-e: tolerably, rather, fairly, passably, pretty, indifferently. Def.: Indikanta grado o valoro meza, la minim alta, quan on povas aceptar o tolerar; III-205. Ex.: Ico esas pasabla vino. La teatrajo esis pasable bona. Ta muliero esas pasable bela. Esas pasable varma en ca chambro, ma ne sat varma por mea olda patro.
pasaj-ar: (intr.) to take passage (on a ship), be a passenger (on ship); to go by sea
-anto, -ero: passenger (on sea; cf. pas-anto). Ex.: Me pasajis de Calais ad Dover. Me havis bela veturo dum la pasajo.
pasion-o: passion: violent emotion; great love or fondness; vehement desire

-izar, -eskar: (tr., intr.) to impassion. Ex.: Amoro ed odio esas la maxim forta pasioni. Il pasionoze amoris el. La muziko pasionizis me. Me pasioneskis pri muziko (E. I became passionately fond of music).
pasment-o, -i: passement(erie): trimmings of lace, gimp, braid of gold, silver, worsted, etc. for clothes an furniture.
paspel-o: edging, welt. Def.: Streta bendo de stofo (generale de diversa kolori), per qua on bordizas ula parti di vesto (kolumo, manchi; specale militistala); VI-142.
past-o: paste: any soft composition; (cook.) dough; (tech.) pâte
pastet-o: pâte: pie, pasty (made of meat or fish)
pastil-o: pastil: aromatic lozenge for breath; a preparation to scent the air.
pastor-o: pastor, minister, clergyman (cf. paroko); shepherd (of sheep)
pastur-ar: (tr., intr.) to pasture (animals), graze, browse, feed (off grass while moving)
patibul-o: gallows (in the form: TT ; cf. jibeto).
patin-o: patina, green film formed on metals.
-ismo: (doctrine taught) patriotism. V. exp.: vid. civismo.
patristik-o: (theol.) patristics. V. exp.: Cienco pri la doktrino dil ekleziala patri.
patroli-ar: (intr.) to go on patrol, go the rounds
patrologi-o: (theol.) patrology. V. exp.: Cienco pri la verki e la vivo dil akleziala patri.
patron-o: (antiq.) patron; (modern) patron, supporter, protector; employer; (eccl.) advowee; patron saint
-eso: patronage: authority or position of a patron
-esar: (tr., intr.) to be a patron (ulu, ulo), to patronize: support (ulu).
