pauz-ar: (intr.) to pause: stop temporarily; (mus.) to make a rest. Ex.: Pauzar dum lektado, dum kantado. Pauzar plurfoye en voyo.
pavan-o: pavan. Def.: Anciena danso (hispana origine); IV-395.
pavilion-o: pavilion: a large peaked tent; a building with a tent-like roof; (cf. tendo).
pavor-ar: (intr.) to be afraid, be in fear, be in a funk
-eskar: to take fright, begin to be scared
paz-ar: (intr.) to take steps, to stride, step (out), stalk (along)
-etar: to trip along, take short steps
pazigrafi-o*: pasigraphy. Def.: Irga sistemo di universala skribado, qua uzas signi, partikulare matematikala simboli, por reprezentar idei, ne vorti.
pean-o: pean, pæan. Def.: Himno o kanto por honorizar ulu, ulo; militala kanto; vinkala kanto.
pec-o: piece; lump (of sugar, of beef, etc.); (cf. fragmento, parto, porciono)
-ope: piece by piece, bit by bit, piecemeal
ped-o: (anat. and fig.) foot; (of animals) paw; (of verse) foot
pedikul-o: (bot., anat.) pedicel, stipe, stem, stalk.
pek-ar: (intr.) to sin; (fig.) to transgress, offend
pekt-ar: (tr.) to comb (the hair); to card (wool, etc.)
pektor-o: chest, breast (cf. mamo, pulmono, sino)
-alo: (anat.) pectoral muscle; pectoral, any breast object
pel-o: skin, hide (on the body; cf. felo)
-ala: relating to the skin, hide; cutaneous (cf. epiderm-ala)
pelerin-o: pelerine, a kind of cape, tippet worn by ladies.
pelmel-o: pell-mell, hurly-burly, hubbub, jumbled mass, medley, litter
pelot-o: ball (formed of thread, silk, etc. wound round)
-igar: to make (ulo) into a ball; to wind. Def.: Bulo ek filo volvita; III-205.
pen-ar: (intr.) to take the trouble (to do something or to do something difficult of execution), to take pains; (cf. esforcar)
-igar: to put (ulu) to trouble (to do something)
-ege, per granda peno: with great trouble, with much difficulty
penach-o: panache, a plume or bunch of feathers, as on a helmet.
pend-ar: (tr., intr.) to hang (up or down), suspend, dangle
-igar: to cause (ulu, ulo) to be hanged or hung
-inda: worthy of hanging. Ex.: La frukti pendas de la abori. Pendar animalo per la pedi. La judiciisto pendigas la trahizinti (E. the judge caused the traitors to be hung). Juvelo pendanta.
penetr-ar: (tr., intr.; lit. and fig.) to penetrate, pierce (cf. perforar, borar)

-eskar: to have an idea; (cf. meditar, reflektar, rezonar, intelektar, imaginar, konceptar, memorar, sonjar, revar, kredar, judikar, opinionar). Def.: Formacar ideo pri ulu, ulo. Ex.: Me pensis (pri) ulo quo povas helpar vu. La homo qua pensas povas esar la mastro di qui ne pensas. Pensez ante ke vu facos to.
pension-ar: (tr.) to pension (soldiers, etc.) to pay a regular stipulated sum for board and lodging

-o: regular payment, board and lodging, regular charge. Def.: Pagar reguloze ula sumo por manteno. V. exp.: Pensiono esas sumo quan ulu pagas o recevas reguloze por lua manteno. Ica senco kontenas ta di pensiono (1) di oficero od oficisto en retreto; ol kontenas anke ta di la pensiono (2) di skolano «interna», qua lojas e nutresas en edukerio, e ta di la pensiono (3) di gasto di hotelo, qua anke lojas e nutresas, o nur nutresas. Takaze ta qua recevas pensiono (1) esus pension-ato, -ario; qua pagas pension (2) o (3) esas pension-anto, -ero; la loko ipsa esas pension-eyo, -erio; V-282.
pent-o: (downward) slope, incline, gradient, pitch, declivity
-a, -e: (downward) sloping, shelving. V. exp.: Rampo e pento esas esence sama, ma pento esas la inklinajo de supre ad infre, e rampo la sinso de infre ad supre
pentark-o*: pentarchos, one of five rulers; quinquivir.
pepit-o: (min.) nugget (especially of silver or gold).
per: (prep.) by means of, through the help of, by, with (marks, instrument, means); (arith.) multiplied by (the sign); (cf. da)
percept-ar: (tr.) to perceive: to receive impressions of external objects; to feel; discern
-eyo: perching place; (fig.) upper gallery in a theater (theatre). V.: exp.: Perchar aplikesas, ne nur a hani, ma ad omnaspeca uceli, e mem metafore ad animali e homi; III-327.
-esar: to be lost, be a loser
peren-a: perennial. Def.: Qua duras plura yari; V-89.
perfor-ar: (tr.) to perforate, pierce through; (cf. borar, penetrar). Def.: Truifar sen rotaco; III-165. Ex.: Kuglo perforas korpo, muro.
perifraz-ar: (tr.) to periphrase; express in a roundabout way, by circumlocution. V. exp.: vid.: parafrazo. Exp.: «La rejo dil uceli» esas perifrazo por l’aglo.
period-o: (astron., chron.) period: term, portion of time (cf. ciklo, punto)
peripeci-o: peripetia, sudden turn of fortune, vicissitude; (theat.) denouement.
peripl-o: (ancient geog.) periplus (a sailing round). Def.: Historiala nomo di ula specala cirkumnavigi, e naraco di li; V-89.
peris-ar: (intr.) to perish: die; be destroyed, ruined
-iva, -ema: perishable. Ex.: Mili di soldati perisis en ta batalio. (fig.) Lua nomo ne povos perisar. Flori perisas.
perjur-ar: (intr.) to perjure: violate one’s oath, (fig.) to break one’s word. Def.: Violacar promiso facita per juro; V-430.
-o: percussion: shock of one body against another

-ilo, instrumento: instrument of percussion; (of guns) hammer, bolt (which sets off the cartridge). Def.: Frapar forte. Ex.: La perkutilo perkutas la amorcilo. La cimbalisto perkutas la cimbali. La mediko exploras per perkutado.

permis-ar: (tr.) to permit, allow, give leave to, authorize, give license to; (N.B. This verb is transitive in relation to the thing, but intransitive relative to the person). -o: permission, consent

-ite: vice versa. V. exp.: Permutar esas chanjar l’ordino di plura kozi, qui duras formacar kolekturo. Me chanjas mea vesti kande me desmetas uli e metas altri. Ma me permutas li, kande (sen metar li) me chanjas lia ordino en mea vesteyo. Kande on mixas ludkarti qui restas sempre sama, on facas nur permuti; on chanjas li kande on prenas altra paketo de karti vice l’unesma; VII-204.
peron-o: perron, an out-of-door flight of steps; outside stair-case; front-door steps.
perone-o*: (anat.) perone, fibula, small bone of the leg. ? eFS
peronospor-o: peronospora: a genus of fungi.
peroracion-o: (rhet.) peroration. Ant.: exordio. Def.: Lasta parto, konkluzo di diskurso.
-igar: to perpetuate. Def.: Kontinua, qua ne cesas. Ex.: Perpetua fairo brulis sur la altaro di Vesta. Perpetua movado. Perpetua exilo.

-eso: perplexity: embarrassment of mind; irresolution. Ex.: Perplexa pro desfacilaji neprevidita. Situeso perplexigiva. V. exp.: Perplexa expresas nociono komplexa, quaze meza inter embarasata e nequieta (kun nuanco di hezito); V-89.
perquizit-a: (tr.) to make (legal) search, inquiry (pri ulu, ulo)

persekut-ar: (tr.) to persecute: harass unjustly; (fig.) to importune, annoy. V. exp.: Persequar esas: proxime sequar persiste, por atingar ulu od obtenar ulo. Ex.: Persequar furtisto. Persequar cervo en chaso. Persequar la glorio, la plezuro, la suceso. Persequar ulu avan tribunalo. Persekutar esas: kruele traktar ulu persiste. Ex.: La mali persekutas la boni, pro ke li odias lo bona. La Kristani persekutesis dum la unesma yarcenti di l’eklezio; V-430.
persequ-ar: (tr.) to pursue (with a view to overtake); (jur.) to prosecute
-eskar: to start pursuit; to indict, sue. V. exp.: vid. persekutar.

persever-ar: (intr.) to persevere, pursue steadfastly: continue on a given course, esp. in the face of discouragement, obstacles; (cf. persistar). Ex.: Perseverar en ula entraprezo. Il esas persever-anta, -ema homo.
persien-o: persienne, (outside) Venetian shutter; the ordinary outside window-blinds with movable slats; (cf. III-290

persist-ar: (intr.) to persist: hold firm, continue steadfast (en, pri) (cf. perseverar). Ex.: La testo persistas negar. Il persistas en sua opiniono. Persistanta morbo. Persistema homo. V. exp.: vid. insistar.
person-o: person (man, woman, child); (theol., gram.) person; (cf. individuo)
-eso: personality, individuality: quality of being a person
-e, -ale: in person, personally, in a personal manner
-ego: personage: a great person or person of distinction
-e: in perspective, in the distance. Ex.: Lineala perpektivo. Desegnuro perspektiva.
persuad-ar: (tr.) to persuade (ulu pri ulo, su)
-iva, -ema: persuasive. Ex.: Il persuadis me venar. Me esas persuadita ke ...
perturb-ar: (tr., astron., social) to perturb, trouble, unsettle, throw into disorder
-anta, -iva: perturbing, disturbing. Ex.: Perturbo di la mento. Perturbi sociala, financala.
-isto: wig-maker. Def.: Kuafuro de falsa hararo.
pervers-a: perverse, obstinate in the wrong, wayward, depraved
-igar: to pervert. Def.: Qua havas nenormala o kontreetika tendenci (o gusto); III-205.
pesk-ar: (intr.) to fish, angle (por, per, ek); (tr.) to draw (ulo) out of the water, to catch (also refers to coral fishing, pearl fishing, etc.)
-yuro: licence, right to fish. Ex.: Peskar karpo.
pest-o: pestilence, pest, plague (cf. kontagio); (fig.) bane, scourge
peticion-ar: (intr.) to petition: present a petition (ad ulu)
petr-o: stone (as a material substance; cf. roko, stono)
petrel-o: (orni.) stormy petrel; Mother Carey’s chicken (Procellaria pelagica).
petris-ar: (tr.) to knead: work into a uniform mass (dough, etc.).
petrol-o: petroleum, rock-oil; (cf. benzino, keroseno, gazolino).
petul-ar: (intr.) to be frisky, impetuous, boisterous, turbulent, unruly.
pez-ar: (intr.) to weigh (dek grami, e.c.) (cf. grav-esar, ponderar)
-ajo: a heavy object; weight for weighing
-acho: a bigot. Def.: Qua reverencas Deo.
piaf-ar: (intr., of horses) to make a piaffer, to paw the ground.
piedestal-o: pedestal (of a column, statue, vase, etc.)
-eto: piedouche: small pedestal supporting a bust, etc.
pigme-o: pigmy, dwarf; (fig.) a person without talent, or merit, or power.
pigment-o: (natural, physiol.) pigment (cf. farbo). Def.: Materio naturale koloroza, qua donas koloro ad altra kozi; V-660. Ex.: Okulala, harala, pelala pigmento.
pik-ar: (tr., lit. and fig.) to prick; prod, goad, puncture; sting
-etar: to peck at; strike with the beak
-anta, -ema: prickly, stinging, piquant, pungent; biting, piercing, sharp, nipping (of cold, liquids, words, etc.)
-bastono: a goad (as for oxen). Ex.: Pikar sua fingro. Pikar bovulo, kavalo, papero. Vorti pikanta. Pikanta mustardo.
pikl-o: something preserved in spice (cf. spico)
-aji: pickles: vegetables, fruit or other food preserved in spice or vinegar pickle and used as a condiment
pikon-o:roko o harda materii (ex. makadamo). La (one-pointed) pick, pickaxe (cf. piocho). Def.: Instrumento por exkavar fera parto esas karakterizita per un pinto perpendikla a la mancho; VI-533.
pikt-ar: (tr.) to paint (pictures in oil or water colo(u)rs); (cf. indutar, farb-izar)
pil-o: (of animals, also bot.) hair, bristle; (of persons) hair of all parts of body except top of head; (cf. haro); (of sheep, camels, etc.) wool; (of cloth, of hats) nap
pilgrim-ar: (intr.) to go on a pilgrimage.
pili-o: (elec.) pile, primary cell. Ex.: La pilio di volta.
-agar: to pillory, put (ulu) in a pillory.
pinastr-o: (bot.) Pinaster, the cluster pine (Pinus pinaster).
pinc-o: nippers (without hinges); claw (of crabs, etc.)
-uro: the mark of a pinch (as on the skin).
pinion-o: pinion: small cog-wheel geared to a larger wheel.
-agar: to dig (ulo) with a pickaxe. Def.: Instrumento por exkavar harda materii, di qua la fera parto havas du extremaji opozita (relate la mancho). VI-533.
pipet-o: (chem.) pipette: tube to transfer liquids; dropping tube.
-o: pip, roup: disease of birds, poultry.
pir-o: (bot.) pear; (fig.) any pear-shaped instrument or object; e.g. an electric light bulb
-ifar: to form a pyramid, rise like a pyramid
pirik-o: (Gr. antiq.) pyrrhic: a warlike dance.
pirog-o: (Indian or savage) canoe, pirogue. Def.: Kanoto di sovajo, facita ek arboro-trunko o kortico (quale uzata da la Malayi Nord-Amerikan Indiani, e.c.).
pirograb-ar: (tr.) to engrave on wood with a hot point
pirometr-o: pyrometer. Def.: Instrumento por mezurar la maxim alta temperaturi.
piruet-ar: (intr.) to pirouette: turn, whirl on toes; (of horses) to whirl.
pist-ar: (tr.) to pound, bruise, crush (with a pestle); (cf. triturar)
piti-o: (antiq.) the Pythia: priestess of Apollo.
piton-o: (myth.) Python; (zool.) python (genus: Python). Def.: Serpento reala e mitologiala; III-142.
-ala: pituitary; (cf. muko). Def.: Humoro viskoza sekrecata da ula mukozi (di la nazo, di la bronkii) en stando morbala; IV-585.
pivot-o: pivot: (mechan.) pivot, journal: pin or short shaft on which anything turns: (milit.) the wing on which a troop turns; (fig.) main hinge, principal agent
plac-o: place: open public space, as a square or circu in a town (cf. loko).
plad-o: plate: small dish to eat off (cf. disho)
plafon-o: (arch.) ceiling, upper surface of a room

plag-o: sore: break in soft part of body from disease; (fig.) plague, scourge (cf. pesto). Ex.: Ilua tota korpo esa kovrata da plagi. L’alkoholo esas plago di la publika saneso. Atilla nomizis su la plago di Deo.

plaj-o: beach, (sea-) shore, strand. V. exp.: Plajo esas la bendo plu o min larja di sulo, quan la maro alterne kovras e deskovras; existas plaji de sablo e plaji de rul-stoni. La rivo esas la limito inter la maro e la tale dicita ferme (sika) tero. La litoro esas la tota regiono adjacanta la rivo. La plaji esas nur aparta ed eceptala loki en la rivi: ne omna rivo esas plajo (ex.: rivo ek klifi od ek rokaji); IV-606.
plaji-ar: (tr., intr.) to plagiarize (words, ideas from another).
plako: plate, sheet, slab: flat piece of metal, etc.; tablet, plaque
-izar: to plate (over), sheathe, sheet over, veneer, overlay
plan-a: plane: without elevations or depressions; level, flat (cf. plata)
-ajo: a flat thing or place; plain: level land
-izar: to ornament, cover with plants (cf. plantacar).
plantac-ar: (tr.) to plant: set in the ground for growth
-ajo: something planted, slip, set, crop, plant (cf. planto)
plas-o: place (for a person or thing)
-izar: to place (ulu); to put (ulo, ulu) in a place (cf. pozar, lok-izar)
plastr-o: (med.) (sticking-) plaster (for the body; cf. kataplasmo)

plastron-o: plastron: breast-plate; breast-pad; shirt-bosom, -front. Def.: Tri senci: pectoral peco di kuraso; pektoral peco, polster-izita, di vesto di skermisto; pektorala parto di kamizo; IV-202. ?eFI
plat-a: flat: having an even surface (cf. plana); (fig.) dull, insipid
-ajo: a flat object; plateau, upland, table-land
platform-o: platform; horizontal surface or structure (cf. programo).
plaud-ar: (tr., intr.) of liquids, waves: to break, beat against, splash
ple-ar: (tr.) to play (a musical instrument, a role in a play; cf. ludar)
plebecit-o: referendum: (hist.) plebescite, plebescitum. Def.: Voto pri ula lego o rezolvo da omna civitani di un stato (ex. en Suisa); III-142
pled-ar: (intr., legal and gen.) to plead, argue (at the bar); to allege
plekt-ar, inter- -ar, en- -ar: (tr.) to (inter-) lace, plait, twine, wreath, weave (straw, etc.; cf. tres-igar)
plend-ar: (intr.) to complain; (jur.) lodge a complaint (che)
-ema, -atra: plaintive, querulous. Ex.: Plendar pri kap-doloro. Il plendis, ke il esas frapita. V. exp.: vid. lamentar.
plenipotenc-o: plenipotence, fullness or completeness of power
plet-o: tray, shallow receptacle for tea, pins, diamonds, etc.
-ala, -ika: plethoric. Ex.: Pletoro de sango, de pekunio.
pleuronekt-o: (ich.) brill, flounder: a flat fish of several species (Pleuronectes).

pleyad-o, -i: (astron.) Pleiades; (fig.) a distinguished of authors, etc. Def.: Propra senco: ula stelaro (en signo di «Tauro»); metafora senco: grupo o skolo de autori, partikulare poeti (ex. la Franca pleyado en la 16a yarcento; III-142.
plez-ar: (intr.) to be pleasing, be agreeable; (tr.) to please (ulu)
plezur-o: pleasure: delight, joy. Ex.: Facar ulo kun plezuro. Dansar esas plezuro.
plik-o: (med.) plica, a disease of the hair.
plis-ar: (tr.) to plait; (fig.) to pucker, crease. Def.: Facar reguloza falduri en ulo; (kp. frunsar).
-siglar: (tr.) to seal or stamp with lead
plor-ar: (intr.) to cry, weep, shed tears (pri)
-ilo: a plow. Def.: Sulkizar la sulo per plugilo. (fig.) Spadagar la tero por plantacar.
plum-o: (of birds) feather, plume; (for writing) quill, pen
-aro: plumage, feathers (cf. penacho); collection of pens
plump! thump! slap! bang! Def.: Indikanta falo, precipue di ulo grava, mola, inerta; IV-511
plump-a: (of things) unwieldy, unmanageable from bulk or weight; (of persons) thick-skulled, dull-witted
-eso: two or more of the same kind
-atra: plush-like, shaggy. Def.: Stofo simila a veluro e kun longa pili o lanugo sur un latero.
plutokrati-o: plutacracy: rule and power of the rich.
-igar: to cause to rain; to shower down upon
po: for, at the price of, in exchange for (indicates value received or given); (fin.) per (cent.) as, kin po cento: (at the rate of) five percent (cf. procento)
podagr-o: podagra, gout in the feet
-ika, -iko: gouty (person). Def.: Goto di pedi; IV-516.
-ajo: a piece of poetry, a poem
pok-a: few: not many; little: not much
-ope: by degrees, little by little, bit by bit
polemik-ar: (intr.) to carry on a controversy (kun ulu)
-eso: polyandry; (bot.) polyandria. Def.: (Muliero) qua samtempe havas plura spozuli; (speco di planti) qua havas duadek o plu multa stamini.
polifoni-o: polyphony. Def.: Multeso de soni diferanta ma sam-tempa.
poligraf-o: multigraph, poylgraph: instrument for multiplying copies of a writing
poligrafi-o: the art of operating a polygraph.
polip-o: (zool.) polyp; (med.) polypus: a species of tumor.
polis-ar: (tr.) to polish (marble, wood, steel, etc.) (fig.) to polish: refine (the mind, one’s style, manners, etc.) Def.: Igar ulo glata e brilanta per friciono; brunisar.
-ala: polytechnic: relating to arts and sciences
-ano: (fig.) a student in a p. school
polonez-o: polonaise, a kind of dance.
polster-o: stuffing, padding, wadding (of garments, etc.)
-ajo: what stuffed, padded: bolster, pad, cushion, padded quilt, etc.
polut-ar: (tr.) to pollute, defile (cf. kontaminar, profanacar)
-esar: (fig.) to be polluted; to have seminal discharge or emission.
-ifar: to rise (of dust); to be dusty (of roads)
-izar: to apply p. to (hair or exterior of the body)
pomel-o: pommel (of saddle); knob on the hilt of a sword or pistol. Def.: Mikra bulo ye l’extremajo di espado, di pistolo od avan solo; III-142.
pompon-o: pompon, top-knot; tuft added to dress of a soldier, etc.
ponder-ar: (tr.) to weigh (ulu, per ulo); (cf. pezar); (fig.) to ponder (mentally)
-agar, poniarde ocidar: to poniard, stab (ulu) with a dagger; (cf. dago).
pons-a: poppy-colo(u)red, flame colo(u)red, vivid scarlet.
-eto: foot-bridge; (R.R. culvert); (nav.) gangway; (tech.) trigger-guard (of a firearm)
pontifik-o: pontiff; (Jewish) high priest; (Roman) pontifex; (cf. papo)
ponton-o: pontoon, boat used as bridge
ponyet-o: wrist-band. Def.: La finala parto di la maniko; VI-245. Ex.: Kamizo ne-starchita, nokto-kamizo ne havas mansheti, ma nur ponyeti.
pop-o: (Russian, Grecian) priest, (village) pope. Def.: Rusa (greka) sacerdoto; III-594.
poplit-o: (anat.) ham, region back of the knee joint; (in quadrupeds).
popul-o: people, population (of a town, city, country; cf. habit-ant-aro)
-izar: to people, populate: furnish with inhabitants
popular-a: popular: prevailing among and liked by the people
por: (prep. indicating aim) for, in view of, in favo(u)r of
-igar: to portion out (ulo). Def.: Parto de un toto; partikulare ula provizuro de pano, de karno, esanta dividita inter uli.
porkespin-o: (zool.) porcupine (European genus: Hystrix; N. American genus: Erethizon).
pornografi-o: pornography: art or literature of an obscene nature.
port-ar: (tr.) to carry, bear, bring, take: convey in vehicles, by ship, hand, or person, also of wind, water, etc. (as agent) to wear (clothes, a sword, etc.)
-ajo: that which is carried; load, burden
portal-o: portal; grand and imposing door (as of a church, etc.).
porte-o: range, reach of a shot, bullet, of a voice, etc.
portfoli-o: portfolio, a case in which to keep loose papers.
portik-o: portico, porch, covered space enclosed by columns at entrance of building.
portret-o: (pr. and fig.) portrait, personal representation by painting, drawing, photography
posed-ar: (tr.) possess, be in possession of, own, have the faculty or quality (cf. havar, proprietar)
-eskar: to become possessor of, take possession of
-alo: possessive case; a possessive. Ex.: Posedar pekunio, domo, ula furio posedis il. Me pagos vu kande me posedos plu multa pekunio. Ka vu esas la posedanto di ta agro? Posedal pronomi.
-libro: a book for the pocket (cf. burso)
post-o: mail, post, postal service, public conveyance and delivery, esp. of letters, packages
-isto: employee of postal service; letter-carrier; postman
posten-o: post, a place to guard; beat (of a policeman, etc.)
-izar: to post, station (uli, ulu, su) (cf. facionar); Ex.: Stacar en posteno. Gardar posteno. Livar, desertar posteno.
postern-o: (fort.) postern; small gate under a rampart.
postig-o: small casement in a door or window; blind (of a carriage). Def.: (Mikra) parto (ordinare, vitro-plako) di la fenestro o pordo qua esas apertebla.
postpozicion-o: postposition, a word or particle placed after or at the end of a word.
postul-ar: (tr.) to demand, exact, require (ulo, de ulu)
postur-ar: (intr., lit. and fig.) to assume an attitude, to pose (as for a statue, a picture); to sit (for one’s picture)
pot-o: pot, kettle, jug: earthenware or metal vessel used for cooking or merely holding something
pov-ar: (tr., intr.) to be able (to do), can (do), could, have the power to

-o: power, ability, force, means, might; (polit.) a power, powerful country. Ex.: Ni facas to quon ni povas. Me ne povis venar hiere. Me povabus manjar ol, ma me ne hungris. La povo di la mento. V. exp.: vid. darfar.
poz-ar: (tr., lit and fig.) to place, set, lay (down), ground (cf. depozar)
pozolan-o: pozzolana, a mortar made from volcanic ashes.
-ala: pragmatical: dealing with practical values or consequences
praktik-ar: (tr.) to practice, put into practice, exercise; to observe (a rule, etc.)
-ala: pertaining to practice or action, practical (matter)
-ebla: practicable, feasible, possible; (of roads) passable; -isto: practitioner
-anta: practising. Ex.: On praktikas la medicino, l’agro-kultivado. Esas necesa praktikar longatempe, ante ke on povas divenar habila. Praktikebla ideo, voyo.
pram-o: (nav.) pram(e): flat-bottomed boat used in the Baltic. Def.: Speco di navo (barko) kun plata fundo, nur un ponto, kun segli e remili; IV-462.
prebend-o: prebend, stipend granted to a prebendary
prec-o: (lit. and fig.) price, charge; (fig.) expense
-oza: costly, expensive, valuable, precious (in money value)
preced-ar: (tr.) to have, to take precedence of, to go before in rank, importance, etc.; (cf. pre-irar)
-o: precedence: right or fact of precedency, priority
-anto: one who has or takes precedence; predecessor (in office); (pl.) predecessors, forefathers
-anta: antecedant, (cf. antea, antecedento). Def.: Esir en plaso, ofico nemediate avan
-e: pasar avan altru segun lego, regulo; VI-418. Ex.: Grava aferi precedas la neimportanta.
precedent-o: a precedent, authoritative case, example or instance.
precept-o: precept, authoritative rule of action.
precipit-ar: (tr., pr. and fig.) to precipitate, cause to fall, hurry along, throw down, hurl headlong, dash down, plunge; (chem.) to throw to the bottom of a vessel
-ajo: (chem.) precipitate. Ex.: Il precipitis su ek la fenestro. Precipitar naciono en milito.
-ajo: the chief thing, essential part, main point
preciz-a: precise, having fixed limitation, not loose, vague or uncertain; definite, distinct, exact, formal, terse; (N.B. not used of persons)
-igo, -iguro: specification. Def.: Qua esas strikte definita o determinita; IV-102. Ex.: Dio preciza. Horo preciza. Ordino preciza. V. exp.: vid. akurata, exakta.
predik-ar: (tr., intr., lit. and fig.) to preach (ulo, ad ulu); (cf. exhortar)
prefekt-o: (Rom. antiq. and chief administrator of each department in France) prefect.
prefer-ar: (tr.) to prefer, like better: give preference in mind to (ulo, kam)
-inda: preferable. Ex.: Preferar mortar kam vivar. Preferar la honoro kam la pekunio.
-izar, -igar: to put at the beginning of a word.
preg-ar: (tr.) to pray (to) (God); to beg, entreat, beseech (ulu, pri, por); (cf. suplikar)
prekar-a: (tr.) precarious, depending upon the will or pleasure of another; uncertain, unsettled.
prekoc-a: precocious, early, ripe befor the proper season; (of persons) ripe in understanding at an early age. Def.: Developita ante la normal evo; III-606.
prelud-ar: (intr., mus.) to play a prelude.
premi-o: (com., fin., insurance) premium, bounty, bonus; (in competitions) a prize
-izar: to give a premium or prize to.
premic-o, -i: first-fruits; (fig.) first mass (of a newly ordained priest).
pren-ar: to take: lay hold of, by hand, etc.)
prepar-ar: (tr., intr.) to prepare (su, ulu, ulo, por, kontre)
-anta, -iva, -ala: preparatory, preparative. Def.: Aranjar antee; predispozar. Ex.: preparar dineo, diskurso, la mento, por voyajar.
preponder-ar: (intr.) to preponderate, have a superiority in weight or influence
prerogative-o: prerogative, exclusive pivilege or right.
pres-ar: (tr.) to press, bear upon with force or weight
presbiteri-o: council of parish trustees; vestry council, presbytery (church elders)
preske: (adv.) almost, nearly, all but, scarcely. Ex.: Me vendis preske omno. Preske nulo restas. Laboro preske parfinita. Me preske nultempe vidis il. V. exp.: vid. quaze.
preskript-ar: (tr.) to prescribe, to set down authoritatively, to direct, order; (med.) to direct as a remedy
presktir-ar: (tr., jur.) to bar or be lost by statute of limitation. Def.: Preskrito: perdo od aboliso di yuro pos definita tempo; III-410.
prest-ar: (tr.) to lend, loan (ulo ad ulu)
-ajo: that which is loaned, a loan
prestacion-o: (feudal law) prestation. Def.: Speco di kontributo per laboro o pekunio por la manteno di la publika voyi, e.c.; IV-447.
prestij-o: prestige. Def.: Speco di autoritato od influo, qua venas de l’extera aspekto ed efikas per l’opiniono ed imaginado; IV-447.
pretend-ar: (tr.) to lay claim to (ulo); be a pretender to (a throne, etc.)
preter: (prep.) passing, past (by): indicates motion from one side to the other past a certain object
pretext-ar: (tr.) to allege (as a pretext), pretend, feign, sham (ulo)
prevarik-ar: (intr.) to betray one’s trust (N.B. not «to lie»; cf. mentiar)
-o: breach of trust (esp. in public office). Def.: Faliar sua devo pro interesto o ne-sincereso. Ex.: Ministro, judiciisto, qua prevarikas en sua ofico.
prevent-ar: (tr.) to prevent, ward off, forestall
-iva, -ivo: preventive. Def.: Impedar o remediar ula evento (mala) ante lua aparo; II-20.
prevost-o: provost. Def.: Titulo uzata en diversa faki: eklezio, militistaro, polico, etc. (La epiteti o la kuntexto specialigos olu); V-89.
prezent-a: (in space) present: not absent; (in time) present: not past or future (cf. nuna)
-eso: presence: existence in a place. V. exp.: On parolas pri persono prezenta same kam evento prezenta; VI-163. Ant.: absenta, pasinta.
prezerv-ar: (tr.) to preserve, save: keep from injury (ulu, ulo, de, kontre); (cf. konfitar, konservar)
-iva, -ivo, -ilo: peservative. Ex.: Preservar ulu de grande danjero.
prezid-ar: (tr., intr.) to preside over; to take the chair, be chairman
prezunt-ar: (intr.) presumptuous, presuming; to have undue confidence in oneself
-ema, -oza: presuming, too confident, self-conceited; without proper basis in reason. V. exp.: vid. superba. Ex.: Yuneso esas prezuntoza.
pri: (prep.) about, concerning, relating to, in regard to, in reference to, as regards, re, apropos of
prikl-ar: (tr., intr.; of sensation) to prickle, tingle
prim-a: primary: first in order of development, of time; not derived
primar-a: primary, elementary, first or lowest in order
-o: (hist. gram.) a primitive. Ex.: Primitiva naturo, eklezio, linguo.
printempo: spring (-time); (fig.) prime, bloom of youth
prior-a: prior, before (cf. antea); (jur.) priority. Def.: Qua pasas avan irgu pri ula kozo; VI-382. Ex.: La parento havas la yuro di prioreso (pro anteeso) dum un yaro.
privac-ar: (tr.) to deprive, take from, strip off; to bereave
-ala, -anta, -iva: (gram.) privative; (jur.) in severalty. Ex.: Privacar ulu de lua havajo, lua libereso. Privaco de vidado.
privilej-o: privilege: peculiar advantage or benefit
-izar: to grant a privilege to a (ulu)
priz-ar: (tr.) to appreciate, like, prize, value. Ex.: Prizar la bona qualesi, la meriti, la servado, la judiko, la opiniono, du ulu.

prizent-ar: (tr.) to present: set or place before; (milit.) to present (arms); to introduce; (cf. ofrar, montrar, expozar). Ex.: Prizentar buketo. Prizentar akredito-letro ad ulu. Ca afero prizentas granda avantaji. Prizentar ulu a la rejo.
pro: (prep.) because of, on account of, out of, owing to, in consequence of
prob-ar: (tr.) to test, make trial of, put to test, prove by experiment; (cf. esforcar); (of ore metals) to assay
probabl-a: probable, likely, having more evidence than the contrary; which is likely to happen
-atra: problematical, doubtful. Ex.: Geometriala problemo. Ol esas problem solvenda. Pozar ulo kom problemo.
proced-ar: (intr.) to proceed, go on (ad ulo); to act, behave in a certain way
-o: proceeding, way of acting, behaviour, process. Ex.: Procedar a la exameno di kandidato. Procedar lente, cirkonspekte. Simpligar la procedo. Procedo kemiala.
procedur-o: (jur.) procedure, manner of proceeding; practice; proceedings: measures taken in the prosecution of an action
-ema: litigious. Ex.: Kodexo di civila proceduro. Spenso di proceduro.

procent-o: percentage (N.B. does not refer to interest or rent of capital; cf. po and Talmey’s Text Book, p. 82). Def.: Raporto di la du nombri; V-681. Ex.: Il postulas kin po cento kom procento. Me kolokis 1000 fr. ye la procento di quar po cento. La procento di la naski, di la morti, di la mariaji en ula populo o habitantaro.
proces-ar: (intr., jur.) to bring action, go to law, institute proceedings, prosecute, proceed (kontre ulu); (law-) suit, action; trial
procesion-ar: (intr.) to walk in procession, to make a procession (in the streets, in the church, etc.)
prodig-ar: (tr.) to lavish, be prodigal of, be unsparing of
prodom-o: (med.) prodrome, premonitory symptom of disease.
produkt-ar: (tr.) to produce, engender, bring forth, bear, yield; (cf. genitar)

-anta, -iva, -ema: producing, productive. Ex.: Ca lando produktas multa oro. La arbori produktas frukti. La autoro produktas verki. La milito produktas granda malaji. La produktaji di naturo. Sulo produktiva.
profan-a: profane, not sacred; related to secular affairs; proceeding from contempt of sacred things
-ajo: a profane thing or act (cf. profanacar); Ex.: Profana parolado, historio, konduto, ago, naturo. Mixar la profanaji kun la sakraji.
profanac-ar: (tr.) to profane: treat sacred things with abuse, irreverence, contempt; to desecrate; (tr.) to degrade, debase
profes-ar: (tr.) to profess, make a profession of
-o: profession. Def.: Deklarar publike. Ex.: On profesas religio, kredo, doktrino, fido pri ulu od ulo.
profesor-o: professor (in a university, college, seminary)
-ala: prophetic, relating to a prophet. (cf. pre-dic-anta).
-izar: to draw or show (ulu, ulo); in profile
profit-ar: (tr., intr.) to profit (pecuniarily or otherwise); (cf. ganar)
-igar: to cause profit to (ulu). Def.: Avantajizar per ulo; ganar per ulo. Ex.: Profitar (ulo) per komercaji vendita, konsilo donita.
profund-a: deep, profound: extending far below the surface; (fig.) abstruse, sagacious
prognoz-ar: (tr., med.) to prognosticate: foretell (ulo) from present symptoms; to make a prognosis.
program-o: program, written outline of entertainment or ceremony; (of a theater) playbill; (of a political party) platform; (in a university) syllabus; (fig.) plan, project.
-emo: a progressive person; (fig.) a liberal, radical. Ex.: La atako kontre l’enemiko progresas. La progreso di incendio, di inundado, di studiado, di morbo. Ant.: retro-irar, regresar.
-aparato: a projector. Ex.: Korpo qua projektas sua ombro sur altra. Projekto di Mercator.
projektor-o: beam-thrower, projector (as of a searchlight).
projet-ar: (tr.) to plan, scheme, purpose, to form a project
-ata, -ita: projected, contemplated. Ex.: Projetar longa voyajo. Projetar facar ulo. Ca homo sen-cese projetas, ma ultempe parfinas ulo.? DEFIRS
proklam-ar: (tr.) to proclaim, cry out, give out
-o, -ajo, -uro: proclamation. Ex.: Proklamar ulu kom rejo. Proklamar la bona agi di uli. Publikigar proklamajo.
prokurac-o: procuration: power to act for another, proxy; the instrument which empowers, warrant, letter of attorney
prolix-a: prolix, verbose, diffuse (style, discourse, narrative, etc.)
prolong-ar: (tr.) to lengthen, extend (by addition, in space)

-o, -uro: prolongation. Def.: Adjuntar ad ula kozo ulo suplementala, qua konstitucas integrajo kun ol, e qua nomesas prolonguro; IV-138. V. exp.: Plu-long-igar relatas tempo, durado. On prolongas kayo, muro; ma on plulongigas vivo, voyajo, milito.
promen-ar: (intr.) to go for a walk, promenade, walk, stroll (for pleasure)
promis-ar: (tr.) to promise (ulu, ad ulu; facar ulo); (fig., of weather, etc.) to forebode
promoc-ar: (tr.) to promote: raise, advance (someone to a higher rank, grade)

pron-ar: (intr., R.C. ch.) «to pronate». V. exp.: Prono esas nek prediko nek solena diskurso. Ol kontenas diversa prego-formuli, rekomendi, konsili, avizi e fine instrukto-diskurso familiara facata por la parokiani dum la meso. Dec. 1538, M.XI 67.
pronac-ar: (tr.) to pronate: turn the palm of the hand downward or backward
pront-a: ready: prepared, in readiness; willing, disposed
propag-ar: to propagate: multiply or continue by generation; (fig.) to spread abroad, diffuse; to make propaganda
propoz-ar: (tr.) to propose: to offer (ulo) for consideration; to propound; to move (a resolution or amendment)
-ajo: what is proposed, proposition; V. exp.: vid. ofrar.
propr-a: own, belonging to, proper, peculiar to
-ajo: something which belongs to someone or something, peculiarity, characteristic, attribute, property, one’s own; (cf. singular-ajo, partikular-ajo)
-igar: to appropriate: consign to a particular person
propriet-ar: (tr.) to own: have legitimate possesion of (cf. posedar)
prosektor-o: prosector: assistant disector or professor of anatomy.
proskrib-ar: (tr.) to proscribe, outlaw. V.exp.: vid. exilar.
prospekt-o: prospectus: preliminary statement of a plan, scheme, or literary work.
prosper-ar: (intr.) to prosper, be successful, thrive
-igar: to cause someone to prostrate himself. Def.: Jetar su avan ulu, ulo, kom signo di adoro o humila respekto (ago o gesto ceremoniala).
prostituc-ar: (tr.) to prostitute, make a prostitute of (ulu); (fig.) to degrade (su); put (ulu, ulo) to a base use
prostrac-ar: (intr.) to be in a stare of prostration (extreme physical weakness) be prostrated
-o: (med. and gen.) prostration (cf. prosterno). Def.: Esar en stando di extrema depreso, mentala o korpala.
protagonist-o: protagonist: (theater) chief actor; (fig.) one who takes the lead in any great matter.
prote-o: (myth.) Proteus; (fig.) a man who frequently changes his opinions; (zool.) proteida
-ato: person protected; (fig.) protégé. Ex.: Protektar lo febla, la inocenti, la urbo. Protektata kontre la koldeso.? DEFIRS
protektorat-o: protectorate. Def.: Autoritato asumita da plu-forta stato super inferiora o dependata stato, partikulare pri la relati exterlanda.

protest-ar: (intr.) to protest (publicly); (tr., com.) to protest (payment on a bill). Def.: Asertar forte, solene, publike. Ex.: Protestar kontre abrogo. Il protestas ke omno esis facata kontre lua volo. Protestar pago.
protez-o: (surg.) prosthesis. Def.: Adjunto di artificala parto por remplas-igar parte o tote korpala defekto (ex.: artificala gambo).
protokol-o: (parl.) written minutes (of proceedings); (diplom.) protocol; «proces verbal», official report (by functionary, as of a crime).
-o: (anat., astron. and gen.) protuberance, prominence: projecting part.
-eskar: to become a proverb; become proverbial
provinc-o: province; (fig.) shire, country district or region outside of a capital city
proviz-ar: (tr.) to provide, supply, furnish (ulu, per ulo); to victual
-anto, -ero, -isto: provider, supplier, caterer, purveyor; (milit.) sutler, canteen-worker. Ex.: Provizar armeo per municioni. Provizar ulu per omna necesaji. V exp.: vid. furnisar.
provok-ar: (tr.) to provoke: call forth; incite, incense
-eso: business, position of being a pimp. Def.: Persono qua agas kom mediacero en shaminda afero.
proxim: (prep.) near, by, close to, nigh to; (of time and space; for quantities cf. cirkum; cf. apud)
-eskar: to draw nigh, approach, to approximate
-altra: prosaic, dull, matter of fact; -atr-eso: prosiness
pru-o: (nav.) bow, prow. Def.: L’avana parto di navo o batelo.
-ajo: a prudish act. Def.: Afektacante pudoroza.
prudent-a: prudent, cautious, politic, discreet, wary
pruin-ar, -as: (impers.) there is (or, we are having) a hoar frost (or, white frost)
prunel-o: (bot.) sloe: fruit of the blackthorn
prunt-ar: (tr.) to borrow (ulo, de ulu); (cf. prestar)
-ajo: that which is borrowed, a loan.
pruv-ar: (tr.) to prove, demonstrate by experiment or argument (ulo, per ulu)
psalmodi-ar: (intr.) to psalmodize, to sing psalms; (tr.) to drone out, recite (ulo) in a sing-song manner
-o: psalmody, psalm-singing. (fig.) sing-song. Def.: Psalmodio: maniero kantar la psalmi (aplikebla ad altro kam psalmi); IV-515.
psalteri-o: psaltery, a stringed musical instrument.
pseudo-*: a prefix signifying false, counterfeit.
-o: pseudonym, nom de plume, alias. Def.: Aganta o skribanta kun falsa nomo.
-ala: psychical. Def.: La koncio fenomenala, la objekto di la «psikologio» (tale psiko esas plu generala kam anmo); V-32. Ex.: Psikala kauzi, qualesi, dolori.
psikiatri-o: psyschiatry. Def.: Kuracado di mentala morbi.
psikologi-o: psychology. Def.: Ta parto di filozofio qua traktas la mentala fakultati ed agado di la psiko.
publican-o: (Rom. hist.) publican. Def.: Recevisto dil imposto o censo por la Romani (e pro to odiata e desestimata da la Judi); VII-281.
publicist-o: publicist. Def.: Persono qua skribis od esas erudita pri la yuri di nacioni, nacional ekonomiko, e.c.
pudor-ar: (intr., esp. of women) to feel a natural shame, modesty; be modest
pudr-o: powder (for the toilet; cf. pulvero)
puf-o: large stuffed footstool; round ottoman seat. Def.: Sidilo (ped-apog-ilo) polsterizita (sen ula dors-apogilo): II-647.
pugn-o: fist, -o-frap-ar: (tr.) to strike with the fist
-aro: bock and tackle, hoisting gear, compound pulley.
pulmonit-o: (med.) pneumonia, inflammation of the lungs.
pulp-o: (of fruits, bot., pharm.) pulp; (cf. paplo)
puls-ar: (tr., intr.) to push, thrust, drive (by force or violence); to impel (by pressure); to displace (by effort); to throb, pulsate, beat (as heart); (cf. shovar)
pultr-o: poultry, collective name for all domestic fowls; (cf. hano)
pulul-ar: (intr.) to pullulate: gow or germinate abundantly (cf. mult-eskar; formik-umar)
pulver-o: powder, any dry stuff composed of small particles, as used in guns, pharmacy (cf. polvo, pudro)
-igar: to reduce (ulo) to powder, to pulverize
punc-ar: (tr.) to punch: indent with pump or die
-ilo: punch. V. exp.: Puncar diferas de la stampo per ke stampar esas nur imprimar sur surfaco, kontre ke puncar esas penetrar o mem borar ula korpo; II-357.
puncion-ar: (tr. surg.) to puncture, tap (a tumor, etc.).
punis-ar: (tr.) to punish, chastise (ulu, por, per)
puns-ar: (tr.) to pounce (a design). Def.: Kopiar desegno per pulvero, quan on pasigas tra la trui di papero perforita segun la linei di la desegno; VI-116.
punt-o: (geom., astron., typo., play) point; dot; position; period; small hole (as made by a needle or awl)
-izar: to dot, prick, mark (ulo) with a point; to punctuate
pup-o: poop, stern (of a ship, boat). Def.: Dopa parto di navo, di batelo; III-594.
pupitr-o: desk for reading, writing, drawing, etc. (N.B. not pulpit; cf. katedro)
pur-a: pure (air, water, blood, wine, race, life, style, intentions, mathematics, etc.); genuine, unmingled, unalloyed; plain, mere, sheer; downright
-ismo: (rhet.) excessive nicety, esp. in choice of words
pure-o: purée, a thick soup, as of vegetables, boiled and strained.
purg-ar: (tr. lit. and fig.) to purge (the body, soul, mind, etc.)

-ilo: a purging instrument. V. exp.: Purgar: kuracar per purgivo (quale purgar intestini); liberigar de nepurajo e stranjeraji (quale purgar metalo); liberigar de kulpi etikal, intelektala (quale purgar de prejudiko, misopiniono).
-eto: small pustule; pimple (filled with matter). V. exp.: vid. papulo.
putativ-a*: putatative, reputed, supposed. Def.: Quan on supozas havar legal existo. Ex.: Putativa mariajo.
pute-o: well: shaft sunk in the ground for water, oil
b: (mus.) ti: seventh note diatonic scale.
babil-ar: (intr.) to babble, prattle (as infants); to chatter (as a magpie); to gossip, gabble, prate (of grown persons)
-ivo: badigeon: a cement or distemper paste of powdered stone and plaster.
bagn-o: bagnio: convict hulk or prison
bakanal-o: (lit. and fig.) bacchanalia: a drunken feast or revel.
balad-o: ballad, ballade: epic dance and song.
balancier-o: (of machines) a balancing body; fly-wheel; gimbals (of a compass). Def.: Maso (generale roto-forma) qua ocilas cirkum sua baricentro per risorto; II-641.
balbut-ar: (tr., intr.) to stutter, stammer (from emotion); to lisp (as an infant); to boggle; hem and haw, to hesitate in reading and reciting; (cf. barbuliar). V. exp.: vid. stoterar.
baldakin-o: baldachin: tester (of a bed); canopy (of a throne, altar, etc.)
baldri-o: baldric, shoulder belt (for sword, etc.).
balis-o: (nav.) sea-mark, buoy, beacon; (cf. boyo); (land) signal-pole (on R.R. or towpath)
balkon-o: (arch.) balcony; (nav.) stern gallery (of a ship)
balon-o: ball or sphere filled with air
balot-ar: (tr.) to elect (ulu) by second ballot, -o: second-ballot (in Europe; necessary when no candidate has obtained an absolute majority). -voto: vote by ballot.

balote-ar: (intr., med. and gen.) to wabble, shake, tremble, quiver (pro). Def.: La vulgara senco di ica vorto expresas la movo ocilanta o tremanta di maso solida, ma elastika o viskoza (quale gelatino). IV-516. Ex.: Lua karno baloteas pro la shoko.
balustr-o: baluster: upright support for railing. Def.: Mikra pilastro faasonita.
balustrad-o: balustrade, railing, (cf. pasamano). Def.: Rango formacita ek balustri, generale horizontala.
balzam-o: balsam: fragrant resin used as medicine; (fig.) balm, consolation
band-o: band (group), company, crew; (of fish) shoal
bandaj-o: (surg.) bandage; truss; (of a wheel) tire
-izar: to bandage; put a tire on
bande-ar: (intr. nav.) to have a list, be lopsided
banderol-o: pennant, streamer, banderole. Def.: Bendo longa ek stofo, qua flotacas en l'aero; finas ofte per du pinti; en pikturi, portas surskriburi; II-708.
bandolier-o: bandolier: cross-, shoulder-belt. Def.: Rimeno o sharpo pozita sur un shultro e suportanta ula kozo (ex. espado) sur l'altra latero, do pasanta oblique sur la korpo; II-708.
baner-o: banner (as used by societies, orders)
-igar: to bankrupt: cause bankruptcy to: -o: bankruptcy
-into,-ero: a bankrupt; (cf. ne-solventa). Note: this word implies something disgraceful or criminal; cf. faliar.
bar-ar: (tr.) to bar to stop up (a way, a door, etc.)
barak-o: shed, hut; temporary wooden building to shelter soldiers, fishermen, etc.; booth, covered stall (in a fair)
barakan-o: barracan: a camel's hair fabric.

barakt-ar: (intr.) to struggle: strive to get away, writhe, strive (kontre); (cf. luktar). Ex.: La kaptata fisho baraktas en l'aquo. Baraktar per manui e pedi. (fig.) La sovaji ne forte baraktas kontre la morto.
baratri-o: (nav.) barratry. Def.: Fraudo da la kapitano o navestro kontre armatori od asekuristi; II-75.
barb-o: beard: hair on the chin, lips and cheeks of men and animals
barbakan-o: (arch.) barbican; loop-hole; escape-hole (in retaining wall for water).
barbot-ar: (intr.) to dabble, paddle, splash, flounder about (in mud or water).
barbuli-ar: (tr.) to sputter, splutter, mumble;(cf. balbutar). Def.: Parolar iro rapide e konseque neklare e konfuze, nekompreneble; III-6.
bark-o: bark: small boat as wherry, punt, skiff. Def.: Mikra kanoto senmasta, movanta per remili, e ne generale uzata in maral aqui; (mitol.) la paromo di C(h)aron en la rivero Styx.
barok-a: odd, queer-looking, uncouth, baroque, bizarre; ill-shped, distorted (of pearls)
-ajo: an oddity. Def.: Qua havas aspekto nereguloza o stranja (ex. perlo, stilo); IV-2.
basa: (of dimensions, also pressure, sound) low (cf. alta)
-igar: to make low: shorten the height of (cf. abasar); to lower (in tone, in pressure)
-eskar: to decline, wane, begin to droop, drop
-Germana: low German (dialect). V. exp.: vid. alta. Ant.: alta.
basament-o: (arch.) basement. V. exp.: Ne konfunenda kun fundamento: basamento esas l'infra parto (bazo) videbla di edifico, qua jacas sur la fundamento; III-670.
basen-o: (dock, river, water-works) basin; (geog.) valley, hollow; (dish) deep, wide pan
bask-o: flap, skirt, tail (of a garment)
baskul-ar: (intr.) to see-saw: sway up and down
-igar: to make s.s., to rock back and forward
-ilo: a see-saw; swing (for play); rocker (of a chiar); sweep (of a well); (tech.) rocking lever
basot-o: dachshund, basset-hound. Def.: Hundo karakterizata da gambi tre kurta e tordita; VI-604.
bast-o: (bot.) bast, fiber: inner fibrous bark.
bastard-a, -o: bastard, illegitimate (of children); mongrel (of animals); hybrid (of animals, plants, etc.).
bat-ar: (tr.) to beat: strike repeatedly (ulu, ulo)
-ita: beaten; (dispute) inter-batar, batar reciproke: fight, quarrel, exchange of blows
batel-o: launch, barge, lighter; boat(s) (in general)
-agar: to b. (ulu), to use the b.
baz-o: base: lowest part of anything, foundation, bottom, foot; (fig.) basis, foundation, grounds; (chem.) base
be-ar: (intr.) to open the mouth, to gape (fig.) to yawn
bedel-o: beadle: apparitor; usher. Def.: La nomo di ta qua preiras o sequas la procesioni (generale religiala); VII-43.
begin-o: beguine: a kind of nun in the Netherlands
bek-o: beak: bill of a bird; (tech.) beak, spout (of a vessel)
bekafik-o: (orni.) beccafico, garden warbler, fig-eater (Sylvia hortensis).
bend-o: bank: long, narrow piece of cloth, paper, metal, etc., strip, stripe, streak; fillet (for head), (hat) band
-izar: to bind up, place a band on
benedik-ar: (tr.) to bless, pronounce a benediction on.
-iero: beneficiary: holder of a benfice; recipient of the profits from a benefit performance.
benigna: benign: kind, morally good; mild (of medicines, diseases).
benk-o: bench, long seat, settle, form; (in boats) thwart
benzo-o: (bot.) benzoin; resin from the tree Styrax benzoin.
bered-o*: beret: round, flat cap such as worn by Basque peasants.
berlin-o: berlin: a kind of coach.
berlok-o: trinket, charm (such as attached to watch chains).
berm-o: (fort. and gen.) berme: narrow shelf. Def.: Parto horizontal en taluso.
besti-o: beast, any animal except man, (cf. animalo, bruto) -ala, -atra: bestial
bestiari-o*: (rom. antiq.) bestiarius: person doomed to fight with wild beasts.
betrav-o: beetroot, beet (edible: Beta Rapa); (cf. beto).
bezon-ar: (tr.) to need; be in want of something necessary
-ego: a large b.; the old-fashioned, high b.
bidet-o: (furniture) bidet; a kind of Sitz bath.
bidon-o: can (for oil etc.) (milit.) canteen. Def.: Ladovazo klozita por oleo, petrolo, benzino, e.c. qua kontenas de un til 10 litri; gurdatra kontenilo ek lado, quan la soldato portas. (III
-kapo: cross-head. Def.: Stango qua ligas un peco ad altra, generale, stango di pistono a manivelo, e transformas movo rektolinea a movo rotaca. II
bifurk-ar: (tr. intr.) to bifurcate, branch off (from), fork (ek, kun) -o, -eyo: bifurcation, crotch (of a tree)
bilkoket-o: cup and ball (used in a game).
bilg-o: (nav.) bilge, lower part of a hold, well.
biliet-o: a written order or ticket
bilion-o: billion: a million millions: (1,000,000,000,000) N. B. not as in U.S.: a thousand millions.
biret-o: biretta: R. C. ecclesiastic square cap
bis: twice, (in theaters) encore! repeat! klamar bis: to encore; (repetition of numbers)
biskot-o: rusk, zwieback. Def.: Loncho de pano rostita o grilita; III
bitr-a: (lit. and fig.) bitter: hot and acid; sharp, poignant; biting; acrimonious
-eyo: a b. (place). V. exp.: Bivakar esas kampar sen tendi, sub la cielo (generale cirkum fairi), nun por un nokto; II
-ano: quibbler. Def.:Qua prizas perdar sua tempo en diskutar subtilaji neutila; IV
blam-ar: (tr.) to blame, find fault with, reprobate, disapprove the actions or conduct of (ulo, pri, pro). V. exp.: vid. reprochar Ant.: laudar.
blank-a: white; (fig.) blank: not written or printed on (page, etc.), -o, -ulo, -ino: a white person
-igar: to whiten, to bleach (clothes): -eskar: to become or turn white
blaz-ar: (tr.) to blunt, pall, cloy, sicken (ulu, pri ulo); -esar: to be palled, surfeited
blazon-o: blazon: coat of arms, armorial bearing
blez-ar: (tr.) to lisp. Def.: Pronuncar s quale th angla o c hispana (t. e. kun la lango-pinto inter la denti); III
blok-o: block, lump (of wood, stone, iron, etc.)
blokus-ar: (tr.) to blockade (a port), to invest (a town)
blotis-ar: (intr.) to lie close to the ground, crouch, cower; (cf. squatar). Ex.: Blotisar en angulo; blotisar dop hego o pordo.
bluz-o: blouse (as worn by workers, painters); smock (peasant's).
bobin-o: bobbin (for winding thread), spool; (cf. spul-ilo).
bogi-o: bogie-frame, -truck. Def.: Ensemblo di quar (o du) roti qui formacas vagoneto e surportas l'extremajo di vagono o di lokomotivo; III
bok-o: (anat.) mouth; orifice, opening, entrance (of a utensil, implement, volcano, harbor, etc.)
bokal-o: glass-jar. Def.: Vazo cilindra o cilindratra, ek vitro, sen pedo, kun plato fundo el larja boko, uzata precipue en kemio, farmacio (e por konfituri); II
boli-ar: (intr.) to boil: be in a state of ebullition (cf. ebuliar)
-ilo: bombarding instrument, as a mortar (cf. obus-kanono)
-eskar: to become, grow g. or better
bonet-o: rimless cap; bonnet (for woman or child)

boniment-ar: (intr.) to make a mountebank's speech, claptrap speech. Def.: Bonimento: diskurso fanfaronema, quan facas la sharlatani e feriala aktori por laudar sua vari od aktraktar la publiko. Bonimentar: facar bonimento; IV
bor-ar: (tr.) to bore, pierce (with a turning instrument)
borborigm-o: (med.) borborygm: rumbling of water or wind in the stomach.
bord-o: border, margin, brink, edge, brim, (ship's) side
borde-ar: (intr., nav.) to tack (ship), beat to windward. Def.: Avanirar (navo) zigzage kontre la vento; III
-ala: boreal. Def.: Mitologiala nomo di la nordvento, de qua venas boreala; III
bosel-ar: (tr., tech.) to emboss, chase (plate, leather). Def.: Formacar reliefi en metalo per martelago (de interne); VI-382.
botaniz-ar: (intr.) to botanize, herborize. Def.: Kolektar por la botanikal studio (ne praktikar o studiar la botaniko); III-169.
bov-o: a beef; bull, cow, ox
-agar: to brace (a rope of a yard).
brak-o: brach-hound; Def.: Speco di chas-hundo, rezapila e oreli pendanta.
braki-o: arm (anat. and fig. as a. of sea)
-umo: brassard, armlet (to show function or office)
bram-ar: (intr.) to make the characteristic call of any animal, except that of the dog, fox, cat, cock, crow, frog, hen
branch-o: (also geom., genal.) bough, branch (cf. ramo)
-izar: add a b. to (a gas or water-main)
brand-o: (fire-)brand; a piece of wood partly burnt
brandis-ar: (tr.) to brandish, flourish (a sword, etc.).
bras-ar: (tr.) to stir: mix up ingredients; (fig.) to concoct, contrive, polot, (schemes, plots, etc.)
braz-ar: to braze: join with spelter (hard solder). V. exp.: vid. weldar.
brech-o: breach, break, gap, opening (in a wall, etc.) dento-brech-oza: gap-toothed
-izar: to make a breach, gap in (ulo).
bretel-o: strap (to carry a knapsack, pack, etc.) strap, sling (for a musket, rifle); brace, suspender (to hold up trousers)
-i, paro: a pair of suspenders, braces.
-baseno: brazier, warming-pan. Def.: Ligno konvertita en karbono per komusto, sive ardoranta, sive extingita; II-708.
brid-o: bridle (of a horse) (fig.) check, curb
brilar: (intr.) to shine: emit or reflect light; be luminous, bright, brilliant, radiant; to glitter, glisten (cf. cin-til-ifar)
brin-o: short end or bit (of a cord, rope); Def.: Parto (seciono o segmento) di kordo; V-157.
brioch-o: brioche; a buttered cake or roll.
brizant-o: sunken-reef, -rock. V. exp.: Rifo salias super l'aquo, ma brizanto esas rokajo reze l'aquo, sur qua la ondi ruptesas; V
brod-ar: (tr.) to embroider: ornament with figures, needle-work.
brokant-ar: (intr.) to deal in second-hand goods
brokoli-kaulo*: broccoli: a hardy variety of cauliflower (Brassica oleracea botrytis).
-uro: brochure: pamphlet stitched, with paper covers; (cf. pamfleto)
-agar, -movar, -kontraktar: to knit one's b.s to frown, flinch.
bru-o: husk, shell (of nuts). Def.: Verda shelo (generale, di nuco); III
bruis-ar: (intr.) to make a noise: rustle, rattle, rumble, clatter, hum
-ego: a loud noise; crash, din, tumult, uproar
-igar: to cause (ulo) to make a noise, to rattle.
brul-ar: (tr., intr.) to burn: consume with fire (wood, coal, oil); to wound or injure with fire; to scorch, parch, dry up; (fig.) to be inflamed (with passion), to be ardent

-odoro: smell of burning; Ex.: La Romani brulis Carthage. La suno brulas la planti. V. exp.:Brular esas la vulgara, kombustar esas la ciencala vorto. On uzas brular ne nur por kombusti videbla, kun flamo, ma anke por la vundi facita da bolianta aquo. Altraparte, on uzas kombustar por omna oxidigo, mem nerapida e nevidebla: ex: la respirado esas kombusto; explozo esas anke kombusto. Nur la vulgara vorta uzesas metafore; on dicas »Me kordio brulas de amo.« On povas dicar, ke ulo kombustar sen brular, se ol nek flamifas nek ardoras (t.e. divenas fairoreda); IV
-igar: to make b., darken; (fig.) to sunburn
brunis-ar: (tr., tech.) to burnish (brass, gold, etc.). Def.: Procedo por polisar metali; III
brusk-a: brusque: gruff, abrupt, blunt (in address or manners)
bud-ar: (intr.) to be sulky, sullen, look sour (cf. facar muzelo)
-era, -ero, -ema, -emo: sulky (person). Def.: Manifestar nekontenteso, mala humoro per silenco, agado, expreso di la fizionomio. Ex.: La puero budas, nam ilua patrino ne permisas ke il ludas.
buf-ar: (intr.) to swell, puff out; to distend (as cheeks by blowing); to stand out (as stout silks, starched muslin, etc.)
-igar: to cause to puff, swell out
bufet-o: buffet: refreshment foom (at balls, R.R. stations, etc.).
-esar: to be a b.; (fig.) to be jocose
bugl-o: key-bugle. Def.: Trumpeto kun klavi.
bugran-o: buckram. Def.: Tolo forta e rigida (gumizita); III-73.
buji-o: candle (made from wax, etc.); (surg.) bougie.
bul-o: ball (as for play in billiards, basseball, etc.)
-eto: small ball, marble pellet (not E. bullet, vid. kuglo)
buletin-o: bulletin. Def.: Mikra jurnalo, revuo, o periodala raporto; III-199.
bulimi-o: (med.) boulimia. Def.: Nenaturala, nesaturebla apetito.
bulin-o: (nav.) bowline. Def.: Kordo qua tensas la seglo per l'infra angulo; VI-530.
bunt-a: many-colored; motley, streaked, checkered, piebald, dappled
-igar, -izar: to varigate (with colors), to streak (with many colors).
bur-o: short-hair or other materials used in stuffing saddle-pads, making mortar, etc.; wad, wadding (for guns)
burask-o: (nav.) squall; (fig.) outburst of passion. Def.: To ne esas ventego, nek tempesto, ma subita e neduranta ventobato; III-8.
burel-o: frieze, baize: a coarse woollen fabric.
bust-o: bust: head and shoulders of body, or as represented in sculpture and painting.
bustrofedon-o: boustrophedon; an ancient mode of writing.
but-ar: (intr.) to stumble, butt, knock, run, strike (sur, kontre ulo)
-ilo, -bufro: buffer: anything so placed as to act as a stop
-juntar, -pozar: to butt-joint; adjust two boards side by side or end for end so as not to overlap (opp. to clinker-build); (cf. klinar and IV-354)
ja: (adv.) already; before or by this time or the time mentioned, even now
jabot-o: jabot: ruffle on shirt bosom; lace frill worn on woman’s bodice.
jac-ar: (intr.) to lie (position of persons or things living or dead)
jar-o: jar: large earthen jug for water, etc.
jardinier-o: jardinière; flower stand or receptacle for plants; a dish of mixed vegetables. – V. exp.: Ne vazo, ma mobl(et)o por suportar flori o buketo; VI-528.

jargon-ar: (intr.) to talk jargon, gibberish, to jabber, to use unintelligible language; (cf. slango, galimatiaso). Def.: Linguo o dialekto nekorekta, ma ne esencale od intence diferanta de la ordinara linguo; VII-158. Ex.: La stranjeri ne parolas la Franca, li nur jargonas. La jargono di la infanti, di la rurano.
javelin-o: (weapon.) javelin. Def.: Speco di dardolonga e dina.

jelozi-o: Jalousie: Venetian blind, curtain blind. Def.: Klozilo kompozita ed multa lati (lameni) superpozita, quin on povas generale inlinar per rotaco cirkum lua longesal axo, e quin on povas levar o deslevar quale kurteno, per kordo o kordono. Kande ol esas tote levita, la lati esas aplikita uni sur altri; III-290.
jem-ar: (intr.) to groan, moan, to give forth a dull, low sound of grief or pain
jen-ar: (tr.) to hinder the movments of the body, (of clothing, etc.) to pinch, be too tight; (fig.) to hold in constraint, prevent, hinder from doing something
jendarm-o: gendarme: one of a body of military police, esp. in France.
jeneroz-a: generous, open-handed, munificent, liberal (in gifts).
-ano: e. soldier, a sapper and miner; (cf. injenioro).
jentil-a: (of character) nice, well-bred, courteous, civi
jer-ar: (tr.) to manage, administer, conduct (a hotel, business (for an owner))
jibet-o: gibbet. V. exp.: La objekto havas la formo di la litero Greka G (ne ta di la litero ?); kp. patibulo; IV-511.
jinet-o: (zool.) genet(te): species of civets (Viverra Genetta); a Turkish ringcurb, -bit.
jir-ar: (intr.) to turn about, gyrate; (nav.) veer around, tack about, put about

-achar: to prowl around. V. exp.: Turnar, rotacar, jirar: La verbo turnar esas la maxim generala e suficas por l’ordinara uzado. La du altri esas teknikala. Korpo rotacas kande ol turnas cirkum axo qua trairas lu (ex. roto cirkum sua axo: to esas l’etimologiala origino di la verbo: L. rota, rotare). Korpo jiras, kande ol turnas cirkum axo o punto situita exter lu, plu o min fore (ex. veturo, navo jiras deskriptante arko di cirklo o di altra kurvo; II-644.
jiravolt-o: (horsemanship) volt right and left, quick turning.
jok-ar: (tr.. intr.) to joke, banter (ulu); to joke, jest (kun ulu, pri ulo)
-ante, per jokar: by way of a joke, in jest
jongl-ar: (intr.) to juggle (per): to play tricks by sleight of hand.
jorn-o: (opp. to night) day, daylight, daytime; (cf. dio)
-eskar: it begine to be light, day is coming
joy-ar: (intr.) to be joyous, be delighted, be glad
-igar: to cause (ulu) to rejoice, to fill with joy; (cf. gay-igar)
ju-ar: (tr.) to enjoy: to have a satisfaction in, feel with pleasure, revel in
jube-o: jube: a gallery in a church containing the rood.
jubile-ar: (tr.) to celebrate the jubilee of
-o: (R. C. Church and Jewish) jubilee; 50th anniversary, golden wedding
judici-ar: (tr., jur.) to judge judicially (ulu, ulo); (cf. judiko)
judik-ar: (tr., intr.) to judge: to conclude or determine by the exercise of judgment (not legal; cf. judiciar); to exteem, deem, think
julep-o: (pharm.) julep: a sweet demulcent mixture, used as a vehicle.
julien-o: julienne: a clear vegetable soup.
jung-ar: (tr.) to put to, «inspan» (as horses to a carriage), to yoke up (oxen)
-izar: to cover with rushes; to cane (chairs, etc.).
junt-ar: (tr., material sense) to join: place one thing in contiguity to another; (of hands) to clasp; (cf. unionar) -uro, -eyo: joint, junction
jur-ar: (tr., intr.) to swear: make solemn declaration, to give one’s oath
-igar: to swear in (ulu), administer the oath to (ulu)
-into: person sworn (cf. juri-ano). Ex.: Jurar dicar la verajo. Jurar fideleso ad ulu. Jurar amikeso ad ulu.
juriskonsult-o: jurisconsult: a man learned in law, esp. Civil law; a jurist; counsellor at law.
jurisprudenc-o: judicature: ordinary method which tribunals use in judging points of law

-i: precedents. V. exp.: Ne en la senco; yuro- (lego-) cienco, ma en la senco; interpretado di la legi per la verdikti di la judiciisti, o generale: maiero aplikar la legi a la partikulara kazi; IV-200.
jus: (adv.) just: just now, this last minute, the moment just passed
-a: of a moment ago. Ex.: Vu venas tro tarde, lu jus mortis. Me jus arivis.
just-a: conforming to some proper standard (N.B. not legal sense; cf. yusta); right, correct, well grounded, exact, proper (of measure, time, balance, word, thought, etc.)
justifik-ar: to justify: prove or show to be right; to vindicate, warrant
-eble: justifiable, warrantable. Def.: Montrar ke ulu od ulo esas justa. (kp. yust-igar); II-673.
rabat-ar: (tr.) to make a reduction in (value or price); (cf. diskontar)
-isto: rabbinist, one who adheres to the tradition of the rabbins.
racion-o: (faculty) reason, power of understanding, intellect; (cf. motivo, expliko, kauzo, rezonar)
radi-ar: (tr., intr.) to radiate, irradiate: to emit rays or beams
-o: ray, beam, gleam; (geom.) radius; (of a wheel) spoke; (ich.) ray, skate

radiator-o*: radiator (of heat); cooling apparatus. Def.: Aparato destinita cedar kaloro a l’aero cirkondanta (quale l’aparati, qui varmigas nia domi, e l’aparati, qui koldigas l’aquo en la motori di automobilo); V-626-7.
radik-o: (of plants, etc., also gram., math.) root; (gram.) root, stem, radix, radical, primitive word or syllable; (fig.) beginning, origin
-izar: to plant: fix (ulo) in earth by roots
radiograf-ar: (tr.) to photograph (ulu, ulo) by means of x-rays
radioskop-ar: (tr.) to view an opaque object by means of Röntgen rays
radot-ar: (intr.) to be in his (or her) dotage, to talk drivel; nonsense
rafin-ar: (tr., lit. and fig.) to refine (metal, sugar, the taste, etc.); (cf. pur-igar; delikat-igar)
-ito: refined person: one who has a delicate taste, in art, literature
raft-o: raft, plank or log float
rag-o: tatter: cloth torn and hanging (cf. shifono)
ragut-o: (cook.) ragout: a highly seasoned dish; a stew; hash.
rajunt-ar: (tr.) to overtake, catch up to. Def.: Atinger ulu, ulo, sequinte lu kun plu granda rapideso; III-470. Ex.: Il jus departis, ma me esperas balde rajuntar il.

rak-ar: (tr.) to draw, rack off (wine, etc.) (fig.) to extract, worm out (secrets, money, etc.) V. exp.: To ne esas trans-varsar (varsar ek un vazo en altra per la suprajo), ma pasigar (liquido) de un vazo en altra, cherpante sube (per robineto o sifono); III-77.
rakont-ar: (tr.) to recount, tell (a made up story, fiction, something which never happened, is not true)
-achar: to tittle-tattle. V. exp.: vid. naracar.

rali-ar*: (tr., intr., milit. and fig.) to rally (troops). Def.: Kunvenigar hazarde soldati dispersita, ne segun individuala ordino; metafore signifikas adhero (plu or min bonvoloza) a partiso, a persono, e.c.; V-742.
ram-o: small bough, twig, small branch (of a tree); (fig.) a subdivision or branch artery, vein; branch of family, etc.
ramp-o: (upward) slope, gradient, incline, ramp. V. exp.: vid. pento.
rang-o: row, file, tier, range; (degree, station) rank, order
-izar: to place (ulo) in rows, put (uli) in ranks; to class (persons, things) (cf. lok-izar)
rankor-ar: (intr.) to have a grudge, a ranco(u)r, spite; to feel resentment, animosity (kontre ulu, pri, pro, ulo).
ranur-o: groove: a long, square-cut, sunken channel in wood or metal; (firearms) rifling; (cf. kanelo).
rap-o: (bot.) a variety of turnip (Brassica rapa rapifera).
rapec-ar: (tr., of clothing) to piece, put a piece in, patch; (of shoes) to cobble; (cf. reparar).
rapid-a: (in space and time) rapid, swift, quick, prompt, fleet, speedy, fast (cf. ajila, hast-ema, alert)
raport-ar: (tr.) to make a report on, to report (ulo, ad ulu)

-anto, -ero, -isto: reporter. Def.: Facar raporto, t.e., plu o min longa naraco o deskripto pri kozo od evento, specale a chefo od autoritato kompetenta, od a societo, kongreso, quan o devas o volas informar; VI-79; matematikala raporto equivalas fraciono, kp. relatar. Ex.: Historio reportas remarkinda fakti. Komercala raporti; La raportisto raportas la novaji od facas raporto pri ula proceso. La reporto di 2 ad 3 esas la fraciono 2/3.
rapsodi-o: rhapsody: poem recited by a rhapsodist; (fig.) rambling composition.
rapt-ar: (tr.) to sieze and carry away by violence, pillage, kidnap, ravish
-ocido: murder (attended) with robbery. V. exp.: vid. furtar, extorsar.
rar-a: rare, seldom occuring, not frequent, infrequent, unusual; (cf. skarsa)
-ajo: a rarity, curiosity. Def.: Des-ofta, des-frequa; V-595. Ant.: ofta, frequa, cf. skarsa.
ras-o: (human, animal) race, stock, breed; (fig.) family, line, ancestry, blood; (agri.) variety
raskal-o: rascal, rogue, knave, scamp, blackguard
rast-ar: (tr.) to rake: clean (ulo) with a rake
rastaquer-o*: a foreigner or stranger travelling without known means of existence; a fashionably dressed swindler.
rastelier-o: rack, wooden frame of open work, as for fodder, for arms, etc.
ratifik-ar: (tr.) to ratify, confirm (a treaty, an act, etc.). Def.: Autentigar ulo ja facita o promisita.
raut-o: rout, a fashionable assembly, a large evening party.
-izar: to gully out (by torrent), to cross (a land) with ravines. Def.: Longa, profunda e streta exkavuro formacita da torento.
-ante: admirably, wonderfully well. Ex.: Vua kantado ravises me. Me esis en raviseso (od, ravisata). Il kantas ravisante.
-ero, -isto: barber. Def.: Tranchar raze la pili.
re: (mus.) re, D, the second note of the diatonic scale.
real-a: real: actually existing, not imaginary, not fictitious
-ajo, lo reala: a reality, what is real
-igar: to realize: make real, bring (ulo) into being; (fin.) to convert into money
-eskar: to become or be realized; be converted into money; (fig.) to come to pass
-eskar, -esar: to rebel, rise in rebellion (cf. revoltar); -esko, -eso: rebellion
-aro: (collect.) rebels. Def.: Qua violente refuzas obediar autoritato yurizita. Ex.: La rebela anjelo. Rebelo kontre rejo. Ant.: obedi-anta, -ema.  ? DEFIS
rebord-o: a raised edge; brim, rim
-izar: to put a raised edge on (ulo). V. exp.: Flanjo existas nur en tubi. Rebordo ne esas simpla bordo, ma bordo salianta ofte perpendikla a la chefa parto (quale rebordo di chapelo); IV-642.
recepcion-ar: (tr., tech.) to take over. V. exp.: Examenar la qualesi di furnisajo e pose decidar pri lua acepto o refuzo. VII-480.
recept-o: (med., cook) recipe, receipt (cf. preskripto). Def.: Formulo qua indikas la kompozuro di ula medikamento o la ingrediento di ulo.
recev-ar: (tr.) to receive, accept (something offered, given, sent)

-atesto: acknowledgement of receipt. V. Exp.: On recevas simple to, quo donesis o sendesis, mem ne demandita o ne expektata. On recevas donacajo, pensiono. On aceptas kande on voluntas recevar (gasto, e.c.). Obtenar esas recevar kozo, quan on deziras, demandas, por qua on konkursis (premio) od irge penis; II-647.
recidiv-ar: (intr., jur.) to repeat the same offence, to commit the same crime again; (med.) to reappear (said of a former illness)
-o: recidivism: relapse into crime or illness, second offense
recipient-o: (chem., phys.) recipient: receiving vessel for gases or liquids.
recit-ar: (tr.) to recite: repeat out loud something learned (a lesson, etc.)
recitativ-o: (mus.) recitative: sort of a musical declamation used in operas, etc.
-igar, -izar: to make red (ulu, ulo); to cause to blush
redakt-ar: (tr.) to draw up, word (a document); to edit (a newspaper, journal) (cf. edit-ar)
redingot-o: frock coat: double-breasted garment for men, with long skirts before and behind.
reduit-o: (fort.) reduit, inner fortification; (fig.) retreat, refuge. Def.: La senco vulgara e la senco militala esas identa: «loko, angulo en qua on povas retretar, refujar, celar su»; IV-706.
redukt-ar: (tr., intr.; also surg., math.) to reduce (to proper, suitable proportions; cf. diminutar); (jur.) to commute (a sentence)

-ebla: reducible. Ex.: Reduktar (la dimensioni di) mapo, tablo. Reduktar ulu a taco. Reduktar ulo a pulvero. Reduktar frumento a farino. Reduktar rupturo. Reduktar du fracioni a la sama denominatoro.
refer-ar: (tr., intr.) to refer (to): to direct, send to another; to attribute, ascribe
referendari-o: referendary, (in France) a former title of certain public officers; (in Germany) young barrister attending the courts and qualifying for the post of «Assessor»

reflekt-ar: (tr., phys. sense) to reflect (back), mirror back (ulo); to turn something back; (intr., fig. mental sense) to reflect, consider, meditate especially on something past (pri): -esar: to be reflected (en, sur)
reform-ar: (tr.) to reform: amend for the better (laws, customs, morals, etc.)
-ebla: refrangible. Ex.: La prismato refraktas la lumo-radii.
refraktar-a: (of substances) refractory, not easily melted, wrought or acted upon
refren-o: refrain, burden of a song; (fig.) constant theme, topic.
refuj-ar: (intr.) to take refuge, seek shelter (che ulu, ad ulo). (fig.) to have recourse (to)

refut-ar: (tr.) to refute, confute, disprove. Def.: Kombatar aserto od opiniono per argumenti, qui nuligas ol o qui pruvas la kontreajo. (En proceso, en diskuto, singla partiso penas refutar la aserto o pretendo di l’altra); III-222.

-ajo: what is refused. V. exp.: Vu refuzas, sive kozo quan on ofras a vu, sive kozo, quan on demandas de vu, sive irga propozo quan on facas a vu. Do refuzar = ne aceptar, o ne koncesar (ne volar donar), o ne admisar, o ne konsentar; III-222.
regal-ar: (tr., also fig.) to regale, treat, entertain, feast
regard-ar: (tr.) to pay regard to: to look at something attentively, cast the eye on

-o, -ado: look(ing), gaze, stare, Ex.: Regardar la homi pasanta. El lansis regardi furioza. Regardar super muro. La regardi expresas la pensi. V. exp.: Vidar esas nur perceptar ulo per l’okulo, vole o nevole. Regardar esas esforcar por vidar, implikas sempre intenco ed atenco, mem se on fakte ne sucesas vidar: ofte on dicas: «me regardas, e me vidas nulo»; V-35; kp. spektar, kontemplar.

regener-ar: (tr.) to regenerate: to generate anew; (theol.) to make to be born again; (fig.) to reform, amend. Ex.: La sapto regeneras la aboro-tisui. Bapto esas regenero. Regenerar naciono dekadanta.
regi-o: regie, direct administration, management of government properties (as opposed to contract administration), esp. the excise administration; a government monopoly.
region-o: (all senses) region, part of a country, of space, of the body, of a science
registr-o: register, record (of persons); account (of acts and proceedings); (com.) account book
regn-ar: (tr., intr.) to reign: to rule as king or sovereign, to hold sway over (ulu, ulo)
regres-ar: (intr.) to regress, recede; to recoil
-anta, -iva, -ema: (lit. and fig.) regressive, retrograde. Ant.: avancar.
regret-ar: (tr.) to regret, be sorry about (ulu, ulo)
-inda: regrettable. Ex.: Regretar la pekunio spensita, amiko mortinta.
regul-ar: (tr., tech. and fig.) to regulate (machines, clocks, etc.)
-oza: regular: conformed to rule or law, uniform, constant
-izar: to make, establish regulations for, impose regulations on
regulator-o*: (mechan.) regulator, governor. Def.: Ula parto di mashino qua regulas la movado.

-o: rehabilitation, vindication. Def.: Riestablisar en lua olima stando, partikulare en yuri. Ex.: Rehabilitar la memoro di kondamnito. Rehabilitar ulu ad lua olima rango, ulu en l’estimo di la populo.

rejim-o: (polit. social, medic.) regime, regimen; mode or system of rule or management. Def.: Senco politikala: formo o maniero di guvernado. Senco teknikala: maniero plu o min reguloza segun qua ula fenomeno (duranta) eventas. Senco medicinala: maniero (metodoza) di vivar e di nutrar su (to ne esas dieto, nek higieno); IV-580. Ex.: Anciena rejimo. Monarkiala rejimo. Rejimo di karceri.
rekalk-ar: (tr., tech.) to upset (metals); to ram (a gun)
-ilo: rammer (of a firearm). Def.: Facar preso sur materio cilindroforma (liquida o solida) sur un de lua bazi en la sinso di l’axo, tale ke on kurtigas ol; IV-581.
rekam-ar: (tr.) to figure or work a fabric with gold, silver, silk, etc.
rekapitul-ar: (tr.) to recapitulate; sum up the principal points. Def.: Rezumar, kurte repetar o rimemorigar per enumero preciza e kompleta di omna punti, parti, o chapitri; III-206.
reklam-ar: (tr., intr.) to advertise (loudly), to boom; (cf. avertar)
reklamac-ar: (tr.) to (re-)claim, put in a claim for (compensation, a reward, what is due, one’s rights, etc.) (cf. postular)
-anto: claimant. Ex.: Reklamacar objekti pruntita o perdita. Reklamacar sumo debata, salario, honorario (cf. III-409).
rekolec-ar: (rel.) to commune with one’s own heart, to turn one’s mind from earthly affairs and piously meditate

rekoli-ar: (tr.) to gather in, in order to save from loss. Def.: Prenar o gardar ulo od ulu abandonita, perdita o falinta; VI-115. Ex.: Rekoliar fragmenti de la naufrajo. Rekoliar la perdita infanti.
rekolt-ar: (tr., also fig.) to harvest, reap, get in (crops), gather in (the fruits of the earth)
rekomend-ar: (tr.) to recommend (ulu, ulo, ad ulu) (cf. konsilar, exhortar)
rekompens-ar: (tr.) to recompense, reward, require, remunerate (ulu, per ulo).
rekord-o: record (in sports). Def.: Sportala prodajo, oficale konstatita, e qua ecelas super omna agi di sama genero entee facita.
rekort-ar: (tr.) to cut, clip; curtail, (the outside, the edge, the end), to pare, crop, prune, lop (the nails, a garment, a coin) (cf. tondar)
rekrut-ar: (tr., milit. and fig.) to recruit, enlist (ulu, ad)
-achar: to entice (ulu) into enlisting, to crimp.
rekt-a: (geom.) straight; not crooked or curved; upright, plumb, erect

-igar: straighten, align, lay out in line; (milit.) to dress the ranks. Ex.: Stacar rekte. Irar segun rekto. Rekta kolumo. Rektigar la trupi. V. exp.: vid. direta, erektar. Ant.: kurva, tord-ita, sinu-oza.
rektifik-ar: (tr., chem, and fig.) to rectify (spirits, errors, etc.). Def.: Purigar per distilado; igar exakta; korekt-igar.
rektor-o: rector: headmaster of an acedemy, of a university, of a Jesuit college; (cf. paroko).
rekuper-ar: to recover, regain, retrieve, get back the possession or use of, to recoup
-ebla: (also fin.) recoverable. Def. Ri-aquirar, ri-posedar ulo. ex.: Rekuperar kaloro, sua havaji, spensi, forteso, parol-povo, vid-povo, bon-san-eso. DeFIS
rekurs-ar: (intr.) to have recourse to (ad ulu, ulo), to appeal, to resort (ad)
-o: recourse; application for assistance or protection; resort (to a source of aid)
rekuz-ar: (tr., jur. and fig.) to challenge (a witness, juror); to take exception to (testimony, statements)

-ebla: exceptionable, challengeable, doubtful. V. exp.: Rekuzar esas teknikal termino di la yurocienco; on rekuzas judikanto o testo (t.e. on ne aceptas lu, ed on exkluzas lu), en ula kondicioni determinita da la legi, ex. kande la senpartiseso di la judikanto o testo esas suspektebla (pro lua relati kun la judikoti, pro lua personal interesti, e.c.). Judikanto povas rekuzar su ipsa spontane pro simila motivi, to esas, refuzas funcionar. Komprenebla, ca vorto povas uzesar kun metafora senco en la komuna vivo; III-222.
relat-ar: (tr., intr.) to have reference to, stand in some relation to, to be related, to relate to; (of persons) to be connected (by business, etc.; N.B. not family; cf. parenta)
-o: relation (di ulo ad ulo, ulu kun ulu)
-e: relatively, comparatively (not absolutely); in reference to, with regard
-anta, -iva: pertaining, relating to; relative to; (jur.) appertaining to
-igar: to put (ulu, ulo) into relation or connection (ad, kun ulu, ulo)

-ata: correlative. Ex.: «A relatas B» signifikas ke existas «relato» inter A e B. On povas anke «relatigar» A ad (od, kun) B. V. exp.: Relato (matematikala senco): On povas dicar 2 relatas 3, quale 4 relatas 6, od on darfas parolar pri «relato» di 2 a 3. La nociono relato esas multe plu general ed ampla kam la nociono raporto. On bezonas sempre parolar pri relati inter diversa grandaji, e ca relati esas tante generala, ke ne omni povas expresesar per equacioni. La relato di a ad b povas esar irga funciono; la reporto di a ad b esas simple e nur la fraciono a/b; VI-296.
relay-o: (also elec., teleg.) relay, fresh supply of horses, etc.
releg-ar: (tr., pr. and fig.) to relegate, send off, shut up, consign, seclude (ulu, ulo) in a fixed place
-o, -eso: regulation, banishment. Def.: Enternar en loko determinita. Ex.: Relegar recidivinto ad kolonio. Relegar ulu a chambro, portreto ad kelero, ulu ad ruro. V. exp.: vid. exilar.
relev-ar: (tr.) to survey, map out, make a plan of; (nav.) take a bearing of (coasts, shores).
relief-o: (paint., sculp., arts) relief, relievo, embossment
-ano: believer in a religion; faithful, true believer.
reliqui-o: relic (of saints, etc.); (pl.) mortal remains, relics
rem-ar, -adar: (tr., intr.) to row, pull on an oar
remark-ar: (tr.) to remark, to notice, observe
-igar: to cause (ulu) to remark, to attract notice to; (fig.) to state, to say
-inda: worthy of note, remarkable, curious, notable
remedi-ar: (tr.) to remedy (a disease, a sickness); (fig.) to redress, repair, set to rights
-ebla: remediable (disease); (fig.) remediar malajo: to remedy an evil

reminic-ar*: (tr.) to reproduce or imitate (consciously or not) from memory some literary or musical piece. V. exp.: Reminico ne esas simpla rimemoro: o esas rimemoro di ula literatural o muzikal peco, quan on imitas nevole o nekoncie: to esas esence imito o kopio di artala verko en altra, do tote altra kozo kam la simpla memoro, qua esas nur la kauzo od okaziono di la reminico. On povas havar rimemoro sen pro to facar reminico; V-627.
remis-ar: (tr.) to remit (debts, sins, etc.); (med.) to abate (symptoms)
-ebla: remissable: that may be remitted or forgiven, pardonable

remonstr-ar: (intr.) to remonstrate. Def.: Expozar polite (mem a superioro) la nejusteso di la ago; V-25. Ex.: En l’anciena monarkio, la parlamenti havis la yuro facar remonstri al rejo . . . qua generale ne egardis oli.
remont-o: (milit.) remount(ing): purchase or supply of fresh horses
remork-ar: (tr., nav. and gen.) to tow, take in tow, tug, haul, drag (a boat, a movable object; cf. tuvar)
rempar-o: rampart, bulwark; (fig.) any means of defence.
remplas-ar: (tr., intr.) to replace: take the place of, be in the place of (ulu, ulo)
-igar: to replace (ulu da ulu, ulo per ulo)
remulad-o: (cook.) remo(u)lade, a French salad dressing somewhat resembling mayonnaise.
rendevu-o: rendezvous: a meeting appointed, appointment
rendiment-o*: (tech.) output, efficiency (of machines). Def.: Elekto utila (di mashini).
reneg-ar: (tr.) to deny (untruly), to disown, disavow

-anto: (rel. and gen.) renegade: apostate from the faith; backslider. Ex.: St. Petro trifoye renegis Jesu. Renegar sua familio, sua religio.Def.: Deklarar nevere ke on ne konocas ulu, ulo; abjurar (ne-vere); des-agnoskar (ne-vere). V. exp.: vid. renuncar.
renet-pomo: rennet-apple: a kind of pippin.
