renkontr-ar: (tr.) to meet: meet with accidentally when in motion, to fall in with, encounter (ulu, ulo)
-izar: to allow a yearly income to (ulu), to endow (public institutions)
-ifar: to bring in revenue, yield an income
-iero: fundholder, stockholder, annuitant, person of independent means

renunc-ar: (tr.) to renounce, give up, relinquish, resign (a position, office). Def.: Cesar dezirar o demandar ulo. Ex.: Me renuncas voyajo, quan me intencas facar; on renuncas yuro, quan on posedas; e.c. Rejido renuncas la trono o la krono, kande, nultempe regninte, il refuzas regnor; IV-100. V exp.: Ni renuncas yuro, precepti o kustumi; ni renegas mastro o nia religio; ni abjuras eroro, od imaginita eroro. Philip V renuncis la krono di Francia; St. Petro renegis sua mastro; Henry IV abjuris la Kalvanismo.
renvers-ar: (tr., intr.) to overthrow, throw down, upset (cf. subversar, invers-igar)
-ebla: that may be overthrown. Def.: Faligar ulo, ulu ad tero. Ex.: Renversar muro, tablo, inkuyo, veturo, persono, (fig.) esperi. La muro renversis.
repar-ar: (tr.) to repair, restore, mend a road, a house, a machine, a picture; to refit (a ship); (cf. rapecar)
repartis-ar: (tr.) to divide into due proportion, portion out, distribute (ulo inter uli)

-anto, -ero, -isto: distributer. Def.: Dividar segun proporciono oportuna o yusta; VI-79. V. exp.: Se publika prunto esas suskriptita dekople, on repartisas ol inter la suskriptinti en la proporciono di 1/10, t.e. on atribuas a singlu 1/10 de la sumo, quan lu suskriptas. Simile on repartisas kargajo inter plura porteri o porto-bestii, inter la axi di veturo o vagono, e.c.; VI-79; kp. disdonar, distributar.
repast-ar: (intr.) to take one’s meal, have a meal (che, kun)
-eto: luncheon, light repast. Def.: Manjar ye fixa horo, apud tablo (generale kune); II-74. Ex.: Li repastis che me. La repast-horo. Il manjas quar repasti omnadie.
repent-ar: (tr., intr.) to repent, rue, feel contrition
reper-ar: (tr.) to put a guiding mark on

-ilo, -punto: guidemark (as made on a piece of machinery so as to assemble easily and accurately; mark on a wall, a measuring-rod, on the ground, in order to indicate alignment, a level, a height, etc.
reperkut-ar: (tr.) to repercuss: to drive or beat back; (of sound) to reverberate
-o: repercussion, reverberation, rebound (cf. ri-salto). Def.: Reperkuto: l’ago di korpo shokata, qua shokas sua-vice altra; IV-138. Ex.: Reperkuto di (pafita) kanono.
repertori-o: a table, index, register by which things can be readily located; (theat.) repertoire; stock-pieces, -plays
repet-ar: (tr.) to repeat: reiterate, tell or say again (what has been told before or what another has said)
-achar: to repeat tediously. V. exp.: On repetas nur paroli; on iteras omna-speca ago; II-80.
replet-a: (of living beings) chubby, plump, stout, firm-fleshed, replete (from food)

-eskar: to become plump, chubby; (cf. korpulenta, obeza, grasa, plena, ronda). Def.: Qua havas formi ronda e karno ferma, do la pelo kelke tensita. (Lu povas tote ne esar korpulenta, ex. infanto. La repleteso esas signo di saneso); VI-601.
replik-ar: (tr., intr.) to rejoin, retort: to answer to a reply
-o: answer, reply: (jur.) replication: the reply of the plaintiff to the defendant’s plea; rejoinder: the defendant’s answer to the plaintiff’s replication
report-ar: (intr., stock exchange) to allow a contango
-o: contango, premium or interest paid by a buyer to a seller to be allowed to defer payment until a future settlement; cf. VI-603, VII-354. Ant.: diporto.
repoz-ar: (intr.) to rest (repose); (cf. dormar, jacar, apogar, haltar)
-altaro: (fig.) temporary altar (in the street). Ex.: Lua korpo repozas sub la stono. Il ne dormas, il ne nur repozas. Il repozigas sua kapo sur kuseno. Havar repozo di koncienco.
repres-ar: (tr.) to repress, check, restrain, put down, suppress (a revolt, abuses, pride, one’s desires, etc.)
-iva: repressive. Def.: Haltigar l’efekto, la progreso di ulo.
reprezel-ar: (intr.) to retaliate, to make reprisals (kontre); (fig.) to give tit for tat

-letri: letter of marque and reprisal. V. exp.: Reprezalar esas plu proxima a venjo kam a revancho. To konsistas (precipue en milito) facar a l’enemiko exakte la sama domajo, quan on subisis de lu. To facesas partikulare pri la agi nekorekta e kruela, qui ecesas la «yuri di la milito», exemplo masakro di nekombatanti, incendio di domi e vilaji, destrukto di monumenti, e.c. Reprezalo nule implikas revancho, nam ol facesas ofte de la vinkiti, precipue kande li vinkesas per nekorekta procedi; VI-143; kp. revanchar, venjar.
reprezent-ar: (tr.) to represent, exhibit by resemblance or action; depict; be the representative of

-anta, -iva, -ala; -anto, -ero: representative. Ex.: La ceno reprezentas palaco. Ambasadisto reprezentas sua stato. Reprezento di kombato. Il esas reprezentanto di la populo. Guvernado reprezentiva.
reprimand-ar: (tr.) to reprimand, admonish, rebuke, reprove, chide, lecture (ulu pri, pro ulo) (cf. exhortar)
-achar, -ar harde: to scold, nag. V. exp.: Reprimandar e reprochar esas «speci» di la generala ideo blamar. Ma reprocho vizas kozo od ago
reproch-ar: (tr.) to reproach, upbraid, taunt, twit (ulo, ad ulu)
reps-o: (fabric) rep. Def.: Stofo ek silko o lano tre forta; III-143.
rept-ar: (intr.) to crawl (as a serpent), to creep (as a child); (fig.) to crawl before one (in an abject manner)
-isto: believer in, partisan of a republic.

repudi-ar: (tr.) to repudiate; to put away (one’s wife). Ex.: Philippe Auguste repudiis sua spozino Ingleburge. V. exp.: Propre, repudiar esas forsendar spozino, «desspozinigar» el segun legal formi. Figure, renegar opiniono, kredo. La repudio diferas de la divorco per ke ol ne bezonas ago di judiciisto o di extera autoritato; III-206.
repugn-ar: (tr.) to have or inspire a repugnance to, to hava an aversion to, to disgust (cf. antipatiar, nauze-igar)
-anta, -iva: repugnant, repulsive, disgusting. Ex.: Repugnar facar ulo. Ulo repugnis il. Il repugnesis da ulu, da ulo. Repugneso kontre ulu, ulo; To esas repugnanta a mea raciono.
repuls-ar: (tr.) to repel, repulse, rebuff, beat back (cf. retro-pulsar)
-anta, -iva: (phys. and fig.) repellent, repulsive. Ex.: Repulsar l’asalto di enemiko. Repulsar tenteso, ula propozajo. La repulso di elektroza korpi. Repuls-anta, -iva korpo, vizajo.
-esar: to be held (to be so and so)
-o, -eso: reputation, character, repute (good or bad). Ex.: Reputar ulu kom richa, kom saja. Reputesar kapabla. Havar bona reputeso. Esar reputata kom bona.
requizit-ar: (tr.) to requisition, make demand in the name of the public or of the law for (persons, animals, thigs, services)
resek-ar*: (tr., surg.) to resect, cut off.
recipicenc-o*: (rel.) resipiscence, change of mind; repentence.
reson-ar*: (intr., lit. and fig.) to resound: send back sound, (re-)echo
-ilo: resonator. Ex.: Ica audeyo resonas perfekte. Voco klara e resonanta. (fig.) Omna loko resonis pro lua prodajo.
resorb-ar: (tr.) to resorb, reabsorb (a tumor, etc.).
-matraco: s. mattress; (cf. elastika). Ex.: Resorto di horlojo, di veturo. (fig.) Donar resorto a la spirito.
resortis-ar: (intr. jur.) to be under the jurisdiction (of), belong to the department, to be the province (of), be under the cognizance
-o: (legal) jurisdiction, resort; (general) province, department, competence, power
respektar: (tr.) to respect: regard with a degree of reverence or esteem
respir-ar: (tr., intr.) to respire, breathe (cf. aspirar, expirar)
-ebla: breathable. Def.: Aspirar l’aero por regenerar la sango e lore expirar ol.
respond-ar: (tr., intr.) to answer, reply, respond (ulo ad ulu)
respons-ar: (intr.) to be responsible, be answerable, be accountable (pri ulu, ulo)
-anto: one who is responsible; a bondsman
rest-ar: (intr.) to remain: to be left, to be left remaining; to stay, sojourn, tarry (N.B. not lie at rest, repose; cf. repozar)
-ajo: that which remains: rest, remainder (of a quantity or sum); leavings, vestige, scraps (cf. reziduo)

-eyo: place of sojourn. Ex.: Nulo restis de nia pekunio. Triadek hoteli restas. Il restis en Roma pos nia departo. Multi restis sur la kombat-agro. Me haltis en la urbo e restis ibe dum du monati. Me brulos to quo restas (od, la rest-ajo). V.exp.: Restar: esar dum kelka tempo en la sama loko o stando, ma ne definitive, t.e. mine kam habitar, ma pluse kam haltar; III-103.
restaur-ar: (tr.) to restore. Ex.: Restaurar domo, pikturo, dinastio, arto, lego.
restituc-ar: (tr.) to make restitution of, refund (ulo). V.exp.: Ne simple ridonar, ma ridonar to quon on prenis o gardis sen yuro, a la legitima proprietero; IV-81.

-anta, -iva: limiting, restraining, restrictive. Ex.: Restriktar la signifiko di vorto. Restriktar sua pasioni. Restriktar su a kozi tote necesa. Li submisis su senrestrikte a la konvenciono (t.e. sen kondicioni expresita o tacita).
ret-o: net, mesh: object formed by threads or lines interlaced, network; (anat.) plexus (of nerves etc.); (geom.) chain (of triangles); (arch.) tracery (of windows)
reten-ar: (tr.) to retain, keep, withhold, keep back, detain (cf. ditenar); (arith.) to carry

-iva, -ema: retentive. Ex.: Me deziras retenar la pekunio quan me pruntis. On ne povas retenar amo per koakto. Retenar sua lakrimi. Retenar lojio en teatro. Retenar memore ulo, od, retenar en memoro ulo. Retenar ulu en karcero. (arith.) Pozar sep e retenar du. Reteniva memoro.
-acho: one who speaks elegantly but uselessly, word-spinner.
retrakt-ar: (tr., lit. and fig.) to retract, withdraw, draw back
-amendo: forfeit. Ex.: La limako retraktas sua korni. Retraktar sua promiso, sua erori.
retret-ar: (intr., milit., rel., and gen.) to retire, retreat, seclude, draw off, draw back (from active work, duty, the world)
-oficiro: retired or «half-pay» officer. V. exp.: vid. abandonar.
retro-irar, -marchar: (intr.) to go back, to retrograde, fall back (as of troops), retreat, to back (of carriages); (cf. retretar, regresar)
retush-ar: (tr.) to retouch, touch up (a picture, etc.).
rev-ar: (intr.) to day-dream, muse: to see or fancy as if in a dream; (cf. son-jar)

-ema, -ach-ema: dreamy. Ex.: Il revis pri la povreso e grandeso di Roma. Me klozas mea okuli e revas pri feliceso. Ulfoye me vere meditas, ulfoye nur revas. La projeto esas nur revo (od, revacho).

revanch-ar: (intr., in good or bad sense) to retaliate, give like for like, get even, requite (su, pri ulu, kontre ulu); to avenge, revenge, take one’s revenge (in return for an injury); (cf. venjar, reprezalar)

-o: retaliation, revenge, avenging. Def.: Retrodonar similajo a similajo, sive bona o mala, ma ofte en mala senco. V. exp.: Revanchar dicesas pri ulu, qua esas vinkata (en milito, konkurso o ludo) e qua inverse vinkas sua vinkinto. Revancho nule implikas ideo di venjo nek sentimento di rankoro, ma admaxime satisfaco propramo. En ludo, jentila ludero, qua vinkis, (ganis), ofras a sua partenero la revancho, o plu exakte la posibleso revanchar; nam ica povas vinkesar en la du foyi; VI-143.
revel-ar: (tr., also theol.) to reveal; (photog.) to develop

-ilo: (photog.) developing bath. Def.: Konocigar ulo da ulu, quo esis olim nekonocata, sekreta o celita. Ex.: Revelar la statala sekretaji. Revelar lua komplico. La latenta imajo esas revelata sur la klishuro. La revelado di Santa Ioannes.
revendik-ar: (tr., jur. and fig.) to claim (as one’s own), to demand back (ulo)
-ajo: object claimed; (cf. reklamacar). Def.: Reklamacar ulo quo apartenas a me, e qua esas en la povo di altru. Ex.: Revendikar sua yuri, ulo perdita, domeno.
reverber-ar: (tr., intr.) to send back, radiate (heat)
-forno: reverberatory furnace. Def.: Absorbar la kaloro e retrosendar ol radiifante; V-67.
reverence-ar: (intr.) to make a bow, on obeisance; (of women) to courtsey (ad ulu, ulo)
revers-o: the reverse: back side of anything
reviz-ar: (tr.) to revise (a book, a judgement, the constitution, etc.); Def.: Emendar; ri-examinar por modifikar.
revok-ar: (tr.) to revoke, repeal (an edict, privileges, a law); to recall (an ambassador); to dismiss (a clerk, officer, official).
revolt-ar: (intr.) to rise in revolt, to rebel (kontre ulu, ulo)
-igar: to cause to revolt or rebel; (fig.) to stir up, rouse. Ex.: La populo revoltis kontre sua suvereno. (fig.) La raciono revoltas kontre tala absurdeso.
revolucion-ar: (tr.) to revolutionize, to change thoroughly (opinions, an art, a country; (cf. perturbar, subversar)
revolver-o: revolver: pistol with revolving chamber.
revu-ar*: (tr.) to review, inspect, carefully examine (troops, books, one’s life, etc.)
-o: review, inspection (of troops); review (magazine, book); (fig.) survey, examination.
revuls-ar*: (tr., med.) to allay a morbid condition by counter-irritation or the like
-o: revulsion. Def.: Lokale iritar por cesigar konjestioneso od inflameso existanta en altra parto di la korpo.
rez-a, -e: even, level (with); close to (a line, the surface); (of hair, etc.) shorn; (of a destroyed city, etc.) razed
-igar: to cut (ulo) close to or even with a surface; to raze, level (ulo) to the ground; (nav.) to razee: cut down; to hug, keep close to (a coast)
rezed-o: (bot.) reseda: mignonette (Reseda odorata); dyer’s weed (Reseda luteola)
rezerv-ar: (tr.) to reserve, save, set apart, lay by or up
-ano: (milit.) reservist. Ex.: Rezervar kelka pekunio por bezoni futura o neprevidebla. Rezervar ula yuro. Rezervo-armeo. Facar mentala rezervo. Mieno rezervema.
rezid-ar: (intr.) to reside, dwell, live, abide (cf. habitar, lojar)
-anto: resident. Ex.: Il rezidas en Paris che me. Establisar rezido en ula loko. Ta domo esas lua rezideyo.
rezidu-o: that which remains: (chem.) residium; settlement (of liquids); (geol.) debris, detritus; (com.) residue, arrear: that which remains (due); (arith.) remainder; (cf. restajo)
rezign-ar: (tr., intr.) to resign (ulo): to be resigned, feel resignation (pri)

-anta, -ema: resigned. Ex.: Rezignar sua anmo a Deo. Me esas rezignanta (od, rezignas) pri la perdo di mea yuri. Subisar exilo kun rezignemeso. V. exp.: Rezignar esas aceptar volunte desfeliceso, domajo, perdo, quan on «subisis» e generale ne povis evitar. La rezigno esas pasiva, dum ke l’abnego esas spontana. On rezignas pri la morto di ulu kara, pri la perdo di sua havajo, pri maladeso neremediebla; IV-101; kp. II-135, abnego, renuncar.
rezist-ar: (tr.) to resist, withstand the shock of something; to defend (oneself), strive against (ulu, ulo); to hold against, oppose; not to succumb to (fatigue, etc.)
rezolv-ar: (tr.) to resolve: take or come to a decision (to do something)
-oze: resolutely, stoutly. Ex.: Rezolvar parolar ad ulu. Rezolvar facar ulo. Ne facez rezolvi dum la unesma ataki di vua iraco. Homo rezolvema. V. exp.: vid. decidar.
-ar: (tr.) to appply one’s reason to (ulo), to study (ulo)
rezult-ar: (intr.) to result (from certain premises, conditions); to follow (from); be the consequence (of)
-anto: (mechan.) resultant (force). Ex.: La deskonkordo rezultis en civitanala milito. La rezulto esas nekalkulebla. Ica (objekto) esas la rezultajo.
rezum-ar: (tr.) to recapitulate, sum up, to summarize
-e: to sum up, upon the whole, in substance
-a: summary, compendious. Ex.: La peroraciono rezumas la tota diskurso. Rezumo di la historio di Francia.
ri-: Note: many common verbal roots compounded with ri- (again, anew) are omitted.
rich-a: (lit. and fig.) rich (esp. in money, land, goods)
-eskar: to become, grow rich. Ant.: povra.
«rictus»: (wide) grin, grinning. Def.: Kontrakto muskulala qua deskovras la denti e donas a la boko ridanta aspekto.
-eskar: to burst out laughing, commence to l.
ridel-o: side pole, rack or board placed on a cart to help hold the load; cart-rack.
rif-o: reef; ledge of rocks standing above the level of the water. V. exp. vid. brizanto.
rigid-a: (lit. and fig.) rigid, stiff, not easily bent, not pliant; (of persons) inflexible, unyielding
-igar: to stiffen, render inflexible. Ex.: Fera stango esas rigida. Stacar rigida. Koldeso rigidas la fingri. Il esas rigida homo. Ant.: laxa, flex-ebla, mola.
rigor-o: rigor; extreme exactness or strictness
-isto: rigorist, a person rigid or exact to excess
-oza, segun rigoro: rigorously, with rigour. Ex.: La rigoro di la legi, di la reguli. Rigoroza judiciisto. Rigoroza demonstro.
ri, retro-kompr-ar: to buy again, buy back
rim-o: rhyme: accord in sound of words (cf. verso)
-izar: to put (ulo) into rhyme. Ex.: Ica du vorti ne rimifas.
rimbors-ar: (tr.) to reimburse, repay, refund (in money). Ex.: Pagez por me, me rimborsos a vu.
rinforc-ar: (tr., milit.) to reinforce (a garrison, etc.)
ring-o: ring, circlet of metal or other substance; (tech.) ferrule, bushing
-izar: to place a ring on (ulu, ulo), to hoop, ferrule, bush
rinoplastik-o*: rhinoplasty, plastic surgery on the nose.
rins-ar: (tr.) to rinse (a glass, clothes, etc.)

rip-ar: (tr., mechan., automobiles and other vehicles) to skid: slide sideways (cf. slipo). V. exp.: Ripar esas glitar skrapante, o kun forta friciono, qua impedas e fine haltas la funciono di mashino (teknikal vorto): II-648.
ri-, retro-port-ar: (tr.) to bring again, to bring back.
risk-ar: (tr.) to risk, hazard, venture (cf. aventurar, pariar)
rism-o: ream (of paper: Eng.: 480 sheets; foreign: 500 sheets).
-igar: (tr.) (cook.) to brown, to fry or roast brown.
-e: respectively. Ex.: La rispektiva yuri di du kunheredanti. Li iris a sua rispektiva hemi. Konsiderar rispektive la avantaji e des-avantaji di ulo.
ristorn-ar: (tr., com.) to cancel (an insurance policy, esp. maritime)
ritornel-o: (mus.) ritornello. Def.: Ario quaze preliminara qua anuncas ulo; IV-14.
riv-o: shore, beach, strand; bank (of a river); (fig.) skirt (of a wood)
-esar: to be a rival; to vie (kun) (cf. konkursar, konkurencar).
ri-, retro-ven-ar: (intr.) to return, come back.
ri-, retro-vok-ar: (tr.) to call again, call back, recall.
rob-o: robe: long, loose garment for man or woman
robinet-o: cock, tap (for draining off liquids).
robini-o*: (bot. genus) robinia; (black) locust; (false) acacia (cf. akacio).
robr-o: rubber (of card games as in whist).
-eso: robustness. Def.: Qua posedas forteso, vigoro. Ant.: febla, debila.
rochet-o*: rochet, a kind of surplice.
rodomonto: rodomont, blusterer, vain boaster, braggart
-ajo: empty blustering, bravado, hectoring. Def.: Fanfaronemo pri milital agi; falsa brav(ul)o; III-204.
rog-o: funeral pile, pyre: stack of wood for burning the dead or a person at the stake. Def.: Lign-amaso por brular ulu od ulo; III-206.
rogacion-i*: (R.C. rel.) public prayers and processions held on rogation days.
rok-o: a (large) rock, boulder (cf. petro, stono)
-ajo: rocky mass high, steep and rising or jutting out to a point, as seen in the sea; rocky cliff, crag
rol-o: (theat. and gen.) rôle: part, character, impersonation
roman-o: a novel, book of fiction
-o, -ajo: any round figure or object (cf. cirklo, disko, ringo)
-iro: round, circuit; (of a policeman, etc.) beat.
rost-ar: (tr., intr.) to roast (meat); to toast (bread)

rostr-o: (in gen.) any beak-like extension; (nat. hist.) bill, beak (of an insect); trunk, proboscis (as of an elephant); (bot) prolonged rigid process; (Roman antiq.) beak of a ship; rostrum in a forum.
rotac-ar: (intr.) to rotate, revolve: turn on axis

rotol-ar: (intr.) to rumble, roll (with noise). Ex.: Veturo rotolas kande ol rulas alonge la strado. La rotolado di tondro, di tamburo. V. exp.: L’ideo expresenda esas ta di bruiso produktata per frapi rapide sucedanta; V-493.
rozeol-o: (med.) roseola, a rose colo(u)red rash; scarlet rash, rose rash; (cf. morbilo).
rubrik-o: rubric. V. exp.: Rubriko esas generala titulo. Ex. en Progreso esas: la Lingual questioni, Kroniko, Bibliografio, Diversaji, sub qui singla artiklo havas sua titulo; VII-412.
rud-a: rude, (of things) rough, unformed by art; (of persons) rough, uncultured, uneducated; (of manners) coarse, unpolished
-o: rudiment, element. Ex.: Rudimenta organo. Rudimenti di gramatiko. La rudimenti di planti.
-igar, -eskar: (tr., intr.) to make, become russet-colo(u)red, brown. Ex.: La tro varma glatigilo povas rufigar la linjo.
rug-o: wrinkle (on the face); ripple (on the water)
-oza: wrinkled, full of wrinkles; corrugated; (bot.) rugose
rukt-ar: (intr.) to belch (gas from stomach), eruct(ate).
rul-ar: (tr., intr.) to roll (by turning over, as a wheel, also from side to side, as a ship), roll along, wheel along
rumin-ar: (tr., intr.) to ruminate: chew over again, chew the cud (cf. meditar)
run-o, -i: rune(s), Runic character(s) or letter(s)
rupt-ar: (tr.) to break (asunder, up, open, by violence, or stress), to snap, rupture, shatter
rur-o: country; rural district as opp. to town
-ana, -ano: peasant, rustic, country person (not in a depreciatory sense)
-ema, -emo: (one) who acts by routine; red-tapist. Def.: Kustumo sequata sen judiko; kustumal ago facita sen reflektar.
ruz-ar: (intr.) to use low craft, cunning, artifice, stratagem
zest-o: the woody skin quartering the kernel of a walnut.
zeze-ar: (intr.) to lisp. Def.: Pronunciar j quale z e sh quale s; IV-647.
zon-o: (geog., geom.) zone; (for body) girdle, belt, sash, waist-band (cf.  tayo)
-izar: to girdle, girt; inclose in a z.; -o torida: torrid z.
zum-ar: (intr.) to buzz (as flying insects), to drone: make a humming or buzzing noise.
-isto: a worker in ebony: (fig.) an inlayer (of wood), cabinet maker (vid.: V. exp. karpentisto).
ebuli-ar: (intr.) to form bubbles, to bubble up or froth (as water from a spring, blood from a vein; (fig.) to be boiling from anger or passion); (cf. efervecar, boliar)
ecel-ar: (intr.) to excel; be excellent, be eminent, be superior (en, pri). Ex.: Ca homulo ecelas en omno quon il entraprezas. Ecelar pri natado; ecelanta libro, homo. Ecelo di frukto.
ecelenc-o: (title) excellency. Ex.: Lua ecelenco, la ambasadisto di …
ecept-ar: (tr.) to except; leave out, exempt, exclude

-ale: by way of exception. Def.: Ne inkluzar en, exkluzar de ula nombro. Ex.: Eceptar ula kondamniti de amnestio. Existas nula regulo sen eceptajo. Ecepte ica personi, omni iros. Me ne permisos ke vu iros, ecepte ke vu pagos la domaji.
eces-ar: (tr., intr.) to exceed; go beyond the proper limits; be guilty of excesses (in eating, drinking, etc.)
-o, -ajo: (math.) difference by which one number exceeds another; transgression of due limits; abuse, waste
-e: to excess, immoderately. Ex.: La debajo ecesas mil franki. Mea spensi ne ecesas mea recevaji. Ecesar pri manjado. Eceso en laborado. Koldeso ecesanta. Ecesanta superbeso. Preco ecesiva. DEFIS

ecit-ar: (tr.) to excite: arouse, impel, incite, urge, provoke, prompt. Ex.: Ecitar ulu laborar, revoltar. Ecitar l'iraco, la jaluzeso. La novaji efektigas granda eciteso. Ecito di la nervi. Vivo ecitanta. Ecitiva medikamento. Ecitema homo.
edific-o: edifice; large building. Def.: Expresas ulo plu general kam domo, kastelo; palaco; edifico esas quaze meza inter ta tri vorti; III-200.
edifik-ar: (tr.) to edify: instruct, improve morally. Ex.: Edifikar ulu per prediko, per exemplo. Konduto, paroli edifik-anta, -ema, -iva.
edikt-ar: (tr.) to enact: to order (by an edict); (cf. dekretar). Ex.: Draco(n) ediktis punisala legi di senkompata severeso.
edit-ar: (tr.) to publish (a book, a paper) (not E. «edit» cf. redaktar): -(ad)o: publishing
-anto, -ero, -isto: publisher. Def.: Imprimar (libro, jurnalo, e.c. por vendar); imprimar la texto di ula autoro; V-405.
edr-o: (geom.) face, outer surface of, superfice; outer configuration of a regularly crystalizing mineral, as a dodecahedron.

eduk-ar: (tr.) to educate (children, people); to develop and cultivate the physical, intellectual and moral faculties; to form the manners of; to rear, raise, breed (cattle and other animals); to train, rear (plants)
efac-ar: (tr., lit. and fig.) to efface: erase, rub out, expunge
-esar: to be effaced, obliterated. (cf. obliterar), -ilo: eraser. rubber. Ex.: Efacar la skriburo qua esas sur tabelo. Esas neposibla efacar la impreso de mea mento.
-igar: to effect, effectuate, produce, bring about, cause; (cf. produktar, en-duktar, efikar)
-igo: effecting, execution, action, causation. Ant.: kauzo, motivo.
efektiv-o: (milit.) effective force, strength. Def.: Vorto militala por expresar la fakte existanta nombro di la trupi de homi, kavali, kanoni e vehili; V-420.
-o, -a insekt-o: (ent.) ephemerid, dayfly. Ex.: Efemera floro, febro, feliceso.
efervec-ar: (intr., pr. and fig.) to effervesce, be effervescent. Def.: Ebuliado di gaso tra liquido; (fig.) emocar vivace, ma nedurante (ex. la eferveco dil pasioni).
efik-ar: (intr.) to be efficient, be effectual, be efficacious
-eskar: to come into play, begin to take effect

eflorec-ar: (intr., chem.) to effloresce; (cf. flor-ifar); (med.) to come out in a rash, break out in pimples. Def.: Indikas fenomeno kemiala (formaco di kristali ye surfaco di solido o liquido), e fenomeno fiziologiala (mikra influro di la pelo); III-74.
egar-ar: (tr.) to mislay: lose for the moment
-esar: to be mislaid, missing. V. exp.: One ofte egaras kozi sen perdar oli. «Me mis-pozis mea plumiero sur la tablo; ol falis en la paperkorbo, e tale egaresis: ma ol ne esis perdita».
egard-ar: (tr.) to pay regard to, take (ulu, ulo) into account
egorj-ar: (tr.) to cut the throat of (ulu). Def.: Ocidar per kultel-frapo en la kolo (fauco); III-698.
ejekt-ar: (tr., tech.) to eject, cast out, expel, discharge, void.
ek: (prep.) (general sense) out; (indicating motion) adportez stulo ek ta chambro: bring a chair out of that room
-igar: to echo. Ex.: La vakua chambri ekigis nia pedopazi. (fig.) Kelki ekigas stultaji di altri.
ekidn-o: (zool.) echidna (genus: Echidna, sp. Hystrix). Def.: Australiana mamifero sendenta, qui ovifas, nutras su per insekti; V-484.
ekimos-o: (med.) ecchymosis; black and blue spot.
eklampsi-o: (med.) eclampsia. Def.: Specala konvulso dum infanteso, uremio o parturo-stando; VI-480.
eklezi-o: church (as an institution; cf. kirko)
eklips-ar: (tr., astron. and fig.) to eclipse.

ekonomi-o: economy; pecuniary management, administration; (not saving, cf. sparo). Def.: La administrado financala di domo, societo o stato; metafore on parolas pri l'ekonomio di organismo, konsiderante lua gani (nutrado) e spensi (perdi di materio e di energio); VII-399. Ex.: On parolas pri ekonomio hemala (menajala), urbala, rurala, nacionala.
elev-ar: (tr.) to elevate, raise on high; (not to make higher in dimension; cf. plu-alt-igar)
-ilo: elevator. V. exp.: Elevar adjuntas a levar ideo di alteso, di supera nivelo. On levas de tero (til su) ulo falinta; on elevas aquo, stoni a la supro di domo konstruktata; II-648. EFIRS
elevacion-o: (design) elevation, raised-plan, side-view. Def.: Desegno di l'extera formi di ula korpo vidata en horizontal direciono; III-81.
elimin-ar: (tr.) to eliminate. Ex.: Eliminar nomo de la listo di kandidati. Eliminar toxikaji de la korpo. Eliminar de equaciono.
elit-o: (milit. and fig.) the elite (of any army); choice troops, best men, flower (of army); (cf. eminent-aro).
elitr-o: (ent.) elytrum: wing sheath of beetles.
eloquent-a: eloquent; (fig.) which produces the same effect as an eloquent speech. Ex.: Eloquenta parolanto, stilo. Lakrimi, silenco eloquenta.
-ema, -iva: elusive, evasive. Def.: Evitar habile, rapide, ruzoze: III-324. Ex.: On eludas la frapo di espado; on eludas vizito, invito, obligo, tasko, questiono. Eludema respondo.
eman-ar: (intr.) to emanate (de, ek). Ex.: Lumo emanas de la suno. Odori esas emani.
emancip-ar: (tr.) to emancipate (ulu, de). Ex. Emancipar sklavo, populo, (fig.) emancipar la mento.
embaras-ar: (tr.) to embarrass; to obstruct, clog up; to encumber, hamper, hinder; (in gen.) to hinder movement (physical, mental)
embarg-ar: (tr., naut. and fig.) to embargo, lay an e. on: prohibit to leave port; (jur.) to distrain, to levy a distress or execution, to garnishee or attack (for debt)
embark-ar: (tr., intr.) to embark: go or put on board (ulu, ulo, en); Def.: Enirar navo; pozar en navo; II-75.
emblem-o: emblem. Ex.: La hanulo esas emblemo (E. symbol) di vigilemeso. Emblemi di rejeso.
embot-ar: (tr., tech.) to cold-roll, to stamp, bend or beat out (sheet metal)
embrac-ar: (tr.) to embrace, clasp, hug (in arms); to bracket

embrag-ar: (tr., intr., tech.) to clutch, put in gear; establish contact between the motive power and that which starts the movement. Def.: Solidigar (en un instanto, e por irga duro) du axi per diversa mediata instrumenti ed organi; III-87. Ex.: Rimen-transmiso "embragas", kande on igas la rimeno pasar de libera pulio sur fixa pulio sam-axa e sam-periferia; (kp. ingranar, kuplar).
embrok-ar: (tr., med.) to embrocate; rub with a lotion.
embusk-ar: (tr.) to ambush; lie in concealment for

emend-ar: (tr.) to emend (a fault), rectify, free from error; (leg.) to amend (a law). V. exp.: On plubonigas o korektigas kozo, verko, ma ne defekto; on ne povas igar defekto "bona" o korekta, on simple supresas ol. Konseque on devas dicar: emendar defekto. On korektigas la kozo, emendante lua defekti; V-282.
emerit-a: emeritus; retired. Ex.: Profesoro emerita.
emers-ar: (intr.) to emerge (from a liquid); (fig.) to rise into view. Ant.: imersar, submersar.
eminenc-o: (title) Eminence. Ex.: Lua eminenco, la kardinalo.
eminent-a: (quality) eminent, superior; (of place) conspicuous; (cf. remarkinda)
-aro: the elite, pick of a group
-ega: most e. Ex.: Eminenta homulo, ofico, rango. Vertuo, servo eminenta.
emis-ar: (tr.) to emit: send forth, give out; (finan.) to issue (for circulation). Ex.: La kalor-radii quin la suno emisas. Emiso di monet-papero.
emoc-ar, -eskar: (intr.) to feel emotion, be agitated, moved
-igar: to cause e. to. Ex.: El parolis tote sen emoco. Lua aspekto emocigis me. Quik kande me vidis il, me emocis.
emperial-o: top, roof, outside (of a coach with seats).
empire-o: empyrean. Def.: Maxim alta cielo di antiqua mitologio e kosmologio; (poet.) la cielo.
emul-a: emulous. Def.: Qua penas egalesar od superesar la ceteri en laudinda kozi o loyala konkurso; III-468. Ex.: On kurajigas la emuleso inter la lernanti.

emund-ar: (tr., hort.) to lop, prune, trim; (fig.) to remove anything useless, noxious or inferior. Def.: Branchotaliar; (vulgarasenco) netigar, beligar o preparar kozo per depreno di omna parti o peci neutila, nebona o nebela; (IV-106). Ex.: Emundar arboro. Emundar legumi, salado, ucelo, fisho (por koquar oli). Metafore, on emundas kalkulo, la konduto di ulu, verko literatural od artal, e.c.

en: (prep.) in, of time and place; when really necessary to indicate motion into a place (into) ad should be prefixed: la ucelo flugis aden la kajo: the bird flew into the cage. (En la kajo may mean that the bird was flying about the cage)
encefalit-o: (med.) encephalitis: inflammation of the brain.
energetik-o: energetics : theory or science of energy.
engaj-ar: (tr.) to engage: to hire (ulu); (milit.) to enlist (ulu, su).
enlumin-ar: (tr.) to illuminate (a book); (cf. ascendar, lum-izar, iluminar); to color (an engraving, map).
enorm-a: enormous. Def. grandega, grosega, kolos(atr)a, monstr(atr)a.
enoy-ar: (intr.) to feel dull, be bored, be weary (because of inaction or monotony)
ensembl-o: the whole, ensemble; all parts taken together; general effect, collectivity, aggregate, totality; (cf. kune, entote)

entam-ar: (tr.) to cut the first piece of, make a first cut, incision; (fig.) to encroach upon, begin upon, open up. Def.: Facar l'unesma trancho, l'unesma frapo, brecho, nocho, e figurale komencar; iniciar od inaugurar ulo; IV-102. Ex.: Entamar pano, botelo, pasteto, poto de konfituri; frapo (stroko di kultelo, o spado). Entamar (E. incise, cut) la pelo, la muskuli, la osto. Prodigemo entamas sua kapitalo.
entern-ar: (tr.) to intern: confine in a place or country.
en-tote: on the whole, in all, altogether.
entraprez-ar: (tr.) to undertake, engage to perform, take in hand, contract for; (cf. asumar)
-ajo: what is u.; the enterprise, contract

-ema: enterprising. Ex.: Columbus entraprezis la deskovro di la kontinento ocidental. Entraprezar voyajo, konquesto. Me entraprezis la feliceso di mil homi desfortunoza: (E. I undertook to make a thousand unfortunate beings happy.) Ta firmo entrapezis la furniso di liti ad la armeo. La entraprezo di la kanalo di Suez esis laboro kolosala. Homulo entraprezema.
entraten-ar: (tr.) to support, keep (with the needs of life) (ulu); -o: maintenance, livelihood.
entrav-ar: (tr.) to shackle, fetter, trammel (a horse); (fig.) to clog, impede, embarrass. Def.: Impedar o jenar la marcho di animalo per irga moyeno; III-468.
entre-o: (cook.) entrée, side-dish. Def.: Disho qua venas pos la fisho ed ante la rostajo; V-621.
entremes-o: (cook.) entremets, side dish. Def.: Disho inter la repasto propre dicita e la desero; V-621.
entuziasm-ar, -eskar: (intr.) to be, become enthusiastic (por, pri); -igar: to enthuse (ulu). V.exp.: On entuziasmas pri granda ideo o pri bela verko, quan on admiras
enumer-ar: (tr.) to enumerate; reckon up singly, count or tell off.
enunc-ar: (tr.) to enunciate: express by speech or by writing: -uro, -ajo: enunciation, statement. Ex.: Enuncar sua idei, opinioni, problemo.

envelop-ar: (tr., pr. and fig.) to envelop; cover up (ulu, ulo, su); -ilo: covering, wrap, casing (not of letter-envelope; cf. kuverto). V. exp.: Envelopar signifikas nur: tegar omna parti di l’objekto, enklozar ol en tegilo. Envolvar implikas la ideo di volvar, qua ipsa implikas ideo analoga a rular: volvar esas pozar ula objekto sur altra, turnante ol cirkum ica
envergur-o: span, extent of wing or sail spread. Def.: Dimensiono di ucelo, o di flugilo (o di seglo) inter la extremaji di la ali extensita.

envidi-ar: (tr.) to envy, (be)grudge, be envious of (ulu, pri ulo; ulo, ad ulu). Ex.: Il sempre envidias la suceso di sua frato. Envidio esas kompozita de jaluzeso e de odio. Il havas envidi-ema, -oza mento.
epark-o: (antiq.) eparch: governer of a province.
epicen-a*: (gram.) epicene; common to both sexes.
epigon-o*: epigone; a successor, ordinarily an inferior one.
epigraf-o: epigraph, inscription. Def.: La skriburo quan on trovas o pozas sur la monumenti; VII-155.
epigrafi-o*: epigraphy. Def.: La cienco dil epigrafi; VII-155.
epitaf-o: epitaph: inscription on a tomb.
epitet-o: epithet. Def. Vorto adjuntata a substantivo por qualifikar ol.
epitom-o: epitomy, compendium, abridgment (of a book)
epizod-o: episode; an incidental narrative or digression; an event.
equilibr-ar: (intr., tr.) to be in state of equilibrium, balance, counterpoise
-igar: to equilibrate; to put in balance equilibrium (ulo)

-isto: equilibrist, juggler. Ex.: "A equilibras B", o: "A e B equilibras" = "Existas relato di equilibro inter A e B". "X (aganto) equilibrigas A e B", o "A per B". On uzas equilibrigar nur por l'extera aganto, qua pozas la forci (pezi, e.c.) en equilibro, qua efektigas l'equilibro sen partoprenar ol; IV-171.
equip-ar: (tr.) to equip, fit out (a ship, an expedition, a soldier); (cf. provizar).
equitat-o: equity; natural justice. Def.: Yusteso natural, segun la komuna raciono, quan on opozas a la yusteso legal, a la yuro; IV-9.
er-o: era. Ex.: La ero Kristanala.
eratik-a: (geol.) transported from its original location or bed (stones, etc.); (fig.) erratic; deviating from the common course.

erekt-ar: (tr.) to erect; stand (ulu, ulo) straight up, set up (u1o). V. exp.: On erektas monumento, statuo, kolono, masto. Persona anke erektas su, mem kande lu ja stacas. "Il levis su, stacas senmova dum kelka instanti, e pose erektas su sur la pedo-pinti (por regardar super la muro)". On ne povas dicar rekt-igar, nam on ne rektigas masto ja rekta; pluse on rekt-igas en omna direcioni, ma on erektas nur vertikale, ad-supre; VI-383.
ergot-o: ergot, fungus disease of grains.
ergotism-o: (med.) ergotism, state of health caused by eating ergot.
eritrozin-o*: erythrosin; a red coloring matter.
erod-ar: (tr., geol., med. etc.) to erode, corrode, eat away.
-igar: to cause (ulu) to err, lead astray, deceive (without bad intention; cf. trompar)
erste: (of time) not before, not until (then), only (not earlier than), for the first time
erupt-ar: (intr. geol. and gen.) to erupt: to break forth from an inclosure, to make an outburst; (med.) to break out in pimples, pustules, rash
-igar: to cause an e. in (ulo, ulu)
-ifar: to swarm: collect in a s.
esbos-ar: (tr., of plastic arts and fig.) to rough-hew, cut, to boast (in order to make the outline of a figure)
-uro: rude outline; (fig.) first draft (of a plan, etc.), -ilo: (sculp.) boasting tool; mortise chisel. V. exp.: Skisar relatas la desegnal arti

-a, -ala: essential. Ex.: La esenco deala. Esenco di citrono. Inerteso esas la esenco di materio. Esenco di rozi (E. attar of roses). Esencala principi, reguli. La homo esas esence sociema. Ant. acesor-ajo.
esforc-ar: (intr.) to make an effort, strive, strain, exert oneself
eshafod-o: scaffold(ing); staging (for a mason, etc.); frame-work of timbers for a spectator's stand, for execution of criminals
eskal-ar: (tr., nav.) to touch (or call) at (a port)
-eyo: port of call. Def.: Haltar en portuo dum voyajo por embarkar o desembarkar pasajanti o vari; II-75.
eskald-ar: (tr.) to scald; injure the skin with hot liquid; to expose to the action of boiling water (a jug, etc).
eskamot-ar: (tr.) to perform conjuring tricks, cause (ulo) disappear by legerdemain. Def.: Habile desaparigar objekto, por ludo; II-647. V. exp. vid. furtar.
eskap-ar: (intr.) to escape, find a way out (ek, de) (tr.) to e. from, get away from, slip away from, avoid (ulu, ulo); (cf. fugar)
-moyeno: any means of e.; (fig.) shift, subterfuge, means of evasion
eskar-o: (med.) eschar: a dry slough, crust, or scab.
-igar: to make slope sharply. V. exp.: Eskarpa indikas granda inklineso (o prefere rampo)
eskart-ar: (gen. sense, tr.) to put aside, apart (ulo, ulu); to go aside, apart, swerve, turn aside (de)
eskopet-o: blunderbuss. Def.: Speco di karabino (anciena); V-219.
eskrok-ar: (tr.) to swindle, cheat (ulu); to cheat out of (ulo). Def: Speco di furto per trompo o ruzo; III-200.
eskudel-o: porringer; bowl for porridge, soup.
eskup-ar: (tr.) to bail (water out of a boat, etc.)
-agar: (tr., intr.) to use, wield the s.; to put (ulu) to the sword
espaler-o: (hort.) espalier; a row of fruit-trees trained up to a lattice or wall; the trellis or wall on which trained.
espar-o: (nav.) spar: a timber used for masts, yards, booms etc.
espart-o: (bot.) esparto (grass); a Spanish grass (Stipa tenacissima) used in making cordage, papar, shoes, baskets, etc.
-libro: spelling-book. Def.: Lektar la vorti literope e formacante la silabi; II-582.
esper-ar: (tr.) to hope for, to expect with desire (ulo); (intr.) to hope: have confidence, trust (de, en); -ajo: thing hoped for
-ema, -oza: hopeful. Ex.: Esperar suceso. Esperar de od en Deo. Espero esas granda konsolaco.
espinet-o: (mus.) spinet. Def.: Speco di klavikordo.
espruv-a: proof (kontre) –igar: (tr.) to make (water-, lire-, etc.) proof (ulo); aquespruva: water-proof, -tight.
-ano: member of a squad, of a gang.

establis-ar: to establish; to settle or fix firmly; place on a permanent footing; make firm, stable or constant; (cf. instalar, pruvar). Ex.: Establisar la fundamento di edifico. Establisar komercal societo, fabrikerio, kolonio. Establisar su en urbo. La establiso di banko. Note “Establishment in the sense of “institution” is translated by the suffix –erio; educational establishment: eduk-erio).
estakad-o: boom, chain or row of piles across a harbor for defense; (cf. palisado).
estamp-ar: (tr. tech.) to make an impress, imprint, in relief of a mark or figure

-ilo: stamp, die. Def. Estampilo esas utensilo uzata ye la forjo. Ol esas facita ek harda materio ed havas la negativa formo di la forjenda peco, tale ke per simpla preso la dezirata formo obtenesas; III-81.
estanch-ar: (tr.) to stanch, (blood), stop (a leak, tears, etc.). Def.: Haltigar la fluo di liquido (ne sikigar); IV-9.
estim-ar: (tr.) to esteem, have e. for; hold (ulu) in high regard
estomp-ar: (tr., draw.) to stump; shade, shadow with a stump
-ilo: stump: artist’s soft pencil or rubber.
etaj-o: story, floor (of a house, etc.); tier
etajer-o: what-not, set of selves. Def. Tabuli dispozita erajatre.
etap-ar: (intr.) to halt at a stage (in travel)
etat-o: statement, account (receipts and expenditures); roll
etiket-o: (on bottles, etc.) label; (on goods, parcels) ticket
etiol-ar: (tr.) to etiolate; blanch. Def.: Privicar vivanti (precipue planti) de lumo ed aero, de quo lia feblesko, palesko o senkoloresko; III-603.
etuy-o: case: flat box, opening sideways or from the top
eufoni-o: euphony. Def.: Agreabla e facila kombinado di la soni en linguo; III-138.
ev-ar: (tr., intr.) to be so many years old; to be aged (so many years)

evaku-ar: (tr., milit., med., tech.) to evacuate, empty (N. B. not to empty a vessel, etc., cf. vaku-igarevacuation; (med.) discharge of matter by natural passage or artificial opening. Ex.: Evakuar )
evalu-ar: (tr.) to evaluate, value; to estimate the worth of, to rate at a certain price; to reckon the amount of; to appraise; (cf. expertisar)

-ebla: ratable; appreciable: that may be estimated, appreciated. V. exp.: Evaluar esas determinar valoro o quanto, per kalkulo o per konjekto (se on uzas mezurilo, on dicus mezurar). Taxar esas fixigar la quanto de imposto o kontributo, quan on debas pri ulo. Exemple (en la hipotezo di imposto pri revenuo): "on evaluas la revenuo di ta sioro a 10000 franki; ed on taxas ol a 400 franki, segun la proporciono di 4 po 100;" V-221.
event-ar: (intr.) to happen, occur, come about, befall
eventual-a: eventual: dependent upon events, contingent
evident-a: evident, obvious, plain, manifest, patent
-o, -ajo: evidence: obvious fact; (cf. atesto, pruvo) -eso: obviousness
evier-o: (kitchen-) sink. Def.: Speco di tablo kava, o kuvo ek lapido o ceramikajo, sur qua on lavas (generale en koqueyo); IV-9.
evit-ar: (tr.) to avoid, shun, evade, obviate, (cf. eludar). Ex.: El evitas (E. shuns) me. Evitar frapo, danjero, disputo. Evitar (E. obviate; prevent) skandalo. Ant.: serchar.
evolucion-ar: (intr., philos.) to evolve; (milit.) to perform evolutions
exajer-ar: (tr., intr.) to exaggerate. Ex.: Exajerar vinko, la meriti di amiko.
exakt-a: exact, accurate (not used of persons; cf. akurata, preciza)

-e: exactly. Def.: Qua esas konforma a la verajo, a la realajo, a la normo; IV-101. Ex.: Kalkulo exakta. Sequar exakta dieto. Matematiko esas exakta cienco. Verifikar la exakteso di kalkulo. V. exp.: Mezuro preciza povas ne esar exakta (se l'instrumento, quankam subtila, esas nejusta).

exalt-ar: (tr.) to exalt: raise the spirits of (ulu), to carry (the senses) to a high degree: (not to praise, cf. laudegar). Def.: Ecitar sentimento (precipue nobla, religiala) til extrema grado; IV-9.
examen-ar: (tr.) to examine (ulu) (not used with things, cf. explorar)
exauc-ar: (tr.) to hear and grant (a prayer, a request); to hearken favorably or willingly to (ulu). Ant.: repulsar, refuzar.
exekut-ar: (tr.) to execute, to perform, to do (ulo); to e. a criminal, cf. mort-igar; -(ad)o: execution; performance, carrying into effect
-ala, -enda: (jur.) executory. Ex.: Exekutar impero, lego, projeto, kriminero. Exekuto di verdikto.
-e: for example, for instance; (abbr.: ex.); segun la -o: following the e. (di ulu); punisar ulu kom -o: to make an e. of someone
exempler-o: copy (of a book, paper, engraving, etc.).
exerc-ar: (tr.) to exercise (the legs, the body, one's senses), to exert (strength, one's memory, eloquence); (milit.) to drill
exerg-o: (numis.) exergue. Def.: Infra feldo di medalio; III-672.
exfoli-ar: (tr.) to exfoliate, scale (off). Def.: Forprenar foliope, deprenar folii, t. e. strati sucedanta; III-603
exhal-ar: (tr.) to exhale, send forth, emit (odors, etc.; cf. expirar). Ex.: Ca marshi exhalas vapori pestizanta. La exhalo di rozo.
exhaust-ar: (tr., also fig.) to exhaust: drain, spend
exhort-ar: (tr.) to exhort. Ex.: Exhortar ulu reformar sua konduto. Ant.: des-konsilar, des-persuadar.
exil-ar: (tr.) to exile, banish (ulu, su de); (fig.) to expatriate

-ito: an exile, V. exp.: On exilas ulu, interdiktante a lu restar en la lando: lu esas tote libera extere; e se lu rieniras sen permiso, on simple ekpulsas lu. Proskriptar esas serchar la kondamnito (mem po premio por la denuncanti) e punisar lu severe (generale per morto), se on povas trovar e kaptar lu en la lando (ex. la proskripti da Marius e Sylla). Relegar esas enkarcerigar en fora lando (kolonio)
exist-ar: (intr.) to exist, be in existence
-anta, -anto: existing, existent, extant (being); Ex. Traci ankore existas. Existanta homi.
exkav-ar: (tr.) to excavate (by digging; cf. kavigar)
exkluz-ar: (tr.) to exclude, drive or shut out, debar, deny admission

-ive: exclusively. Ex.: Exkluzar ulu de la Akademio. La bonfacemeso exkluzas la avareso. La exkluzo di homini. Exkluzite altra yuri, devi. Exkluziva yuro. La spirito di exkluzemeso. Ant.: admisar, inkluzar, recevar.
exkori-ar: (tr.) to excoriate, to rub off, abrade, scratch, gall (the skin) Def.: Lacerar la polo (ne sen-pel-igar), deprenar peco de la pelo; IV-136
exkurs-ar: (intr.) to make an excursion, take a trip
exkuz-ar: (refl.) to apologize, make excuses, beg pardon (su pri ulo)

-ebla: excusable (of persons, cf. pardon-ebla). V. exp.: Se vu facis kulpo relate ulu, vu exkuzas vu avan lu, e lu povas pardonar ol a vu. La persono ofensinta facas exkuzo, e la persono ofensita facas pardono; IV-100.
exorcis-ar: (tr.) to exorcise, cast out evil spirits.
-ar: to make an e. Def.: Unesma parto di diskurso. Ant.: peroraciono.
exotik-a: exotic. Def. Qua venas de fora landi, e konseque havas karaktero di rareso o stranjeso; III-603. Ex.: Flori exotika.
expans-ar: (tr., intr., also fig.) to expand, to develop in volume or surface, spread, widen
-ema: expansive; (fig.) unreserved (of persons). Ex.: Expansar aero per kaloro. Expanso di autoritato. Forco expansiva. Naturo expansema. Ant.: kontraktar.
expedi-ar: (tr., com.) to despatch, send off, forward (goods)
expedicion-o: (milit., nav.) expedition. Def.: Sendo di homi por militar, o por explorar regiono; IV-706. Ex.: Naval, ciencala expediciono a la suda polo.
expekt-ar: (tr.) to expect, be in expectation of, look forward to

expektor-ar: (tr., med.) to expectorate, discharge phlegm, mucus from the lungs, to cough up. V. exp.: Expektorar ne esas sputar; l'expektorajo venas de la pektoro, t.e. de la pulmono, quale indikas l'etimologio.
experienc-ar: (tr.) to experience (ulo): to have the lot or fortune of, to undergo
experiment-ar: (intr.) to experiment (per); (tr.) to test, try (ulo, pri ulo)
expert-a: expert: skilful (in trade), well-versed (in knowledge).
-ero, -isto: surveyor, person officially appointed to examine an affair and report on it.
expiac-ar: (tr.) to expiate, to atone for
expir-ar: (intr.) to expire: to breath out (cf. respirar); (fig.) to come to an end (of time), terminate
explik-ar: (tr.) to explain, make plain what is obscure, elucidate, expound; (cf. klar-igar). Ex.: Explikar signifiko, sua desfacilaji, doktrino, sua intenco. V. exp. vid. definar.

explor-ar: (tr.) to explore (a country); to investigate, examine, search into (things, cf. examenar, inquestar); (milit.) to reconnoiter, scout; Ex.: Explorar lando nekonocata. Explorar (E. examine) libro. Exploro, exploranto di subjekto, objekto.
explot-ar: (tr.) to exploit, to get the value out of, as to e. a mine; to work, cultivate (a farm, estate with intent of profit)
-achar: to exploit, to draw an illegitimate profit from, as to e. workers (by underpayment)
expoz-ar: (tr., lit. and fig.) to expose, set in public view; (of houses, etc.) to turn toward, present a side to; to set forth (a situation); explain (a doctrine)
expres-ar: (tr.) to express (by symbols, gestures, words, etc.); Ex.: Vorti expresas la penso. Lakrimi esas la expreso di doloro. Aspekto expres-oza, -iva, -ema.
expropri-ar: (tr., jur.) to expropriate, (the property), dispossess (ulu).
extaz-ar: (intr.) to be in ecstacies, be enraptured; (med.) to be in a trance (cf. katalepsio).
extens-ar: to extend, stretch, draw out, spread
-anto, -ivo: (anat.) extensor. Ex. Extensar brakio, tapiso, mantelo. Extensar povo, autoritato, domeno. Kauchuko esas tre extensebla.
extenu-ar: (tr.) to extenuate, palliate. Def. Igar min grava (kulpo, krimino, aserto, e. c.) II-707.
exter: (prep.) without, outside (without motion; cf. ek); except, besides
exter-klaso: an outside, a separate class.
-erio: day-school. Def. Skolano (lernanto) qua ne habitas la lerneyo; III-672.
exting-ar: (tr., intr.) to extinguish, put out, quench (a fire, a light; also used fig.)
-o di raso: (fig.) the extinction, the extermination of a race. Ant.: Acendar.
extirp-ar: (tr.) to extirpate, uproot; (surg.) to cut out, remove totally; (fig.) to destroy wholly, eradicate, weed out; (cf. arachar). Ex.: Extirpar la mala herbi, kancero, dento, raso.
extors-ar: (tr.) to extort, wrest; to blackmail (ulu): -(ad)o, -ajo: extortion, exaction
extrad-ar: (tr.) to extradite. Def.: livrar stranjera kulpozo (akuzato) a la guvernerio di lua patrio; III-672; kp. exilar.

extrakt-ar: (tr.) to extract: to draw from, out. Ex.: Extraktar frazo de libro, dento, kugleto de la korpo. Extraktar radiko dua (math.: to extract the square root). Extraktado di sukro de betravi. Extrakt-uri opiumo.
extraordinar-a: extraordinary (event, person, etc.; cf. remark-inda).
extravag-ar: (intr.) to talk extravagantly, wildly, to rave; (in fever) to be delirious; to act extravagantly, wildly, unreasonably, eccentricly
-o, -em-eso di konduto, di parolado: wildness of conduct, talk
exud-ar: (tr., intr.) to exude, ooze out. Def.: Ekiro di liquido ek korpo, analoga (e tam lenta) kam sudorifo (N.B. sen gutifar); III-672.
exult-ar: (intr.) to exult. Def.: Esar kaptata da profunda joyo o sentimento (amo), qua expresas su per movi, kanti, e.c.: III-324.
da: (indicating agent after passive verb) la patri esas amata da sua filii: the parents are loved by their children
dag-o: dirk: a short shord or kind of poniard.
damo: married or widowed woman; dame; (in cards, chess, checkers) a queen
-ifar: (checkers) to go to king, (at chess) to go to queen.
-ito: person damned, a lost soul. (cf. maledikar, blasfemar) Ex.: Deo damnas la maligni. Doktrino damninda.
damzel-o: young lady, miss, maid, damsel; unmarried woman, spinster; (before a proper name) Miss
dandi-o: dandy: fop; coxcomb. Def.: Homulo eleganta, segun la modo.
dank-ar: (tr.) to thank (ulu, pri, pro ulo); (cf. gratitudar).
dard-o: dart (pointed missile); sting (weapon of insects).
darf-ar: may, to have a right to, be permitted
darn-ar: (tr.) to darn (garments). Def.: Specala modo di rapecar stofi, vesti, ne pozante peco, ma imitante la texuro; III
datur-o: (bot.) datura (genus: Datura); thorn-apple, Jimson weed (Datura stramonium).

dazl-ar: (tr.) to dazzle: to overpower by bright or moving lights; (fig.) to blind; (fig.) to excite to admiration by brilliancy, display (of beauty, money, honors, etc.) (cf. facinar). Def.: Trublar instantale la vid-povo per tro brilanta lumo, o per tro rapida movado, agitado, e.c. VI
de: (prep) (starting point, origin, derivation) la treno de Lyon: the train from Lyons: blinda de nasko: blind from birth
-a, -ala: divine: of or relating to God
deb-ar: (tr.) to owe (ulo, ad ulu); (intr.) to be under obligation (ad ulu, por ulo)
debat-ar: (tr.) to debate. Def.: Diskutar kun un o plura konversanti en ordinoza ed atencoza maniero, singlu prizentante l'argumenti servanta sua propra interesto o prefero; V
debet-o: (com.) debit (after the balance of an account), debit-balance
-igar: to d. (a sum to somebody's account)
debil-a: (of persons) weak, feeble; (cf. frajila), -igar: to debilitate, enfeeble
debit-ar: (tr.) to sell (goods, supplies, ordinarily at retail)
deboch-ar: (intr.) to go to excess in sensual pleasures, to live dissolutely, to revel, carouse
-igar: to debauch: entice to debauchery, to corrupt with lewdness

-anto, -ero: debauchee, rake: -ig-anto: debaucher. V. exp.: Krapulo esas nur maxim desnobla e vulgara debocho. Debochanto povas esar (restar) eleganta. Pro to debocho koncernas prefere la sexuala ne-etikaleso, krapulo la trouzo di manjado e drinkado, l'ebrieso kustumal, e.c. On povas parolar pri debaucho krapuloza; III
debut-ar: (intr., theat.) to make one's debut, first appearance; (fig.) to start, set out: take one's first steps
dec-ar: (intr.) to be decent, suitable, correct, proper; (cf. esar justa)
decens-ar: (tr., intr.) to go down, descend: to move or pass from a higher to a lower plane
-eyo: descent (place). Ex.: Decensar (de) monto en valo. Decensar (de) arboro. Decensar eskalero. La mareo, la temperaturo decensas. Ant.: acensar.
decept-ar: (tr.) to disappoint, to defeat (the hopes, expectations of someone)
dechifr-ar: (tr.) to decipher: to discover the key to a secret writing. V. exp.: vid. chifrar.
decid-ar: (tr., intr.) to decide, settle, determine
decilitr-o: deciliter: tenth part of a liter: 6.1 cu. in.
decim-o: decime. Def.: Dekimo di franko, o 10 centimi; III-324.
decimetr-o: decimeter: tenth of a meter: 3.937 in.
dedik-ar: (tr.) to dedicate: consecrate to a Divine Being; to devote to a sacred use; to inscribe or address to a patron or friend; (cf. konsakrar).
defekt-o: defect, imperfection, flaw, fault, blemish.
defens-ar: (tr.) to defend, protect (ulu, ulo, su, kontre)
-iva: defensive. Ex.: Defensar sua patrio, sua honoro, sua opiniono.
deferenc-ar: (tr.) to defer to, show deference to

-o: deference, regard, respect. Def.: Deferenco: Respekto qun on manifestas ad ulu exekutante lua volo o deziro. Nociono komplexa, qua ne esas simpla respekto. III-323. Ex.: On devas deferencar sua patri. Kun omna deferenceo qua esas debata a vu. Ant.: (deferenco) des-prizo, aarog-em-eso.
defi-ar: (tr.) to defy, challenge, dare (ulu, pri ulo, o facar ulo); -o: challenge, defying, defiance.
defil-ar: (intr.) to defile, file off, march past (avan ulu).
defin-ar: (tr.) to define: give the definition of
deform-ar: (tr.) to deform, put out of shape; -it(ul)o: a deformed person
degrad-ar: (tr.) to degrade: reduce in rank, remove from office.
dejun-ar: (intr.) to breakfast: (the first repast of the day); have b., -eto: a light b., frua -o: early b. Def.: Dejuno esas repasto di dimezo, VI-162.
dejur-ar: (intr., milit.) to be on duty
dekad-ar: (intr.) to be decadent, be in state of decay, decline (physical or moral)
-o: decadence: decline to a worse or less perfect state, tendency towards dissolution or extinction. Ex.: La dekado di l'imperio Romana. La dekado di arti. Ni vivas en dekandanta epoko.
dekalm-ar: (tr.) to declaim; to speak or deliver rhetorically
deklar-ar: (tr.) to declare (ulo, ad ulu). Ex.: Deklarar sua intenci, sua opinioni, Deklaro di milito.
deklin-ar: (tr., gram.) to decline, inflect; (intr., phys.) to deviate from the true north, as magnetic needle; (astron.) to remove from the equator, as a heavenly body.
-o, -uro: decoction, extract from a body boiled in water.
dekolt-ar: (tr.) to cut low (a dress); to bare the neck and shoulders
-ita: décolletté, in a low dress; (n.) dekolturo; -ach-ita: uncovered to an improper degress.
dekubit-ar: (med.) to like down in bed, decubation.
deliber-ar: (intr.) to deliberate. Def.: Ponderar en su ipsa o kun altri, pri questiono solvenda o rezolvo facenda, la motivi por e la motivi kontre la decido; V
delic-o: delight; high degree of pleasure or enjoyment; the cause of the pleasure
-ega: exquisite, superfine. Ex.:Delikata infanto, organi. La delikateso di la pelo, di linguo, di gusto.
delikt-ar: (intr.) to commit an offence (against law and order); (cf. kontravencar)
-o: offense; (jur.) misdemeanor: offense punishable by fine or imprisonment; (cf. krimino)
deliquc-ar: (intr., chem.) to deliquesce: become liquid.
delir-ar: (intr.) to be delirious, to rave
demand-ar: (tr.) to ask for (ulo); (N.B. Not the E. «demand», (cf. postular)
demarsh-ar: (intr.) to take steps, measures (to obtain something)

-o: step, proceeding; act, measure taken in business; Def.: Demarshar implikas sempre l'ideo di «pazi» facata extere, en la socio, port atingar ula skopo, por obtener irga helpo, favoro, e.c.; IV-100. V. exp.: Esforco esas propre ago muskulala, o generale, mekanikala
dementi-ar: (tr.) to give the lie to (ulu, pri ulo); to deny (flatly, publicly)
demision-ar: (intr.) to resign: give in one's rsignation; (milit.) to throw up one's commission; (parl.) to vacate one's seat. V. exp. vid. abdikar.
-igar: to democratize. Def.: La rejimo en qua la populo guvernesas da su ipsa (t.e. da sua elektiti); lua principo esas la suvereneso dil populo; VII-154.
demolis-ar: (tr.) to demolish, pull down, break up (a house, a fortification, an old ship)
demon-o: (myth. and fig.) demon, evil spirit, genius
demonstr-ar: (tr.) to demonstrate: prove by arguments; to make evident
-o: (lig., polit., milit., naval) demonstration. Ex.: Demonstrar propoziciono. Lua redesko demonstas lua shamo. Demonstri enemikala.

denigr-ar: (tr.) to disparage (ulu, ulo): run down, decry, depreciate, vilify, blacken the record of; (cf. difamar, kalumniar, maldicensar). Def.: Inspirar mala opiniono pri ulu (o ulo) per severa o nejusta aserti e judiki; IV
dens-a: dense: having its parts crowded together; compact, close: (cf. dika)
-igar: to thicken (liquids); (cf. plu-dik-igar). Ex.: Densa turbo, vaporo. Platino havas la maxim granda denso de omna metali. Ant.: skarsa, dis-sem-ita, ne-, des-densa.
-izar: to furnish with teeth; (fig.) to cog; indent; to put scallops in
-ifar: to make teeth; to cut teeth
denunc-ar: (tr.) to inform against, denounce (a guilty person).
depart-ar: (intr., also fig.) to depart (ek, de)
-ala: departmental. Def.: Teritoriala dividuro or resortiso; VI
depend-ar: (intr.) to depend: be conditioned or contingent (de); to rely on for support; to be a dependency (di)
deperis-ar: (intr.) to pine away, gradually lose strength; wither; slowly decline or perish. Def.: Debilesko duktanta ad (se ne til) la morto; III
deplor-ar: to deplore: to feel or express deep grief
-inda: deplorable, lamentable, wretched. Ex.: Deplorar la desfortunaji di ulu, la morto di ulu.
deport-ar: (tr.) to depart: to transport into banishment; to convey to a penal colony. V. exp.: vid exilar.
depoz-ar: (tr.) to depost: to lay, set or put down; to lodge for safekeeping; to bond (in warehouses)
-eyo: place of deposit, as a depot, depository, warehouse
-ario: trustee, depositary, guardian, warehouse-keeper. Ex.: Depozar portajo. Nil(e) depozas omnayare slamo fekunda. Depozanto di pekunio en panko.
depres-ar: (tr., phys. and moral) to depress: to press down; to deject
deput-ar: (tr.) to depute, deputize, send (ulu) as a deputy
deriv-ar: (tr., math., gram.) to derive (ulo de); have its root (de)
derog-ar: (intr., jur.) to derogate: to act contrary, invalidate, annul (in part), to depart from (a custom)

-anta, -iva: derogatory. Def.: Teknikala termino di yuro-cienco: facar ecepto, violaco instantala di ula lego, regulo; III-329. Ex.: Ica du partisi derogis de lia kontrato (E. both parties have invalidated some part of (or, have departed from) their contract). Derogar de la lego, de kustumo establisita.
des-afabla: crabbed, cross, churlish, surly, ungracious, uncivil.
desegn-ar: (tr.) to draw, design, delineate, sketch, (cf. esbosar, skisar)
desert-ar: (tr., intr., milit. and gen.) to desert, abandon, quit, forsake.
deserv-ar*: (tr., intr., eccl.) to serve (a living), have the parochial duties of (a chapel, hamlet); (cf. oficiar).
despens-o: pantry, larder, buttery, steward's office

despit-ar: (intr.) to be vexed; to fret. Def.: Despito: chagreno mixita kun iraco. Ex.: Ilua agi despitigas me (E. his acts vex me); Quo importas, sive il esas joyoza sive il esas despitoza (E. what do you care whether he is joyous or vexed). Lasar eruptar sua despito; (E. to vent one's ill humor).
destin-ar: to destine (ulo, ulu, ad ulo). Ex.: Destinar sua filiulo esar advokato. Esar kontenta pri sua destino (E. to be content with one's lot).
detach-ar*: (tr., milit., nav.) to draft: to send away, to send off for a particular service (from the main body).
detal-o: detail, particular: a minute or distinct part
-e: in, with d.s, minutely, piece-meal, bit by bit
-igar: to particularlize, state circumstantially, give the d.s of
determin-ar: (tr.) to determine: to fix the limits of; to ascertain or settle the exact truth about (ulo); (gram.) to fix the extent, the meaning of a word or sentence

-o: determination (not resolution, cf. rezolvo). Ex.: Lavoisier determinis la kompozuro di l'aero. Determinar disto de la tero a la suno. La determino di la volo. Determinita nombro. La doktrino di determinismo. V. exp.: vid. definar.
deters-ar: (tr.) to deterge: to cleanse, purge away (as foul matter)

detriment-ar: (tr.) to prove detrimental to, be prejudicial to; Ex.: Ica fakto detrimentis mea reputeso. Ica aranjo esas facita a mea detrimento, lo detrimentas me. V. exp.: Detrimentar e domajar esas diversa speci di nocar. Domajar (ulo) esas facar material altero, qua minbonigas kozo (o la korpo di persono). Detrimentar (ulu) esas efektigar a lu ula perdo, mem nerekte e nevole; IV-237-8.
dev-ar: (tr.) to have the obligation of, have the duty of, ought, should

-o: duty, obligation. Def.: «Devar» konvenas ad omna ed omnaspeca obligesi (moral od altra), do devas uzesar en omna imperi, preskripti e konsili. Ex.: Se vu volas bone standar, vu devas esar sobra. Vu devas ne adulterar, furtar. V. exp.: vid. darfar; kp. mustar.
devanc-ar: (tr.) to out-run, out-strip, out-do, to distance. V. exp.: On preter-iras kozo senmova, ma devancar implikas ke la objekto movas, e movas en sama sinco kam la subjekto; IV-137.
devast-ar: (tr.) to devastate, lay waste, ravage, desolate. Ex.: Ula uragano, ula pesto devastis la lando, la urbo.
develop-ar: (tr.) to develop: make larger, fuller; to unfold (a plot, etc.)
deviac-ar: (tr., intr.) to deviate, swerve (de). Ex.: La deviaco di magneta agulo.
devoc-o: devotion: act of religion, external worship (cf. pi-eso)
-esar, -igar su: to be d., to devote oneself. Ex.: Esar tote devota ad ulu, ad ulo. Devoteso a sua patrio. Devotigar su ad ula skopo.
-ano: (parl.) member of party on right (a conservative)
-igar: to make a d. of (ulo). Def.: Qua esas sovaja (od arida) e ne habitata. Ex.: Insulo dezerta. Sahara esas dezerto. Lando dezerta e nehabitata (E. a wild and uninhabited country).
dezinenc-o: desinence: formative suffix, word-ending. Def.: Finalo di vorto, precipue por indikar la flexiono.
dezir-ar: (tr.) to desire: to wish for earnestly, long for, hanker for, covet
dezol-ar: (tr.) to make disconsolate, distress, grieve (ulu)
-anta, -iva: grievious, disheartening. Ex.: La morto di mea amiko dezolas me.
di: (marks the genitive, possession, belonging to) la domo di mea patrulo: my father's house
diachilon-o*: diachylon: a kind of a plaster for wounds.
diafiz-o*: (anat.) diaphysis: the shaft or main part of a long bone.
diakritik-a, -o: diacritic. Def.: Teknikala termino por omna signi adjuntita a literi (supersigni, subsigni, e.c.); III
dialekt-o: dialect. Def. Vario regionala di linguo.
dialog-ar: (intr.) to dialogue: take part in a dialogue (kun)
-izar: to put in form of a d. (ulo).
dic-ar: (tr.) to say, tell, (ulo, ad ulu): -o, -ajo: saying, what one says
dicern-ar: (tr.) to discern: to see and identify by noting differences
-ebla: distinguishable. Def.: Vidar o komprenar la difero di du kozi (t.e. ke li diferas); III
dicion-o, -arto: elocution, delivery (utterance; N.B. not «diction»: choice of words; cf. stilo)
-isto: elocutionist. Def.: Arto, maniero parolar o deklamar; III
-igar: to d. (ulu); impozar -o ad ulu: to place someone on a d.
difam-ar: (tr., jur.) to defame, traduce, libel, asperse
-anta, -iva, -ema: defamatory; (cf. maldicensar, kalumniar, denigrar). Def.: Dicar ulo vera o nevera qua atakas la honoro or reputeso; ago, punisebla da la civila lego; II
difer-ar: (intr.) to differ: be different, be unlike; (of opinion) to disagree
-anta: different. Ex.: La sentimenti, la interesti di homi diferas. Diferar opinione de ulu. La difero inter tri e un esas du. V. exp.: Difer-anta: esence des-simila (per speco)
diferenci-ar: (tr., intr., biol., sociol.) to differentiate, to acquire or give a distinct or separate character (cf. diferencial-igar)
difuz-ar: (tr.) to diffuse: to spread, disperse widely.
-izar: to dike, dam. Def.: Konstrukturo por preventar indundado.
dign-a: worthy; meriting, deserving; having merit, worth, virtue
-eso: worthiness; (cf. respekt-ind-eso). Ex.: Digna de rekompenso, de laudo, de puniso.
digram-o: digraph; a combination of two or more letters to represent one sound, as ch, sh.
-o: (also astron.) digression: departure from main subject.
dikt-ar: (tr.) to dictate; utter sentences to be written down; (cf. imperar, impozar).
dilat-ar: (tr.) to dilate. Ex. Kaloro dilatas korpi.
dilet-ar: (tr.) to have a great liking for, be partial to, be an amateur in (music, etc.)
diligent-a: diligent. Def.: Qua agas kun zelo e rapideso. V. exp.: vid. asidua. Ant. lenta, indolenta, ne-ag-ema.
dilut-ar: (tr.) to dilute; thin by admixture of a liquid
diminut-ar: (tr., intr.) to diminish, lessen, -iva, ivo: dimunutive; (cf. min-grand-igar, min-gros-igar). Ant. Augmentar, kreskar, ampligar; developar.
din-a: thin; on dimension of a paper, plank, etc.
dinamism-o: dynamism; the doctrine that all substance involves force.
dine-ar: (intr.) to dine, to be at dinner
dioptr-o: (opt.) diopter: sight-vane. Def.: La fesnestreto tra qua on regardas por vizar punto per l'instrumento nomata alidado; IV
dioptri-o: (opt.) diopter; unit of refractive power. Def.: Uneso di mezuro por la «okulvitri»; IV
dioptrik-o: dioptrics. Def.: Teorio di la optikala vitri (kp. katoptriko); IV
diplas-ar: (tr.) to displace; to change the place of (ulo); to misplace; put out of place (ulo)
diplomac-o: diplomacy, diplomatics; (fig.) tact, shrewdness; skill in conducting any kind of negotiation or social matter
diplomatik-o: diplomatics: science of ancient writings.
diport-o: (stock exchange) backwardation. Def.: Ajorno til proxima borsal liquidaco di la livro di valori vendita, pagante premio; la premio pagata por ta ajorno; II
diptik-o: diptych: ancient tablet of two leaves.
direcion-o: (line of) direction, bearing (both ways). Ex.: Du paraleli havas la sama direciono; IV
direkt-ar: (tr.) to direct; manage, conduct; put in a direction, (ulu, ulo, ad)
diret-a: direct (opposite to indirect, as: direct way, discourse, method)
-o, uro: dissertation; oral or written examination on a question; disquisition; (college) theme.
-eso: dissent. Def.: (Teknikala termino di religiala historio): qua ne konsentas kun la maxim multa samreligiani pri ula punto, dogmato; III
disimul-ar: (tr.) to dissimulate, dissemble; hide under a false appearance
-anta: two-, double-faced, artful, sly. Def.: Celar sua pensi, opinioni, sentimeni, o fingar altri; III
disip-ar: (tr.) to waste, squander; (cf. extravagar, prodigar)

-anto, -ero, -emo: squanderer, spendthrift, prodigal, waster. Def.: Spensar abunde ed ecese sua havaji en multa frivola o sterila spensi, e havas prefere blamanta senco. Figurale, on disipas sua forteso, sua atenco inter multa objekti e skopi; IV
diskont-ar: (tr., com.) to discount: advance money on a bill, deducting the interest

diskret-a: discreet, -eso: discretion. Ex. Il esas saja e diskreta persono. Atingar la evo di diskreteso. Fidar a la diskreteso di ulu. V. exp.: Modesta esas ta qua havas pri su opiniono moderata, ne exajerata, e ne havas ecesa pretendi
diskurs-ar: (intr.) to make a speech, deliver a discourse, an address to discant (pri)
diskursiv-a*: (phil.) discursive: proceeding regularly from premises to conclusion.
diskut-ar: (tr.) to discuss (a questoin, project, point of law, etc)
-ebla, -inda:: discussable, debatable. Def.: Examenar questiono ponderante la «por» el la «kontre». Parolante pri personi ne havanta la sama opiniono, kambiar argumenti pri ula temo; V

dislok-ar: (tr.) to dislocate: disarrange, put out of order or place; (milit.) to break up (an army); to dismember (a state). Ex.: On dislokas, sive mobili, utensili, mashini, sive armeo od armeo-korpo; III
disoci-ar: (tr., chem.) to dissociate; break up into consitutents.
disonanc-ar: (intr., mus.) to make a dissonance, discord; (cf. des-, mis-, ne-akordar).

-ajo, -eso: disparity. Def.: Teknike e precize, aplikesas a du nocioni, qui ne apartenas a la sama genero, nek esas genero l'una di l'altra. Vulgare e laxe, dicenas pri omno quo esas tre nesimila, nekoheranta, neharmonianta; III
dispens-ar: (tr.) to dispense (ulu de ulo) to exempt, excuse from, give leave not to do or observe (ulo)
-o: dispensation; (cf. permisar). Ex.: Dispensar de la fasto. La granda evo dispensas la oldi militar. Ant.: obligar, koaktar.
dispensari-o: dispensatory, dispensary (med.) Def.: Loko en qua la povri povas konsultar medicinisti e recevar flegi o medikamenti (sen lojar en ol); III

dispers-ar: (tr.) to disperse, scatter. Ex.: La vento dispersas la nubi, la folii. Armeo vinkinta dispersas l'enemiki. Disperso di la Judi. V. exp.: Dispersar esas preske sinonima di dissemar, ma kun ideo plu agema, ideo di lanso, pulso ad fore; IV
dispon-ar: (tr.) to have the disposal of, have (ulo) at one's disposal; to dispose of (ulo)
disput-ar: (intr.) to have a dispute, to quarrel, wrangle, bicker
-achar: to squabble, brawl, wrangle about trifles
dist-ar: (intr.) to be distant, be remote
disting-ar: (tr.) to distinguish; set apart; to characterize; to make distinct or different by sign, mark or characteristic
-iva: distinctive. Def.: Facar ulo por ke altru povez discernar; III

-anta:, -iva: diverting entertaining. Def.: Deturnar la mento, l'atenco de sua objekto per amuzivo, sive per irg altra moyeno. Existas menti naturale distrakata o distraktebla, qui distraktesas da irga extera kauzo, o mem da nula; IV

distribut-ar: (tr., gen. and tech.) to distribute; to deal out, apportion, dispense; (cf. disdonar, repartisar). V. exp.: Distributar esas donar (o sendar) a siversa personi o loki, ma kun dicerno, ne hazarde. Exemple, on distributas premii a la skolani. Teknikale, on distributas la vaporo a la du parti di cilindro en oportuna tempo; VI
distrikt-o: district. Def.: Limitizita teritorio sub un judicial resortiso.
diten-ar: (tr.) to detain; withhold, keep back (what belongs to another)
-anto, -ero: holder, possessor (of public property); one who withholds from another. (N.B. not used in sense of imprison, cf. en-karcer-igar). Def.: Konservar til ula evento; II

divag-ar: (intr., lit. and fig) to ramble, wander, rove, stray, divagate. Ex.: Bestii divigas. La divagi di aquofluo. Alkoholiko divagas en sua parolado, t.e. vagas en sua parolado o mem sua pensado, sen ordino nek raciono; III

divan-o: divan. V. exp.: Divano ne havas dors-apogilo, ma nur movebla kuseni. Sofao havas dors-apogilo (esas quaze repozlito). Kanapeo esas quaze larja stulego por plura personi, kun dors-apogilo e brakio-apogili; II
diven-ar: (intr., tr.) to become; to get, grow, pass into some new state or condition; to become of; be the final condition of
diverg-ar: (tr.) to diverge (de, ek). Def.: Deviacar, dispersar di un punto a diferanta direcion-o, -i; (fig.) esar ne-konkordanta. Ex.: Lumradii divergas. Divergo di opinioni. Ant.: konvergar.
-aji: sundry articles: distinct things, not necessarily different in kind
-eso: diversity; variety, multiplicity. Def.: Qua esas plu multa kam un, ma ne granda nombro. Ex.: Diversa personi. La diversa interesti di la nacioni. La diversa senci di vorto.

-ar: (intr.) to make, cause a d. Def.: Atako (en kombato) por deturnar l'atenco e la fortaji di la enemiko; simila taktiko en la konversado, por deturnar ol de temo jenanta, desagreabla, nekonvenanta, e.c. (Ne konfundenda kun digreso); III
divid-ar: (tr., math. and gen.) to divide (ulo, per ulo)
divin-ar: (tr.) to divine: guess (by any means)
-ajo, -endo: puzzle, poser, riddle; (cf. konjektar, pre-dicar). Ex.: Divinar la intenci di ulu. Divinar engimato. Me donas a vu di foyi divinar ol. Divino di la futuro.
divulg-ar: (tr.) to divulge; reveal, make known (a secret, news, etc.).
dizastr-o: disaster. Def.: Desfortuno tre granda e subita, generale koncernanta multa homi o tota socio, ex. grava vinkeso, granda incendio, naufrajo; III
do: (mus.) do: first tone of diatonic scale.
do: (prep.) therefore, then, so, consequently, (introduces a conclusion). Ex.: Me pensas, do me existas. Il esas vua patro, do vu devas respektar il. L'alkoholo foligas, do ol esas veneno.
doari-o: jointure, dower, marriage-settlement (provided by the bride-groom or his family; cf. dotar)
docent-o: private docent; private teacher or lecturer (university).
docil-a: docile, tractable. Def.: Facile docebla e duktebla; II-19. Ex.: Skolano docila. Docila kavalo.
dok-o: dock. Def.: Mar-baseno por konstruktar o reparar navi; baseno cirkondita da kayi o warfi por charjar o descharjar navi.
doktor-o: doctor; holder of a doctorate
dol-o: (jur.) fraud, deception, malice; evil or criminal intent
dolc-a: pleasing to the taste: -a oranjo, vino: sweet orange, wine

-iero: dolly, holding-on-tool. Def.: Doliiero esas specala instrumento, qua uzesas en la rivetago pro impedar la riveto ekbatesar per la martelagi. Dolio esas la kavajo, qua esas ye l'extremajo di la doliiero; III
dolmen-o: domen, cromlech: table-stone. Def.: Speco di megalita monumento; VI
dolor-ar: (intr.) to feel a pain, to suffer (physically; cf. chagrenar)
-igar: to cause pain to (ulu), to make sore, make suffer
domaj-ar: (tr., phys. sense) to damage; to injure, harm, impair, spoil
domicil-o: domicile; residence, place of abode
dominant-o*: (mus.) dominant; fifth note of scale.
dominac-ar: (tr.) to have dominion over, sovereign authority, sway over; (fig.) tower, rise above, command, control

domt-ar: (tr.) to subdue, subjugate, quell. V. exp.: On domtas propre la sovaja bestii (sen vere amansar oli, nek igar oli domestika). On domtas figurale la pasioni, la furioza amaso (turbo), e.c.; III
donac-ar: (tr.) to give: make a donation, a gift, a present of (ulo, ad ulu), to give away, bestow
-anto, -into, -ero: donor. Ex. Donacar almono. Donacar (senrekompense) manjaji a la povri. V. exp.: vid donar.
dop: (prep., in space) behind, back of, after, posterior; (cf. pos)
dorad-o: (ich.) dorado: a species of dolphin (Coryphaena hippurus).
dorlot-ar: (tr.) to coddle, pet; (fig. to nurse)
dorm-ar: (intr., tr.) to sleep, be asleep, slumber
dors-o: (anat. and of knife, book, hand, etc.) back
dosel-o: dais; raised, canopied seat, fixed or portable.
dot-ar: (tr.) to endow: furnish a dowry, dower, marriage-portion to (ulu); supply (some public institution with a permanent fund)
-o, -uro: dowry (provided by father or family of the bride), (cf. doario) endowment; (fig.) gift, talent
-igar: (tr.) to put up a doze of, to apportion a dose of (ulo).
drag-ar: (tr.) to dredge (out) (a river, etc.), to explore with a drag
dragoman-o: dragoman. Def.: Interpretisto en Oriento; IV
draje-o: sugar-plum. Def.: Mandelo od altra kozo kovrita per harda sukrajo; V
drakm-o: (Gr. money) drachma; (weight) dram: eighth part of a troy ounce.
drapir-ar: (tr.) to drape: to cover with drapery, hang in folds.
dren-ar: (tr.) to drain (a field, a wound, etc.)

dres-ar: (tr.) to train, break in (animals). V. exp.: On dresas l'animali por igar li exekutar ula determinita (ofte ne naturala) movi, sive por servar la homo (ex. kavalkado), sive por facar irga prodaji. Omna domestika animalo esas edukata da sua mastro; ma ne omni esas dresita. Me povas edukar chasokundo (t.e. hundo de chasala raso) sen ule dresar lu (por la chaso o por irga altra agado); VI
drift-ar: (intr., nav.) to drift. Def.: Esar pulsata da vento o mar-fluo exter sua voyo; II
dril-o: (tech.) drill-handle, holder; (cf. borilo, trepano). Def.: La instrumento qua portas e movas la borilo (en metalo).
-izar: to physic, give a d. to (ulu, su).
dron-ar: (tr.) to drown; (of ships) to founder, go to the bottom
-ito: a d.ed person. Def.: Mortigar ulu, su per asfixio en liquido. V. exp.: La navisti ne dronesis, nam la navo ne dronesis, ma nur sinkis til la bordo; (cf. II
-ima, -imo: half (N.B. but «half» in composition is translated by mi- as, mi-horo, mi-cirklo)
dub-ar: (intr.) to doubt; waver in opinion, hesitate to believe
duel-ar: (intr.) to fight a duel (kun, kontre ulu).
dukt-ar: (tr.) to lead, conduct, bring along (ulu, ulo). V. exp.: vid. guidar.
dum: (prep.) during (the whole period spoken of); marks interval of time an event has taken place in
-e: meanwhile, in the mean time, yet, still
dur-ar: (intr.) to last, endure, remain, continue, hold out; (cf. permanar, kontinua)
-onta: to be continued (cf. pluso sequos). Ex.: La piramidi di Egiptia ankore duras. La skribado duras. Durigar diskurso, letro. Spaco e duro. Dur-iva stofi, instrumenti. Duranta joyi, chagreni.
durst-ar: (intr., also fig.) to thirst, be thirsty
dush-ar: (tr.) to douche: give a shower bath to.
duv-o: (barrel-) stave. Def. Duvi esas planki di specala formo, ek qui on kompozas la bareli; III
duyong-o: dugong (Halicore dugong). Def.: Mar-hundo di la Malayal insularo (India-oceano, e.c.); III
habil-a: (physical, intellectual) able, clever, skilful, adroit, dextrous, handy

habilit-ar: (tr.; esp. juris.) to habilitate, to qualify, to render competent, to enable. Ex.: Habilitar minor(ul)o kontraktar. Habilitar su por ula ofico. La habiliteso heredar cesas en fora gradi di parenteso.
habit-ar: (tr., intr.) to inhabit, to live (in) (permanently); (cf. rezidar)
-ebla: (in)habitable. V. exp.: Habitar esas rezidar permanante en propra o fixa domo
hach-ar: (tr.) to hatch, shade by lines cut or drawn; to hash, to mince, cut into very small parts

-ilo: (cook.) chopping-knife. Def.: Pece-tigar (karno, e.c.); IV-562. Ex.: On hachas karno per multa densa tranchuri preske paralela; simile on hachas desegno per multa linei preske paralela; V-31.
hak-ar: (tr.) to chop, (rough) hew, cut up (with an axe or large cutting instrument), (cf. hachar)
hal-o: a large room of considerable size; (merkato-) market, public place, ordinarily covered, where marketing is carried on
halon-o*: halo (as around moon, head, etc.).
-igar: to cause (ulu) to halt; to stop (ulo)
-ez: (command.) halt! stop there! that will do!
-agar, exercar su per -i: to do d. b. exercises.
halucin-ar: (intr.) to have hallucinations, to delude (su)
-igar: to cause h.s in (ulu); to affect with visions or imaginary perceptions.
halux-o*: hallux, great toe of foot.
han-o: a fowl, hen or cock
hanch-o: hip (of persons), haunch, hind-quarter (of animals)
handikap-ar: (tr., in sports and fig.) to handicap.
hangar-o: shed (esp. for vehicles), outhouse; (aviation) hangar. Def.: Tekto pozita sur fosti o pilastri; II-709.
har-o: a hair (of a person's head; cf. pilo)
-igar: to harden (ulu, ulo); to temper (iron, etc.); (fig.) to indurate, toughen, inure
