-eso: hardness. Ex.: Fero esas metalo tre harda. Ovo harde koquita. Lito harda. Hardigar sua korpo. Havar harda kordio (fig.). Kavalo kun harda boko. Ant.: mola.
harmoni-ar: (intr., lit. and fig.) to be in harmony (kun)
-igar: to hurry (ulu, ulo, su); to press, push forward expedite; (cf. acelerar, plu-rapid-igar, avancar)
-eto, plata -o: mattock. Def.: Instrumento fera kun ligna mancho, por exkavar la tero; la fera parto esas larja, plata e tranchanta, kun aristo en plano perpendikla a la mancho; VI-533.
haul-ar: (tr., nav.) to haul, heave in (cf. tirar); to tow
hav-ar: (tr.) to have (ulo: money, occasion, motive, time, etc.; N.B. not to be used as verbal auxiliary)
hazard-o: (hap-)hazard, luck, chance, something uncertain and unplanned
heg-o: hedge, hedgerow. Def.: Barilo o klozilo (cirkum agro) formacita ek arbusti; IV-204.
hegemoni-o: hegemony. Def.: Speco di dominaco o prepondero di un naciono inter altri (historial e politikal termino); III-603.
hektolitr-o: hectoliter: 22.01 imperial galls; 26.417 U.S. galls.
helic-o: (arch., geom.) helix; (of a ship) propeller; (bot.) tendril
heliograb-ar: (tr., photo, engr.) to make heliogravures.
helm-o: (ancient) helmet. Def.: Specala formo di kasko (mezevala e blazonala); IV-78.
help-ar: (tr.) to help, aid, assist (ulu, pri, por, ulo)
-anto, -ero, -isto: assistant, helper; (in composition) assistant-, under-; (on ships) mate; aide
-ilo, -ivo: (instrument, object which aids) aid, help, relief, assistance, auxiliary

-facita, -bakita: home-made, -baked. V. exp.: La hemo povas esar ne kompleta domo, ma apartamento mikra e mem nur un chambro; lo esencala esas, ke on sentas ke ol esas personala "eseyo" (rezideyo), tote diferanta de chambri di hotelo o di lojeyo; I-411.
hepatit-o*: (med.) hepatitis, inflammation of the liver; (min.) hepatite, liver stone.
herb-o: herb, a plant which does not have a woody stem (cf. herboro)
herbari-o: herbarium, classified collection of dried plants.
-isto: herbalist. Def.: Medicinala planto sikigita o preparita (en la formo en qua ol vendesas da herboristo); VI-213.
herd-o: hearth, fireplace, hearthstone; floor or bottom of an oven.
hered-ar: (tr.) to inherit, be the heir to (ulo, de ulu)
heris-ar: (tr.) to bristle (up) (of hair, feathers, etc.)
hezit-ar: (intr.) to hesitate, falter, be doubtful
-anta, -ema: hesitant, irresolute, faltering. Ex.: Il hezitas inter deziro e shamo. Hezitar avan danjero. Karaktero hezitema. Hezitanta voco, respondo.
-igo: hybridization. Def.: Animali e planti qui venas de mixo di du speci; V-33. Ex.: Mulo esas hibrido de kavalino ed asnulo.
"hidalgo": hidalgo: Spanish nobleman of lower class.
hidr-o: (myth., astron.) Hydra; (zool.) hydrophis, a genus of fresh water polyps.
hidrocefal-eso: (med.) hydrocephalus, water on the brain
hidroskopi-o: bletonism, art of finding under-water sources.
higien-o: hygiene. V. exp.: vid. salubra.
hip-ar: (intr.) to have the hiccoughs, to hiccup.
hiperbat-o: (gram.) hyperbaton. Def.: Figuro di retoriko konsistanta en renverso di l'ordino dil vorti; VI-135.
hipertrofi-ar: (tr.) to cause hypertrophy to; to develop to an unusual or abnormal degree
hipnot-ar: (intr.) to be in a hypnotic state
his-ar: (tr., nav.) to hoist, raise, haul up (sails), to run up (a signal, a flag)
histerotomi-o*: (surg.) dissection of the womb; Caesarian operation.
historiograf-o*: historiographer: official historian of a prince or state.
hivernar: (intr. of animals and persons) to hibernate, to winter (cf. estivar); (milit.) to go into winter quarters.
ho! Oh! ho! (denoting pain, sorrow, regret); ho there! holla! (nav.) ahoy
holograf-a: holographic: -a testamento: will written in testators own hand.
holokaust-o: (also fig.) holocaust, burnt offering. Def.: Sakrifiko en qua la viktimo esis tote kombustata; IV-79
holoturi-o: (zool.) holothurian: a kind of water polyp (genus: Holothuria), trepang, beche de mer.
hom-o: (species, inclusive of both sexes) man, a human being, person
-eso: humanity, quality or condition of being human (cf. human-eso)
homaj-ar: (tr.) to do (or pay, render) homage to (a prince, a sovereign); (fig.) to pay one's respects to (ulu)
honest-a: honest, fair and straightforward in conduct, thought, etc., free from deceit or fraud, upright, worthy
-izar: to h., pay h. to (ulu, per ulo)
honorari-o: honorarium, fee, emolument. Def.: Salario di la "liberal arti" (advokato, medicinisto, e.c.); IV-163.
hor-o: hour, the twenty-fourth part of a day; (cf. kloko)
Hori: (Gr. rel.) Horæ, the three goddesses of the seasons.
hord-o: horde, a nomadic group; (fig.) crowd, band, pack.
-grano: a grain of b.; (fig., med.) stye
horor-ar: (intr.) to feel dread mixed with detestation, to abhor, detest, loath, dread, have a horror of (pri, pro, ulu, ulo)
-inda: horrible, horrid. V. exp.: vid. pavorar.

hospic-o: asylum, convalescent hospital, refuge (for the infirm, poor, aged, etc.); (as in the Alps) hospice, inn for travelers (kept by religious order). V. exp.: En hospitalo on kuracas maladi; en hospico on mantenas (longe, o mem por lia restanta vivo) oldi, infirmi, infanti, e.c. Malado konvalecanta povas ekirar hospitalo por enirar hospico; IV-136.
hospital-o: hospital (cf. ambulanco). V. exp. vid. hospico.
host-o: host, one who receives or entertains a guest.
hu-o: (orni.) owl, particularly the white owl (Athene noctua)
-eto: owlet; tawny owl, brown owl (Syrnium aluco, Strix aluco)
-isto: humanist, a student of the humanities

-igar: to humble, humiliate, cast down. Def.: Qua basigas su vole, qua subordinas o submisas su (etikal senco). Per extenso, on darfas parolar pri gesti, paroli, agi, e social situeso humila, humil-iganta; III-226. V. exp. vid. diskreta. Ant.: superba.
humor-o: (bona, mala) humor, temper, mood, disposition; (old physiol.) one of the four bodily fluids determining the temperament
humur-o: humor, humour, jocose imagination (less intellectual and more sympathetic than wit). V. Exp. vid. humoro.
hungr-ar, -eskar: (intr.) to be hungry (cf. apetitar); (fig.) to be eager, greedy
hura! hurrah! hurray! hura-o: a hurrah, huzza.
hurd-o: hurdle, a movable frame, as of wattled twigs, for folding sheep, gates, etc.; hurdle, an artificial barrier to be leaped.
habil-a: (physical, intellectual) able, clever, skilful, adroit, dextrous, handy

habilit-ar: (tr.; esp. juris.) to habilitate, to qualify, to render competent, to enable. Ex.: Habilitar minor(ul)o kontraktar. Habilitar su por ula ofico. La habiliteso heredar cesas en fora gradi di parenteso.
habit-ar: (tr., intr.) to inhabit, to live (in) (permanently); (cf. rezidar)
-ebla: (in)habitable. V. exp.: Habitar esas rezidar permanante en propra o fixa domo
hach-ar: (tr.) to hatch, shade by lines cut or drawn; to hash, to mince, cut into very small parts

-ilo: (cook.) chopping-knife. Def.: Pece-tigar (karno, e.c.); IV-562. Ex.: On hachas karno per multa densa tranchuri preske paralela; simile on hachas desegno per multa linei preske paralela; V-31.
hak-ar: (tr.) to chop, (rough) hew, cut up (with an axe or large cutting instrument), (cf. hachar)
hal-o: a large room of considerable size; (merkato-) market, public place, ordinarily covered, where marketing is carried on
halon-o*: halo (as around moon, head, etc.).
-igar: to cause (ulu) to halt; to stop (ulo)
-ez: (command.) halt! stop there! that will do!
-agar, exercar su per -i: to do d. b. exercises.
halucin-ar: (intr.) to have hallucinations, to delude (su)
-igar: to cause h.s in (ulu); to affect with visions or imaginary perceptions.
halux-o*: hallux, great toe of foot.
han-o: a fowl, hen or cock
hanch-o: hip (of persons), haunch, hind-quarter (of animals)
handikap-ar: (tr., in sports and fig.) to handicap.
hangar-o: shed (esp. for vehicles), outhouse; (aviation) hangar. Def.: Tekto pozita sur fosti o pilastri; II-709.
har-o: a hair (of a person's head; cf. pilo)

-eso: hardness. Ex.: Fero esas metalo tre harda. Ovo harde koquita. Lito harda. Hardigar sua korpo. Havar harda kordio (fig.). Kavalo kun harda boko. Ant.: mola.

helic-o: (arch., geom.) helix; (of a ship) propeller; (bot.) tendril
heliograb-ar: (tr., photo, engr.) to make heliogravures.
helm-o: (ancient) helmet. Def.: Specala formo di kasko (mezevala e blazonala); IV-78.

ho! Oh! ho! (denoting pain, sorrow, regret); ho there! holla! (nav.) ahoy
holograf-a: holographic: -a testamento: will written in testators own hand.
holokaust-o: (also fig.) holocaust, burnt offering. Def.: Sakrifiko en qua la viktimo esis tote kombustata; IV-79

-eso: humanity, quality or condition of being human (cf. human-eso)

-izar: to h., pay h. to (ulu, per ulo)

Hori: (Gr. rel.) Horæ, the three goddesses of the seasons.

-grano: a grain of b.; (fig., med.) stye

-inda: horrible, horrid. V. exp.: vid. pavorar.

V. exp.: En hospitalo on kuracas maladi; en hospico on mantenas (longe, o mem por lia restanta vivo) oldi, infirmi, infanti, e.c. Malado konvalecanta povas ekirar hospitalo por enirar hospico; IV-136.
hospital-o: hospital (cf. ambulanco). V. exp. vid. hospico.
host-o: host, one who receives or entertains a guest.
hu-o: (orni.) owl, particularly the white owl (Athene noctua)
-eto: owlet; tawny owl, brown owl (Syrnium aluco, Strix aluco)
-isto: humanist, a student of the humanities

-igar: to humble, humiliate, cast down. Def.: Qua basigas su vole, qua subordinas o submisas su (etikal senco). Per extenso, on darfas parolar pri gesti, paroli, agi, e social situeso humila, humil-iganta; III-226. V. exp. vid. diskreta. Ant.: superba.
humor-o: (bona, mala) humor, temper, mood, disposition; (old physiol.) one of the four bodily fluids determining the temperament
humur-o: humor, humour, jocose imagination (less intellectual and more sympathetic than wit). V. Exp. vid. humoro.
hungr-ar, -eskar: (intr.) to be hungry (cf. apetitar); (fig.) to be eager, greedy
hura! hurrah! hurray! hura-o: a hurrah, huzza.
hurd-o: hurdle, a movable frame, as of wattled twigs, for folding sheep, gates, etc.; hurdle, an artificial barrier to be leaped.
ya: indeed, most certainly, truly (used in a sentence to lend emphasis, to confirm a statement)
-ala: yearly, annual; relating to y.; -ala (od,  un-yara) planti: annual plants

ye: preposition of indefinite meaning to be used when no other preposition covers the meaning;  especially denoting position, place, precise situation, time: ye la fino di la libro:  at the end of the book

yen: (conjunction with an interjectional character) (with or without hike, ibe) here is, there is;  (interj. meaning) look here! behold! lo! yen la volfo: here is the wolf; look, the wolf!  yen (hike) me: here I am
yes: yes, aye, yea. Ant.: no.
yol-o: jolly-boat; a ships boat of medium size; yawl.
yur-o: right (founded on law, property, vested interest) legal-right, -title, -authority; right (moral claim founded on justice, equity); (cf.  lego, yust-eso)
-izar: to entitle, authorize, give the (legal) right to; (cf. darfar)
yust-a: just, equitable, rightful, fair, justifiable (cf. yur-iz-ita, equitatoza, justa)
-eso: (moral) justness, justice, fairness, uprightness, integrity (cf. equitato, yuro)
gaban-o: water proof cloak with hood and sleeves; (naut.) pilot-coat.
gabar-o: lighter, barge (for loading and unloading ships).
gaf-o: boat-hook; (fig.) gaff (as used to secure heavy fish).
gain-o: a long narrow vertical holder, sheath, scabbard (as for a sword, bayonet, etc.: en- -igar: to sheath) a sword, etc. V. exp: vid. etuyo.
gaj-o: pledge, pawn, deposit, gage; something given as security for repayment of money borrowed
-izar: to give as a pledge, secure
-robo: a gala robe, festive dress. V. exp.: Ica vorto uzesas precipue adjektive, por qualifikar festo, dineo, reprezento, e.c. On uzos do ol kom unesma elemento di kompozita vorti; IV-11.
galant-a: gallant; polite and attentive to ladies
-ajo: act of gallantry, courteous act (to ladies).
galanten-o: (cook.) galantine; collared turkey or veal.
-ano: one of the crew of the g.; (fig.) g.slave (cf. bagn-ano).

galeri-o: gallery, a long narrow room, hall or passageway; highest balcony (in theaters, churches); balcony on stern of ship; drift tunnel, (in mining or fortification) -spekt-anti, -ant-aro: the gallery, people seated in g.
galimatias-o: galimatias, jargon, gibberish. V. exp.: Galimatiaso ne estas linguo, ma diskurso o parolado qua estas gramatikale korekta ma konfuza ed obskura per la stilo; VII-158.
galon-o: galoon, a narrow trimming, lace of gold, silver, silk, etc.
galosh-o: galosh: a shoe with a wooden sole.
galvaniz-ar: (tr. elec., and fig.) to galvanize, electrify; (cf. galvano-plastar).
gam-o: (mus.) gamut, scale. Def.: Sequo di la soni di ula tono en l'ordino di alteso (ex.: c, d, e, f, g, a, b esas la gamo di la tono di C); IV-467.
gambit-ar: (tr.) to trip up (ulu); (fig.) (in chess) to play a gambit.
gambol-ar: (intr.) to gambol, skip about in frolic, romp.
gan-ar: (tr.) to gain, to earn, to win
gangren-ar: (intr. med.) to be affected with gangrene
-igar, -ifar: (tr., intr.) to g., to produce mortification
gap-ar: (intr.) to gape with wonder or curiosity (like a simpleton).
gar-ar: (tr.) to put or place to one side of a road or way (temporarily for protective purposes); to shunt, switch, (trains on a siding)

-eyo: a side place; (fig.) a garage (for autos). Def.: Pozar latere ad ula voyo, en halto o rezervo, quaze depozita o shirmata; IV-103. Ex.: On garas treni sur gar-voyi (N.B. gareyo ne esas staciono). On garas bateli en la protui o gareyi (larjigita parti) di kanalo. La pasanti en la stradi garas su de la veturi o por lasar altru pasar. La skermanto garas su por «kovrar» (protektar) sua korpo ed evitar la stroki di espado.

garanti-ar: (tr.) to guarantee, warrant; (cf. cert-igar, responsar, kaucion-igar). Ex.: Garantiar la pago di debajo. Me garantias ca posh-horlojo pur un yaro. Me ne povas garantiar la vereso di ta aserto.
gargar-ar: (tr.) to gargarize, to gargle (the throat) (ulu, su)
garnis-ar: (tr.) to furnish with things necessary to complete or embellish
garnitur-o: garniture, ornamental appendages, embellishment, furniture, dress.
garot-o: short piece of wood used to tighten anything, especially cords by twisting around; packing-stick
-ligar: to make fast, with or in a garrote; (fig.) to pinion, strangle.
-esar: to be a g., to stay, lodge (che ulu)
-igar: to receive (ulu) as a g.; to lodge (ulu)
gastralgi-o*: (med.) gastralgia: gastric neuralgia, pain in the abdomen; belly-ache.
gastronom-o: gastronome, epicure. Def.: Homo qua havas subtila gusto e savas dicernar la qualesi di la manjaji e drinkaji; VII-155. V. exp.: vid. gurmando.
gastronomi-o: gastronomy. Def.: Quaza arto di la gastronomo.
gauj-ar: (tr.) to gauge, measure (the capacity of), to take the g. of. Def.: Mezurar la konteno (interna volumino) di navo, barelo. e.c.; III-75.
gav-ar: (tr.) to cram, gorge (with food), (artificially) to fatten (animals).
gavot-o: gavot(te): a kind of lively dance or tune (French).
-igar: to make (ulu) merry, cheer, enliven, gladden
«geisha»: geisha, Japanese singing or dancing girl.
gelt-o: commission money, percentage on sales, bonus. Def.: Sumo po cento pagata a komizi, vendisti, e.c. ek lia vendi; II-75.
generacion-o: generation, people of same period.
geni-o: genius, particular natural talent, uncommon intellectual power; (fig) attendant spirit
genit-ar: (tr.) to beget, breed, generate, procreate (living beings); cf. produktar (ulo); (geom.) to generate
-uro: offspring, a progeny; (of animals) a litter; -ema: prolific; V. exp.: On genitas filio; luxo produktas vicio.
genr-o: (gram.) gender. Def.: Gramatikala sexuo; IV-692.
-o: gesticulation, gesture, deaf and dumb sign
gichet-o: wicket, small gatelike window in ticket-offices, etc.; also as in game or cricket.
gild-o: guild, gild. Def.: Ensemblo di samspeca mestieristi. M.-X.132.
giloch-ar: (tr., arch.) to furnish or decorate with a guilloche
gimnazi-o: gymnasium, classical preparatory school (esp. in Germany); (cf.kolegio; liceo).
gipaet-o: (orni.) gypaetus, lammergeier, bearded vulture (Gypaetos barbatus).
gips-o: gypsum, plaster-of-paris; ordinary plaster (as used for house interiors); (cf. mortero)
girland-o: garland: wreath of flowers, leaves, etc.
gis-ar: (tr.) to cast: found molten metal; (cf. muldar)
-defekto: defect in casting, blow-hole. Ex.: Gisar kanono en mulduro. III-82.
gizard-o: (anat.) gizzard. Def.: Triesma stomako di l'uceli; V-87.
glac-ar: (tr., tech.) to gloss, glaze (paper, leather, etc.) (cf. glezar); to calender (fabrics).
-ala: relating to ice, -igar: to freeze (ulo) into ice (cf. konjel-ar, frost-igar, frigor-izar)
-ruptado, -dis-solvado: the breaking up, the melting of ice
glacier-o: glacier: -ala: glacial: relating to g.s (cf. glaci-ala).
glav-o: (also fig.) sword; -di yusteso: (fig.) the s. of justice. Def.: Espado tranchanta.
glez-ar: (tr.) to glaze, apply a vitreous coating to pottery. Def: Aplikar vitra strato sur ceramikajo; IV-579.
glicin-o: (bot) glycine; (chem.) glucina, oxide of glucinum.

glin-ar: (tr.) to glean (ears of grain); (fig.) to gather (things thinly scattered). Ex.: Glinar la spiki pos la rekolto. Li studiabis ta epoko tante komplete, ke nun ni povas nur glinar poka fakti nova.
glipt-ar: (tr.) to carve, engrave, grave (precious stones)
-arto: glyptography. Def.: Skultar medali e lapidi; IV-291.
glit-ar (intr.), -igar (tr.): to glide, slide, slip, slur (over)

-flugar: (aviation) to plane; -shuo: snow-shoe. Ex.: On glitas sur voyi kovrita per frosto-pluvo. Il sizis la kordo e glitis til la tero. La batelo glitas sur la kalma maro. La taso glitis de mea manuo. Glitigar sua manuo en la posho di ulu. Vua remonstri glitas de lua mento.
glosari-o: glossary: partial dictionary explaining the harder words.
glugl-ar: (intr.) to gurgle (cf. gorgolar, klukar). Def.: Bruiso di liquido ekiranta botelo; IV-11.
glut-ar (tr.) to swallow, gulp, gobble up (food, etc.); to quaff, swill (liquids); (fig.) to take in, to look at, with eagerness, avidity
glutin-ar: (tr., intr.) to stick, fasten or be fastened by adhesion; adhere, paste, glue, agglutinate; (cf. adherar) kun- -ar du kozi: to stick two things together
-isto: paster, sizer, paper-hanger, bill-sticker. (cf. glu-izar, gum-izar).
gnomon-o: gnomon, index of a sun-dial.
gnomonik-o*: gnomonics, the art of dialling.
godron-o: (arch. and ornamental) godroon, a kind of edge molding or fluting.
golf-o: (geog.) gulf, a large bay; (game) golf; (cf. bayo).
golp-o: smut, blight (of grain) (Ustilago carbo). Def.: Fungo parazita dil frumento; VI-540
gonagr-o*: (med.) gonagra, gout in the knee.

-bendo: pintle-brace, iron-work clamped on a door to sustain the pintle.  V.exp.: Charniro kompozesas ek du metal peci ocilanta sur un axo komuna, e quan on skrubagas sur pordo, kesto, e.c. por apertar o klozar. Gondo esas axala fer-peco kudatra e pivotoza, sustenanta la gondobendo, sur qua rotacas la pordo, e.c.
-isto: gondolier. Def.: Vehilo suspendita ad aerostato (direktebla o ne); speco di batelo uzata en la laguni, aparte en Venezia (E. Venice); VI-26.
-etar: to cheep, peep. Def.: La specala kanto di mikra uceli; VI-27.
gorgol-ar: (intr.) to gurgle, to fall with a purling, splashing noise (as noise of brooks); to rattle, rumble (of water in stomach); cf. gluglar).
gorjeret-o: (surg.) gorget, a cutting instrument used in lithotomy.
graci-o: gracefullness, charm, elegance of manner or form
gracil-a: gracile, slender and graceful, svelte, lithe. Def.: Gracioze tenua ed alta; VI-569.
grad-o: step (of stairs); degree (as of temperature); degree (in university); grade, rank (in order of dignity); step (in progress); size (of shoes, gloves, etc.)
-izar: to put steps into (ulo); to graduate (an instrument); (university) to confer a degree on (ulu)
-oza, -opa: gradual: proceeding by steps or degrees
-arti: g. arts (as opposed to plastic arts); (N.B. «a g. account» = pitoreska deskripto).
granari-o: loft, attic (in country houses for grains, hay).

grand-a: a term of comparison denoting more magnitude than something else, or beyond what is usual; as great, large, big; also used fig. in the sense of the E. «grand» apart from material dimensions: -a vazo, domo: a large vase, house
-ulo: a large man; a great man (in power, dignity), grandee (Spain)
-eso: (quality) magnitude, largeness of bulk or dimensions, bigness, bulk; (fig.) high degree, grandness
grant-ar: (tr.) to grant, allow, concede, confer (demands, favors, privileges, etc.); to award (damages)
-o, -ajo: grant, concession, award. (cf. exaucar). Def.: Donar o koncesar ulo kom favoro, konseque ulo demandita o dezirata; II-709.
granul-o: (med.) granule (of a granulation, as from wounds, ulcers)
grap-o: cluster, bunch, a number of fruits or flowers growing along a common stalk.
grat-ar: (tr.) to scratch (so as to allay itching); (of animals) to claw; (of noise) to scrape, grate. (cf. skrachar).
gratifik-ar: (tr.) to bestow (money) on; to tip (ulu per ulo)
-uro: bounty, gratuity, tip. Def.: Donar pekuniala rekompenso exter la salario o preco debata; IV-12. Ex.: La rejo gratifikas il per pensiono. Ni donis drink-moneto a la garsono kom gratifikuro.
gratin-o: (cook.) gratin, brown crust, burnt crumbs
-izar (tr.), -ifar (intr.): to gratinate, to cook, as with a covering of buttered crumbs, until a crust or crisp surface forms
gratitud-ar: (tr.) to be grateful, thankful to (ulu, pro, pri ulo)
-e: gratis, for nothing. Def.: (adj.) recevata sen pago; (adv.) sen demander pago; II-75, III-322.
gratul-ar: (tr.) to congratulate, felicitate. Ex.: Gratular ulu pri lua vinko.
grav-a: (phys.) heavy, ponderous; (fig.) weighty, momentous, not frivolous, grave, (cf. importanta, serioza); (mus.) low (note), deep (tone); (gram.) grave (accent)
gravel-o: (med.) gravel, stone in the kidneys or bladder
gravi-o: gravel, small stones or pebbles intermixed with sand
-igar: to make pregnant, get with child
-eskar: to become pregnant, conceive a child
gravit-ar: (intr., phys. and fig.) to gravitate, be attracted, tend to a center
-ajo, -uro, -o-sproso: graft, portion of a plant to be grafted on another.
gremi-o: lap (of a sitting person); (fig.) -o di l'eklezio: bosom, pale of the church
-alo: gremial, lap cloth worn by a bishop. Ex.: El tenis sua infanto sur sua gremio.
-isto: a soldier who throws g.s; (fig.) grenadier: a foot soldier of a special corps.
gret-o: grating, a partition of iron or wood bars; grate (of a stove), (metal or wood) railing or fence (used to partition off)
-izar: to inclose or cover with railing, to rail in
grifon-o: (myth.) griffon; griffon, a kind of European water-dog.
gril-ar: (tr.) to grill, broil (ulo) on gridiron
grim-ar: (tr., theat.) to make up (su), by painting wrinkles, etc., the appearance of an old person; to make up (ulu) as an old person.
grimas-ar, -adar: to grimace, contort the face, make a wry face.
grinc-ar: (intr.) to gnash, grind (per la denti); to grate (as a door, etc.).
grind-ar: (tr.) to grind, rough down as on a grindstone, or as with emery, etc.
grond-ar: (intr.) to roar, rumble (of thunder, storm, wind, waves); to growl, snarl (of animals). Def.: Audigar bruiso duranta e nelauta, quale la tondro fora, od ula animali iraceskanta; IV-12.
grop-o: croup, rump (of a horse and some other animals); (arch.) hip-roof
gros-a: thick and long; (fig.) large, great, gross, thick, bulky; (cf. granda), -a arboro: a large tree
grosier-a: (of persons, acts or objects) without delicacy, coarse, rude, blunt, boorish, low
-ajo: coarse language or word; vulgarity, rude act
grotesk-a: grotesque (object, antic, dance, idea, etc.).
-iero: one who carries c.s; (fig.) a cripple
grumo: groom, a manservant, esp. one in charge of horses.
grumelo: grume, a clot (in the blood, in milk, etc.)
grun-ar, -achar: (intr.) to grunt (as a pig); (of persons) to grumble, growl.
grup-o: group (of persons or objects), clump (of trees), flock (of sheep)
gruz-o*: (orni.) grouse, ptarmigan, white, black, red (Lagopus scoticus) M. XI. 348.
guat-ar: (tr.) to watch, be on w. for; to lie in wait for
guberni-o: government (district; e.g., as in Russia)
guid-ar: (tr.) to guide, to lead, to conduct in a way

-libro: g. book. V. exp.: Guidar esas esence montrar la justa voyo ad ulu, qua ne konocas ol, qua povas hezitar od erorar. Duktar e guidar esas direktar ulu od ulo akompanante lu: ex. Kapitano duktas sua kompanio, ma generalo nur direktas armeo, restante en sua quartero. On duktas o direktas navo, aer-navo, kande on esas «ye bordo» (en oli); ma per Hertzala radii on povas direktar torpedo sen duktar ol; IV-162.
guind-o: heart cherry. Def.: Frukto simila a cerizo; IV-136
gum-o: gum, vegetable substance which exudes from certain trees; (cf. kauchuko)
gurm-o: milk-scall, -crust, scabs on an infant’s head (crusta lactea).
gurmand-o: gourmand, one fond of good living
-acho: glutton. Def.: Homo qua prizas la bona (bon-saporoza) dishi e manjas multo de li; VII-155. V. exp.: Manj-eg-ero (gurmand-acho) esas homo qua manjas multo, sen dicerno, kun apetito brutal
gurt-o: broad strap, band; girth (of saddle)
-frapar, -flogar: to strike, flog with a strap. Def.: Bendo larja e plata (de ledro, tolo, e.c.) por ligar o kun-ligar. (To ne esas bendo, rimeno, nek zono); III-469.
-experto: expert taster (as of tea), connoisseur (of wines, etc.)
-ifar: to drop, drip, trickle, run down

-alo: (gram.) a gutteral. Def.: L’interna kavajo supre en la kolo (ciencale: la faringo, la laringo e la supra ezofago): ex. on parolas pri soni guturala (ciencale, li esas velala od uvulala); III-165
guvern-ar: (tr. general sense) to rule with authority, to have physical power over, to direct: -ar navo: to steer a ship; to rule over a ship
-anto, -isto di navo: helmsman of a ship
vab-o: honey-comb. Def.: Konstrukturo ek vaxo, quan la abeli facas en la abeluyo IV-398.
vacil-ar: (intr.) to vacillate: be unsteady, waver, reel, stagger; to fluctuate,  waver in mind or opinion; (of light) to flicker; (in speaking) to falter
vag-ar: (intr.) to wander, rove about, stroll, stray, straggle
vajis-ar: (intr., of infants) to wail, cry. V. exp.: La specala krio di nove naskinta o  yuna infanto; IV-578.
-anta: vacant. Ex.: La trono, la  ofico vakas. Vakigar la trono, lo ofico. Vakanta aprtamento, episkopeso.
vakanc-ar: (intr.) to have a (or, be on a) vacation, holiday
-dio: a day's holiday.  Ex.: Pasar la vakanco en la ruro. Ni vakancas dufoye dum la yaro: la paskala e la somerala vakanco.
-igar: to empty, vacate; to draw (poultry), to gut (fish);  to drain (a ditch, etc.)
-ifar: to make a void, produce a vacuum  (as by air-pump)
valerianel-o: (bot.) valerianella, corn-salad, lamb's lettuce (Valerianella olitoria).
valid-a: (jur.) valid: having legal force, good
valor-ar: (intr.) to be worth, be equal to in value, be as good as; be fit, be useful or good  (for something); (of laws) to be in force
-igar: to make (ulo) of worth, of value, make  useful for
van-a: vain: fruitless, ieffectual; (cf. vanitat-oza, frivola)
-e: in vain, to no purpose;  no use! -eso: vanity (N.B. not of person), emptiness, vainness (of a project, etc.)
-ajo: a v. act, wish. Def.: Sen-efikiva; sen-rezulta; sen reala fundmaneto. Ex.:  Vana esforci, esperi. Vaneso di homala grandaji. Vaneso di la vanaji, omno esas vanajo.
-oza, -oz(ul)o: self-admiring, vain (person). Ex.: Lua  vanitato esas netolerabla. V. exp.: vid. superba. Ant.: modest-eso.
vapor-o: steam (from boiling water); vapor (from liquids or fluid floating in the atmosphere);  (of wine) fume (affecting the head)
-agar:  (tr.) to steam (ulo), give a steam bath to
var-o, -i: ware(s), commodit-y, -ies; merchandize (cf. komerc-ajo). Def.: Kozo vendebla,  granda o mikra; II-76.
vars-ar: (tr.) to pour (out) (as liquids); to spill (accidentally); shed (blood); to empty  (solid things)
vart-ar: (tr.) to await, wait for (ulu, ulo)
-ante: while waiting, in the interim (cf. dume)
-eyo: waiting-place, -room. Def.: Restar en la ula loko o stando, til ke ulo eventas; III-423.  Ex.: Me vartas nepaciente la decido. V. exp.: vid. expektar.
vaskul-o: (anat., biol.) blood vessel, tube, canal
vat-o: wadding, padding: soft stuff of loose texture; prepared sheets of carded cotton (as used  to thicken dresses, quilts, etc.)
vax-o: wax (of any kind, nat. or artific.)
vaz-o: vessel (for holding liquids); vase (as for flowers, etc.)
veh-ar: (intr.) to go about in any sort of vehicle: ride, drive, sail
-igar: to  convey, carry, cart, transport (in a vehicle)
-ilo:  vehicle: any means of transport by land, air or water; (fig.) any means of transmitting;  (med.) excipient; menstruum
vein-o: (anat., also of marble, wood) vein; (geol., min.) vein, seam
vek-ar: (intr., also fig.) to awaken, wake up
vel-o: veil; a piece of stuff used to conceal something; (fig.) cover, screen, shade
velit-o: (Rom. antiq.) velite: a light-armed soldier.
velk-ar: (intr.) to fade away, wither, lose freshness; (of flowers) to droop
-igar:  to cause (ulo) to wither. Ex.: La suno velkigis la folii di la planti.
-ema: reverent.  Def.: Veneraco: projunda respekto religioza o religiatra; III-328.
venial-a: venial: that may be forgiven; excusable

-anto, -ero: avenger. V. exp.: Venjar ulu esas punisar, pro rankoro, altru qua  facis domajo od ofenso ad «ulu». Venjar esas tranzitiva; on povaos venjar su od altru;  on povas anke venjar ulo (ex. l’ocido di sua patro). Pluse la venjo aplikesas, ne nur al  autoro di la domajo od ofeso, ma anke a lua familio o havajo. Exemple, en Korsika, la venjo (vendetta)  praktikesas inter du familii: se A ocidis B, la filio di B ocidas A; pose la filo di A ocidas la filio  di B, . . . e tale senfine, o ti la destrukto di la du familii; VI-143; kp. revanchar, reprezalar.
-as: (impers.) it is windy, the wind  is blowing, there is a (high) wind
ventr-o: belly, paunch, stomach; (of bottles, etc.) belly, body; (cf. abdomeno,  stomako)
-ajo: a g. object; verdure;  (pl., fig.) salad-herbs, pot-herbs
verg-o: rod, wand; ferule or birch (used for punishment)
-agar:  (tr.) to flog (with a birch), to cane
verifik-ar: (tr.) to verify (by examination), to confirm; to try, test (weights and measures);  to audit; to prove (a will)
-isto, -ero: verifier, inspector, auditor. Def.: Kontrolar l’exakteso, justeso di kalkulo, di  mezuro o mezurilo; III-203. Ex.: L’evento verifikas lua predico. Verifikar aserto, signaturo.
verjus-o: verjuice: the sour juice of unripe or green fruits; (fig.) acid liquor. V. exp.:  Dicesas metafore pri vino tro yuna od acida; IV-646.
-aro: literature (= books in general; cf. literaturo)
verm-o: worm: any small creeping animal; maggot, grub Z(cf. larvo, lombriko, silko-raupo,  tenio)
vers: (prep., physical sense) toward(s): in the direction of (cf. ad)
vers-o: verse (in poetry; also of Bible)
-ajo, -aro: a piece of poetry, verse(s), poem
version-o: version: manner of relating a fact (cf. tradukuro). Ex.: Existas plura versioni  pri l’acidento.
vertebr-o: vertebra: joint or bone of spine
vertic-o: vertex: top, crow (of head), sinciput.
vertij-ar, -eskar: (intr.) to be dizzy, have a swimming, whirling sensation; (cf. aturdar)
vest-o: garment: article of clothing, vestment
-aro: clothes, attire, dress, toilet,  garb, habiliment; raiment, wearing apparel
-izar:  to clothe, dress, array (ulu, per ulo) (cf. metar)
vesti-o: round jackets (without tails, as for waiters, fencing, etc.).
vestibul-o: vestibule: front hall of an edifice, anteroom, lobby.
veston-o: jacket: short coat for men (cf. jaketo).
veteran-o: veteran: old soldier; (fig.) any one of long practice.
vetrin-o: glass case (for showing objects, as in museums, shops, etc.), show-case.
vetur-o: vehicle (serving to transport persons or merchandise, carriage, wagon, conveyance
-irar: (od, -vehar): to go, travel, drive in a v.
vex-ar: (tr.) to vex, provoke, irritate; (cf. despitar, molestar)
viatik-o: money or provisions given for a journey; (R.C. rel.) viaticum, last sacrament.  V. exp.: La primitiva senco esas voyajo-subvenciono, de qua venas la religiala senco; IV-646.
vice(-): (prep. and prefix) vice, instead of
-ala: visceral. V. exp.: Vicero  havas senco diferanta de intestino, e plu vasta: ex. la kordio esas vicero; IV-81.
vici-o: vice: fault of character (cf. defekto, manko)
-izar:  to vitiate: taint, contaminate; to sully (the character of); (jur.) to render defective or void.  Ex.: Ebriemeso esas vicio. Vici-zar legal akto. Ant.: vertuo.
vicin-a: (esp. of people) neighboring, bordering, contiguous, adjacent (cf. proxima,  apuda, kontigua)
-igar (ulo da ulu): to cause someone to see  something
-ajo: what is seen, a sight, a view
-enda: what ought or must be seen
viel-o: vielle: a stringed instrument played upon with a wheel; (cf. turn-orgeno). Def.:  Instrumento muzkala kun kordi, quan on pleas per manivelo e klavi.
vigil-ar: (intr.) to abstain from sleep; to watch; to sit up; (cf. vekar)
vigili-o: vigil; eve of a feast pf R.C. church. V. exp.: La dio ante la dio, quan on konsideras.  Necesa ed internaciona en la religial uzo; IV-646.
-oza, -oze: vigorous (ly). Ex.: Vigoro di yuneso, di la mento. Agar  vigoroze.
vikari-o: vicar: substitue in office; curate
viktim-o: victim: person or animal sacrificed; (fig.) sufferer, dupe
viktuali-o: victuals, provisions; (nav.) stores. Def.: Provizuri por manjar; IV-646.
vil-o: (bot., anat.) villosity: coating of hairs
vilanel-o: villanelle: a kind of rustic ballad or dance.
-izar: to stock with g.: -chasar, -kaptar:  to hunt
vind-ar: (tr.) to reel up; to wind or hoist (as with a windlass; cf. spular, hisar,  en-volvar)
vink-ar: (tr.) to overcome, vanquish, conquer, master, defeat, get the bette of; (intr.)  to win; be victorious
violac-ar: (tr.) to violate: to infringe, transgress, break a law, one’s oath);  to ravish, rape (a female)
violent-ar: (tr.) to violate: do or use violence to, to ill use, force (ulu, ulo)
-esar: to suffer violence (da). Ex.: Violentar la koncienco.
viper-o: viper: venemous reptile, as adder; (fig.) malignant person
vir-o: a (grown) man, a manly person: male adult possessing masculine qualities, as a soldier,  etc.
-ala, -atra: virile, manly (of voice, sexual organs, etc.)
-eso: virility, manliness,  manhood, man's estate, vigor
-aro: crew (of a ship), squad of men, etc.
virg-a: virgin(al: entirely chaste, also in fig. sense
-eso: virtuosity,  virtuosoship: professional or consummate skill, artistic perfection, masterly style or play.
vis-ar: (tr., intr.) to screw in: turn in a screw
vish-ar: (tr.) to wipe (off), wipe dry by rubbing; (cf. sik-igar)
vist-ar: (tr.) to visé: to endorse, countersign
-o: visé: official signature. Def.:  Oficale signatar o autentikigar dokumento od akto. Ex.: La visto di konsulo sur pasporto.
-izar:  to furnish or cover (ulo) with g. (windows, etc.)
viul-o: (mus.) viol; name for instruments of violin family
viv-ar: (intr., tr.) to live: be living, be alive (cf. habitar, kondutar)
-oza, -ema: full of life, animated, lively, vivacious
-etar, -achar: to make shift to live, live from hand to mouth
-igar:  to vivify, quicken, give life to, animate (cf. anm-izar)
-iva, -kapabla: likely to live,  capable of living
vivac-a: lively, nimble, vivacious, sprightly, brisk
viz-ar: (tr., intr.) to aim at, to take aim (cf. intencar, tendencar, ambiciar)
-o:  aim: direction of the sight toward an object
vizaj-o: visage: face of a person. Def.: L’avana parto di la homala kapo, konsiderata de  extere ed en lua expresiveso; V-679.
vizier-o: visor (of a helmet, a cap)
-era, -ema; -ero, emo: visionary (person). Ex.: Imaginar  sua vizioni esar realaji. La vizioni di la profeti. Unesme la populo nomizis Columbus kom vizionero.
vizit-ar: (tr.) to visit, pay a v. to, call upon (ulu, ulo)
voc-o: (also gram.) voice; (fig.) expression of opinion
-ala: vocal, verbal, oral, uttered or relating  to the v.
vokaliz-ar: (intr., tr., mus.) to vocalize: to sing a vowel sound without uttering words.
vol-ar: (tr.) to will: determine in the mind, to decide, resolve, exercise volition (cf. dezirar,  voluntar)
-eto, -esko: low degree of will, fancy, mind, slight degree of inclination, caprice, humor
-eso: volatility. Def.: Vaporeskema ye l’ordinara temperaturo; IV-4.
volt-ar: (intr.) to volt: make a sudden turn or leap aside (as in fencing); (cf. voltijar).
voltij-ar: (intr.) to vault (on a horse, on a slack rope, etc.)
volumin-o: (geom.) volume: space occupied; (cf. maso, tomo)
volunt-ar: (tr., intr.) to be willing (to); to have no objection (to); (in polite phrases)  to be so kind as, be pleased to

-e: gladly, readily, willingly. Ex.: Me voluntas facar to. Voluntez  enirar, sioro. Voluntez dicar a me. Me akompanos vu tre volunte. On volunte (E. readily) kredas to quon  on deziras kredar. V. exp.: Voluntez esas vicina a komplezez, degnez, ma min forta; VI-213. La  tri vorti: voluntar, komplezar, degnar formacas gradaro: komplezo esas ulo plu kam volunto
vom-ar: (tr., intr.) to vomit, throw up, belch out (wind, gas, etc.)
vomik-o*: (med.) vomica: abscess cavity in the lungs.
vomitori-o: (anc. arch.) vomitory. Def.: Arkeologiala termino: enireyo ed ekireyo en la  teatri ed amfi-teatri; IV-647.
vot-ar: (intr.) to vote (either viva voce or by ballot) (por, kontre): (tr.)  to v. for (ulu); to enact (ulo)
vov-ar: (tr., intr.) to vow, make a v. (of)
-ala: votive. Ex.: Vovar absteno. Vovar templo a deo.
voy-o: (tera, fera, mara) way, road; (R.R.) track, route
voyaj-ar: (intr.) to travel; (by water) to voyage
vu (pl. vi): you; (for familiar usage cf. tu)
vulgar-a: vulgar: used or done by the common run of people, common, popular, unrefined; (N.B.  for low, coarse sense, cf. grosiera, ne-polita, mal-gusta); (noun form = populo, turbo, plebey-aro)
-eso: (quality) vulgarism: commonness, unrefinedness (N.B. not «low» cf. grosier-ajo)
vulgat-o: Vulgate: Latin version of the Bible.
vund-ar: (tr.) to wound; (cf. lezar, kontuzar, ofensar)
xeni-o*: satirical epigram (first introduced by Goethe and Schiller); (biol.) xenia.
xilofag-a, -o: xylophagous (insect, bivalve). Def.: Una de la multa speci de insekti, qui rodas la ligno; IV-647.
xilograf-ar: (tr., intr.) to engrave on wood or print from wood engravings.
-ema: (tendency) obedient. Ex.: La soldato obedias sua chefo.
-eso: obesity. Def.: Qua havas tro abunta graso, precipue en la ventro: on qualifikas lu vulgare «ventroza». L’obezeso esas maladeso e preske infirmeso; VI-601.
objecion-ar: (tr.) to object: adduce as an objection. Ex.: On objecionis a Galileo ke, se la tero rotacas …
objekt-o: object: anything that comes within the cognizance of the senses (cf. skopo, komplemento)
oblat-o: wafer. Def.: Dina tabuleto ek farinpasto (azimo) uzata por siglar letri.
oblig-ar: (tr.) to oblige: put (ulu) under obligation to do or not to do something, to bind, constrain (by duty, hono(u)r, etc.) (cf. devar, koaktar)
obligacion-o: (fin.) debenture, bond: a legal obligation (bond) bearing interest
obliqu-a: (also anat., gram.) oblique, aslant, slanting; (fig.) indirect, not straightforward, insincere

obliter-ar: (tr.) to obliterate, blot out (little by little or in a manner to leave traces). V. exp.: Nek efacar, nek nuligar, ma nuligar per signo, qua igas ulo neuzebla (ex. postal marko); IV-394. Ex.: La censuristo obliteris la enskriburo.
-igar: to cause (ulu) to forget, to cause (ulo) to be forgotten (da ulu)
oblong-a: oblong. Def.: Qua esas plu longa kam larja.
obol-o: (Gr. coin) obol(us); any of several small European coins; mite, groat, farthing; a very small sum
obsed-ar: (tr.) to beset: to haunt, importune; to obsess, to worry; to possess (by fixed ideas); (cf. persekutar, tedar)
observ-ar: (tr.) to observe: look at, watch (with attention and study); (cf. obediar, remarker)
-ebla: observable. Ex.: Observar naturo, la irado di la astri, la mori di la diferenta nacioni. Astronomiala observado. Mento observema.
obskur-a: (lit. and fig.) obscure: without sufficient light to enable one to see objects, gloomy, dim, somber (sombre); not easily understood; little known; (of colo(u)rs) dark
-eso: obsoleteness, desuetude, disuse. Def.: Exter la uzado, la kustumo.
obstakl-o: (lit. and fig.) obstacle, hindrance, obstruction, impediment, bar, clog: that which opposes
obstin-ar: (intr.) to be obstinate (en, pri) to persist, be firmly bent (on)
obstrukt-ar: (tr.) to obstruct, block up, choke up; be in the way of
-iva: obstructive. Ex.: Obstruktar voyo, tubo. V. exp.: inkombrar.
obten-ar: (tr.) to obtain, procure, get (ulo, de ulu). Ex.: Obtenar favoro de ulu. V. exp.: vid. recevar.
obtur-ar: (tr., tech.) to obturate: to stop or close, as an opening.
obtuz-a: obtuse: blunt, dull, (of edges, angles); (geom.) larger than a right angle; (fig.) dull (in sensibility, mentality)
-angula: obtuse angular. Ex.: Hakilo obtuza. Il esas homo mente obtuza. Ant.: akuta.
ocean-o: acean; (fig.) sea, flood, great quantity (cf. maro)
oci-ar: (intr.) to be idle, be unoccupied

-emo: loafer, sluggard. Def.: Esar en stando di senlaboreso. Ociemeso esas la tendenco a ne laborar, a facar nulo; ocioza signifikas la fakto, ne tendenco; IV-287. V. exp.: On povas laborar dum sua liber-tempi, ma ne dum periodo di ocio (cf. chomar, flanar).
ocid-ar: (tr.) to slay, murder: kill with violence
ocil-ar: (intr.) to oscillate: swing back and forwards (cf. vibrar, fluktuar)
ocipit-o: (anat.) occiput: back part of head or skull
ocit-ar: (intr., of persons) to yawn (cf. bear).
odor-ar: (intr.) to have a smell or scent, smell (fragrant, etc.), exhale odo(u)r; (cf. flarar)
ofens-ar: (tr.) to offend, give offense (offence) to, shock (the sensibilities)
ofic-o: (function, duty, assigned service) office, post (cf. oficio, employo)
-ala: functionary relating to office, duty; (cf. oficiala)
-estro: head of (civil) office. Def.: Funciono administrala o direktala, sive en la stato, sive en societo o grand entraprezo; III-697.
ofici-ar: (intr., eccl.) to officiate: perform divine service
oficir-o: (milit. nav., of an order) officer (cf. ofic-isto)
ofr-ar: (tr.) to offer, proffer, tender (ulo ad ulu), to offer (to do); to place at the service of (ulu)

-o: (polit. econ) supply: what is offered; Ex.: Ofrar helpo, sua brakio a siorino, sua manuo ad amiko, viktimo en sakrifiko, acompanar ulu. La lego di l’ofro e di la demando determinas la preco di la vari sur ula merkato. V. exp.: Il propozis a me irar kun il en la teatro, ma il ne ofris a me plaso. On povas ofrar la vari sen prizentar li: en la komercal borso, on ne prizentas la vari ipsa, same kam en la financal borso en ne prizentas la valori: tamen on ofras li; II-79, 167.
ogl-ar: (tr.) to ogle: view with side glances; to cast glances at slyly
oktant-o: octant: eighth of a circle; (astron. instr.) octant.
oktopod-o*: octopod (having eight legs); order Octopoda; (cf. polpo).
okult-a: occult. V. exp.: vid. arkana.

-ata: occupied, busy. Ex.: La lito okupas la tota spaco. La soldati okupis la urbo. La diskutado okupis la tempo. Ca laboro okupis dek yari di lua vivo. Il okupis su en (od, pri) sua gardeno. Esar sen okupeso. La okupo di la urbo da la trupi. La okup-antajo, -ivo di soldati, di komercisto.
ol: (abbr. for olu; acus. olun) (neuter pronoun referring to a definite object; cf. lo, lu) it

-ia: their (cf. lia). Ex.: Ol esas tre bela. La afero semblas bona, ma forsan ol ne esas tala. La kavalo esas tro fatigita; ol(u) ne povus tirar la veturo, La viri e la bestii ne konkordas inter su, nam ili (la viri) tiris ad-dextre, dum ke oli (la bestii) tiris adsinistre.
old-a: (of living beings) old, of advanced age
-eskar: to grow old; (plu-) -igar: to age, make look old. Def.: Di evo avanc-inta. V. exp.: vid. anciena. Ant.: yuna.
-ifar: to produce oil, give out oil
-lampo: Argand lamp: common oil lamp for illumination
olfakt-ar*: (tr.) to perceiveby sense of smell
olim: formerly, in former times, once upon a time
olimpiad-o: Olympiad: a period of four years.
-izar: to shade, over shade; put in, cover with shadows
omis-ar*: (tr.) to omit, leave out or undone, pass over
-o, -ajo: omission (cf. neglijar). Ex.: Omisar formalajo. Ne omisez facar to. Il omisis fakto importanta.
on: one (indefinite pronoun): people, men, we, they (when used vaguely for society), for people in general
onagr-o*: (zool.) onager: a wild ass (Equus Onager); (hist.) onager: a stone-throwing machine.
ond-o: (lit. and fig.) (small) wave, swell, surge (of water); undulation
-ifar: to rise in billow form or produce waves; to undulate, wave
-igar, -izar: to cause waves on; to cover with waves
opak-a: opaque. Def.: Qua ne esas diafana, ne permeebla per lumo. Ant.: diafana, translucida.
operac-ar: (tr., surg., mil., math., finan.) to operate (upon)
opinion-ar: (tr.) to opine, express one’s opinion, be of the opinion. Def.: Expresar judiko pri temo. Ex.: Me favore opinionas pri la projeto. Publika opiniono.
oport-ar, -as: (intr., impersonal) it is required, it is necessary (ke); (cf. suffix: -end-)
oportun-a: (of things) opportune, seasonable, timely, convenient (cf. favor-oza)
-isto: opportunist; (N.B. «opportunity» is translated by okaziono or oportunajo); Ex.: Okaziono oportuna. Oportuneso di la sokurso.
opoz-ar: (tr.) to oppose (ulu ad ulo, ulu, ad ulu), to put in opposition to, place (ulo) opposite

opres-ar: (tr., phys., mental, social) to oppress: to lie heavy on; deject, treat with hardship; (cf. charj-egar, pres-egar); Def.: Presar forte (fizike o etikale) kontre ulu. V. exp.: On esas fizike opresata, kande on respiras kun peno; on esas etikale opresata, kande on angoras pro desquieteso, en expekto di trista evento od informo. La richuli opresas la povruli. La konquestiti povas esar opresata da la konquestanti, la laboristi da la patroni, e.c. III-223.
-isto: optician: one skilled in optics (cf. okul-isto).

or: (conj.) now, but (in argument). V. exp.: Or expresas ne nur intersequo di du propozicioni, ma induktas nova argumento, plusa premiso, expliko, motivo. Ex.: Or, vua argumento semblas bona, ma ...  Omno qua foligas esas veneno; or l’alkoholo foligas; do ... Kande la premiso (motivo) sequas la konkluzo, or vicesas da nam;  ex.: L’alkoholo esas venono, nam ol foligas; kp. nam; VI-141-2; Talmey’s Text Book, p. 113.
-oza: full of, rich in gold, auriferous
ordin-ar: (tr.) to order: put in, reduce to, dispose in, order (cf. rang-izar)
-ala, -alo: ordinal: indicating order or succession; as, first, second, etc.
ordinac-ar*: (tr., eccl.) to ordain (a priest, clergyman); (cf. ord-izar).
-e: commonly, ordinarily. Ex.: Vanitato esas kulpo tre ordinara. Ordinara manjajo, homo. Ant.: extraordinara.
-oficiro: ordinance officer. Def.: Soldato qua exekutas o transmisas la komandi di oficiro; la ordinanc-oficiro ludas simila rolo apud supera oficiro; III-266.
orelion-o: (med.) mumps; an infectious inflammation of various glands (cf. parotidito).
organ-o: organ (part of an organized body); (fig.) instrument, means; (cf. orgeno)
-ala: organic: relative to organs or organized means; (cf. organika)
-izar: to organize: furnish with organs; (cf. aranjar, institucar)
organdi-o: (fabric) organdy. Def.: Speco di muslino; IV-448.
organik-a: (chem.) organic (substances, chemistry, etc.; cf. organ-ala).
organism-o: (lit. and fig.) organism. Def.: (lit.) Ensemblo di la organi (la organaro) qui konstitucas ento vivanta. Ex.: Homala organismo. (fig.) Politikala organismo.
organzin-o: organzine: a double-thrown silk used in weaving.
-izar: (pr. and fig.) to orient: place or set toward the east; (fig.) to give the correct aspect, the right direction to; (nav.) to trim (sails)
-izar: to adjust one’s bearings toward the east; (fig.) to ascertain one’s position, find out what one is about
-ala: original: relating to origin; not copied; (cf. stranja)

-e, -ale: originally, primitively; in the beginning, by origin. Ex.: Origino di vorti, di la mondo. Originala edituro, penso, pikturo. La pikturo montras originaleso. Kopiuro konforma a la originalajo.
orikalk-o: (met.) orichalk. Def.: Anciena nomo di latuno.
oriol-o: (orni.) oriole (European: Oriolus galbula: golden oriole).
oripel-o: tinsel; Dutch gold. Def.: Dina, oratra folieto, quan on uzas por orizar diversa objekti; VI-142. V. exp.: Or-pelikulo (E. gold leaf) esas vera oro
orkestr-o: orchestra: a part in theater (theatre) nearest the stage; a company of instrumental performers.
orl-ar: (tr., needle-work) to hem: turn down and sew the edge of (a garment, fabric)
orn-ar: (tr.) to adorn, embellish, bedeck (ulo, ulu, per ulo); (cf. dekorar, plu-bel-igar)
-iva: decorative, ornamental. Ex.: La domi esas neta, komoda, ma li ne esas ornita. Ornar parko per statui. (fig.) Ca viri esas ornivi di nia yarcento.
ornitopter-o: ornithopter: a flying machine propelled by flapping wings.
ortopedi-o: (surg.) orthopedics. Def.: L’arto qua korektigas o preventas deformaji di la korpo.
orvietan-o: orvietan: a pretended antidote or counter-poison.
ostent-ar: (tr., intr.) to do a thing out of ostentation, show off, make a show (pri), parade (ulo); (fig.) to swagger
otari-o: otary: eared-seal. Def.: Speco di mar-hundo kun oreli; V-341. (Otariidae).
otoman-o: ottoman. Def.: Speco di divano; IV-395.
ovacion-ar: (tr.) to give an ovation to, to receive in triumph (ulu)
ox-o*: oxygen (the scientific word; cf. oxigeno)
-igar: to oxidate: convert into an oxide.
-izar: oxygenize. V. exp.: Oxigeno esas la ordinara vorto
nab-o: nave; hub of a wheel.
nabob-o*: nabob. Def.: Princo di India; metafore, richega viro; VII-280.
-ano: a native, national; member of a nation
-eso: nationality (of a nation as a whole)
naiv-a: naïve: unaffectedly simple: ingenuous; artless

nam: (conj.) for (= because, but in a less immediate and explicit way than pro ke. Introduces a sentence or subordinate clause which adduces reason, proof or justification). Esas matino, nam la uceli kantas: it is morning for (not because: pro ke) the birds are singing. Ex.: Vu ne trovos il en la domo, nam me jus vidis il en la strado. Vu ne povas vidar il, nam il esas departinta de longe. Lavez vua manui, nam li esas sordida. Me ne povas amar ilu, nam il odias me. Ni irez lente adheme, nam balde esos nokto. V. exp.: Nam, pro ke: Pro ke introduktas dependanta propoziciono, qua kontenas motivo o pruvo por la chefa propoziciono prieranta o sequanta: nam introduktas chefa frazo, qua kontenas anke motivo o pruvo, ma nur por preiranta frazo, o tacita penso. Ex.: Pro ke pluvas, me ne ekiros. Me ne ekiros nam pluvas; III-223; cf. or. Ta du konjuncioni interdistingesas precize quale Angla for e because. La Angla linguisto Sweet skribas pri li tale: «La du precipua konjuncioni kauzala esas pro ke, qua konstatas nemediata e direte aganta kauzo, e nam, qua ajuntas expliko o motivo, ofte kom quaza posa penso; ex.: ni kunprenis nia parapluvi, pro ke ni timas ke pluvos; nam la barametro falis de kelka tempo. Konseque, nam uzesas libere pos pauzo ed esas do nur mi-konjunciono (konjunciono koordinanta); IV-524; kp. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 113.
narac-ar: (tr.) to narrate, relate, tell (something that happened, a true incident)
narkot-ar: (intr.) to be in a state of narcosis
nas-o: bownet, eel-trap (for fish); hoopnet (for birds).
-kolora: (of wood, etc.) not colored, of natural colo(u)r.
nauze-ar: (intr.) to feel nauseated, be sick to the stomach, be qualmish
nav-o: (nav.) vessel: (merchant-) ship (cf. milit-navo); nave (of a church)
-fetida: a stinking nose; (med.) affected with ozaena
nebul-ar: (impers.) to be foggy, misty, hazy
-oza, -atra: foggy, misty, nebulous (cf. nebuloza); (fig.) obscure, not intelligible
-igar: necessitate. Ex.: Esas necesa konsequajo. Respirado esas necesa por la vivo. Ne esas necesa parolar pri to. Ant.: superflua, ne-utila.
ne-ego: (philos.) the non-ego, the external world.
ne-fertila: (of ground, inanimate things) infertile, barren (cf. ne-fekunda).
neg-ar: (tr.) to deny: declare untrue or non-existing; (cf. renegar)
neglij-ar: (tr.) to neglect: to treat carelessly, slight, be remiss (in the performance of a duty, task, care of health, peson, etc.)
neglije-o: negligee, undress, dishabille: unceremonious attire.
negoci-ar: (tr.) to negotiate: to procure, or arrange for, by negotiating. Ex.: Negociar ligo atakala e defensala; Negociado pri ula afero grava, pri mariajo.
nekrolog-o: necrology: obituary review of (distinguished) persons who have died within a certain length of time.
nekromanci-o: necromancy: pretended divination by aid of spirits; black art; (fig.) magic
nekropol-o: necropolis, city of the dead, large cemetery.
neni-o*: nenia. Def.: Kanto o lamento funerala, en l’antiqua mori.
nenufar-o: nenuphar: nenuphär: the great white water-lily of Europa (Nymphaea albl or, Nuphar).
net-a: clean, spotless, neat, tidy, natty: without spot, stain, blot, impurity; (of price) net (cf. sen-tara)
-igar: to neutralize (cf. equalibrar, kompensar). Ex.: Neutra vorto, sexuo, naciono, persono, (chem.) salo.
nevus-o: nævus: pigmented place on skin, usually congenital; birthmark, mole
-a: our(s) «Nia Patro»: the Lord’s Prayer, (cf. note under on).
nich-o: (arch.) niche, nook: recess in a wall (as for a statue or a bed)
nihil-o: naught, nothing, something non-existent, nonenity (cf. nulo)
niktalop-a: (med.) nyctalopic: part blind by day
nimb-o: (meteor.) nimbus: a large rain-cloud of uniform greyness (N.B. not halo; cf. aureolo).
nipel-o: (tech.) nipple. Def.: Interna junto-tubeto kun filetoza extremaji.
nivel-o: level: horizontal surface; (cf. plano, plata)
-izar: to measure the level of, to find the height of (by a surveyor’s level)

-igar: to ennoble: raise to nobility (ulu). V. exp.: Nobela, nobla: La nobeli esas sociala klaso, qua formacesis per la reputeso heredita de la ancestri da la decendanti. Nobleso esas etikal traito. Nobelo tote ne bezonas esar nobla, ed inversa nobla homo ne bezonas esas nobela.
-igar: to ennoble: to make noble. V. exp.: vid. nobela. Ant.: abjekta, vulgara, infama.
noc-ar: (tr.) to harm, injure, hurt, wrong, be injurious (ulu, ulo)
-iva: noxious, nocive, harmful, detrimental. V.exp.: vid. detrimentar.

-izar: to notch, dent. Def.: V-forma dentizuro (quale en flecho, dento-roto; l’intervalo o lakuno inter du denti di ingranajo, do l’inverso di dento; (kp. III-142). Mikra kavajo produktita per instrumento o frapo.
nocion-o: notion. Def.: Ideo quan on havas pri ulo. Ex. La koncienco direte donas al homo nociono pri la bono e lo mala. Il donos a vu nociono pri ca afero.
nod-o: knot (in thread, cord, rope, etc.); (nav.) knot: nautical mile: 6080.27 ft., 1852 meters (metres)
nom-ar: (tr.) to name: call (ulu) by name, to say the name of (ulu)
-esar: to be named, to be called
-izar: to name: give a name to (ulo)
nombr-o: (cardinal) number, numeral (i.e. numbers used in simple counting: 1, 2, 3, etc. cf. numero); (gram.) number
-izar: to give numbers to; to count, take census of
nomin-ar: (tr.) to nominate: to name as a canditate for election or appointment to an office or title
-e: northerly, in the north (with movement: ad –e)
nori-o*: noria: a machine for raising water by buckets on an endless chain.
norm-o: norm: authoritative standard or model
-a: of or constituting a norm, rule, or principle
-ala: ordinary, regular, normal: relating to an authoritative standard, as in speaking of health, etc.; (goem.) -ala, -alo: normal: perpendicular to a tangent
-igar: to establish (ulo) as a norm, to make a standard of (ulo)
-izar: to furnish with a standard, norm
nostok-o*: (bot.) nostoc: a plant of blue-green algæ (genus: Nostoc).
not-ar: (tr.) to note down, set down in writing, make memo of; (cf. remarkar)
-izar: to annotate, make notes in (a book); (mus.) to write down the notes; (N.B. on notas remarki en libro; on notizas libro per remarki; cf. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 109)
-o: noting; note, mark, memo, minute (to assist the memory); (mus.) note (written or sounded); (diplom.) note
notic-o: (short) notice, note, or account (instructive or informative as on bottle labels, or in a museum, etc.)
notifik-ar: (tr.) to notify (formally), give notice of (ulo, ad ulu). V. exp.: sav-igar.
notor-a: manifest, well-known, known generally, notorious (N.B. but not in a bad sense)
nov-a: (of things) new, novel; (of persons) new (in service, office)

-isto: short-story writer. V. exp.: Romano esas generale libro kontenanta fingita historio di un o plura personi. Novelo signifikas nur rakonto de kelka pagini, qua havas la naturo di romano, me esas romano tre kurta, tam per l’ampleso kam per la duro (generale on rakontas nur aventuro, epizodo, fakto); IV-291-2.
nu: (interj.) well! now then! come now! well now!
nuanc-o: nuance: a slight shade, gradation, as of tone, colo(u)r, meaning, etc.
-oza: full of shades, tints, slight gradations or distinctions
-izar: to shade, variegate, express the nuances
nuc-o: a walnut; (fig,) nut: any hard shell enclosing a kernel
-igar: to strip, undress, lay bare, denude
nugat-o: nougat, a kind of almond cake.
-umo, -kovr-ilo: neck-covering, -flap (as to protect against sun or rain); (fig.) muffler. Def.: Nuk-umo esas acesoro o peco di kasqueto; IV-337.
-e, -maniere: nowise, in no way, not at all
-o: nothing; (interj.) no use! no go! not a bit of it! -u: no one, nobody
numer-o: (ordinal) number (i.e. indicative of order or succession; as 1st, 2nd, 3rd, etc.)
-izar: to give successive numbers (to houses, journals, etc.).
nun: (adv.) now, at present, at this time
-a: (time) present, actual, current, now occurring (cf. prezenta)
-a: indicates exclusion (of all else) only, sole (cf. sola, unika)
nutr-ar: (tr.) to nourish, feed, sustain (ulu), (cf. alimentar, alaktar)

qua: (relative and interrogative pronoun; acc. quan)  who, what, which (person) (Note:  qua used as an interrogative adjective has the same form in the plural as  in singular; ex.:  qua membri ne pagis ankore: which members have not paid yet?; used  substantively it takes the form  qui; (cf. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 26)
quadr-o: freestone, ashlar, hewn or squared stone; opp. of kruda stono.
quadrant-o: (instrument) quadrant; (geom.) quadrant:  quarter of a circumference of a circle; (cf. VI-322).
-igar: to  s. (ulo), to form in s.s (uli)
-izar: to cover (ulo) with s.s, to checker
quadratur-o: (astron.) quadrature, quartile (aspect or relation of  90 degrees).
quadril-o: quadrille (dance and music); troop of horsemen (at a  tournament); a game of cards played by four persons.
quadrirem-o: (antiq.) quadrireme: galley with four banks of oars.
qual-a: what (= what sort of, of what kind, what quality; indicating  comparison)
qualifik-ar: (tr.) to qualify: to ascribe the quality of; (gram.)  to express a quality; to style, term
-o: qualification: attribution of a quality or title

-anto: (R.C. rel.) a  qualificator. Def.: Expresar la qualeso di, atribuar qualeso ad ulu, ulo. Ex.:  L’adjektivo qualifikas la nomo. Qualifikar ulu kom fripono. La verko esas  qualifikita kom herezioza.
quankam: (conj.) although, though. Ex.: Il esas jeneroza, quankam  il ne esas richa. Quankam il esas mea amiko.

quant-a, -e: (of quantity, price) how much (ex.: quanta multo  (od quanto) de ta stofo:  quante to kustas?); (of numbers) how many (ex.: quanta homi  mortis?) (of time) how long (ex.:  dum quanta tempo il restis)
-eso: (an abstract) quantity (as in math., physics, music, etc.)
quart-o: (mus.) fourth; (fencing) quarte; (piquet)  quart; (nav.) a four (or two) hour watch
quartan-a: quartan: occurring every fourth day
quarter-o: quarter, district, ward, section of a city.
quartermastr-o: (milit.) quartermaster, one who provides quarters,  provisions, etc.; (nav.) quartermaster, a petty officer rating.
quarteron-a, -(ul)o: quadroon. Def.: Genitito da blanko e da mulato;  V-25.
quatren-o: quatrain. Def.: Poemeto di quar versi; III-143.
quaz-e, -a: as it were, so to speak; (jur.) quasi
question-ar, -adar: (tr., intr.) to question, ask questions of,  interrogate (ulu, pri ulo)
-aro: set of questions (as for an examination, etc.)
-punto: q.  point. V. exp.: vid.  demandar, inquestar.
quiet-a: (mental condition) quiet, peaceful, tranquil (cf.  tranquila)
-igar: to tranquilize,  comfort, calm, reassure, quiet down (ulu)
quik: (adv.; of time) immediately, at once, directly, forthwith  (N.B. not the E. «quick»; cf. rapide, balde, subite)
-a: done or happening at once, instantaneous, immediate
quin-o: quinquina, cinchona, Peruvian bark; (cf. quinino)
quinin-o: (chem.) quinine, quinia. Def.: Alkaloido extrakta di  quino.
quinkunc-o: quincunx. Def.: Kinopa dispozo di kozi (un en omna angulo e  un meze di quadrato).
quint-o: (mus.) quint: interval of five consecutive notes; (fig.)  a tenor violin; (piquet) quint, a sequence of five cards; (fencing)  quinte, fifth guard.
quintesenc-o: (lit. and fig.) quintessence, essential thing, pith  (of a matter).
quiproqu-o: quid pro quo, mistake, blunder. Def.: Intermixo di du personi  o kozi; V-25.
quirit-o: quirite, a citizen of ancient Rome in his civil capacity.
quirl-ar: (tr.) to twirl, querl; turn or wind (ulo) around.  V. exp.: Agitar liquido, ex. kremo, per quirl-ilo.
quit-a: quit(s), clear; rid, free (de, pre ulo); discharged (from  debt)
-igar: to receipt (a bill, etc.); to give a receipt to (ulu);  to pay off, clear up
quodlibet-o: pun, quibble, sorry joke, jest.
quot-o: quota, portion, share, contribution. Def.: Parto quan on devas  pagar o recevar, en repartiso di ula sumo totala.
kakofoni-o: cacophony. Def.: Desagreabla kunligo di soni, sive en parolo, sive en muziko; III
kal-o, -ajo: (also bot.) callus, callosity; (on foot) corn
kalam-o*: (ant.) a reed pen used in the East.
kalamit-o: calamite: a gum-resin; a fossil plant. Def.: Speco de gumo (Styrax calamita); fosila planto.
kalamitat-o: calamity. Ex.: La famino, la milito esas kalamitati.
kalandr-ar: (tr.) to calender (paper, cloth); to mangle (household linen).
kalcin-ar: (tr.) to calcine: to oxidize (as by heat); to roast (ores).

kaldier-o: boiler (steam generator); copper: large boiler for brewing, washing, etc. Def.: Klozita vazo (apartenanta generale a vapor-mashino), en qua on boliigas aquo e konservas la vaporo sub preso; III
kaldron-o: caldron: kettle for cooking. Def.: Apertita vazo uzata en koqueyo; III
-isto: punster. Def.: Speco di vortoludo, en qua vorto o serio de vorti prizentas du senci; III
kalentur-o: (med.) calenture: a tropical fever attributed to heat

kalesh-o: calash, open barouche, open buggy. V. exp.: Kalesho, karoso: La du esas veturi kun quar roli e quar plasi, ma kalesho esas apertita, karoso esas klozita (kun plafono). Pluse, karoso esas generale suspendita per specala modo (per rimeni); II
kalfat-ar: (tr., nav.) to calk (a deck, etc.).
kalibr-o: caliber, bore (of a gun, etc.)
kalic-o: chalice, communion-cup; (bot.) calyx. Def.: Granda kupo, uzata precipue en religiala ceremonii; II
kaligraf-ar: (tr.) to put (ulo) into fine handwriting
kalkane-o*: (anat.) calcaneum: the great bone of the heel.
kalkol-o: (med.) calculus: stone in bladder, kidneys, gall-ducts.
kalkul-ar: (tr., math.) to calculate, reckon, compute
kalm-a: (of objects, fig. or persons) calm, unagitated, quiet, still, placid; serene (of the elements, passions, etc.); unruffled, composed, sedate (in manner and deportment)

-esko, kalma intervalo: lull. V. exp.: Kalma signifikas tote pasiva e materiala stando di kozi, qua ne movas: aero, aquo, maro kalma (t.e. ne agitata da la vento). Tranquila havas senco samtempe material e mentala, ma prefere aktiva: qui ne agitas su, ne movas su sen utileso o skopo; on dicas ad infanto: restez tranquila! on parolas pri vicini tranquila (qui ne lacas bruiso). Quieta expresas stando mentala, qua plu klare definesas per lua kontreajo, desquieta; I-713.
kalmar-o: calamar, calamary, cuttlefish, squid, (genus: Loligo vulgaris). Def.: Genero di molusko cefalopoda kun dek brakii; V-420.
kalori-o: (thermal unit) calory. Def.: Unajo di kalor-quanto. On distingas la granda kalorio, qua korespondas ad un kilogramo de aquo, e la mikra kalorio, qua korespondas ad un gramo; V-420.
kalorik-o: (hist.) caloric. Def.: Historiala koncepto di la kaloro, kom material substanco.
kalot-o: callotte; (soldier's) rimless cap; (eccl.) skull-cap; (math.) segment of a sphere divided by a plane.
kalqu-ar: (tr.) to counter-draw: to trace (a design through transparent paper)
kalumni-ar: (tr.) to calumniate; (cf. difamar, maldicensar, denigrar). Def.: Dicar mala neveraji pri ulu.
kalv-a: bald: having but little hair. V. exp.: Kalveso ne esas kompleta senhareso; III-201.
kalvari-o: Mount Calvary; a calvary: hill with a cross on top; (fig.) punishment, expiation.
kam: (adv.) than, as, to (in comparison, degree); (cf. tam)
kamali-o*: (ancient armor) camail: chain mail guard for neck; a hooded cloak or mantle (esp. worn by bishops).
kambi-ar: (tr.) to exchange (money, goods), to barter (ulo por ulo); -o, -eyo, -erio: money or goods exchange
kambr-ar: (tr.) to camber: make slightly convex (a piece of wood, a road, a ship's deck, etc.); to throw out one's chest.
kamion-o: dray, truck, lorry: long sideless four-wheeled, goods vehicle
-eto: small dray; two wheeled hand truck. Def.: Kargo-veturo konstitucita ek platformo sur qua on pozas la vari; IV
-utensili: c. utensils. V. exp.: vid. bivakar.
-igar: to canalize: make like a c.
-izar: to canalize: to provide with c.s (a field)
kanali-a, -ala: of the lowest class of people, rascally
-eso: candor. Def.: (kandid-eso) Sincereso e naiveso di persono senkulpa, bonvoloza, qua ne konocas la vicio; III
-agar: to go boating. Def.: Mikra batelo senlerdeka, movata per remili, segli, motori, e ordinare uzata en maral aqui.
kapabl-a: able (to do, to execute), capable; (cf. kompetenta, apta, suffix -iv-); V. exp.: vid. habila. Ant.: ne-povanta, ne-potenta, ne-kapabla.
kapelin-o: sun-bonnet: hood to shade head and neck from sun.
kapistr-o: (surg.) head bandage for fracture of lower jaw.
kapitul-o*: (anat., bot.) capitulum; (rel.) «capitule:» a short prayer.
kapot-o: overcoat: storm or heavy coat (as worn by soldiers: cf. gabano, surtuto) (nav.) hood: a cover for a companion hatch, engine, etc.; (engine) bonnet; (auto.) hood.
kapriol-ar: (intr.) to caper, cut capers; (cf. kabrar)
-o: capriole: a leap, caper (as in dancing), a leap that a horse makes with all fours without advancing.
kapsul-o: (bot., anat., pharm., tech.) capsule; (fire-arms) percussion-cap.
kapt-ar: (tr.) to capture: catch hold of, gripe, snatch; (cf. sizar, prenar)
kaptac-ar: (tr.) to inveigle: to obtain by underhand manoeuvers or bribery or ruse, to captivate (in an ill sense)
kapuc-o: (person's) hood, cowl; -izar: to hood, put cowl on.
karaf-o: carafe, decanter (for wine, water, etc. at table).
karakter-o: (distinctive quality of a person or thing) character
karambol-ar: (intr.) to make a cannon (at billiards).
karasin-o*: crucian, a carplike fish (Carassius vulgaris)
karat-o: carat: part or weight of precious stones or gold.
-igar: to make into or change to coal
-izar: to cover with c.; (fig.) to besmut
karbonari-o: (ich.) coal-fish, pollack, (Gadus, carbonarius, Pollachius carbonarius).
kardamom-o: (bot.) cardamon (Eletaria cardamomum, an species of Amomum).

-ajo: something wanted but which one has not or cannot have now. V. exp.: Me indijas ulo = to mankas a me, e me bezonas ol; me kareas ulo = to mankas a me, e me ne bezonas ol: me povas esar (agar, vivar) sen ol. Me facile kareas krinkar kande me kelke durstas. Me ne povas karear fairo en vintro. Me ne povas karear dormo. En voyajo on devas karear multa kozi III
-izar: to pave (a surface with tiles, bricks, etc.)
-achar: to fawn upon, cajole, wheedle. Ex.: Karezar infanto. La zefiro karezas la flori. Karezachar oldulo por igar il facar sua testamento.
-ajo: a fleshy object, a piece of meat
-ifar,  -igar: (intr., tr.) to produce, to make flesh (on)
karnacion-o: carnation: flesh-tint, complexion. Ex.: Ica koloro ne konvenas a mea karnaciono. La karnacioni en ica pikturo (protreto) esas tre natural.
karonad-o: (artil.) carronade. Def.: Speco di navala kanono (anciena); VI
karos-o: coach: a large closed carriage; ornamental coach (for state occasions). V. exp.: vid. kalesho.

karpent-ar: (tr.) to work timber, do carpenter work. V. exp.: La karpentisto facas nur grosa laboruri ek ligno, generale por domi e konstrukturi. La menuzisto facas plu mikra laboruri, konseque plu preciza e delikata, exemple por mobli, parqueti, eskaleri, e.c. La ebenisto juste plakizas ebono(-plaki) sur mobli, tabli, e.c., ma per extenso on povas uzar ica vorto por plak-laboristo en altra ligno kam ebeno, en senco simila a menuzisto; IV
-uyo: c. case: intermixar la -i: to shuffle the c.s
kartamin-o:*: (chem.) carthamin(e): red-coloring matter from safflower.
kartav-ar: (intr.) to pronounce one's r's gutterally
kartel-o: cartel: letter of defiance or challenge, as to a duel.
-diablo, plunjanto: (phys.) C. Devil or diver, bottle-imp; (cf. ludiono).
-isto: fortuneteller (by cards). Def.: Speco di divinado, predicado per ludkarti; V
-izar, -bindar, -kovrar: to put up in cartons (ulo), to bind in boards (books).
kartush-o: (arch.) cartouch(e): a scroll shaped ornament.
kasac-ar: (tr.) to quash, annul, reverse, to declare null and void, to invalidate
-iero: b.c. bush or tree; -liquoro: b.c. cordial.
kason-o: caisson: under-water cofferdam; cradle to lift ships from the water; (cf. municiono-furgono).
kasquet-o: (for men or boys) cap with visor (as golf-cap, naval officer's cap, etc.).
kataklism-o: cataclysm. Def.: Irga subverso di la teral surfaco per granda fenomeno: inundo, tertremo, erupto; IV
-izar: to c. V. exp.: vid. avizo.
katastrof-o: catastrophy (cf. kalamitato, kataklismo). Ex. L'erupto di Vesuvius esis granda katastrofo.
katedr-o: desk (of a professor); pulpit (in a church)
-ero: catechist. Def.: Docar la katekismo; instruktar ulu per questioni et respondi pri la precipua punti di (Kristana) religio.
katis-ar: (tr.) to give a gloss, a luster to (cloth, by hot or cold pressing).
katoptrik-o: (opt.) catoptrics; (cf. dioptriko). Def.: Teorio di la speguli (omnaspeca) ed optikal instrumenti kompozita ek speguli; IV
-izar: to stand bail or go surety for (ulu); (cf. garantiar)
kaud-o: (also fig.) tail; train (of a gown)
-agar, -agitar: to wag or switch the tail
kaustik-a*: caustic; (chem.) burning, corrosive; (fig.) biting, stinging, satirical (language, etc.)
kauz-o: cause: that which produces an effect
-o, -ajo: (natural) hollow, cavity, -igar: to h. out, scoop out (by natural causes cf. exkavar)
-stulo: pannier -leg-ilo, -reto: covering for a h.: -vend-isto: h. dealer.
kavalk-ar: (tr.) to ride (as on a horse)
-bloko: h. block. Ex.: Kavalkar kavalo, asno. La sorcistini kavalkas bastoni. Sidar kavalke (E. astride) sur benko.

kay-o: quay; (R.R.) platform. Def.: Rivo masonita et vertikal (alonge rivero, lago et metafore la senco fervoyala), qua posibligas l'embarko o desembarko di personi, vari, o por charjar e descharjar navi; VI
kayer-o: blank-book: a few sheets of paper stiched together and covered with a wrapper.
kaz-o: (jur., gram., med. and general) case (N.B. not casing)
-o (o, questiono) di koncienco: a case of conscience
kazak-o: cassock: a large sleeved coat formely worn by soldiers; (woman's) long jacket (for outdoor wear)
kazin-o: casino: assembly room for cardplaying, etc.
-o: a contingent thing (as, a prequisite, extra salary, etc.)
kazuistik-o: casuistry: science or doctrine of right and wrong
ke: (conj.) that (where it unites a clause with the principal sentence; it is often united with prepositions to form subordinating conjunctions): pro ke: because
-aro: a set of skittles or ninepins
kel-o: (tech.) (wedge-) key, peg, cotter-pin, linch-pin, gib
kelk-a, -i: some, a few, a little: indicates an indeterminate but not large number, quantity or degree; (cf poka)
kepi-o: kepi: milit. cap worn by French soldiers.
kerl-o: fellow, chap, (N.B. this word carries no proper moral valuation and is not used as an insult; cf. II
kern-o: kernel, stone (of fruits); core (of statutes, etc.)
kest-o: packing-case, box, chest (of tea, soap, etc.); case (of wine, etc.); (cf. kofro, buxo)
kik-ar: (intr.) to kick (out behind, of horses, and other animals); (cf. pedo-frapar)
kilogramo-metro: kilogrammeter (unit of energy or work).
kiragr-o: chiragra. Def.: Goto en la manui.
kiromanci-ar: (tr.) to read the hand of
-egar: to give a hearty kiss to.
klad-o: first (or rough) draft (of a writing)
klak-ar: (intr.) to clap (per) (as with the hands), to clack, smack (as the lips, the tongue against the palate), to chatter (as teeth from cold)
-igar: to clap, to crack (the fingers, a whip, etc.)
klam-ar: (tr.) to shout, exclaim, vociferate, cry aloud (words)
klap-o: any flat piece turning on a axis; as: flapvalve; leaf (of a folding door); flap (of a pocket or envelope or table)
klar-a: clear: free from all dims, blurs, obscures, obstructs; (fig.) plain, evident
klarion-o: clarion: military bugle; (cf. buglo, trumpeto). Def.: Speco di trumpeto kun sono akuta e penetranta, uzata da soldati e milit-navisti.
klaudik-ar: (intr.) to be lame, to hall, limp, hobble, (in walking)
-igar: to cause (ulu) to limp, to make lame (in legs): -ar en la du pedi: to be lame, to limp with both feet.
klauz-o: clause, stipulation, article (in a contract, will, etc.; N.B. not in sentence; cf. membro di frazo).
-aro: keys (collect.), key-board. Def. La extramjo di levero quan on presas por produktar ula efekto (en piano, orgeno, telegrafilo, tiposkribilo, e.c.); VI
klem-ar: (tr.) to press closely together, squeeze, tighten, clench
klement-a: clement, merciful, lenient. Def.: Indulgema e pardonema (anke teologiala senco); III593. Ant. severa, ne-pardon-ema.
klient-o: client (of a lawyer); patient (of a physician); cutomer (of a tradesman)
-izar: to get costumers for (a shop, etc)
klikt-ar: (intr.) to clank, click, clack, clash, clatter: to make a sudden, sharp noise by striking
klim-ar: (tr., intr.) to climb (up), clamber (over), mount, ascend (by hand or foot or tendrils). Ex.: Klimar (sur) arboro, monto. La planto klimas til la duesma etajo.
klin-ar: (tr., intr.) to overlap, to cover partially, to clinkerbuild. Def.: Superpozar la bordi di la folii di tolo o la planki qui kompozas la kareno di batelo, e.c.; IV
klish-ar: (tr.) to take a stereotype of something to be printed
-tubo, -pump-ilo, -izilo, injekt-ilo, -siringo: instrument for giving an enema.
klosh-o: a bell; anything in the form of a b.: -eto: little b., hand b.
-aro: collections of b.s; chimes: -turmo: b. steeple, belfry
klostr-o: cloiter: coverered arcade, especially around a monastic building.
kloz-ar: (tr.) to close, shut (up) (a door, a window, a room, a way, the eyes, a wound, etc.)
-punisar: to keep in (for punishment), to restrict liberty (mililt.).

knik-ar: (tr.) to bend a thing so as to occasion a flaw in it (yet no entirely to break it), to crack, flaw; (cf. krakar, flexar, fendar). Def.: Strenar korpo relative longa, ex. stango, per preso en la longesal directiono sur la du extremaji .
koagul-ar: (tr., intr.) to coagulate, curdle, clot, curd.
koakt-ar: (tr.) to constrain, coerce, oblige, compel, force (N.B. this refers espacially to moral; social, intellectual compulsion, rather than physical force; cf. forco, forsar)
-o, -uro: coalition: union of persons, parties or states.
koaltar-o*: coal tar: tar made from coal.
kobold-o: koblod: imp, hobglobin, familiar spirit or brownie, puck, sprite.
kofi-o: bonnet, cap, coil (such as worn only by country women).
koincid-ar: (intr.) to coincide (kun) (in form, in time).
koit-ar*: (tr.) to perform the sexual act (cf. kopulac-ar).
kolacion-ar: (tr.) to collate: compare two writings; to assemble and verify the sheets of a book for binding.
kolaret-o: collarret (of cambric, lace, etc, for women and children).
kolateral-a, -o: (geneal., jur.) colateral; -a parenti: c. relations.
kold-a: (pr. and fig.) cold, frigid, cool: -eso: coldness
kolekt-ar: (tr.) to collect (books, plants, etc.); to gather (of persons, objects, matter, into a mass)
koli-ar: (tr.) to gather, cull, pluck, pick off (fruits, flowers, etc.).
koliar-o: necklace, neck-badge, collar (as on dogs or horses); (natural marking of birds, and other animals) collar
kolik-ar: (intr.) to have severe pain in the bowels
-eto: hillock, knoll, ridge. Ex.: Roma esis konstruktata sur sep kolini.
-o: collision: mutual striking of two bodies
kolm-o: highest part, top (of a building or any elevation); ridge (of a roof)
kolon-o: (anat.) colon; (arch., fig. in anat.) column, pillar; (of  troops) column
-izar: to color: -aro, izo, -iz-eso: iz-uro: coloring, coloration
kolorit-o: color(ing), hue, shade: effect which results from the mixture or use of colors; (fig.) brilliancy of style
kolport-ar: (tr.) to hawk about, peddle: carry about wares for sale.
kolubr-o: (genus) coluber: a common non-poisonous snake, ring or grass snake.
koluzion-ar: (intr., jur.) to collude: to conspire in a fraud
-o: collusion. Def.: (koluziono): Interkonsento sekreta por facar kune ula fraudo o nelegalajo; V
kolz-o: colza, rape seed (Brassica Napus oleifera)
kom: as (being), being, to be, in the capacity, character, role, quality of
koma-o*: (mus.) comma: a minute interval or difference in pitch.
komand-ar: (tr. milit, nav, tech) to command (an army, a ship), to give word of command to (ulu)
komandit-ar: (tr.) to finance a commercial undertaking, to become a sleeping partner in: -ala societo: a (French) limited, joint-stock company (in which some of te partners take no active part)
komandor-o: (knight-) commander: an ordrer of knighthood.
kombat-ar: (tr., intr.) to fight, combat, make war on: -ema: combative, pugnacious, quarrelsome
-eskar: to start a fight: (milit.) to go into action
kombin-ar: (tr.) to combine: -o, uro: combination. Ex.: On povas kombinar la quar literi a, b, c, d, en duadek e quar manieri diferanta. Kombinuro di kolori, di soni.
komend-ar: (tr., com.) to order (goods, a dinner, etc.)
koment-ar: (tr.) to comment on (by speaking or by annotation)
-o, -uro, -aro: comment, commentary. Ex. Komentar temo, Virgilius. La komentaro di Caesar.
komerc-ar: (intr.) to trade, traffic, deal (pri ulo, kun ulu)
komic-o: comitia. Def.: Specala nomo di popul-asemblo (pricipue antiqua Romana).
komik-a: comic, ludicrous, funny, laughable (cf. rid-inda).
komis-ar: (tr.) to commission: to charge, empower (ulu facar ulo), to appoint (ulu por ulo)

-ato: person commissioned: commissioner, representative; (cf. prokuraco): -it-aro: commission: body of commissioners, board. Ex.: Komisar ula komision-firmo komprar o vendar acioni por su, por ulu. Komisar komisitaro studiar temo. Ca oficiro ne ja recevis sua komiso. Komisar milit-navo. Komisitaro pri la budgeto. Facar la komisi: (E. to carry out the instructions; (fig.) do the errands).
komisari-o: commissary (di polico, di provizuro): -eso: (function) commissaryship
komision-o: (com.) commission: order by which a person buys or sells goods for another: -isto, -ero: c; merchant, c. agent
komiz-o: clerk; writer, copyist in an office or counting-house; salesman in a store or shop .

komocion-ar: (tr., med. psychol.) to affect strongly, unnerve, unstring, cause to shake; la violentoza pafado -is la trupi: the hot fire unnerved the troops; san-eso konocion-ita: shattered health.
komod-a: (of things) convenient, commodious: adapted to its use or purpose, suitable; affording convenience, conductive to comfort
