komod-o: (furniture) commode, chest of drawers, bureau.
komon-o: commune (in France); parish, township (the political division)
-ano: an inhabitant, a member of the commune or parish.
kompan-o, -ulo, -ino: companion, mate, one who keeps company with another person, one associated with another in an employement
kompat-ar: (tr., intr.) to pity, have compassion, be compassionate, commiserate, have mercy on: (cf. simpatiar)
-inda: worthy of compassion, pitiable, miserable, piteous
kompens-ar: (tr.) to compensate: to be equivalent to, to counterbalance, to make amends for, to make up for; (com.) to offset.
kompetent-a: competent (pri), capable, having (legal) power. Ex.: Kompetenta autoritato. Vu ne esas kompententa facar to. Kemiisto kompetenta.
komplement-o: complement: that which it is necessary to add to make a thing complete; (trig.) the difference between an angle and 90°; (gram.) object, the added word to complete a predication
komplex-a: complex: not simple, consisting of many parts; complicated intricate. Ex.: Temo, ideo komplexa. Komplexa nombro, questiono. Ant.: simpla.
komplexion-o: (med.) complexion: constitution, natural disposition of body; (cf. konstituciono); (N.B. not color of skin).
komplez-ar: (intr.) to please, gratify, humor; to be complaisant, obliging (ad ulu)
-o, -em-eso: complaisance, disposition to oblige; readiness to serve
-eso: complicity. V. exp.: Indikas la neegaleso (etikal e legala) la precipua kulpanto e di lua komplico o complici.III-264
komplik-ar: (tr.) to complicate: render complex, make intricate
kompliment-ar: (tr.) to compliment: to address with expressions of civility: (cf. gratular). Ex.: La generalo komplimentis la soldato pri lua kurajo. Il sendis la donacajo kun sua komplimenti.
komplot-ar: (tr.) to complot: to plot (ulo, kontre ulu). V. exp.: Komploto esas plu generala
kompost-ar: (tr.) to set up in type
kompoz-ar: (tr.) to compose: to compound; to form (by uniting two or more things; N.B. not to set up in type; cf. kompostar); to constitute; to invent and set in order; to fashion, adjust
-achar: to scribble; Ex.: Omna parti qui kompozas ca mashino. La vorti esas kompozata da literi. Kompozar libro, diskurso, opero. Kompozita vizajo.
kompren-ar: (tr.) to comprehend: to understand, apprehend by the senses; (cf. intelektar, konceptar, konocar, savar; kontenar, inkluzar)
kompres-ar: (tr.) to compress: press or squeeze together.
kompromis-ar: (tr.) to compromise: to imperil or injure (the reputation, credit, etc. of a person)
kompuncion-o*: compunction: reproach of conscience; contrition, remorse.
komun-a: common: pertaining to, connected with, or participated in by two or more persons or things; joint, general
komuni-ar: (intr., rel.) to communicate: to receive the sacrament
komunik-ar: (intr.) to communicate; have communication (by intercourse), be connected by passage; (tr.) to communicate; impart, transmit, acquaint with
-igar: to put (uli) into communication; to make a connection between (buildings, etc.)
komunion-o: communion: religious fellowship; a denomination. Def.: Uniono en komuna kredo (religiala); III-605. Ex.: La protestanta komunioni.
komut-ar: (tr., elec., math.) to commute, commutate (a current)

koncentr-ar: (tr.) to concentrate: to draw or converge to or toward a common center (troops, rays of light, the mind, the affections, etc.); (chem.) to concentrate: free from extraneous matter; (cf. pludens-igar).
koncept-ar: (tr. physiol. and psychol.) to conceive (a child, an idea); (cf. gravid-eskar)
koncerna-ar: (tr.) to concern: relate or belong to (ulu, ulo)
-o: concern: affair: -ant-a, -e: concerning, relating to, regarding, (jur.) appertaining to (cf. aparten-ante)
koncert-ar: (intr., mus.) to give a concert
konces-ar: (tr.) to concede (a point in argument). Def.: Grantar ulo por obtenar konkordo; III-168.
koncesion-ar: (tr., intr.) to grant a (public) concession to, to enter into (public) contract (with)
-o: consciousness: the knowlegde or perception of what passes in one's own mind.
koncili-ar: (tr.) to concilliate: bring to a state of friendship, gain, win by moral influence; to reconcile: make consistent or suitable; (cf. ri-konciliar)
-ema: conciliatory, accommodating, compliant, easy to get along, tractable

kondanm-ar: (tr.) to condemn: to sentence, doom; to censure; to judge to be unfit for service. Ex.: Kondamnar ulu a morto. Kondamnar libro. Il kondamnis ca entraprezaji: (E. he has condemned (censured) these undertakings). Kondamnar navo, furnisaji. Ant. : absolvar.
-ilo: condenser. Ex.: Koldeso kondensas la aquo-vaporo. Ant.: vapor-igar.
kondicion-ar: (tr.) to stipulate, make conditions about; (cf. stipular)
-alo: (gram.) conditional, -e ke: on condition that, provinding that
kondil-o*: (anat.) the head of humerus (upper arm).
-izar: to season, flavor; (fig.) to give a relish to; (cf. saporar). V. exp.: Kondimento havas senco tre generala, plu larja kam spici, pikli, e.c. Omno quo servas por kondimentizar; III-264
kondol-ar: (tr.) to condole with (ulu): to express or feel sympathetic sorrow
kondomini-o: condominium: joint dominion or sovereignty; (Rom. law) joint ownership
-ar: to have c. Def.: Kunposedar e komune dominacar.
kondukt-ar: (tr., phys.) to conduct, transmit, convey (by tubes, wires, etc.) gas, electricity, heat, etc.
konduktor-o: (on trains, trams, omnibuses, etc.) (Europe) guard; (U.S.) conductor.
kondut-ar: (intr.) to conduct onself, behave, demean oneself
konekt-ar: (tr.) to connect (ulo kun ulo). Def.: Juntar du organi qui servas por transmiso di energio, sive elektrala, sive mekanikal (la energio esas una); III-417.
konestabl-o: constable: a former title of commander-in-chief of French armies.
konfekt-o: confection, sugar-plum. Def.: Diversa-speca sukraji generale mola; V-722.
konfer-ar: (intr.) to confer: discourse with any one on some subject; (cf. grantar).
konferv-o: (bot.) conferva: any of the threadlike green algae that form in scum in ponds and ditches.
konfes-ar: (tr.) to confess, own up, avow (ulo)
-eyo: confessional (cabinet): irar por -ar: to go to confession
konfesion-o: (theol.) confession: a formulary of articles of a religious creed, profession of faith; creed

konfid-ar: (tr.) to confide: instrust, commit, to the care of; (cf. fidar, konfidencar). Def.: Livrar ula kozo (su, ulu, ulo) a la sorgo, a la fideleso, a la habileso o la kapableso di ulu, di ulo. Ex.: Me konfidas a vu la maxim kara e maxim precosa kozi quin me posedas.
konfidenc-ar: (tr.) to tell in confidence (ulo, ad ulu)
-ajo: that which is confided: the information
konfirm-ar: (tr.) to confirm: assure by added proof, corroborate, verify; add firmness to, to strenghten; (jur.) to ratify, sanction; (rel.) to receive into the church by confirmation
konflikt-ar: (intr.) to (be in) conflict (kun). Ex.: Nia interesti konfliktas. Konflikto di armei.
konform-a: conformable: that conforms, like, similar
-igar: to (make) conform (ulo, su, ad ulo). Ex.: Kopiuro konforma a la originalo. Vua interesti konform-esas a nii. Konformeso a la volo di altru. Konform-igar su a la manieri di vua tempo.
konfront-ar: (tr.) to confront. Ex.: Konfrontar la testo ad akuzato.

konfund-ar: (tr.) to confound: to make a muddle of serveral things in not distinguishing them properly (with kun); to confuse the indentity of something with something else (with ad). V. exp.: Kunfundar kun ..., kunfundar ad ..: Se ek plura kozi on facas pelmelo per mala o nesuficanta dsitingo mentala, qua mixas iti kun ici, lore la prepoziciono uzenda esas kun. Ex. : «Nun il konfundas omno en sua odio, la kulpozi kun l'inoncenti, la boni kun la mali». Se la spirito transportas erore la qualesi od individueso di ulu od ulo ad altra, lore la prepoziciono uzenda esas ad. Ex.: «Vu konfundis manekino ad homo. - Ne konfundez lampiro a lanterno». En l'unesma kazo (kun) la konfundo esas reciproka; en la duesma, ol ne esas reciproka; VI-513-4; also Talmey's Test Book, p.90) Ant.: dicernar.

konfuz-a: (physical and mental) confused: jumbled together, indistinct. Ex.: Bruiso konfuza. Nepreciza e konfuza idei. La multa intrucioni konfizigas mea mento. La konfuzeso di la tempo. Ant. klara, preciza.
kongregacion-o: (rel.) congregation: -ano: member of a c.
-umar*: to shape like (or, form into) an angle.
konivenc-ar: (intr.) ton connive (kun): to feign ignorranc; (fam.) to wink at
konjed-ar: (tr.) to give leave or holiday to; to furlough. Def. : Donar tempala libreso: IV-67.
konjekt-ar: (tr.) to conjecture: to surmise, presume, guess, suppose; (cf. divinar).

konjel-ar: (tr., intr.) to congeal; to freeze; (cf. koagular, glaci-igar, forst-igar). Def.: Transformar liquido a solido per la ago di koldeso. Ex.: Temperaturo di 130°K konjelas alkoholo. V. exp.: Frosto povas aplikesar nur a vetero, a la meteorologiala stando, di qua konjelo di l'aquo esas nur elemento o signo; III-330.
-o: congestion. Def.: Akumulo morbala di sango en parto limitizita di la korpo.
konjug-ar: (tr., gram.) to conjugate: to inflect (a verb).
kunjuntur-o: concurrence, combination of events and circumstantces, conjuncture. Ex.: Me nultempe trovis plus desfortunoca konjunturo.
konjur-ar: (tr.) to conjure, raise, call up (spirits).
-igar: to make c., scoop or hollow out.
konkluz-ar: (tr.) to conclude: to bring to a conclusion, settle, to come to a decision about; (cf. inferar)
-e: in conclusion. Ex.: Konkluzar kontrato, pakto, mariajo, diskurso. La konkluzo di la kontrato prizentis poka desfacilaji. Konlkuziva pruvo. Konkluze me volas dicar.
konkord-ar: (intr.) to agree, be in harmony, concord, concordance, (kun)
-igar: to bring into concord, to reconcile
-ario: certified bankrupt. Def.: (Kormercala) Konkordo di faliinto kun sua kreditanti por pago di sua debi; II-76.
konkret-a: concrete (number, term). Ant.: abstrakta-a, ala.
konkubinat-o*: (legal) concubinage (applies to men and women).
konkupicenc-o*: concupiscence. Def.: Inklineso juar la bonaji di la mondo, particulare la kozi sensual.
konkurenc-ar: (tr.) to compete (in business, for personal profit); (cf. emul-esar)
konkurs-ar: (intr.) to go into a competition, match (for prizes)
konkusion-ar: (intr., jur.) to peculate, practice extortion, graft. Def.: (konkusiono): Prevariko o pekuniala extorso facita da publika funcionero.
konoc-ar: (tr.) to know: be aware of, be acquainted with; (through the senses)
konosment-o: (com., nav.) bill lading. Def.: Dokumento signatata da kapitano o navestro, deklaranta la naturo e quanto di la vari transportata e la kondicioni di transporto; II-76.
konsakr-ar: (tr.) to dedicate, consecrate (a church, one's life, etc.); (cf. sakr-igar).
konsekrac-ar*: (tr., Cath. lit.) to consecrate: to convert the bread and wine into the proper substance of Christ.
konsent-ar: (intr.) to consent, give consent, accede, agree, acquiesce
konsequ-ar: (intr.) to follow, result, ensue (de ulo)
konserv-ar: (tr.) to conserve: keep in a safe and sound state; (of fruits, etc.) to preserve
konsider-ar: (tr.) to consider; (cf. egardar, regardar, atencar, pensar, judikar, evaluar, reflektar, deliberar, meditar)
-ario: consignee. Def.: Sendar vari por vendo segun posibleso; II-76.
konsil-ar: (tr.) to advise, offer counsel to (ulo ad ulu)

konsist-ar: (intr.) to consist: have as its foundation, essence, be composed, be made up of. Ex.: Feliceso konsistas en moderemeso e vertuo. Ca armeo konsistas ek infantrio ed ek kavalrio (kp. kompozar).
konskript-ar: (tr.) to conscript: to enlist by compulsion
konsolac-ar: (tr.) to console: comfort (a person) in grief.
konsonanc-ar: (intr.) to be agreeable or uniform in sound
konspir-ar: (intr.) to conspire: to hatch a treason against a government

konsput-ar: (tr.) to treat (publically) most contemptuously, scorn, spurn, flout (cf. mok-egar). V. exp.: To esas nek desestimar, nek abominar, ma expresar extere, per paroli, gesti, agi, la desestimo od abomino (etimologie: kovrar per sputaji); III-203.
konstant-a: (all senses) constant; (cf. sen-cesa, perman-anta, persist-anta)

-e: constantly. Ex.: Job esis konstanta (E., steadfast) (od, ferma) en desfortuno. Konstanta en amikeso. (math.) Konstanta quanto (od, konstanto). Konstanta (od, sen-cesa) venti. Konstante bona. Konstanteso di valoro.

konstat-ar: (tr.) to establish, substantiate (for oneself by observation or experiment), to attest, state (after investigation, to other people). (Note: This word applies to serious even scientific observation and proof, rather than to the perceptions of everyday life). La mediko konstatis la prezenteso di…: the physician observed (verified, proved, established) the prescence of…

-ebla: ascertainable, able to be verified or determined. Def.: Certeskar pri la vereso di ula fakto, generale per percepto, observo; VII-207. Vidar tote certe, explorar tale, ke la fakto esez por vu tote nedubebla. Mondo, XII, 226. Ex.: Fakto konstatita (E. established fact). Me verifikis la fakti per exameno di la konstati (E. statements) en la protokolo (od, me konstatis la fakti per exameno di la protokolo).
konstern-ar: (tr.) to dismay, to strike with, or throw into consternation
konstip-ar: (tr.) to constipate; render costive, bind (the intestines).
konstituc-ar: (tr.) to constitute: to form, compose, make a thing what it is, make up
-anta, -iva: constituting: component, composing, constituent (N.B. not elector; cf. elektanto)

konstrikt-ar: (tr.) to constrict; to draw together, bind, cramp. Def.: (Konstrikto) La diminuto di ampleso di kavajo (stomako) o truo (ex. La natural aperturi di la korpo esas cirkondita da muskuli konstriktiva); II-645.
konstrukt-ar: (tr.) to construct: to put the parts of anything together in their proper order, to build.
konsult-ar: (tr.) to consult (ulu, ulo, pri ulo); (cf. konferar, deliberar)

konsum-ar: (tr.) to consume, destroy, use up, wear out, expend. Ex.: La rusto konsumas la fero. La fairo konsumas la domo (kombustante ol). Maladeso konsumas la energio. On konsumas vino, karno, korbono, petrolo, papero, aquo, e energio en la vapor-mashini e mem la mashini ipsa, uzante li. kp. IV-397.
kont-ar: (tr.) to count, reckon (money, trees, people, hours, etc.); to take a census; (cf. kalkular, enumerar)
kontagi-ar: (tr., lit. and fig.) to communicate a contageous disease to (ulu)

-o: contagion, pestilence. Def.: Transmisar morbo per kontakto mediata od nemediata kun ulu; (fig.) transmisar etikala malajo per frequento, per imitado nevolata. Ex.: La kontagio di morbo, di vicio. Rido kontagiiva.
kontakt-ar: (intr.) to be in touch, have contact (kun)
-eskar: to come into c.; -igar: to place in c. (ulo, kun ulo)
kontamin-ar: (tr.) to contaminate, defile; (cf. polutar, koruptar, sordid-igar).

kontempl-ar: (tr.) to contemplate. Def.: Regardar longe, ma aktive, kun reflekto o fervoro por studiar o admirar l’objekto; V-35. Ex.: Kontemplar la belaji di naturo. Kontemplado di la boneso di Deo.
-ema, -oza, -iva: comprehensive. Ex.: Ca tanko kontenas duacent litri. La kontenajo di libro. Donar kontenoza deskripto di ula afero.
-igar: to content, satisfy. Ex.: Kontenta mieno. Havar kontenteso esas plu bona kam havar richaji. V. exp.: vid. saci-ar.
kontest-ar: (tr.) to contest, dispute, call into question. Ex. Kontestar la yuro di ulu. Kontestar debajo, heredajo. Il havas ne-kontestebla yuro facar to.
kontigu-a: contiguous, adjoining; meeting at the surface or border, touching
-o: continence: forbearance of lawful pleasure, restraint of passion for sexual enjoyment.
kontingent-a: (philos.) contingent: happening by chance, casual, accidental
-eso, -ajo: (philos.) contingency. Ex.: Kontingent evento; Singlu de la federiti furnisos sua kontingento de trupi e pekunio. Ni agos segun la kontingentajo.
kontinu-a: continuous: uninterrupted, unbroken, which goes on without intermittance or break; joined without intervening space
-o, -ajo: (philos.) that which is indivisible (matter, body, space); (cf. sen-cesa, perpetua, dur-anta; prolong-uro, sequ-ant-ajo)
kontrabas-o: contrabasso: the largest kind of bass-viol, violone, double-bass.
kontradans-o: contradance, country dance, old fashioned quadrille.
kontrafakt-ar: (tr.) to counterfeit (money), to forge (a signature)
kontrafort-o: (arch.) counterfort: a buttress, spur or pillar serving to support a wall.

kontrakt-ar: (tr., phys., anat., gram.) to contract: to draw into a smaller compass, draw together or nearer; to shrink (together); (cf. konstriktar, astriktar, plu-kurt-igar). Def.: Diminuto di longeso, di larjeso o di volumino; II-645. Ex.: La maxim multa korpi kontraktesas da la frigoro; muskolo aganta kontraktesas.
kontraktur-o: (med.) rigidity, stiffness of muscles. Def.: Rigideso duranta, ma nevolita, di muskolo. Ex.: Tetano efektigas grandega kontrakt-uro.
kontrast-ar: (intr.) to contrast: stand, be in contrast
-igar: to (put in) contrast (ulo, ad ulo). Ex.: Kontrastigar to quon on facas a to quon on intencas facar. Kontrasto di ombro e di lumo.
kontrat-ar: (tr., intr.) to make a contract (kun)

-o: contract: agreement or covenant between two or more persons; bargain; (cf. paktar). Ex.: Kontratar facar ulo. Kontratar kun la stato facar ulo laboro. Donar vendo-kontrato (E. to give a deed of sale).
kontravenc-ar: (tr., intr.) to contravene: transgress, infringe on (regulations, orders, the law, etc.). Ex.: Kontravencar la dekalogo. V. exp.: vid. krimino.
kontre: (prep.) against: in opposition to, with; in contradiction to, contrary to; in an opposite direction; opposite; (law term) versus
-e: by way of compensation, as a set off, per contra; on the contrary, on the other hand
kontre-agar: (tr.) to act contrary or in opposition to (ulu, ulo), to thwart

kontribut-ar: (tr., intr.) to contribute (ulo, ad ulo). Ex.: Kontributar duimo di la sumo. Kontributajo a la suceso di la afero. To esos kontributiva a vua feliceso (E. that will be conducive to your happiness).
kontric-ar*: (intr., rel.) to feel deep sorrow for sin; -o: contrition, remorse, repentance
kontrol-ar: (tr.) to control by checking, verification, entering into a counter-register or counter-roll
kontrovers-ar: (tr.) to controvert, dispute, discuss. Def.: (kontroverso) Debato pri questiono, opiniono, e.c., precipue pri temi religiala, filozofiala.
kontumac-a: (jur.) contumacious: disobedient to a lawful summons; non-appearing; defaulting
kontur-o: contour, outline: the line that bounds a figure
kontuz-ar: (tr., med.) to contuse, bruise (by blow or fall).
konvekt-ar: (tr., phys.) to transfer (heat, electricity) by means of currents in liquids or gases
-o: convection. Def.: Modo di transporto di la koloro, dil elektro; III-139.
konven-ar: (intr.) to suit: be suitable, be fitting, be congruous, be proper, fit in, match; (cf. decar); (impers.) to be expedient, be advisable, be convenient
-o: fitness, suitableness, pertinence; (pl.) good manners, decorum, proprieties
konvencion-ar: (intr.) to make an agreement, come to a (written) understanding
-ala: conventional: stipulated; tacitly understood, arising out of custom
konvent-o: convention, assembly; conventicle: assembly, usually secret, as of freemasons
konverg-ar: (intr.) to converge: tend to a point. Ant.: divergar.
konversion-o: (milit.) a change of front, wheeling.
konvoy-ar: (tr.) to convoy: transport, convey troops, munitions, etc. (usually under armed escort)
konvuls-ar: (intr.) to have a violent and involuntary contraction of the muscles

-ala, -atra: convulsive. V. exp.: Konvulso (konvulsi) esas general e duranta kontrakti di la muskuli, ne volita, ma pro nerval influo. Spasmo esas kontrakto lokala (di un muskulo aparta), generale bruska e neduranta. Krampo esas kontrakto partala e doloroza di un muskulo (ex. En la suro); II-646.
kooper-ar: (intr.) to cooperate ( in a co-operative institution); (cf. kunlaborar, kontributar (ad)

koopt-ar: (tr.) to co-opt: to choose or elect a fellow member. Def.: Adjuntar a su membro per interna elekto. Ex.: La elektita komisitaro havis la yuro di koopto, e kooptis Sro. X. pro la specala autoritato; IV-105.
-iti: (geom.) coordinates. Def.: Kombinar en la ordino asignita da la formo o la naturo id l’elementi. Ex.: Koordinodi la muskuli.
kopi-ar: (tr.) to copy: write, print, engrave, or paint, alter an original; (cf. imitar)
kopulac-ar: (intr.) to copulate: unite in sexual intercourse (kun)
koquar: (tr.) to cook (food) by baking, boiling, broiling, roasting, etc.; (cf. bakar, stufar, boli-igar, grilar, rostar)
kord-o: line, cord, rope; (geom.) chord; (of an arch.) span, chord
kordi-o: (anat., fig. of affections and cards) heart
kordon-o: a short cord or ribbon; as: klosh-(et)- -o: bell-cord, -pull
korekt-a: correct: conforming to the rules or the conventional standard, accurate, exact, right, faultless
korespond-ar: (intr.) to correspond: to hold communication by letters, (kun ulu); to answer in character, function, etc., be adequate (ad ulo); (cf. konform-esar, konkordar).
koribant-o: (antiq.) Corybant: a priest of Cybele.
korife-o: (antiq.) coryphæus (ballet) coryphee; (fig.) one distinguished in his profession or in a society.
korion-o: chorion, the outside membrane of the foetus.
-izar: to cork (a bottle), to lay c. on (a floor, etc.)
korn-o: horn (of animals, as material or as used in wind instrument)
kornaj-ar: (med.) to be short of breath.
-anta, -iva: corrosive. Ex.: La rusto korodas la fero.
koroid-o*: (anat.) choroid coat of the eye.
korp-o: body: total organised substance of a person, animal or plant; the principal part of anything; (milit.) corps
korpulent-a: corpulent, stout (cf. obeza, repleta). Def.: Ta qua havas la tota korpo (anke la membri) grosa, dika; lu esas muskuloza, do generale forta e sana; VI-601.
kors-o: public-drive, -walk. Def.: Speco di promeneyo en urbo; III-203.
kort-o: (of justice, of sovereign) court: (of a house) court(-yard)
korupt-ar: (tr., phys., moral) to corrupt: taint, spoil; deprave, demoralize. Ex.: La kaloro balde koruptas karno en la somero. Koruptar linguo, texto, judiciisto, la mori di ulu.
korve-ar: (intr.) to do corvee; to do compulsory (or, statute-) labo(u)r (on highways, etc.); (milit.) to do fatigue duty.
krecent-o: crescent; (fig., cook.) a crescent-shaped roll.
kredenc-o: (in church) credence (-table); (in house) sideboard, buffet.
kredit-ar: (tr., com.) to credit: to enter upon the credit side of an account; to give trust or credit to (ulu) (cf. kredar)
-o: credit: reputation for solvency; delay in payment (cf. estimo)
krem-o: cream; (fig.) the best part of anything

kremon-o: window-fastening (vertical, as in car windows). Def.: Stango qua restas vertikala, e qua, sive rotacante cirkum sua axo, sive per shovo-movo (komandata per maneto) engajas su (o sua hoki) en trui supre ed infre en la fenestro; IV-448; (kp. spanyoleto).
krenel-o: crenelle: loop-hole, embrasure (in a battlement)
krepis-ar: (tr.) to rough-cast, rough-coat, parget, give a coat of plaster to (a wall).
krepit-ar: (intr.) to crepitate; to make a crackling sound (also surg. of noise of fractured bones).
krepuskul-o: crepuscule: twilight (in evening or morning).
kresk-ar: (intr.) to grow (esp. of living things; cf. augmentar, plu-grand-igar, divenar)
-ante: (mus.) crescendo. Ex.: Herbi, hari, homi kreskas. La pluvo kreskigas la frumento.
krestomati-o: chrestomathy: select passages to be used in learning a language.
krev-ar: (tr., intr.) to burst, break suddenly, fly open. Ex.: Se vu tro plenigus la sako, ol krevos. La abceso krevis. Krevar pro rido.

krevis-ar: (tr., intr.) to crack, chap, chink (surface only, as in china, hands). V. exp.: Expresas surfacala fendeto, qua eventas ex. en la sulo, en la muri, en la glacio, en la pelo, e.c. To esas altro kam fendeto: nam ex. vazo krevisita nule esas fendita; III-203.
kri-ar: (intr.) to scream, cry out: make inarticulate noise (men and animals)
-achar: to bawl (cf. plor-achar). V. exp.: vid. klamar.
kribl-o: screen: a coarse sieve for separating stones from earth, dust from coals, etc.; (cf. sivo)
-o: crime (such as treason, murder, arson, etc.)
-anto: criminal, malefactor, -al-igar: to make a criminal out of (ulu)
krin-o: hair (of animal’s mane or tail)

-igar: to cripple, maim. Def.: Qua perdis membro, o lua uzebleso per deformo; V-157. V. exp.: On povas esar infirma sen esar kripla: multa oldi esas infirma (blinda, surda, nekapabla marchar, e.c.) nam li ankore konservas omna sua membri e korpala integreso, sen esar kripla. Ed on povas esar kripla sen esar infirma (ex. ulu a qua mankas nur un fingro o falango esas kripla, ma ne remarkeble infirma: segun la legala termino, lua labor-kapableso ne diminutesis); V-95.
kriptograf-ar: (tr.) to write (ulo) in cryptogram (secret characters).
krism-o: (Cath. and Gr. lit.) chrism, holy-oil.
krisp-a: (of hair) crisp: woolly (as on negroes).
kritic-ismo*: critical philosophy: the metaphysical system of Kant.
kritik-ar: (tr.) to criticise (ulu, ulo); to examine and judge critically; (cf. blamar)
-achar: to make unjust criticism of, to carp at.
kriz-o: crisis, decisive moment, critical time, turning point
krizokalk-o: pinch-beck: an alloy of copper and zinc resembling gold.
kroas-ar: (intr.) (of crows) to caw; (of frogs) to croak.
krok-ar: (tr.) to craunch, crunch (with the teeth and fig.). Def.: Mastikar ulo harda qua ruptesas bruise; IV-137.
kromotip-ar: (tr.) to chromotype: print in colo(u)rs.
kron-o: crown (also fig. as of teeth)
-izo: crowning, coronation; (fig.) crowning (as of a career)
kronometri-o*: chronometry: the art of measuring time.

kros-o: (gen.) any long object with a hook-like end; (of bishop) crozier, pastoral staff; (in hockey) hockey-bat; (of a pistol or musket) butt-end. Def.: Senco generala: kurvigita extremajo; VI-116.
-edo: pitcherful. Def.: Tera o porcelana vazo kun larja ventro e streta kolo, kun anso e kun varsilo.
krud-a: crude: not changed from its natural state; (of foods) uncooked; unwrought; (fig.) lacking finish, polish
krug-o: (wooden or metal) mug, pot (as used for carrying or measuring liquids).
krul-ar: (intr.) to fall in, collapse, tumble down (in pieces with noise); (fig.) to sink in ruin
krum-o: soft part of bread; (cf. pano-pec-eto). Def.: Parto interna e mola di pano; VI-140.
krumpl-ar: (tr.) to rumple, crumple, (rough) crease. Ex.: Krumplar robo, papero.
krust-o: crust (of bread, of earth, etc.); (of a sore) scab
kuaf-ar: (tr.) to dress the hair of (ulu)
-isto: hair-dresser, coiffeur. Def.: Aranjar la hararo di ulu.
-igar, -izar: to make an e. out of (ulo); (fig.) to bend (ulo) in the form of an e.
-pulsar: (od, shokar, frapar per la kudi): to elbow, jostle (with elbows)
-apogar: to lean on the e., -apog-ilo: e. rest
kukurbitace-o: cucurbitaceous plant (as cucumber, melon, squash, pumpkin, gourd).
kul-o: bottom (of objects); arse, buttocks (of persons)
kulat-o: breech (of a cannon, musket, etc.)
kulbut-ar: (intr.) -igar: (tr.) to somersault, turn upside down; (nav.) to capsize
«kuli»: coolie, cooly: cheap laborer in the Orient.
kulis-o: coulisse: (tech.) a groove in which something glides; (theat.) side scene, wing; (finan.) outside stock-exchange, or «curb market»
kulmin-ar: (intr.) culminate: to reach its highest altitude or meridian; to reach the highest point, as of rank, number, size, glory, power, etc.
kulp-ar: (intr.) to commit a fault, to err
-o: fault, blunder: deviation from duty, propriety through human weakness; deviation from rule through indolence or ignorance; (cf. pekar)

kultiv-ar: (tr.) to cultivate: till (land); raise, as plant or crop, by tillage; (of arts, letters, the mind, etc.) to improve and develop by study and training; (of friendship, acquaintance, etc.) to pay assiduous attention to, to foster

-ebla: cultivable, arable. Ex.: Kultivar agro, viti, flori. Kultivar sua spirito, sua memoro, mem sua korpo (on parolas pri korpala kultivado). Instruktisto, edukisto, anke kultivas la spirito di sua dicipuli, lia atenciveso, lia kurajo, ed altra fakultati e vertui. Individui o populi povas kultivar ca or ta cienco, arto, mestiero; ed on povas anke dicar, pri individuo o populo, ke ol esas plu o min «kultivita»; (IV-349-350). Vu devas kultivar amikeso kun ta bona homulo.

-oza: cultured. Def.: Etikala, intelektala e sociala parto di civilizeso (kontraste a progreso en la cienci, l’arti: la civilizo). Ex.: On povus dicar, ke Rusia esis kulturlando, pro ke tanta rusa autori, muzikisti, e.c. pruvis la alta stando di la maxim progresinta Rusi, ma ke Rusia esis apene civilizita, quale aparas per la sistemo di guverno e per la nesavo di la amasi; III-561.
«kumis»: kumiss, koumiss: a fermented (or distilled) liquor made from milk.
kumul-ar: (tr.) to hold a plurality of (offices). V. exp: Kumular havas specala, quaze teknikal senco: to esas akumular sur su (akaparar) plura ofici, funcioni . . . e salarii; II-645.
kun: (prep.) with, in company with, in connection with

-e: together (with); both; (cf. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 108). Ex.: La matro arivis kun la filiino. Lu drinkas teo kun lakto. Me kompris ca domo kun la gardeno. La matro e la filiino arivas kune. La infanti dormas kune en la lito. El esas kune (E. both) bela e bona. Ant.: sen.
kuneiform-a: cuneiform (writing); (anat.) cuneate (bones in the foot).
kup-o: (wine-)glass, vase (as for prize). Def.: Vazo antiqua e ceremoniala, kun pedo, e plura larja kam profunda (on drinkas ex. champano en kupi); II-645.
kupel-o: (chem., tech.) cupel: a small dish made of bone earth used in assaying.
-ika: blotched and pimpled. Def.: Specala dermatoso di la nazala regiono; V-675.

kupl-ar: (tr., mechan.) to couple, link together. V. exp.: Kuplar implikas fixa, konstanta ligo di la peci, exemple per skrubi, per kelo, per stango artikizita, e.c. tale ke li nultempe povas movar nedependante (tam longe kam on ne desmuntas la mashino). Ex.: on parolas pri lokomotivi kun 2 o 3 axi «kuplita»; e l’organo di la kuplo esas «kuplo-stango»; III-88.
kuplet-o: couplet, stave, stanza (in song). Def.: Strofo di kansono; III-605.
-izar: to cover with c.; (fig) to copper-plate
kur-ar: (intr.) to run, to race; (cf. fluar, vehar)
kurac-ar: (tr.) to treat (a patient); (cf. ri-san-igar, remediar)
-isto: healer (whether by medicine or not; cf. mediko).
kuraj-ar: (intr.) to be courageous, have courage
-izar: to put armo(u)r-plate on; to put a breast-plate on
kurat-o: (jur.) guardianship over an orphan, minor, etc.); trusteeship (of a property)
kurbatur-ar: (intr.) to over-fatigue, become stiff all over, be knocked up; (vet.) to founder. Def.: Indikas la specala doloro quan on sentas en la muskuli pro granda fatigeso; III-266.
kurbet-ar: (intr., of horses) to curvet; (cf. kabrar). Def.: (kurbeto) Galopo per kurta salti en qua la kavalo levas la avana pedi e preske samtempe kontraktas la dopa gambi; VI-76.
kure-ar: (tr., hunt. and fig.) to set (on): to precipitate in a mass on something (as dogs on a quarry); to grab one’s part while quarreling or fighting

-ajo: quarry; the part of the beast given to the hounds (to encourage them). Def.: Precipitar su amase sur ulo por arachar, raptar sua parto interlukante e disputante, de qua derivos «kureo» kom ago di la chashundi, o, metafore, di homi os altra animali; VI-162-3.
kurioz-a: (of persons) inquisitive, curious; (cf. vid-inda, stranja, rara, remark-inda)
kurs-o: course (of lessons, of lectures, of study, etc.); (fin.) rate (of exchange), current price, market price, ruling price
kursor-o: (instr.) cursor; (tech.) slide-weight (on scale). Def.: Indikas irga peco shovebla segun lineo, e quan on povas fixigar en ula punti (ex. Sur vekto di balanco); IV-579.
-e: in short, briefly. Ex.: Kurta homo, kolo, tempo, vivo, parolado. Ant.: longa.
kurtaj-ar: (intr.) to carry on the business of a broker
kurten-o: curtain (as of a window, a bed); (fig.) screen (as of trees); (fort.) rideau.
kurtez-ar: (tr.) to pay court to (a king, etc.), to woo (a woman)
-eto: pad. Def.: Stofo mola quan on pozas sur lito, divano, irga sidilo; II-647.
kush-ar: (tr.) to put (ulu) to bed; (su) to go to bed; to lie (su) down on (the ground, etc., to sleep); (cf. jacar, sternar).
kuspid-o*: (geom.) point of retrogression (of a curve).
kust-ar: (tr.) to cost, to be bought for (nulo, cher-ege, e.c.)
kustum-ar: (intr.) to be accustomed to, to be in the habit of, to be wont to (followed by infinitive)
kut-o*: long coat of a peasant
kuti-o: (fabric) ticking (as for a bed), drilling, duck (as for tents, trousers).
kutr-o: (nav.) cutter: small armed vessel with one mast.

abandon-ar: (tr.) to abandon, (wholly) give up, (totally) relinquish, forego, forsake. Ex.: Abandonar navo, domo, projeto, infanto. Abandonar su a desespero, a joyo. Ant.: gardar, retenar. V. exp.: Livar urbo, portuo, domo, persono ... esas simple forirar de ol sen ula sentimental impliko. Abandonar persono, ofico, posteno, esas sive lasar li, nevolunte o kontrevole, sive violacante ula devo (abandonar infanti, parenti). Retretar esas retromarchar: la senco primitiva e propra esas militala; senci figurala e derivta: livar la mondo (religiala retreto), funciono od agado (retreto di oficisto, komercisto, e.c.); II
abas-ar: (tr.) to lower: let down to a lower level; (fig.) to abase (morally), debase
abat-ar: (tr., phys. sense) to knock, beat, strike down, fell
abatis-o: (of fowl, game) refuse parts, as head, feet, wings, skin, etc.; small edible parts, as giblets. Def.: Mikra parti di pultro, anke di leporo; VII
-eskar: to become or turn to an a. Def.: Pusoza kavajo en la korpo.
abdik-ar: (tr.) to abdicate. V. exp.: Abdikar dicesas precipue pri la reji o suvereni, qui cesas regnar por transmisar la povo a sucedanto, sive naturala, sive selektata
abdomin-o: abdomen. V. exp.: Abdomino esas ciencala vorto, plu preciza kam ventro: IV-512.
abdukt-ar: (tr., physiol.) to abduct. Note: Not abduct: to kidnap; cf. raptar.
-ajo a. act. Def.: Qua esas di extrema grado di etikala abaseso. Ex.: Persono, sentimenti abjekta. Ant.: nobla.
abjur-ar: (tr.) to abjure. Def.: Renuncar publike e solene. Ex.: Abjurar religio, doktrino, opiniono.
-ar: to ablate: to remove by surgical operation. Ex.: Ablaciono di membro, di tumoro.
ablucion-ar: (tr., relig., med.) to purify by washing
-o: ablution. Def.: Lavar parto di la korpo segun medicinal (o religiala) preskripti; IV-515.

-o, -eso abnegation, self-denial. V. exp.: Abnegar esas renuncar omna profito, personal interesto o mem plezuro, por konsakrar su ad altru or ad ula sociala religiala verko. Abnegar esas propre renuncar su ipsa t.e. sua propra feliceso; IV-101; vid. renuncar, abdikar, rezignar.
abomin-ar: (tr.) to abominate, abhor, loathe, detest (cf. odieg-ar, horor-ar); -ajo: an abominable act or object
abon-ar: (tr.) to subscribe for or to (a periodical) igar-ar: to cause (ulu) to subscribe to (ulo)

abord-ar: (tr.) to land on a (shore, a wharf, etc.); to board (a ship, a vehicle); (fig.) to go alongside, come up close to. Def.: Irar sur ulo o, per extenso, venar flanke ad, bordo an bordo kun ulo (por irar sur ol). L’etimologiala senco esas: irar a (sur) la bordo di ulo. Ex.: La Portugalani esis le unesma qui abordis la literi di India. Abordar la navo dil enemiko. La navo abordas (ad, an) la warfo. La pasajanti abordas sur la warfo.

aborijen-a, -o: aboriginal, autochthon. V.exp.: Aborijeno, indijeno: Indijeno signifikas simple la populo (raso) qua habitas la lando «de l’origino» (historiala). Ex. Omna Amerikani qui naskis en Amerika esas indijena, opozite a l’enmigranti ed a l’Europani (mem samlingua e samrasa), ma nur l’Indiani e simila rasi esas aborijena; IV-512-3.
abort-ar: (intr.) to abort, miscarry; (fig.) to come to nothing, fail
aboy-ar: (int., also fig.) to bark, bay
-achar:  to give tongue falsely, snarl, bawl.
abrevi-ar: (tr.) to abbreviate (words), abridge (a book), curtail (a narrative); (cf. rezumar, kurt-igar)
abrog-ar: (tr.) to abrogate, repeal, annul. V. exp.: vid. abolisar.
abrupt-a: precipitous, cragged, abrupt; (fig.) rough, broken, unpolished. Ex.: L’abrupta flanko di monto. Stilo, karaktero abrupta. V. exp.: vid. eskarpa.
-eskar: to absent oneself, keep out of the way
-o: (rel.) absolution, (jur.) acquittal; (cf. indulgar). Def.: Deklarar senkulpa (do nepunisebla) ula akuzato; III-699. Ant.: kondamnar.
absorb-ar: (tr.,physical sense) to absorb; (fig.) to engross (attention)
absten-ar: (tr.) to abstain (voluntarily) from, to refrain from (ulo)
-emeso: abstinence (habitual state); igar ar: to cause (ulu) to abstain from (ulo)

-eskar: to begin to abstain; Ex.: Ne esas facila abstenar drinkar, kande on durstas. V. ex.: Abstenar, karear: Karear ne implikas «vole», ol prefere implikas «nevole» o mem «kontrevole». On abstenas kozo, quan on havas o povus havar; on kareas kozo, quan on ne havas o ne povas havar (nun). Ex.: En voyajo on mustas karear multa kozi (pro ke la kozi mankas); ma se on havus li, probable on ne abstenus li, IV-658.
abstinenc-ar*: (intr., relig.) to abstain (from meat), to practise abstinence (from pleasure), to fast (de).
abstrakt-ar: (tr.) to abstract: separate in thought, -ala: abstract (science, question)
abstruz-a: abstruse, recondite. Del.: Desfacile komprenebla e tedanta; II-706.
absurd-a: absurd, preposterous. Del.: Kontre la komuna raciono. Ant.: saja, racion-oza.
-eganta: superabundant; -o-korno: horn-of-plenty, cornucopia. Ant.: esar skarsa, mankar.
abut-ar: (intr.) to abut (ad), come out (into), end (in); (abscess) to come to a head. Def.: Tushar per un extremajo. Ex.: Omna radii di cirklo abutas al centro.
aceler-ar: (tr.) to accelerate, hasten, quicken. Ex.: Acelerar la pazi. Ant.: moderar, (plu)lent-igar.
acend-ar: (tr.) to light (a lamp), to kindle (a fire), to turn on (electric light); (fig.) to inflame (the passions)
acens-ar: (tr., intr) to go up, ascend, mount
acent-o: accent: stress of voice (not written accent, cf. super-signo); -izar; to accent, lay stress on
acept-ar: (tr.) to accept (something willingly, as a proposal, condition apology, challenge), to receive (a guest)
acerb-a: (also fig.) acerb: sour, bitter and harsh in taste (as unripe fruit); -eso:: acerbity, harshness; severity. Ex.: Frukto acerba. Parolado acerba. V. exp.: vid. aspera.
aces-ar: (tr.) to have access to (ulu, ulo); (med.) to have an access, an attack
-ebla: accessible, approachable. Ex.: Il acesas loko, persono (o havas aceso a loko, persono). Loko, persono acesebla. Aceso di febro, (fig.) aceso di iraco, furio, desespero.
acesit-o: accesit: honorable mention accorded to a student.
acesor-a: accessory, subsidiary; (cf. help-anta, konfirm-anta, surogata)
-o,-ajo: an accessory; (milit., ledra-) accoutrement. Def.: Qua akompanas precipuajo. Ant.: esencala, precipua.
acident-ar: (tr.) to cause an accident to
-o: accident (generally in an ill sense), mishap; (philos.) accident
-anto: on who or that which causes an a. -ito: vicitim of an a.
-e: accidentally, by chance. Def.: Efektigar acidento ad ulu (ulo); IV-105, VI-162. Ex.: Acidento bona o mala. La infirmaji e acidenti di la vivo homala. Kozo acidental. Deskovrar acidente ulo.
acion-o: (fin.) share (of a bank, railway, joint-stock company, etc.)
aciz-o: town or city tax on commodities, excise, octroi.
adapt-ar: (tr.) to adapt ulo ad ulo; -ar su: a. oneself
ad-avan, -e, -a: forward (with movement). Ex.: Avane marchar.
ad-base: (with movement) to the bottom, (cf. ad infre). (cf. II-163.)
ad-dextre: (with movement) to the right (hand side).
ad-en: (with movement) into. Ex.: Irar aden la gardeno. La ucelo flugis aden la kajo.
adequat-a: adequate. Ex.: Havar ideo adquata pri kozo.
ad-heme: (with movement) to or toward home.
adher-ar: (intr.) to adhere (ad): stick close to, be attached; (fig.) to give adhesion (to a party, a principle)
-igar: to cause to adhere, stick. Ex.: La epidermo adheras a la pelo. Donar sua adhero a projeto.
adi-ar: (tr.) to bid adieu to (ulu), say good-bye
ad-ibe: (over) there, thither, (with movement). Ex. Omnube vu iros, adibe me iros kun vu.
adicion-ar: (tr., math.) to add: cast up (numbers, cf. ad-juntar) -o: addition. Ant.: sustracionar.
ad-infre: (with motion) down(ward); (cf. ad-sube, ad-base). Ex.: Irar adinfre sur l'eskalero.
adjudik-ar: (tr.) to adjudicate, adjudge: to award (ulo ad ulo) judicially in a controversy: (at auctions) to knock down to, declare to be the purchaser of
-o: awarding (of prizes), granting (of contracts): -ario: person who receives the award; highest tenderer
-ajo what is awarded. Ex.: Adjudikar la domo a la plendanto. Adjudikar premio ad ulu.
adjur-ar: (tr.) to adjure: command in the name of God, to charge solemnly. Ex.: Me adjuras vu, dicar la verajo.
administr-ar: (tr.) to administer: to manage, conduct (a business, an estate, a department of government)
-inda; worthy of admiration, admirable. Ant.: des-prizar, des-estimar.
admis-ar: (tr.) to admit, to receive (ulu, ulo; cf. agnoskar); -o, -eso: admission, admittance, affiliation
-ebla, -inda: admisable, allowable. Ex.: Admisar ulu aden domo, ulu en societo.

ad-monte: above (i.e. further up on the same general level; not overhead, cf. super), up stream (toward the mountain, the source of the stream). Aernavo flugas trans la rivero admonte de la urbo: the airship flies over (crosses) the river above (i.e. not over the city itself, but up-stream from the city). Ant.: ad-vale.
-o, -eso, -tempo: adolescence, period of life between puberty and maturity
adopt-ar: (tr.) to adopt (an opinion, a system); (jur.) to adopt (a child); (in assemblies) to agree upon, carry (a motion, resolution), to pass (a bill)
-ito: an adopted child or person. Ant.: repulsar.
ador-ar: (tr., rel.) to worship (Deo); (gen.) to adore, idolize (ulu, ulo); -inda: adorable.
ados-ar: (tr.) to set the back (di ulu, ulo) to (ulu, ulo), to put back to back
adragant-o*: (bot.) gum-tragacanth, gum-adraganth. Def.: Gumo extrakita de tragakanto. IV-644.
adres-o: address (on a letter, parcel, etc.)
-izar; to address: put an a. on (a letter). Ex.: Ca letro esas adresizita a vu.
adsorb-ar: (tr., tech.) to adsorb: to condense by adsorption.
ad-sub: (with motion) under. Ex.: La kato kuris adsub la tablo.
ad-sur: (with motion) on to. Ex.: Irar adsur agro.
ad-ube: (with motion) (toward) where, whither. Ex.: Adube vu iras?
ad-vale: below: further down on the same general level; (not below = under, cf. sub), down stream (toward the valley, the outlet); vid. ad-monte. Ant.: ad-monte.
-o, -ulo, -ino: adversary, opponent. Ex.: Fortuno adversa. Ant.: (adverso) partenero, teder-ito, help-anto, defensanto.
adyunt-o: deputy, associate: assistant (in some duty)
-izar: to air, renew the air, (chem.) aërate
aeroplan-o*: aëroplane. Note Technical terms may be found in IV-330-333. DEFIRS
-ala: aërostatic. Def.; «Balonegi» qui flotacas passive en l'aero (ne la «direktebla baloni» a qui esas rezervita la nomo: aernavo). 11-706.
-eso: affability; -ajo: amenity, courteous act. Ant.: des-, ne-afabia, ruda, impertinenta.
afecion-ar: (tr.) to have an affection for, to delight in, to be fond of (ulu, ulo)
-ata: beloved, devoted, Ex.: La Polonani afecionas sua patrio. Afecionoza fratino.El afecionas sua matro.Ant.: antipatiar, odiar, abominar.
afekt-ar: (tr., psychol.) to touch (the feelings), to move (emotionally); (med.) to take effect on, to sicken

afektac-ar: (tr., intr.) to pose, to make an artificial show, to pretend ostentatiously ; -(ad)o: affectedness, affectation, mannerism; -anta, -ema: affected, pretentious, finical. Ex.; Afectacar la vertuo.Afektacar kom richulo, kom eleganto.
afer-o: (com..) business; (gen. sense) affair: matter, thing, concern, question, etc.; (leg.) cause, legal action

afin-a: (chem.) having affinity (ad); (fig.) akin, congenial; -eso: affinity; -esar (ad): to have a. (to). Def.: Qua havas tendenco a kombino, ad uniono. Ex.: Karbono afinesas ad oxo. Afineso spiritala, mentala. Ant.:repuls-anta, -iva.
afirm-ar: (tr.) to affirm, aver (the truth, or that something is true)
afish-o: poster, bill: placard posted in a public place
-igar: to publish, gazette (ulo); -o-glutinar: to post bill, billstick
afix-o: (gram.) affix: a prefix or a suffix.
aflikt-ar: (tr.) to afflict: to cause to suffer mentally, to distress, grieve
afrank-ar: (tr.) to frank: to prepay (postage on letters), carriage on parcels)
-ita, -ite: post free (of letters), carriage paid (of parcels)
afront-ar: (tr.) to affront: to meet front to front, to face; (fig.) to brave. Def.: Opozar (su) fronto a fronto: figurale on afrontas danjero, tempesto, e.c.; II-136.
afuzion-ar: (tr.) to affuse. -o: (med., rel.) affusion; pouring of water, etc., on the body.
ag-ar: (tr., intr.) to do, to act
-igar: to make, cause (ulu, olu) to do (ulo); -(ad)o: acting, deed, action
-eskar: to begin to act, to come into play

-anto, -into: doer. V. exp.: Agar, facar: La difero inter agar e facar esas proxime ta qua existas inter D. tun a machen (E. to do, to make). Ica du verbi esas transitiva, ma kun diversa senci. On facas ula kozo, konkreta objekto; ma ago havas nul objekto extera. Pro to on darfas e devas dicar: Quon vu agas? Me agas nulo (t.e.; me facas nula ago). La sequanta frazi indikas ica difero: "Quon vu agas dum la tota jorno, se on interdiktis a vu facar irga laboro manuala? Ho! me ne restas nul-aganta; me facas argila statueti (V-623, VI-482). Note: Agar is also used as a suffix with the names of instruments to denote the act done with the particular instrument, as: baston-agar: to beat (with a stick), martel-agar: to hammer

agac-ar: (tr.) to set on edge (teeth); (fig.) to irritate, annoy, tantalize, -anta, -iva: irritating, provoking. Def.: Senco propa esas iritar la nervi (specale e prope di la denti, ex. per la froto di kultelo sur plado o vitro); II-136. Ex.: Limar segilo agacas mea denti. (fig.) Agacar hundo.
agend-o: agenda: memorandum of things to be done.
agit-ar: (tr.) to shake, agitate (ulo, ulu); to wave (a flag, the hand, a handkerchief); (cf. ond-ifar); (fig.) to excite (the feelings
-ilo: agitator (inst.) Ex.: Agitar liquido. Agitar pupulo. El agitis sau brakio vers me.
aglo-o: (orni.) eagle; (fig.) heraldry, (milit. standard) eagle; (astron.) Aquilo
aglosi-o*: (zool.) aglossity: state of being tongueless.
aglutin-ar: (tr.) to agglutinate: stick as with glue; (fig.) to join together.
agnel-o: (poetical and rel.) lamb; (cf. muton-yuno); -eto: lambkin
agnosk-ar: (tr.) to acknowledge, admit, own (something as right, good, true, false)
agoni-ar: (intr.) to be in the death agony, in the last death struggle, in death pangs, in extremis. DeFIRS
agorafobi-o* (med.) agoraphobia; morbid dread of, or giddiness in crossing open spaces.
agr-o: field: piece of ground; (cf. feldo); -ala: agrarian, rural
agraf-o: hook, hook-and-eye (to fasten dresses, etc.); clasp (for book-lids, cloaks, etc.); snap (of a necklace, bracelet, etc.); (ancient) agraffe
-eso: agreeableness, charm. Ex.: Agreabla muliero, loko, figuro, sento. Ant.: des-agre-abla, des-plez-anta; ofens-iva.
agreg-ar: (tr.) to aggregate, incorporate; to admit (into a society, university)
agronomi-o: agronomics: the theory of agriculture
-agar: to ply the needle; to switch, shunt
-pinto: point of a n. trikot-agulo: knitting n.
-e: quickly, on the jump! Ant.: lenta.
ajiot-ar: (intr.) to speculate (in public securities, stocks), to be a stock-jobber
ajorn-ar: (tr.) to adjourn, put off, defer, (ulo til); -o: adjournment, postponement, reprieve
ajur-o: ajour-work: open-work, fret-work, (of fabric) webbed: carving, metal work, embroidery, etc. where background is pierced or removed, or where it is translucent
ajust-ar: (tr. tech.) to adjust, regulate, set (cf. ad-just-igar); Ex.: Finita instrumenti esas ajustebla. On ajustas teleskopo por la disto (ne por la direciono: apuntar); III-219; cf. regular.

ajut-o: ajutage: nozzle, spout. Def.: Specala tubulo o fino di tubo, destinita ne a juntar du tubi or recipienti (quale tubulo), ma a determinar la formo di la sprico ekiranta (ex. ya la fino di lanco por arozar); VII-197.

-ano: academician. V. exp.: Akademio esas societo de ciencisti (generale elektita ed en fix nombro) qui ne docas. On devas do evidente rezervar akademiala a ta senco, e ne uzar ol parolante pri universitato (profesori, studenti, kursi, e.c.); III-496
akanton-ar*: (tr., milit.) to canton: billet, allot quarters (to troops in a locality)
akapar-ar: (tr., finan.) to corner (goods, the market); (fig.) to monopolize. Def.: Amasigar komercaji en granda quanto por skarsigar li e cherigar lia preco.
aklam-ar: (tr.) to acclaim: to shout approval or applause. Ex.: La rejo esis kronizata inter la aklami di la turbo. Li aklamis il kom rejo. Li aklamis la propozajo.
aklimat-ar: (tr.) to acclimate, acclimatize: to season, to inure, accustom to a climate; (fig.) to habituate, make one feel at home.
akomod-ar: (tr., tech., opt., etc.) to accomodate: adapt, adjust
akompan-ar: (tr., also mus.) to accompany: escort
akord-ar: (intr., mus.) to be in tune; (cf. konkordar); (gram.) to agree
akr-a: acrid (taste, smell); (cf. acerba, acida); harsh (in voice); (fig.) acrimonious
akredit-ar: (tr.) to accredit: to give credit or sanction to (ulu, ulo); -ita: accredited
akroch-ar: (tr.) to hang (on a hook), to hook on (ulo ad ulo), to interlock, grapple (a ship): -o: hitch, hooking on
aktiv-a: active (opposed to passive; also used in com., fin., gram., mil. senses); (cf. agema, ajila); -eso: activity

-igar: to actualize. Def.: Qua traktesas od interesas en la nuna instanto (proxime reala); fakte e komplete existanta, opozite a to quo povus esar, ma ne esas, ed a to quo naskas o divenas (ica od ita); IV-495. Ex.: Aktuala energio, opozata a potencial energio. La evento aktuala esas . . . . La jurnali povas vivar nur per aktualaji (E. journals can live on passing events).
akul-ar: (tr.) to bring to bay (ulu a ulo): To drive into a place from which there is no escape. Ex.: On povas akular kombatanto a muro, armeo a rivero o monto, bestio chasata a klozilo; IV-135.

akurat-a: punctual. Def.: Qua venas (persono) od eventas precize ye la loko, ye la kloko fixigita, konvencionita, IV-102. V. exp.: Persono povas dicesar akurata, ma ne exakta o preciza. Akurateso indikas la ideo di sorgo; IV-102.
akush-ar: (tr., obstet.) to deliver (a woman); (cf. parturar): -o accouchment: delivery in child-bed
akut-a: (also fig. of sound, pain, sickness, accent) acute, sharp, keep
-igar: to sharpen, whet, put an edge on
akuz-ar: (tr.) to accuse, inculpate, charge with, indict
-o, -ajo: accusation: impeachment (for state offenses); charge (before a police magistrate); indictment (for larceny, etc.)
-motivo: reason for accusation. Def.: Imputar kulpo, delikto, krimino ad ulu. Ant.: justifikar.
al-o: (also fig. of army, aeroplane, building, windmill, etc.) wing
alakt-ar: (tr.) to suckle, give suck to
alarm-ar: (tr.) to alarm: sound the alarm, give signal of danger
-o: cry or signal of danger; (fig.) sense of danger, fright (cf. pavoro); -ema, -emo, -isto: alarmist
alb-o: alb. Def.: Longa, blanka robo portata da la sacerdoto dum la meso; III-42.
album-o: album: book for photographs, autographs, cards, etc.
ale-o: lane, walk, path (in a garden, park, wood, etc., generally between rows of trees); (cf. strad-eto).
aleg-ar: (tr.) to allege, adduce, advance (arguments, facts, etc. in order to prove or justify something)
-ajo: allegation: what is alleged. V. exp. vid. citar. DEFIS

alej-ar: (tr., phys. sense) to lighten, relieve (of a load); (fig.) to alleviate, ease, relieve (the mind, etc.). Ex.: Alejar mulo di qua la portajo esas pezoza. Alejar navo. Alejar dento-doloro. Alejar la mento. (vid. lejer-igar.
alen-o: awl (shoemaker's, sailmaker's, etc.; cf. punc-ilo).
alert-a: alert: wide-awake, smart, brisk, sprightly; (cf. ajila, ag-ema, aktiva). EF
alez-ar: (tr.) to ream, bevel out, bore smooth (inside of a cannon, steam cylinders, etc.); (cf. borar) -ilo: reamer
alg-o: alga(e): sea-weed, kelp, dulse, sea-lettuce, etc.; (cf. fuko).
alianc-ar: (tr.) to unite, ally (families by marriage)
-ito: relation by marriage; (cf. mis-aliancar). V. exp.: Ta verbo ne esas sinonimo di mari-ajar, qua relatas nur la gespozi; aliancar relatas lia familii; II-706. DEFIS
alien-ar: (tr.) to alienate: to sell, dispose of (estates, property, rights)
alienac-ar: (intr.) to be in a state of alienation (mental derangement)
aliment-ar: (tr.) to supply with what is necessary (as water, fuel to a machine, provisions to a town, food to a family or person); (cf. nutrar)
-o: alimentation: supply, maintenance, feeding; -ala, -anta; alimental: sustaining.
aline-o: (print.) a line of which the first word is indented; a new paragraph.
aliterac-ar: (tr., intr.) to alliterate. Def: Komencar (finar) per la sama sono o soni; IV-649.
alize-o: trade-wind. Def.: Vento qua suflas konstante dum la tota yaro inter la tropiki; II-641.
almanak-o: almanac: yearly calendar with variety of information; (fig.) year-book
alodi-o: allodium, freehold estate, fee-simple estate; (opp. to feudo)
along-e: along, at the side of
-irar: (tr.) to go along, skirt, coast. Ex.; Ni iris alonge (od, alongiris) la bordo dil lago.

alonj-o: lengthening piece; leaf (of telescope, table), (jur.) allonge (of bills of exchange); Def.: Tubo quan on adjuntas ad altra por longigar ol o por igar ol komunikar kun altra tubo o vazo (III-134), anke uzata por (la prolonguro di) la tabli e trati; VII-197.
alopeci-o: (med.) alopecia: loss of hair, baldness; (cf. kalva, sen-hara, senpila).
alloy-ar: (tr.) to alloy; combine metals by fusion
-o, -uro: alloy (of metals); (fig.) any impure mixture; quality (of things in general)
alt-a: high, tall, lofty (also used with pressure, sound)
alter-ar: (tr.) to alter; modify the nature or quality of anything (generally for the worse)
-anta: alternating (movement, crop, etc.) -igar la kultivo: to vary, rotate the crops. Ex.: La sezoni alternas.
alternativ-o: alternative, choice, option. Def.: Posibleso di selekto inter plura kozi, hipotezi.
alud-ar: (tr.) to allude to, have reference to, refer to
alur-o: gait, pace. Def.: Maniero mar-char; IV-234.
am-ar: (tr.) to love: to like (very much), care for, have affection for, cherish; (cf. amorar, prizar, afecionar); -o: love
amans-ar: (tr.) to tame, make docile (animals), to make tractable, sociable (persons)
-ebla: tamable. Def.: Igar la animalo min sovaja; (fig.) igar persono plu sociema. Ex.: Amansar leono, urso. Il esas homulo di humoro sovaja; on ne povas amansar il. V. exp. vid. domtar.
amar-o: mooring-cable, hawser; lashing (as for a gun, etc.)
-agar: (tr.) to moor (by cable), to belay, make fast
-igar: to heap up, hoard up, amass
ambaj-o, -i: ambage(s): circumlocution, beaing around the bush.
ambici-ar: (tr.) to be ambitious of, to aspire to
ambigu-o: ambiguous, equivocal (cf. du-senca, plur-senca); -eso: ambiguousness
ambl-ar: (intr., of horses, etc.) to amble.
ambulanc-o: ambulance: field hospital following an army
amil-o: starch: (chem.) amylaceous substance in plants; (gen.) fecula used to stiffen linen; (cf. starch-ivo); -izar: to starch: put starch on (cf. starchar); -iferio: s. works
amnesti-ar: (tr.) to grant a general pardon
amor-ar: (tr.) to love (as man or woman)
-o: love: expresses not merely the sexual relation but also the sentiment between sexes
-deo: (myth.) god of love, Cupid. Def.: Expresas specale l'amo di la sexui, ne kom relato sexuala e pure korpala, ma kom specala sentimento; VI-322.
amorc-ar: (tr.) to start a thing off, set going (an instrument or a force); to prime (a gun); to fetch (a pump)

amortis-ar: (tr.) to weaken, deaden, break, (the force of a stream, a blow, a fall or shock); to calm (passions); to abate (inflammation); to blunt the feelings; to tone down, soften (colors); (fin.) to pay, liquidate (a debt), to redeem (an annunity); (jur.) to amortize: to sell in mortmain; (cook.) to make (meat) tender by long-keeping
-ilo extinguisher (for charcoal, etc.). Def.: Igar ulo min violent-oza; febl-igar; extingar debajo per pagar la kapitalo; igar plu mola.
ampl-a: ample: (of space) spacious; (of garments) full, easy; (of supplies) abundant; (of reward) liberal, etc.

-igo: amplification. V. exp.: Expresas relato inter du kozi de diversa speci, maxim ofte la relato di kontenanto e kontenajo. "Ampla" no-mizesas mantelo, qua fitas tre laxe la portanto, chambro od agro ube granda kunveno devas eventar; provizuro qua satisfacas la demandi esas "ampla", stato qua havas granda mar-komerco mustas havar "ampla" floto; IV-596. Ant.: streta.
ampul-o: ampulla: a bellied phial, glass bulb; (med.) a blister (on feet as from walking, or on hands from rowing).
amput-ar: (tr., surg. and fig.) to amputate, cut off.

amuz-ar: (tr.) to amuse, entertain; (fig.) to distract, divert (cf. distraktar); -ar su; -esar: to a. oneself (per, pri), to be amused (da); -(ad)o: amusement (act): -ivo:, ilo: that which amuses: plaything, toy
anakronism-o: anachronism: error in chronology; something incongruous in time.
analgezi-ar*: (tr.) to lull the sensibilities, produce insensibility to pain
-ajo: something analogous. Es.: Rezonado analoga. La linguo Italiana havas multa analogeso a la linguo Latina. An.: ne-simila.
-ajo: something old. V. exp.: anciena, nova; yuna, olda; antiqua: anciena, nova relatas prefere la kozi
anestezi-ar: (tr.) to anesthetize (as by ether or chloroform)
-izar: to put a hook on. (cf. peskar).
-atra, -a-mode: in the English fashion: -o-mani-ika, iko: anglomaniac, -ago: E. idiotism, anglicism
-igar: to cause a. to, to agonize
-o: anguish: pang, agony, violent pain (of body or mind)
-oza: full of a. V. exp.: vid. pavorar.
-faldar: (tr.) to fold the corners of (ulo); -moblo: corner-piece (furniture)
anhel-ar: (intr.) to pant, gasp for breath
-igar: to put out of breath, to wind
anim-ar: (tr.) to animate: endow with life; (fig.) to enliven, give animation to
-ata, -oza: animated. Ex.: La anmo animas la korpo. La konversado esis animoza.
ankilos-ar: (tr., surg.) to anchylose: make stiff
ankore: (adv., conj.) yet, still, until now, until then (refers to a fact or act already existing)
anm-o: soul (cf. psiko); -izar: to put soul into, to hearten
ans-o: handle: the arc shaped handle of a cup, bucket, etc.
antecedent-o: (gram., log., math.) antecedent. Ex.: La antecedenti di individuo, t.e. lua antea historio e konduto.
anti-: contra (use generally as a prefix with scientific words) (cf. kontre-) anti-bakteria: bactericide.
antidot-o: (also fig.) antidote. Def.: Substanco qua neutrigas l'efekti di la veneni; IV-76.
antifraz-o: antiphrasis. Def.: Figuro di retoriko, qua konsistas en uzar ula vorto o frazo en senco kontrea a lua vera signifiko.
antipati-ar: (tr:) to have an antipathy, aversion to (or against)
-oza: (who feels         antipathetical, full of aversion. Ant: simpatiar.
antiqu-a: antique, ancient: of a former epoch
-iva, -ivo: antiseptic. Def.: Kombatar kontre la mikrobi per antisepsiivo.
antonomazi-o: (rhet.} antonomasia. Def: Remplasigo di propra nomo per komuna nomo equivaianta, o reciproke; V-483. Ex.: L'anjelo     di la skolo (vice Santa Thomas).
anxi-ar*: (intr.) to be anxious, -o: anxiety; -oza: anxious.
apanaj-o: appanage: royal grant of domain or allowance
apar-ar: (intr.) to appear (to or before: -o, -ajo: appearance (act)
-igar: to cause to a. to; apparition (thing visible); to put in an appearance, -anta: apparent, plain, obvious, ostensible, specious
aparat-o: (tech., surg.) apparatus; machine, instrument or appliance used to perform a certain operation.
apartament-o: apartments: suite of rooms; flat.
aparten-ar: (intr.) to appertain, pertain; belong to by right, nature or custom
-ajo: appurtenance. Ex.: Algeria apartenas a Francia. Il apar tenas a bona familio. Domo e lua apartenaji.
apati-o: apathy: want of feeling, indifference: (cf. indiferent-eso); -oza: apathetic, impassive. Ant.: anim-oz-eso, viv-em-eso.
apel-ar: (intr.) to appeal (in law); (fig.) to call for aid or sympathy (ad ulu, pri ulo); facar apelo: to lodge an a.
apene: (adv.) hardly, scarcely, barely. Ex.: Il apene arivis. Il apene eskapis la morto.
apert-ar: (tr.) to open, unclose (also fig. with heart, soul, etc.)
-e openly, plainly, frankly; (cf. kandida); -iva, -ivo: aperient, laxative
apetit-ar: (tr., pr. and fig.) to have an appetite for; crave or desire (instinctively)
-igar: to give or cause an a. for
api-pomo: ‹‹api››: a small red apple (Malum Appianum).
aplast-ar: (tr.) to crush, squeeze, squash (soft objects); (fig.) to overwhelm, overburnden, oppress
aplaud-ar: (tr.) to applaud, clap; (fig.) to express approbation, -(ad)o: applauding
aplik-ar: (tr.) to apply, lay on, impose
-ebla: applicable, apposite, suitable. Def.: Pozar ulo sur ulo.
aplomb-o: (fig.) assurance, self-confidence, self-possession (cf. audaco); (inst.) plummet, plumb-line

apog-ar: (tr.) to prop (up), stay, support; to lean, to rest; to base, found, ground (assertions, reasons, etc.) -o: propping, supporting: -ilo, -trabo: prop, stay, support, pillar, strut, stanchion, brace
apologi-ar: (tr.) to vindicate (in writing or speech)
-o: apology: written or spoken discourse to justify a person, a thing
-isto: apologist. Ant.: blamar, denigrar, difamar. Note: For the translation of apologize in the sense of «to beg pardon» cf. exkuzar.
-eskar: to become an a., to apostatize.
apostil-o: apostil: marginal note, annotation; recommendatory note (to back a petition)
-esar: to be an a., obligar ulu kom -o: to bind as an a.
apret-ar: (tr., tech.) to dress: put a finish on calicoes, leather, etc. by applying a glaze dressing or varnish. - DFIR
aprob-ar: (tr.) to approve, give approbation to. Ant.: des-, ne-aprobar.
aproch-o, -i: (milit., fortif.) approaches: the works, trenches, etc. made by besiegers.
apt-a: apt, fit, appropriate, good for, suitable (ad); -eso: aptitude, aptness, qualification
apud: (prep.) close by, next to, beside, -a: near, neighboring, adjacent
apunt-ar: (tr.) to point (a fire-arm); take aim at; level at
aquamarino-o: (min.) aquamarine. Def.: Varietato de berilo.
aquilon-o: (poet., lit.) Aquilon: the north wind personified.

aquir-ar: (tr.) to get (through one's own exertions), to become the possessor of (by purchase, by labor, etc.), to acquire, win; to contract (a habit, a sickness); to gain (affection favor), to incur (dislike, hatred)

arach-ar: (tr.) to pull or drag out (a nail, etc.); to tear out (the hair, the eyes); to grub up (roots); to tear away (a child from its mother); to snatch, wrest, extort, wring (ulo de ulu); Ex.: arachar afisho, konfeso, krii, lakrimi. Arachar ulu de la morta.

aranj-ar: (tr.) to arrange: make orderly disposition of, dispose of in a proper manner; (cf. ordinar) -o, -eso, -uro: (act, state, result) arranging, disposition; Ex.: Aranjar libri sur tablo. Aranjar afero, mariajo, kofro, lito Aranjar por facar ulo.
arbitr-ar: (tr.) to arbitrate: award as an arbitrator, decide, judge, settle (ulo); -o: arbitration
arbitraj-ar: (tr., com.) to carry on arbitrage: to buy and sell on the market.
-ajo: arbitrary act, caprice: -e: ad libitum, at will
arbust-o: shrub, bush (not over three feet in height)
ardor-ar: (intr.) to be aglow, glowing, hot, fiery (cf. brular, kombustar); (fig.) (of passion, zeal) to be ardent, fervent; (of animals) to be in heat, rut
-anta, -oza: fiery, burning, full of ardor, passionate
-igar: to make burn, set on fire, make ardent.
ardu-a*: arduous: (of mountains, etc.) steep, rugged: hard to climb (cf. eskarpa); (of tasks, etc.} difficult to perform.
are-o: area; extent of surface: (geom.) superfices.

aren-o: arena, ring. V. Exp.: Areno esas spaco rondatra od elipsoiorma e klozita, por la ludi e kombati cirklala. Lico esas longa kureyo, generale duopia (por iro e riveno) por kuri o por turniri, II-646.
arest-ar: (tr., legal) to arrest: make a prisoner of, put under a.
-anto, -ero: person a.ing; -ato, -ito: person a ed; -impero: order for a.
argil-o: argil; clay, potter's earth; -a, -oza, -atra: argillaceous, clayish; -izar: to marl (land).
argumenta-ar;(intr.) to argue: hold an argument. Def.: Rezonar por pruvar ulo.
arid-a: arid: dry and barren; (cf. sterila)
ariet-o: (instr. of war and tech.) battering-ram; Aries, sign of the Zodiac; hidraulikala -o: hydraulic ram.
arist-o: (geom.) edge, projecting angle; (arch. and carp.) arris; (bot.) awn, beard (of barley, wheat, etc.); ridge (of nose, of mountain, of a bayonet, etc.)

ariv-ar: (intr.) to arrive (at destination, at a certain place). V. exp.; Se ulu venas de Berlin ad Paris, lu advenas dum la tota voyajo; nia lu arivas nur ye la tino (lasta momento) di la voyajo; e lu povas advenar sen anvar (se lu esus haltigata da acidento); VI-322- Ant.: departar.
ark-o (geom., arch., elec.) arch (as of bridge), arc
-igar: to arch: bend, curve, in form of a.
arkaism-o: archaism: antiquated form of speech

-o: arcanum: great secret of nature. V. exp.: Sekreta, arkana, okulta: Sekreta esas la maxim generala vorto. Arkano esas sekreto ciencala (o, pseudo-ciencala), quan on revelas o docas nur ad iniciati (ex.: l'arkani di l'alkemio). Ol esas analoga a misterio, ma misterio apartenas a religio, ed arkano a cienco o tekniko. Okulta dicesas omno quo koncernas la mondo di la spiriti e nia (asertita) relati kun li (ex. magio, astrologio, spiritismo, e.c.). La ‹‹okulta cienci›› ne esas simple sekreta cienci ma la cienci qui pretendas revelar a ni l'altra mondo o komunikigar ni kun olu; (kp. IV-237).
armator-o: shipowner. Def.: Posedanto ed equipanto di navo; III-75.
armatur-o: (elec.) armature; (tech.) iron braces, stays (to strengthen masonry, etc.)
-korpo: a. corps; (fig.) cielal- - o: celestial a.
arog-ar: (tr.) to arrogate (ulo a su): to make undue claims
-ema, -anta: arrogant, overbearing, supercilious, haughty. Ex.: Il arogas a su autoritato sen havar la yuro.
arom-o: aroma: spicy flavor or smell.
arorut-o: arrowroot: starchy flour of Maranta arundinatea and other plants.
aroz-ar: (tr.) to moisten, wet, water (with any liquid)

-venturo: sprinkling cart; V. exp.: aquizar, aspersar, irgacar: On povas arozar materiale o figurale, per mult altra liquidi kam aquo. La biblo dicas, ke Noa ‹‹arozis›› la vito sucedante per sango di pavono, per sango di simio, per sango di leono e per sango di porko. Do on ne povas uzar ‹‹aquizar››. On aspersas planti ed arbori por preventar ula morbo. Asperso relatas saneso. Irigaco esas brancho di agrokultivado. Ol aquizas tota farmi, distrikti per fluigar aquo de riveri, lagi, e.c., en artificala kanali a la kultivo-loki; IV-353, 459.
art-o: art: practical skill guided by rules; occupation requiring such skill
arteriit-o*: arteritis: inflammation of the arteries; (cf. flebito).
artific-o: artifice: artful or ingenious expedient
-ala: artificial; (cf. falsa): -acho: (in a bad sense) cunning, craft, wile, trick
artikl-o: (newspaper, gram.) article; (cf. varo, komerc-ajo); -o redaktistal: editorial
artikul-ar: (tr.) to articulate: pronounce, utter words
artilri-o: artillery: body of troops; (cf. kanon-aro); -ano: a. man, gunner
artr-o: (anat.) part or segment of a limb or body; movable articulation. Ex.: La korpi di kelka insekti havas multa artri.
aruf-ar: (tr.) to ruffle up, turn back (feathers, hair)
asafetid-o: asafetida: gum resin of Ferula Asafoetida.
asalt-ar: (tr.) to assault, storm (a fortified place); to assault, charge (the enemy)
asasin-ar: (tr.) to assassinate. Def.: Mortigar kun preintenco ed embuske o surprize; III-698.
asekur-ar: (tr., finan.) to insure, underwrite (against loss)
asembl-ar: (tr., gen.) to assemble: collect, bring together (people, materials, etc.)
asent-ar: (tr.) to give assent to: agree to, aquiesce in. Ex.: Me asentas vua judiko (t.e. me opinionas same, me judikas to kom vera. V. exp.: Asento koncernas opinioni pure teoriala
asert-ar: (tr.) to assert, allege, set forth, protest (declare)

-ita: a.ed. V. exp.: Sufokar esas la vulgara, asfixiar la ciencala vorto. Asfixiar esas la halto dil arterio-pulsado. Ol esas stando sucedanta al neperfekta oxigenizo dil sango, finanta per la morto, kande lu tro duras. Sufoko esas speco de asfixio, per obstaklo al adveno dil areo til pulmoni, obstruktado di naztrui, di boko, kompreso di kolo, e.c.; II
asidu-a: assiduous: constant, regular (in attendance or work). V. exp.: Diligenta relatas la fervoro od agemeso, ed asidua la akurata e reguloza prezenteso, la kontinueso di laboro; II
asign-ar: (tr.) to assign, to appropriate, allot, set apart (a sum), to fix, appoint (a day, place, rank), (fig., legal) to summons, cite, subpoena; (cf.atribuar, cedar)
asimil-ar: (tr.) to assimilate (physiol. and fig.). Ex.: La animali povas asimilar nur animala o vejetala substanci. Usa asimilas multa populi.
asist-ar: (tr.) to be present at, attend
-anto, -ero: person present, onlooker, bystander (not helper; cf. help-anto)
askolt-ar: (tr.) to listen to, hearken to, give ear to
-anto, -ero: listener. V. exp.: Askoltar implikas sempre intenco e volo. Audar esas perceptar per l'orelo, vole o nevole. Ex.: Me askoltas vu ma me ne audas pro la bruiso; V
asoci-ar: (tr.) to make (a person) one's associate, partner, colleague, companion, accomplice (in an ill sense); to make (ulu) participate or share in (ulo)
asom-ar: (tr.) to fell, to knock down: to knock on the head
-ilo: loaded bludgeon. V. exp.: On povas asomar per mazo o sen instrumento (ex. per pugnobato); II
asort-ar: (tr.) to assort, match, suit, sort out, classify things alike, or somewhat alike, or suited to each other
aspekt-ar: (intr.) to look (like, as if: quale), to seem (to be), appear
asper-a: (of touch) rough, uneven. V. exp.: Acerba koncernas la gusto, aspera la takto; II-707. Ant.: glata.
aspers-ar: (tr.) to sprinkle (to prevent disease); (rel.) to asperse
-ilo: sprinkler; (rel.) aspergillum. V. exp.: vid. arozar.
aspir-ar: (tr.) to inhale, draw in (air, smoke, etc.); to suck in or up (liquids); (gram.) to aspirate (a sound); to aspire: desire eagerly, long for, aim at
asterism-o: (astron., opt. of crystals) asterism. Def.: Optikal fenomeno; reflekto radianta di la lumo sur ula lapidi; III-135.
aston-ar: (tr.) to astonish, surprise, amaze: -egar: to astound, aghast; (fig.) to stupify; (cf. stupor-igar); -esar: to be a.ed (da).
astrikt-ar: (tr.) to have an astringent effect on
-iva, ivo: astringent. Def.: Astrikto esas densigo di ula organika texuri: ex. ‹‹aluno esas astriktiva›› II-645.
asum-ar: (tr.) to assume, take on oneself, undertake; (cf. entraprezar)
atak-ar: (tr.) to attack; (milit.) to take the offensive; (cf. asaltar, asomar, atentar); -o: (alo med.) attack(ing)
ataraxi-o: (philos.) ataraxy: perfect piece of mind.
atenc-ar: (tr.) to pay attention to (ulu, ulo); to apply the mind to, heed
-ez: attention! mind! look out! ne- -oza, -ema: inattentive, heedless
atent-ar: (tr.) to make a criminal attempt on (ulu, ulo)
-o: attempt (to commit an offense or crime); attack, assault (on persons or property), outrage
atest-ar: (tr.) to attest: certify, bear witness, give proof of
atlant-o: (arch.) atlas; (pl.) atlantes; (cf. kariatido). Def.: Virala figuro, qua servas kom suportilo.
atrakt-ar: (tr. also fig.) to attrack, draw
atrap-ar: (tr.) to entrap: take in, trick, hoax, dupe
atribu-ar: to assign, give, bestow, vest, allocate, invest with (something as due and appropriate)
-o: (theol.) attrition: grief for sin arising from fear of punishment.

aturd-ar: (tr.) to stun. V. exp.: Aturdar ne esas sempre vertijigar, nek ebriigar; en sua propra senco, ol indikas nekoncio o preska nekoncio produktita exemple da frapo, granda shoko, e.c. IV-1102.
aucion-ar: (tr.) to bid for, offer a higher price
aud-ar: (tr.) to hear: receive sensations by the ear
audac-ar: (tr.) to dare, venture, be so bold as
audienc-o: audience, sitting, hearing (granted by person in authority)
augment-ar: (tr., intr.) to augment: to increase, enlarge, to make larger or more numerous; to raise (rents, prices, wages, etc. (cf. plu-cher-igar)
augur-ar: (tr.) to augur (de ulo); -o: augury, omen, presage
august-a: august: imposing awe or veneration, majestic. Ex.: Il esas persono di august aspekto.
‹‹aula››: aula: hall in universities, colleges, etc.
aureol-o: (pr. and fig.) aureole, halo, nimbus
-izar: to put a halo around (as in painting); (fig.) to crown with glory.
auster-a: austere: (in a moral sense) strict, rigid. Def.: Tre severa por su pri la mori, kun nuanco di rigoro ed asketeso; II-707.
auto-: (prefix for scientific and technical words) auto-, self-
autograf-a: autographic: written by one's own hand
autopsi-ar: (tr.) to hold an autopsy on (ulu); -o: autopsy, post-mortem.
autoritat-o: authority: legal or rightful power
autun-o: autumn: fall of the year
aval-o: aval: guaranty, surety: a signature at bottom of a bill to guarantee payment
avalanch-ar: (intr.) to fall in an avalanch
avan: (prep.) in front of, ahead of; before (in space, cf. ante); -e: (adv.) in front
-ajo: thing, object in front, forepart; (fig.) forequarters (as of a horse)
-viro: front man; (milit.) chief of file. Ant.: dop.
avanc-ar: (tr. intr.) to advance: to go forward, move, put forward, (in space and time)
-ez: forward! Ex.: Avancar la manuo, la pedo. La armeo avancas en la lando. Avancar sua departo. Avancigar la laboro. Ant.: retro -irar; regresar, tard-igar.
-izar: to advantage, bestow an a. on, to favor
avantal-o: apron (for persons or vehicles), pinafore.
-o: damage, loss, (com.) average. Def.: Avario indikas omna domajo, ne nur di navo, ma di kozi transportita per navo, fervoyo, veturo; II-138.
aventur-ar: (intr.) to seek adventures, go on adventures, lead an adventurous (or roving) life
avenu-o: avenue. Def.: Larja voyo arborizita, duktanta ad ula loko, kastelo, monumento (forsan placo), III-16.
avers-o: front-, right-side (of cloth, medals, etc.) first page (of a book)
-e: front side to; (cf. facio). Ant.: reverso.
avert-ar: (tr.) to give notice, apprise, caution, advertise, warn (N.B. not necessarily to warn of danger)
aviac-ar: (intr.) to practice aviation, to fly
-ilo: flying machine (heavier than air). Note: for technical terms see IV-330-333.
avid-a: avid, greedy, rapacious, craving, eager
aviz-ar: (tr.) to apprise, advise, give notice of (pri ulo); -o: notice, notification (generally an order or prohibition)
axoid-o: (anat.) axis: second vertebra of neck
azil-o: asylum: place of refuge for poor, sick, or helpless; (fig.) any place of retreat or security
la: (def. article) the; (cf. le). When the following word begins with a vowel, the «a» may be omitted; as: l’infanto. (mus.) la: sixth note diatonic scale.
labor-ar: (intr.) to work, labo(u)r (pri ulo); (tr.) to work (the earth, iron, wood, etc.)
-eso: workmanship, manner in which work is executed
lac-o: lace: a plaited string to fasten something through eyelet holes; shoelace, etc
lacer-ar: (tr.) to lacerate, tear, rend, to fray out (by rubbing).
laciv-a: lascivious, libidinous, lewd, lustful, wanton, lecherous.
-ifar: (intr.), -igar: (tr.) to produce tears, to cause to shed tears
-ifar: to secrete or yield m.; (cf. melkar): -ifo: lactation

lakun-o: lacuna, blank space, gap. Def.: Mi-teknikala vorto uzata en diversa faki: indikas generale manko o vakuajo en loko, qua devus esar normale plena (lakuno di texto; lakuno un ula organal texuri); III-204.
lam-o: thin plate, sheet (-metal); blade (of sword, knife, etc.)
lamel-o: lamella: flake, scale (tech., bot., anat.).
-inda: lamentable: worth lamenting. V. exp.: Lamento esas expreso vocala di doloro, ne nur per paroli, ma per krii, jemi, sospiri
lamin-ar: (tr.) to laminate: to flatten out, roll flat
lampas-o*: lampas: ornamental fabric for furniture.
lampion-o: cup or small pot filled with tallow or oil with a wick, for illumination.
lancin-ar: (intr.) to shoot, dart, twinge (of pain)

langor-ar: (intr.) to languish, pine away, droop (from hunger, love, etc.); to be languid. Def.: Deperisar pokope pro maladeso od afekto qua deprenas la vigoro. Esar komplete senenergia. Ex.: To esas morbo en qua on langoras longatempe ante mortar. Langorar en karcero. La ardoroza suno langorigas la flori. Depos la milito esas granda langoro en komerco. Langor-anta, -oza, -ema spirito.
langust-o: spring (or spiny) lobster, sea crayfish (Palinurus vulgaris); (cf. homardo).
lanj-o: swaddling cloth, clout, baby’s diaper.

lansar: (tr., pr. and fig.) to fling, hurl, throw out or forward, cast, lance, dart (stones, darts,etc.) to shoot (an arrow); throw, cast (a look); throw in (an epigram, a word); to send forth (a book, a pamphlet); to cast (a beam of light); to launch (a ship); (cf. jetar, spricar, impulsar, iniciar).
lanug-o: fine soft hair or hairlike growth; down (of birds); (anat.) lanugo; (of fruit) wool; (of cloth) soft nap (cf. pilo).
lap-ar: (tr.) to lap (up): take into the mouth with the tongue; (cf. lekar).
lard-o: bacon, (cf. saimo); (of whales, etc.) blubber
larj-a: broad, wide; (N.B. not «large»; cf. grosa, granda)
las-ar: (tr.) to let, give leave, permit, allow: not to hinder to have, to do; to let alone; (pos) to leave behind
-e: lastly (of time) lately (cf. recente). Ex.: La lasta horo di la dio. Lasta yaro. La lasta domo en la strado. Laste naskinta. En lasta instanco. Laste, me parolis pri.
latent-a: latent. Def.: Qua ne aparas extere; II-20. Ex.: Defekto latenta (en mashino, en animalo). Latenta kaloro.
lav-ar: (tr.) to wash, wash off or up, lave; (of clothes) to launder: (fig.) cleanse (cf. net-igar, skurar)
lax-a: loose, slack, lax, not tense, not tight, not close; (med.) flaccid; (cf. mola)
lazaret-o: lazaretto: pest-, quarantine-house for sailors.
«lazarone»: lazzaroni: the poor class in Naples.
le: (pl. of def. article la) the: only to be used when there is no other sign of plural, e.g. «the ayes and the nayes»: le yes e le no.
leg-o: (natural, moral, social, parl., legislative) law (cf. yuro)

-ario: legatee. V.exp.: Legacar diferas de testamentar, per ke ol koncernas specale la kozi, havaji donata per testamento, e konseque havas sempre ta kozi kom rekta komplemento. On povas testamentar sen legacar ulo; III-160.
legitim-a: legitimate; having the sanction of law, custom or logic; (of a child) born in wedlock; (of a king) hereditary
-igar: to legitimize; (cf. yur-izar: yust-igar, justifikar). Ex.: Legitima infanto, autoritato, pretendo, plendo.
lejer-o: light (in weight, force); (fig.) not burdensome or severe (of food, clothing, work, punishment, etc.)
-igar: to lighten (cf. alejar). Ant.: grava, opres-anta, pez-oza, facila.
lem-o: (log., math.) lemma; loam (as used for founding).
lent-a: slow: not acting, moving promptly, sluggish, lagging; (cf. tarda)
lern-ar: (tr.) to learn (ulo); (cf. instruktar, docar, studiar, saveskar)
lesiv-ar: (tr.) to wash (clothes, etc. in lye); (chem.) lixiviate
-ajo: linen or object to be washed, the laundry.
lev-ar: (tr.) to lift (up); to raise (from below)
-ponto: lifting-bridge. Ex.: Levar la pedo, la manuo, la ankro. V.exp.: vid. elevar.
lexik-o: lexicon, dictionary (esp. of Greek, Latin, Hebrew); (cf. vort-aro, vorto-libro).
lez-ar: (tr., physiol., jur.) to injure, hurt, wrong
lian-o: (bot.) liana, bind-weed, creeper; any woody, climbing and twining plant.
libel-o*: libella: an instrument which measures levels: (water-) level.
