-ala: (of books, arts, education, principles, political parties, etc.) liberal
libertin-a: (esp. of the imagination, mind) unrestrained, wayward, flighty (to an excessive degree)
-eso: libertinism (obs. sense), -esar: to be free from restraint, to go to excess.
-isto, -vend-isto: book seller, -aro: collection of books, a library – books alone; cf. biblioteko).
librac-o*: (astron.) libration: an apparent oscillatory motion (as of moon).

lic-o: (ancient) lists; (modern) track, race course. Def.: Voyo preparita specala (ed enklozita) per konkursala kuri (sive di kavali, sive di homi, sive bicikli, automobili, e.c.); IV-454. V. exp.: vid. areno.
licenc-ar: (tr.) to grant a license, give (official) permission (to sell spirits, to teach, etc.)

-o: license, licensing; (poetic) license; deviation from strict fact, form or rule (by artist or writer); licentiate: a European university degree between that of bachelor and doctor; M.A. degree (= L licentia docendi ), -iero: (univ.) licentiate, an M.A.
lienteri-o*: (med.) lientery: a kind of diarrhoea.
lig-ar: (tr.) to bind (down), tie (up), fasten, attach
-ilo: lash, band, strap (for tying); (fig.) bond (as of matrimony)
lik-ar: (tr., intr.) to leak. Def.: (1) (aquo) enirar navo; (2) (liquido o gaso) ekirar vazo, e.c.; (3) (navo) enlasar aquo tra truo, fenduro; (4) (vazo) eklasar liquido o gaso; II-76.
likenin-o*: lichenin: a starch derived from Icelandic moss.
limb-o: (tech.) limb; an edge or border, as of a disk.
-izar: to set bounds to, to bound (a field, a country; cf. restriktar)
-okulo: (lit., and fig.) eye of a lynx, lynx-eye.
line-o: (telegraphic, R.R., genealogical, military, writing, printing) line; (cf. streko)
-ala: lineal: relating to lines; in a direct line (as line succession; cf. lineara)
-e, rekto-linee: in line, in a straight line
linear-a*: (math.) linear; of the first degree
-ala: linguistic: relating to a language (cf. linguistik-ala)
linj-o: (lit. and fig.) linen: a piece of washable wearing apparel or household goods, made from flax , muslin, cotton
lintel-o: (carp.) lintel: head-piece of a door-frame or window-frame.
-igar: to liquefy. V. exp.: Liquidaji referas kozi qui havas, mem instantale, la qualeso liquideskar; ex.: (liquida) metalo. Fluido nultempe asumas formo solid; aero esas fluido; (kp. fluido).
liquidac-ar: (tr., com.) to liquidate, settle, wind up (property, debts, businesses).
list-o: list (of persons, of things); (parl., milit.) roll
lit-o: bed ((for sleeping, also fig. as bed of river), -ala kozi: bedding
-ala: relating to letters; literal: following the letter of exact meaning, not figurative; (cf. vort-opa)
literatur-o: literature: the collective body of literary productions, belles-lettres
-ozi: the literati, literary people. Def.: La artiste skribita verki, la «bela literaturo»; II-87. V. exp.: Literaturo ne esas sinonima di verk-aro qua indikas omnaspeca verki; II-87.
litier-o: litter: straw, hay, etc. used for bedding of animals.
litor-o: littoral: coastal region, seaboard. Def.: La tota regiono plu o min larja, kontigua a la rivo; IV-426, 606; cf. plajo. Exp.: Litorala voyo o fervoyo ne sequas ne sequas sempre la rivo.
liv-ar: (tr.) to leave or depart; to leave behind; to quit (a place or position). V.exp.: vid. abandonar.
livid-a: livid: black and blue, leaden-colo(u)red. V.exp.: Pal-ega tote ne esas exakta: livida esas plu juste plombo-kolora; III-20.
livr-ar: (tr.) to deliver (goods, culprits, manuscripts, etc.)
-isto: delivery-man. V. exp.: La furnisanto ne livras la vari, nam il havas nula livristo; II-79.
liz-o: lees, dregs; grounds (of wine, beer); (fig.) dregs of the people.
lo: it (referring to the contents of a previous sentence, i.e. a fact, rather than a definite object; cf. ol)
locion-ar: (tr., med.) to wash with a lotion (ulu, ulo)
-tabelo, -libro: log-book. Def.: Instrumento por mezurar la rapideso di navo; III-140.
loj-ar: (intr.) to lodge, live, dwell for a limited time (che ulu, ulo)
-eskar: to take one’s abode, settle oneself; (fig.) to lodge itself, fix itself
-bilieto: billet (for troops). V. exp.: vid. habitar.
loji-o: (theat.) box, loge; (actor’s) dressing-room; (house-porter’s) lodge; (masonic, etc.) lodge; (arch.) loggia.
lokac-ar: (tr.) to hire, rent, lease (ulo, de ulu); (cf. lugar)
-anto, -ero: one who hires, rents, lessee, tenant
-ajo: what is hired, leased (house, vehicle, etc.)
lokl-o, -eto: lock of hair, curl, ringlet
lokomobil-o: (agri., manu.) traction engine; (portable) steam engine.
-ar: (intr.) to move from place to place. Ex.: Lokomoco divenis plu rapida depos la kreo di fervoyo. Muskuli lokomocala.
lonch-o: slice, chop (of bread, meat, etc.)
-e, longa-tempe: (for) a long time, a great while
lor: (prep.) at the time of (a definite event), at the same time as
-e: then, at that time, by then
lorn-o: (small) telescope, spy-glass; a single-barrelled field glass
-agar: (tr.) to look through a spy-glass at (ulu, ulo).
lot-o: lot: portion, share; (things for sale) lot
-igar: to divide into lots, to portion off: (cf. porcion-igar: parcel-igar)
-izar: to put a share, a lot into something
lotri-ar: (tr.) to cast lots for (ulo); to raffle for; to draw (lots, in a lottery)
loxodrom-o*: (geom., nav.) loxodromic curve or line.

loyal-a: loyal: faithful in any relation implying trust or confidence; straight-forward, fair-dealing; bearing true allegiance. Ex.: Loyala a la rejo, a sua patrio, a sua promiso, en amikeso. Ant.: ne-sincera; hipokrita.
lu: (pron.) he, she, it (common gender form)
-a: his her(s), its; (when desirable to indicate gender, the forms: ilua, olua, elua are used ); V. exp.: su, lu: il lavas su (E. he washes himself)
lubrifik-ar: (tr.) to lubricate: to oil; grease (part of a machinme)
lucid-a: (of mind) lucid, clear, sane. Ex.: Homo di lucida mento. Instanti lucida.
lud-ar: (intr. of games, sports) to play (per); (cf. plear)
ludion-o: «ludion»; (toy) Cartesian devil, bottle-imp. Def.: Aparato fizikala uzata por studiar la diferanta efiki sur korpo plunjita en l’aquo, anke uzebla kom ludilo.
lug-ar: (tr.) to let (out), rent (out); hire (out), lease (out) (ulo, ad ulu); (cf. lokocar)
lukt-ar: (intr.) to wrestle: contend by grappling (kun) and striving to throw; to scuffle, tussle; (fig.) to strive, struggle (kontre).
lul-ar: (tr.) to lull (ulu) to sleep, to soothe, compose, quiet
lum-ar: (intr. also fig.) to shine: emit rays of light, give light; (cf. brilar)
-izar: to light (a room, etc.) throw light upon; (fig.) to elucidate (a subject)
lump-o*: (min.) nodule: kidney-shaped ore, lump (of sugar).
lun: (abbr. accus. form of  ilun, elun, olun, without gender).

lup-o: (simple) magnifying glass, reading glass, pocket lens. Def.: Optikal aparato, qua servas por «grandigar» l’objekti (ye mikra raporto), e qua esas nek sempre simpla lenso, nek mikroskopo. On nomizas ol anke «mikroskopo simpla»; V-675.
lupi-o: (med.) wen. Def.: Speco di tumoro sub la pelo; V-675
lur-ar: (tr.) to lure, allure, entice; (fig.) wheedle, cajole (cf. seduktar)
lustr-o: chandelier (cf. kandel-iero); (antiq.) lustrum: space of five years.
lustrac-ar: (tr., antiq.) to lustrate: make clear or pure by propitiatory offering.
-aji: luxuries, fancy goods, articles de luxe, -ala: sumptuary: relating to luxury
luxac-ar: (tr., surg.) to luxate, dislocate, put out of joint (cf. dislokar).
sabat-o: Sabbath: seventh day of the week among the Jews (Saturday); (fig.) the first day of the week as observed by Christians (Sunday) (cf. sundio, saturdio).
-frapo, -vund-uro: blow with a s., s. wound
saci-ar: (tr.) to give a bare sufficiency to, give a minimum to (ulu)
-esar: to content oneself; put up with
saguin-o: (zool.) sagoin: squirrel-monkey, marmoset of genus: Callithrix.
saim-o: lard (cf. lardo). Def.: Porko-graso fuzita, sen salo; IV-581.
saj-a: wise, knowing, enlightened, sage, sensible, reasonable
sak-o: (also anat. and bot.) sack: bag, pouch
-igar: to render s., to consecrate (ulu, ulo); (fig.) to annoint, crown (a king); (cf. konsakrar)
sakrament-o: sacrament. Ex.: Donar la lasta sakramenti ad uli. Sakramentala vino. La katolikismo havas sep sakramenti: sakramento di bapto, di konfirmo, di la extrema unciono, e.c.
sakrifik-ar: (tr., intr.: lit. and fig.) to sacrifice (ulu, ulo); to make offerings
-anta, -inta: sacrilegious. Def.: Profanacar ulu, ulo veneracinda o sakra. Ex.: Sakrilejar kontre sacerdoto, kontre vestalo. (fig.) Esus sakrilejo abatar ica belega arboro.
-igar: to salify: to form a salt with; to impregnate (ulo) with salt
salari-ar: (tr.) to pay a stipend, wages, a salary to (ulu)
sald-ar: (tr.) to settle with: pay the balance due on an account current
-ajo: balance due: difference between debits and credits of a running account; (cf. bilanco). Ex.: Saldar trupi, employati.
salep-o: (esp. pharm.) salep: dried roots of various orchids.
sali-ar: (intr.) to be protuberant, to jut out, project. (N.B. refers to form not movement; cf. spricar)
-igar: to cause to jut out, to bring into prominence; (of fluids) throw up
-o, -ajo: jutting forth; protuberance, prominence, projection; (fort.) salient
salikari-o: (bot.) spiked purple loose-strife; willow-weed (Lythrum salicaria).
salin-o: salina: salt-works; (cf. sal-min-eyo). Def.: Loko ube produktesas la salo per vapigoro di la saloza aquo; IV-715.
-ifar: to salivate (cf. sputar). V. exp.: vid. bavar.
salon-o: saloon: drawing-room, parlo(u)r; (cf. art-ala expoz-eyo). Def.: Chambro en apartamento destinita por aceptar vizitanti.
salt-ar: (intr.) to leap, jump, bound, hop (upward or forward), vault (ad, sur, trans, retro, ad-avane)
-igar: to bounce (ulo): cause to leap or jump
salubr-a: (of places, things) salubrious, wholesome, healthy
-igar, -eskar: to render, become s. V. exp.: Salubra tote ne esas sana; sana koncernas la personi o vivanti
salut-ar: (tr.) to greet, salute (cf. salvear, reverencar)
-ego: a very low bow, salaam; hearty salute
salutar-a: salutary, wholesome, beneficial. Def.: Qua risanigas o salvas; IV- 138. Ex.: Salutara legi, kura-civi manjaji. V. exp.: vid. sana.
salv-ar: (tr., also theol.) to save (from danger, peril, sickness), to deliver, rescue; to salvage (goods)
-eso: safety, salvation: state of being saved
-boyo: life-buoy. Ex.: Salvar urbo, vivo, sua honoro.
salve-ar: (intr., milit.) to fire a salute, a volley (cf. salutar)
san-a: (pr. of persons; fig. of things) healthy, well, hearty, hale, sound in health; (fig.) sound, wholesome
sancion-ar: (tr.) to sanction: give validity to. Ex.: Sancionar lego. Ica vorto ne havas la sanciono di kustumo.
-ala: relating to b.: -oza: sanguinary: bloody, blood-stained
sani-o*: (med.) sanies. Def.: Materio sangoza e fetida, qua fluas de ula ulceri. V-349.
sant-a: holy, saintly; (of titles) saint; (cf. sakra)

santuari-o: sanctuary: that part of a church where the altar is placed; chancel; altar; (Jewish) holy of holies. (fig.) asylum, sacred refuge. Def.: Parto di kirko, di templo interdiktata a la profani; IV-582.
sap-ar: (tr., lit. and fig.) to sap, undermine
-isto: (milit.) sapper. Ex.: Sapar la fundamenti di basiono, di edifico. (fig.) Ta sistemo sapas la fundamenti di la Kristana religio.
-agar, -izar: to use s., put s. on, lather
-igar: (tr.), -ifar: (intr.) to saponify, make or produce soap
sapor-ar: (intr.) to have a certain flavo(u)r (taste) (cf. gustar, savurar)
sapt-o: (of plants) sap. Def.: Suko quan la planti tiras ek la tero, e qua acensante en li nutras oli; II-705.
saraband-o: saraband. Def.: Anciena danso, origine Hispana; IV-582.
sarment-o: (bot.) sarmentum: a running stem (as the strawberry plant)
-oza: sarmentose: having slender prostrate branches or runners.
satelit-o: (astron. and fig.) satellite. Ex.: La luno esas satelito di ica planeto.
-umar: to glaze: give to fabrics, paper, etc., a satin-like gloss
satisfac-ar: (tr.) to satisfy: to answer, fulfil (expectation, promise), to discharge (an obligation); to make amends, atone for (an offense, sin)
-anta: satisfactory: making amends. V.exp.: On adoptas satisfacar en la sequanta uzo: «satisfacar devo, obligo, kontrato, promiso, kondiciono», ne en la senco di kontent-igar; III-666.
«satisfecit»: certificate of satisfaction, of good conduct. Def.: Atesto-letreto donata (quale da skolestro a lua skolano).

satur-ar: (tr.) to fill completely; to satiate, glut, saturate, surfeit; (chem.) to unite or dilute until no more can be received. Ex.: Saturar acido. Saturar sua kuriozeso. La saturo-punto varias segun la tempuraturo. Saturita per manjajo, per aquo, per doloro. V.exp.: vid. saciar.
sav-ar: (tr.) to know (by learning), to have a knowledge of; to be versed in; be aware of; to know how (to do)
-igar: to cause (ulu) to know (ulo), to apprise, inform, instruct
-ema: (of persons) desirous of learning, curious (cf. kurioza)
savan-o: savanna: treeless plain or meadow; U.S.: prarie.
savur-ar: (tr.) to savo(u)r, relish (a dish); (fig.) to enjoy, delight in
-o: savo(u)r, relish. Def.: Gustar lente, kun atenco e plezuro. Ex.: Savurar ula vino, tasedo de kafeo. (fig.) Savurar ula plezuro, la honori.
sbir-o*: sbirro: a former member of Italian Police.
se: (conj.) if (followed frequently, but not necessarily by conditional)
-nur: if only, provided that. Ex.: Se me povus, me venus. To esas importanta, se vera. Obediez; se ne, gardez! Me facos to, se nur il venos.
seb-o: tallow or tallow-like substance, suet; (cf. stearino)

secion-o: (geom.) section (cf. segmento). V. exp.: Seciono signifikas la figuro (plana) obtenita «sekante» objekto per plano (ex. la koniki esas konala secioni); kun ta senco ol uzesas tre ofte en geometrio e cetera matematika cienci; IV-351; V-660.
sed-o: bottom, backside: hinder part or seat of body; (cf. gropo, rumpo, lumbo)
sedentari-a: sedentary (life, profession). Def.: Qua restas konstante sidanta, pro mestiero; per extenso, la mestiero anke dicesas «sedentaria»; III-207.
sedici-ar: (intr.) to (cause a) mutiny, to riot (cf. rebel-eskar, revoltar)
sedukt-ar: (tr.) to seduce (chastity); to lead astray (from the path of rectitude, duty); to beguile, entice (cf. lurar, trompar, facinar, misduktar, koruptar, subornar)
-anto, -ero: seducer (cf. atrakt-iva). Ex.: Seduktar puerino. La charmo di lua manieri seduktas me.
seg-ar: (tr.) to (cut with a) saw: -ilo: a saw
-aro: sails (of a ship); set of s.s.
-irar: to s.: go sailing before the wind
segun: (prep.) according to, agreeably to, in conformity with; pursuant to, after
-quante: as far as, in so far

-vole: at will. Ex.: Segun vua deskripto, vua rekomendo, mea opiniono. Traktar ulu segun lua merito. Evangelio segun St. Johano. Ni diskutos to, nur segun quante ol povas kontributar a nia projeto. Segun ke vu esos richo o mizeroza, la homi judikos vu kom bona o kom mala.
seid-o: fanatical partisan, zealot. Def.: Fanatiko volunte kriminas pro religiala zelo, e.c.
sejorn-ar: (intr.) sojourn, remain for some time at a place (cf. restar).
sek-ar: (tr.) to make a surface cut in; cut partially through; divide into sections
sekond-ar: (tr.) to second, back (up) support (a motion, proposition)
sekret-a: secret, not made known, not revealed, clandestine (cf. cel-ita, privata)
-e: secretly, in secret. V.exp.: vid. arkana.
sekund-o: second: 60th of a minute of time or of an arc.
sekundara: secondary: indicates relationship as used in geology, electricity, public school, medicine, etc., compared with primara, terciara; (cf. acesora: duesma-grada; min grava).
sekur-a: safe, secure: out of danger, without danger
-esar: to be s., -igar: to make safe, secure (cf. cert-igar)
-izar: to s., -if-erio: saddlery (where saddles are made; cf. harnes-if-erio)
selekt-ar: (tr.) to select, choose, pick out (cf. elektar, preferar, asortar)
-ajo: what is chosen, choice. Ex.: Selektar sua amiki. Selektar la maxim bona cerizi. Naturala selektado.
sem-ar: (tr., lit. and fig.) to sow, strew, scatter (seed for growth)
semantik-o: semantics, semasiology. Def.: Cienco di la signifiki (di vorti), di lia evoluciono (parto di la linguistiko); IV-81.
sembl-ar: (intr.) to seem, appear (to be), look (like) (cf. aspektar, simular)
-o: appearance, semblance, external aspect, outward show
-ante: apparently (cf. kred-ebla). Ex.: Ca vino semblas a me esar mala. Il semblas dormar. Semblo di amikeso.
semestr-o: semester: six months period (of study) (cf. trimestro).
-a: perpetual. Ex.: On ne esas sempre felica. Matine me levas me sempre tre frue.

sen: (prep.) without, not with, free from: indicates absence, privation, exclusion, destitution; (Note: Sen is often compounded with verbs in place of des-, ne- to signify deprivation, absence: des-esperar: to despair
senatuskonsult-o*: senatys-consultum: decree of the (Roman) senate.
send-ar: (tr.) to send: cause to go, dispatch, forward
sens-o: sense: one of the five physical senses or faculties
sensacion-o*: sensation: excited interest or feeling (cf. sento)
-ala: sensational (cf. impres-anta, -iva). Ex.: Ula novaji ofte produktas sensaciono. Sensacionala jurnali, libri.
sensual-a: sensual: devoted to the gratification of the senses; voluptuous
-ismo: sensualism: sensuality (cf. sens-al-ismo). Def.: Devota a sensala plezuri; agreabla a la sensi.
sent-ar: (tr.) to feel (a sensation) (cf. konciar, perceptar, flarar, odorar, saporar)
sentenc-o: sentence: maxim: short saying containing an axiom, saw (cf. proverbo). (N.B. This is not the E. grammatical «sentence» cf. frazo)
-ema, -atra: sententious, terse, pithy. Ex.: Sentenco da Seneca. Stilo, maniero sentencala.
sentiment-o: sentiment, mental feeling, emotion (opp. to physical sensation), -ala: (of things) sentimental
-esar: to be on s. watch (cf. facionar)
separ-ar: (tr.) to separate, part, divide, (ulo, de ulo)
-ajo: that which is separated, a s. part
sepult-ar: (tr.) to entomb, bury (a dead body) (cf. en-ter-igar)
-eskar: to prepare for burial, lay out (a body)
sequ-ar: (tr.) to follow, go or come after, go next, to be or come next

-enda: which must be followed. Ex.: Il marchis adavane e la altri sequis il. Sequar ulu per la okulo. Sequar voyo, metodo. La sequantaro venis dop (od, sequante) il. Sequo di lud-karti. Il remarkis sua eroro erste ye la sequante matino. Exemplo sequinda. Voyo sequenda.
sequenci-o*: (R.C. liturgy) sequence: a certain hymn sung during mass.
-ajo: what is sequestered. Ex.: Sequestrar la havajo di ulu.
sequoy-o: (bot.) sequoia: red-wood tree (Sequoia gigantea; Sequoia sempervirens).
ser-o: (physiol.) serum: thin, transparent part of blood (cf. serumo)
serbatan-o: air-cane; pea-shooter. Def.: Longa tubo uzata por lansar, per suflado, mikra projektili.
serch-ar: (tr.) to seek, look for, search for, be in quest of
-eso: serenity. Ex.: Mieno, fronto, tempo serena.
seri-o: series, row, file; continued succession, order or course (cf. inter-sequo, sucedo)
-e: in s., in rows. Ex.: Serio di personi, di objekti, di questioni, di soni.
serioz-a: serious, sedate, grave; not lively or amusing
-eso: seriousness. Ex.: Serioza karaktero, konverso, morbo. Parolar serioze. Konsiderar ulu, ulo kom serioza. V. exp.: vid. grava. Ant.: vivaca, gaya, amuz-anta, rid-ig-anta, komika, jokema.
seron-o: (com.) seroon: a bale of tea, indigo, etc. wrapped in hide.
-eto: pruning-, garden-knife. Def.: Speco di kultelo larja kun pinto kurvigita (en la sama plano), qua servas por taliar la arbori, tranchar la branchi; VI-539.
serv-ar: (tr., intr.) to be of service to, to serve (as an assistant or domestic); to be in the service (of), to serve (customers), to tend (a machine)

-achar: to dance attendance on (ulu), -em-acha: servile. Ex.: Servar ulu. Esar servisto di ulu. Facar servo ad ulu. Me esas pronta servar vu. Administrala servado. Servar ulu kom sekretario. Servar kliento, mashino.
servitud-o: (jur.) servitude: liability of property to rights of other persons, as a right of way over it. Def.: Obligo pri domeno relate altra domeno; III-606.
sesg-ar: (tr.) to cut (ulo) in the form of a crescent; (of dresses) to cut low; (cf. dekoltar). Ex.: Sesgar korsajo.

sesion-o: session, sittings (of a deliberative body, as a court, legislature, etc.). V. exp.: Duro dum qua deliberanta korporaciono kunsidas kontinue. To ne esas kunsido, qua indikas la duro di singla kunveno; III-332.
sever-a: severe, hard, stern, harsh, strict (cf. austera)
-eso, -ajo: (quality, act) severity; (of weather) inclemency. Def.: Rigoroza; ne-indulgema. Ex.: Severa judiciisto, lego, morbo, klimato. Ant.: indulgema.
sext-o: (mus.) sixth: an interval of six diatonic degrees.
sezon-o: season (of the year; cf. okaziono, oportun-ajo)

shablon-o: pattern (cf. modelo); (fig.) routine (cf. rutino). Def.: Plana figuro, qua indikas la konturi sugun qui on devas taliar stofo; anke utila metafore (por expresar sklavatra kopiado); IV-447
shabrak-o: shabrak: ornamented saddle cloth, caparison. Def.: Tegilo ornita di kavalo; VI-75.
shaft-o: shaft, staff: long handle, as of a lance; stock (of a gun); shank (of a tool); (cf. shakto).

-ar: to give a check (to the king). V. exp.: Por la shako-ludo on adoptas: damo, episkopo, kavalo, turmo, e la expresuri: soldati, oficeri, roquar, shakar la rejo; VI-116; for other descriptive terms, cf. VI-299.
shakt-o: shaft, pit (of a mine or quarry).
shalm-o: pipe or tube of straw, reed, glass, or metal (as used for sucking up liquids); (chemist’s) blowpipe; shawm: an acient reed instrument; shepherd’s pipe; (bot.) hollow sterm (of a plant).
shalot-o: (bot.) shallot: an onion-like plant (Allium ascalonicum).
shalup-o: (sailing-) launch, long boat or cutter propelled by sails or oars; shallop
-igar: to s. (ulu), to make (ulu) feel ashamed, to humiliate, mortify; (cf. pudoro)
shancel-ar: (intr.) to stagger, totter, waver, reel, be unstready, shake
-igar: to cause something to totter; (fig.) to shake (an opinion, decision, etc.)
shapk-o: fur cap. Def.: Furizita kap-vesto.
shark-o: (ich.) shark. V. exp.: Sharko esas la nomo vulgara di Squalus carcharius
-eso: charlatanism, quackery. Def.: Venderacho di drogi, dent-extirpero, e.c. en publika loki; (fig.) ne-savanta mediko qua explotas la publiko.
sharp-o: scarf (for shoulders); sash (as insignia or ornament); (surg.) sling; (cf. zono)
sheik-o: sheik. Def.: Chefo di Araba tribuo; III-603.
shekl-o: (tech.) shackle. Def.: Masho di kateno qua havas altra formo kam la cetera mashi e servas por specala skopo (fixigo di la hoko, di siteli en dragilo, e.c.); III-85-6.
shel-o: shell, peel, rind, hull: hard outer case of eggs, nuts, etc.; (cf. skalio, bruo)

shibr-o: (tech.) slide-valve (in steam engine); sluice-gate (for water). Def.: Valvo-pordo qua agas glitante en sua plano tale ke ol obstruktas (parte o tote) vaporo en la vapor-mashino, aqua en kanalo, tubo, e.c.; III-293.
shifon-o: rag: piece of cloth torn off (cf. rago); scrap (of paper, etc.)
shikan-ar: (intr.) to chicane: to pettifog, quibble, prolong a contest by shifts, subterfuges; (tr.) to quibble over something or with somebody about something; to wrangle (without motive)
shink-o: ham: thigh of a hog prepared for food
shirm-ar: (tr.) to shelter, shield, screen: -ar su: to take shelter
-tekto: penthouse, lean-to (cf. hangaro). Ex.: Parasuno shirmas el. Shirmata da la foliaro kontre la vento e suno.
«shirting»: (com.) shirting: cloth suitable for making shirts.
shok-ar: (tr., intr.) to shock: (physical) to strike on or against, dash against; give a shock to, clash with; (mental) to offend, be offensive to; (cf. kolizionar)
shov-ar: (tr.) to shove or push (ulu, ulo) along; (cf. pulsar, glitar). Ex.: Shovar ulu sur glacio. Shovar su tra turbo. Shovar botelo sur tablo, batelo al aquo.
shu-o: (low-) shoe for the human feet)
si: (mus.) si: seventh note of diatonic scale.
sid-ar: (intr.) to sit , be seated (of persons, assemblies, courts); (fig.) to lie, reside (of things)
-eskar: to take one’s seat, sit down
-eyo: place where one sits; seat, bench (as of a court); see (of a bishop); (fig.) residence
siej-ar: (tr.) to besiege, lay s. to, invest (ulu, ulo)
sifl-ar: (tr., intr.) to whistle: make a shrill sound ordinarily musical; (fig., med.) to wheeze; to whiz

-anto, -ero: a whistler, one who whistles. Def.: Facar la sono (ordinare) muzikala, kun alteso definita, quan produktas sifl-ilo, t.e. orgen-tubo kurta e konseque akuta, o la sifilo di lokomotivo; VII-207. Ex.: Siflar a hundo. Siflar ario. La respirado di asmatiko siflas. (fig.) La vento, flecho, paf-kuglo (ulfoye) siflas. V. exp.: vid. sisar.
sigilari-o*: sigillaria: a genus of fossil trees.

sigi-ar: (tr.) to seal, affix a s., as a mark of authenticity, to a document, letter, bottle, etc.; (fig.) to seal up: close for security, as a closing a letter by means of gum or wafer; (cf. masonar)
sign-o: (natural or artificial) sign, mark (cf. indik-ajo, indico)
-izar: to put a s. on (ulo, ulu)
signal-ar: (tr.) to signal: convey (ulo) by s.
-izar: to hoist signals on (a mast,etc.), to cover with signals; to write or put a s. (on a tree, etc.)
signat-ar: (tr.) to sign, subscribe (one’s name), put signature to (cf. sub-skribar)
sik-ar: dry, dried: free from moisture
siki-o: sickle. Def.: «Falchileto», t.e. longa streta lameno kun mi-cirklatra formo, quan on uzas (od uzis) por tranchar ex. la frumento; VI-538.
-igar: to separate into s.s.; to spell by s.s.
silenc-ar: (intr.) to be silent: not to make noise
-ez: stop that noise! Ex.: La mashino silencis. Dum la silenco di la nokto. Foresto silencoza. V. exp.: Taco esas absenteso di parolado
silogistik-o*: syllogistic: a department of logic.
silur-o: (ich.) silurid, silure, sheat-fish, cat-fish (genus: Silurus).
silv-o: forest of fully-grown lofty trees.
silvan-o: (myth.) sylvan: god, Sylvanus: wood deity.
silvi-o: (orni.) garden warbler, white-throat (species of Sylvia).
simar-o: simar: (of priests) cassock; (cf. sutano); (justice’s) robe; a former long gown worn by women.
-esar: to be symbolized (da ulo). Ex.: La balanco esas la simbolo dil yusteso. La glavo simbolizas la lego.
simetr-a: symmetrical: which corresponds in proportion, position
simi-o: (general term) simian: ape, monkey, baboon, etc.
-igar: to render s., to assimilate (cf. asimilar)
-esar: to be s., be alike, resemble
-o: simony. Def.: Simonio: komerco kontre-etika di la sakra kozi: III-332.
simpati-ar: (tr., moral and physical) to sympathize with, have sympathy for (ulu); (phys.) be in sympathy with
simpl-a: simple: not complex or complicated; easy; (of dress) plain, common
simptom-o: (med. and fig.) symptom: -a, -atra: symptomatic. Ex.: Simptomo di anemio. (fig.) Simptomo di revolto.
simultan-a: common, co-existing, co-equal, simultaneous. V. exp.: Qua valoras egale e kune, solidare, ex.: equacioni simultana. Konseque simultana ne esas sinonimo di samtempe. Dec. 1212, VII-66

sin-o: intimate place, internal part, close or secret receptacle: (fig. senses of) bosom, heart (midst), womb. Ex.: En la sino dil eklezio. En la sino di la tero. La sino di Deo. En la sino di sua familio.
sindik-o: syndic: a municipal officer; manager, business agent (of corporation, company); administrative assignee (of an insolvent’s estate).
-igar, -ifar: to s. Def.: Grupo formacita por la defenso di sua ekonomikala interesti komuna.
sinekur-o: sinecure. Def.: Ofico sen responsiveso o devi.
singular-a: singular: pertaining to one (cf. stranja)

-eso: (quality), -ajo: (something pertaining to one) singularity, peculiarity. Ex.: Verbo en la singulara nombro (od, en la singularo). Singulara propoziciono, ideo, kazo. Singulareso di opiniono. Singularajo en la manieri di ulu.
sink-ar: (tr., intr.) to sink (ulo, en ulo, su); to settle, subside; Ex.: Sinkar palisegaro en la tero. La fero sinkas en l’aquo. V.exp.: kp. Dronar. DE
-eso: synonymy: quality of being a s. Ant.: antonimo.
sinoptik-a: synoptic(al). Ex.: Sinoptika tabelo di cienci. La sinoptika evangelio.
sins-o: direction (one way); (math.) sense: one of two opposite directions
-ar: to synthesize. V. exp.: Sintezo esas l’ago inversa di analizo. Kemiala sintezo, metodo sintezala. Sintezar albumino.
-ifar: to wind about, meander. Ex.: La sinui di litoro, di rivero.
sinus-o*: (geom.) sine; (anat.) sinus: a cavity, channel.
-ino: Mrs., Miss, madam, lady (married or not); (cf. sinioro, damzelo, damo)
siren-o: siren: powerful whistle; (acoustics) a measuring instrument for air vibrations; (myth.) sea-nymph, mermaid; (fig.) a seductive woman
-ala, -atra voco, kanto: (fig.) a siren (bewitching, fascinating) voice, song.
-o: a half dozen (Note: For other derivative forms cf. du).
sis-ar: (intr.) to hiss; to siss, sizzle

-anta, -anto: sibilant. Def.: Produktas la sono sss…od fff…, t.e. bruiso ne-muzikala, qua esas fonetike konsonanto; VII-207. Ex.: Serpenti, gansi sisas. V. exp: Lokomotivo siflas per sua siflilo, e samtempe sisas emisante vaporo ek la kaldiero o la cilindri, tra robineti, ma ne siflante.
sism-o*: earthquake, vibration of the earth
sismograf-o: seismograph. Def.: Instrumento por enskribar la ter-tremi; VI-135.
sismometr-o: seismometer. Def.: Instrumento por mezurar la ter-tremi.
-igar: to systematize. Ex.: La sistemo di Descartes. Planetala sistemo, od planetosistemo, od planetaro. Il esas persono tre sistemema. Sistemigar sua idei, sua dokumenti.
sistematik-o*: systematizing: scientific (or efficient) disposition; labo(u)r saving arrangements.
situ-ar: (tr.) to place, seat, locate (ulo, ulu) (cf. jacar, pozar, plas-izar, lok-izar); -o, -eso: situation, site location

-ita: situate(d). Ex.: Domo, urbo bone situita (o kun bona situeso). Dramatatra situeso. Situeso bona, mala, embarasiva. V. exp.: Situeso, relate personi, esas generale acidentala, tempala; la stando esas kustumale permananta. On trovas sua aferi en neagreabla situeso, qua forsan developos a permananta mala stando.
siv-o: sieve, sifter (for flour, etc.); strainer (for liquids) (cf. kriblo, filtrar)
-agar: (tr.) to sift, bolt, strain; (fig.) to examine minutely, separate the good from the bad; to winnow.
sive: (1) whether; (2) either; (1) sive ... sive: (alternative and condition) whether … or whether
siz-ar: (tr.) to sieze, gripe, catch or lay hold of; (fig.) to take, grasp quickly, apprehend (arrest); to distrain (property)

-ilo: griping. Def.: prenar o manukaptar vivace e vigoroze ulu, ulo. ex.: Sizar l’espado per la pinto. Sizar la brakio di ulu. Sizar la havajo di ulu. Sizar oportuna instanto (o tempo). Sizar pretexto. Teroro sizis la menti. La febro sizas me.
skabel-o: (wooden-) stool, foot-stool (cf.tabureto). Def.: Moblo por la pedi, o por acensar sur olu; II-647.
-ika, -iko: (person, animal) infected with itch; (N.B. A scab on a sore is to be translated by krusto).
-iero, -isto: diver. Def.: Plunj-vestaro kompleta kontenanta homo tota; III-267.
skal-o: ladder; scale: instrument of measurement; (math., mus.) scale
skali-o: shell (as of an oyster, etc.) (cf. shelo)
-oza: scaly, squamous. Def.: La krusto dika e solida qua kovras la korpo di la tortugi, ostri, musli, e.c.; VI-603.
skalp-ar: (tr.) to scalp: deprive of s.
-ajo: s.: skin on top of the head.
-anta, -oza, -iva: scandalous. Ex.: Lua konduto skandalis la tota urbo.
skaramuch-o: scaramouch; (fig.) cowardly buffoon. Def.: Persono di la komedio Italiana; IV-583.
skarifik-ar: (tr., surg.) to scarify (the skin of someone). V.exp.: tranchar.
skarmuch-ar: (intr.) to skirmish, to have a brush with the enemy.
skars-a: scarce: not plentiful; scanty (cf. rara, des-densa)
-eso: scarcity. Def.: Des-abund-anta; V-595. Ant.: densa, abund-anta.
skem-o: schema, scheme: systematic plan; outline or demonstration of a system, showing relations and functions; (N.B. not «scheme» project)
-uno: one of the threads of a skein.
-kurar, -glitar: to skate on skees. Def.: Speco de sketilo longa, ligna, por kurar e glitar sur la nivo; IV-707.
skis-ar: (tr.) to sketch, outline, make a rough draft of; (fig.) to delineate: give the plan or idea of
-o, -uro: sketch, outline; (rough) drawing. Ex.: Skisar peizajo, portreto, (fig.) poemo. Skisar demarsho. Skisuro di romano. V. exp.: vid. esbosar.
-ala, -atra, -ema: slave, slavish, servile; -eso, -atr-eso, -igo, -esko: slavery, servility, servitude, bondage
-esar: to be a s., be in slavery
skol-o: school: a place or establishment where instruction is given, usually elementary; disciples or followers of some teacher or doctrine in art, philosophy, -etc.
-ano: schoolchild, pupil, scholar (cf. erudito, ciencisto, lern-anto, stipend-iero, dicipulo)
skoli-o: (lit., geom.) scholium. Def.: Komento od expliko di texto; matematikal expliko di teoremo; IV-583.
skolopendr-o: (ent.) scolopendra, the genus of centipedes.
skop-o: that at which one aims; aim, scope, objective, intent(ion), purpose, view, goal, butt, object to attack

skrach-ar: (tr.) to scratch, claw, graze, gall; (of ropes) to chafe; (of clothing) to make a rent in; (cf. lacerar, gratar, skrapar, exkoriar). Def.: Facar sek(et)o en la pelo (od altra surfaco), do vundeto; IV-656. V. exp.: La ungli di kato skrachas bonege, ma nule exkorias. Me tante gratis me, ke me fine skrachis me.
skrap-ar: (tr.) to scrape (with a tool), scrape off, abrade; (of chimneys) to sweep; to scale off

-uri: scrapings. Def.: Deprenar gratante per instrumento ula parti de la surfaco di korpo. Ex.: Skrapar anciena pergameno. La stono skrapis la pelo. Skrapar kraso de la pelo, o fango de la vestaro.
-ajo: what is written: written paper, document
-isto: professional writer, scribe (N.B. not author; cf. autoro)
-agar: to s. down, s. on (something with screws. N.B. not to screw the screw; cf.visar)
-izar: to put screws on: cover with screws
-oza, -ema: scrupulous. Ex.: Havar skrupulo pri ulo. Homo sen-skrupula.
skult-ar: (tr.) to sculpture, carve (ulo, en, ek)

-isto, -ero: sculptor, carver. Def.: Produktar statuo en korpala naturaleso od en vera reliefo; VII-414. V. exp.: On povas ex. cizelar kapo (vizajo) homala segun la perspektivo, ma on skultas ol donante ad ol la reala formo. On cizelas perspektiva figuro sur bloko, on gliptas reala figuro sur bloko, ma on skultas figuro de bloko, t.e. on transformas la bloko a ta figuro korpala; VII-414.
skur-ar: (tr.) to scour, furbish: to cleanse by scrubbing
-isto: scourer; scullion. Def.: Destruktar e forprenar partikli o despuraji de la surfaco di ula korpo per friciono; III-163.
-eyo: miry place, slough, mudhole, quagmire (cf. marsh-eto)
-izar: to cover with, choke up with fine oozy mud or silt.
-ar: to speak s. (cf. jargono, galimatiaso). Def.: Linguo specala, konvencionala e plu o min sekreta, propra a profesiono od a societo klozita (studenti, raptisti); VII-158.
sling-o: noose, sling, snare, loop (cf. glit-nodo, lazo). Def.: Nodo en kordo, e.c. ne forsita per tiro; III-288.
slup-o: (nav.) sloop. Def.: Speco de seglo-navo kun un masto; IV-583.
-agar: to take (a boat, ship) through a l.; to open a l. for a boat
smalt-o: smalt: a deep-blue glass (often pulverized).
snap-ar: (tr.) to snap, snatch: bite or catch suddenly with the teeth ( as a dog) or with beak (as a bird). Def.: Kaptar bruske per la boko; IV-512.
snifl-ar: (tr., intr.) to sniff: inhale strongly; snuff up; (fig.) to turn up one’s nose (at)
snort-ar: (intr., of horses) to snort: blow through the nose (cf. sternutar, mungar).
sobr-ar: (also fig.) temperate: moderate in food or drink; sparing, abstemious, sober; (cf. ne-ebria, temper-ema, -moder-ema)
-e: soberly, with sobriety. Ex.: La homo qua ne exajeras manjante, drinkante, qua esas moderema e su-dominacanta, esas sobra persono. Esar sobra en parolado, en laudado.
soci-o: society (in general) community: any large body of persons or living beings living a community life
-eto: society (formed for a particular object), association; (com.) company, partnership (cf. firmo)
sofa-o: sofa. V. exp.: vid. kanapeo, divano.
-ala: sophistical (cf. sofist-ala). V. exp.: vid. paralogismo.
sokurs-ar: (tr.) to succo(u)r: to come to the aid of when in danger

-armeo: relief army. Ex.: Sokursar ulu dronanta. V. exp.: Sokursar signifikas irar rapide e kurajoze helpar ulu, uli, en situeso di minacanta danjero; on helpas ulu en desfortunoza o perturbita situeso per la donaco di adicionala forci o moyeni.  On sokursas amiko en batalio; on helpas la povri, falinto.
sol: (mus.) sol: fifth note of diatonic scale.
sol-a: alone; without company, sole, only (cf. nura, unika, solitara)
-o: (mus.) solo. Def.: Qua esas ne-akompanata; izolita. Ex.: Il esas sola en la chambro. Unu sola ne povas facar to. Laborar sole. Il esas sola en solitara loko.
-igar: to solemnize. Ex.: Solena festo, vovo, dio, tono, vizajo.
solfej-ar: (tr., mus.) to (sing) sol-fa: sing the notes of the scale
soli-o: threshhold (of a door, of a window; also fig.), door-soll. Ex.: (fig.) la solio di vivo.
solicit-ar: (tr.) to solicit: earnestly apply for (cf. suplikar, peticionar)
-anto, -ero, -isto: solicitor, canvasser. Def.: Insistoze demandar. Ex.: Solicitar audienco, employeso, ofico, favoro. Segun la solicito (di). Solicitero por voti.
solid-a: (also geom.) solid: not liquid; (fig.) firm, substantial, sound
-o, -ajo: a s. body; (geom.) a s. figure
solidar-a: (jur. and gen.) solidary: jointly and severally responsible or liable; binding upon every one
-eso: solidarity, joint responsibility; (fig.) coherence, fellowship, community of interests

-igar: to make jointly liable; to unite the interests of (cf. konsolidar). Ex.: Solidara obligaciono. La spozulo esas solidara por la debaji di sua spozino. Asociiti en komercal societo esas solidara. (fig.) La solidareso en la interesti di omna laboristi.
solitar-a: (of places) solitary, lonely, deserted; (of persons) (living) alone

-eso: loneliness, solitude. V.exp.: Solitara esas ulo plu kam sola, mem kam solesema: to esas: «qua restas kustume tote sola ed izolita». Exempli: Solitar querko stacas meze di la planajo. On povas anke parolar pri solitara loko; to nule esus sinonima si dezerta: ex.: «ta solitara templo esas frequentata da multa pilgrimanti.» Solitareso expresas la L. solitudo. On povas vivar sola, mem en urbo; to ne esas vivar solitara od en solitareso. On anke havas la substantivo solitaro por persono; V-101.
solvar: (tr.) to solve (a problem, etc.) (cf. dis-solvar)
-ajo: what is to be solved, the problem
-ebla: (also phys.) solvable; soluble, dissolvable. Ex.: Solvar problemo, desfacilajo. La rezultajo di dis-solvo di sukro per aquo esas sukroza (dis-)solvuro.

somit-o: (geom., also of trees, mountains, etc.) summit, top. V. exp.: La suprajo ne esas sempre nek necese la somito, nam ol povas esar larja e plana; on ne parolas pri la «somito» di moblo, di (plata) domo. La suprajo di la tero tote ne identesas kun la somiti di la monti; II-163.
-egar: to be overpoweringly sleepy. Def.: Sentar la bezono o tendenco (momentala) dormar; IV-463. V. exp.: Dormema indikas kustumala tendenco a dormar, ne instantala stando.
sonali-o: small bell (as used on the harness of horses). Def.: Instrumento sonora, en formo di bulo kava, fendita, qua sonas per la bulo agitata interne; IV-14.

sond-ar: (tr., intr.) to take soundings in; (gen.) to sound: ascertain the depth of, explore the nature of the bottom; to fathom; (fig.) to try, test; (med.) to probe (with a probe), to sound (with a sound); (mining) to make a boring
sonj-ar: (intr.) to dream (while asleep; cf. revar). Ex.: Me dormis e sonjis ke me esis richa.
-eso: sonorousness. Ex.: Sonora voco, linguo. Ant.: matida.
soqu-o*: sock: shoe used by actors in ancient comedy.
-iero: sorb-tree, service tree, mountain-ash, rowan tree (genus: Sorbus).
sorc-ar: (intr.) to practise sorcery, witchcraft; (tr.) to bewitch
-isto: sorcerer: one who is supposed to be in league with evil spirits; (fig.) wizard, conjuror, magician
sordid-a, -ega, -acha: (of things) dirty, nasty, foul, soiled, sordid, slovenly, sluttish; (fig. of persons, acts) mean, disgusting (cf. shaminda, pudora)
-igar: to dirty, soil. Def.: Des-neta. Ex.: Sordida aquo, linji, chambro, manui, homo, avareso.
sordin-o: (lit. and fig.) sordino: a mute or damper on trumpet, violin, piano, etc.
sorg-ar: (tr.) to care for (by physical acts), take care of, look after (ulu, ulo); to take pains with

-ema: careful, painstaking, regardful (cf. diligenta). Ex.: Konfidar ad ulu la sorgo (pri). Komisar ulu por sorgar (pri). El esas la flegisto qua sorgas il. Sorga la stilo. Sorgema laboristo. (fig.) Esar sorgema pri sua honoro, sua reputo. V. exp.: vid. suciar.

-aro: assortment. (Note: For idiomatic uses of the E. «sort», «kind», cf. quaza, quala, tala, ul-maniere). Ex.: Ibe esas omna sorti di bestii. Quala viro! Il esas ulsorta (o quaza, od ulspeca) giganto.
sospir-ar: (intr.) to sigh, heave or fetch a s.; (tr., fig.) to sigh out, breathe forth. Ex.: Sospiro pro doloro. (fig.) Sospirar versi.
sovaj-a: (referring to living and growing persons, plants, trees, etc.) savage: wild (living in a state of nature) not domesticated, uncivilized; (fig.) unsociable; ferocious, fierce
-igar, -eskar: to make, become s. Ex.: Sovaja populi, animali. Anado sovaja (E. wild). (fig.) Mieno sovaja.
sozi-o: double, second self, counterpart. Def.: Persono qua esas perfekte simila ad altru.
-oza: spacious, roomy. Ex.: spaco havas tri dimensioni. Hike ne esas sata spaco. Spacala relati. Spacoza chambro.
span-o: chip (of wood, metal) (cf. rabot-uro). Def. Reziduo dil ago limar, rabotar o di altra tranchanta instrumento. V. exp.: vid. splito.
spant-o: a timber, rib, in the frame of a ship.
spanyolet-o: window-sash fastening (the ordinary bolt and catch; cf. kremono). Def.: Vekto ocilanta cirkum sua mezpunto e qua ingranas od embragas en hoki supre ed infre di la fenestro; IV-448.
spar-ar: (tr.) to economize, save, put by, husband; (intr.) to be economical, frugal
-buxo: money-box. Ex.: Sparar la revenui di la heredajo. On povas sparar tempo, kredito, forteso. Me sparis mil franki por futura uzo. Spariva procedo. Sparema mento.
sparadrap-o*: (pharm. Med.) cerecloth, sparadrap. Def.: Kataplasmo aglutinanta extensita sur linjo o papero. Ex.: Kovrar vunduro per sparadrapo.
spec-o: species (fig.) kind (cf. genero, sorto, qual-eso)
-o: a specific. Ex.: Graveso specifika. Esas specifika mikrobo en tuberkloso. Quinino esas specifiko kontre ula febro.
specimen-o: specimen, sample. Ex.: Montrar specimeno di frumento, di drapo, di vino, di insekto.
spektar-ar: (tr.) to look at or on, be a spectator of, witness; (cf. regardar, vidar, kontemplar)

-ajo: spectacle, sight, view (cf. spektaklo). Def.: Regardar longe, pasive, ma kun atenco ed intereso, quale en teatro od altra spektaklo; V-35. Ex.: Il spektis ta eventi. La aktori e la spektanti. La spektajo (od, vidajo) de ta vidpunto esis bela. Ta veneracinda viro esas spektindajo.
spekul-ar: (intr.) to speculate: (philos.) to theorize; (finan.) to make (financial) speculations. Ex.: Spekular pri metafizikala problemi, pri frumento.
spermacet-o: spermaceti (used for candles, cosmetics, etc.).
spic-o: spice: pepper, nutmeg, ginger, etc; (cf. kondimento, piklo)
spik-o: (bot.) ear: spike or head of corn, grain
spindel-o: spindle: piece of wood used for twisting and winding thread (cf. fuzelo; bobino, ruko)
spion-ar: (tr.) to spy on (ulu, ulo); (intr.) to act as a spy
spir-o: (geom.) a winding line like the threads of a screw, helix.
spiral-o: (geom.) spiral; (of a watch) hair spring; (in gen.) a spiral spring
-a, -atra: spiral: winding like the turns of a screw.
-isto: spiritist, spiritualist: one who professes to hold intercourse with departed spirits or believes such intercourse possible
-ismo: spiritism, spiritualism: doctrine or beliefs of spiritists
-eso: splendo(u)r. Def.: Brilanta; belega; luxoza. Ex.: Palaco splendida. Splendideso di la suno, di la trono.
splin-ar: (intr.) to be splenetic, be in low spirits
-igar: to give the blue devils to (ulu)
-o: spleen: hypochondriasis: morbid depression of mind; (cf. spleno).
splint-o: (tech.) small metal pin (used to fasten parts); (cf. stifto)
-ilo: splicing-fid, marlingspike. Def.: Specala maniero juntar du kordi per desplekto di l’extremaji e posa riplekto; III-86.
split-o: splinter, sliver, shiver, (of metal, glass, wood, etc.)

-igar: to splinter: cause to fly into splinters. V. exp.: Splito esas spano di tote nereguloza formo, dum ke spano havas formo dependanta de la materio e de l’instrumento per qua on laboras ulo; III-488.

spoli-ar: (tr.) to spoliate, (des)spoil, rob, pillage, sack, plunder. Def.: Desposedigar ulu, ulo de ulu per fraudo, o violento; for-portar violentoze. Ex.: Spoliar orfano de lua heredajo. Spoliado di urbo. Domo spoliita.
spontan-a: spontaneous: voluntary, self-acting, -moving. Ex.: spontana genitado. La movi di la kordio esas spontana. Spontaneso di ula ago.
sporadik-a: sporadic; scattered; (med.) not epidemic. Ex.: Dum ta yaro aparis sporadika kazi di kolero.
spoz-o: spouse: either one of a married couple
-igar: to make (ulu) one’s spouse, to espouse, wed (ulu)
-igar: to cause (ulo) to spout, to throw up, dash (liquids)
spring-ar: (intr.) to spring: rise upward and go forward with impetuosity
-o: spring, dash, rush, leap, bound; (cf. precipitar). Ex.: Il springis e saltis super la fenco.
spul-ar: (tr.) to reel: wind on a spool (thread, wire, etc.).
spum-o: foam, froth, spume: -acho: scum (bad sense)
squadr-o: (set) square: instrument for determining right angles
squal-o: (ich.) shark (genus: Squalus). V. exp.: vid. sharko.
-oza, -atra: scaly, squamous. Def.: La lameneti qui dependas de la pelo (di fishi, serpenti, e.c.); VI-603.
squat-ar: (intr.) to squat down (on one’s hams or heels); (cf. blotisar).
-igar: (tr.), -eskar: (intr.) to stabilize. Def.: Qua esas en stando, en situeso ferma, solida. Ex.: Stabila equilibro. Stabileso di edifico.
stacion-o: (building and place) station; R.R. depot; (R.C. rel.) station; (cf. gar-eyo)
-navo: s. ship. Ex.: Fervoyala staciono. Katoliko facas sua stacioni en la kirko.
stacionar-a: steady, stationary: not moving or changing at the time

-eso: steadiness. Ex.: La temperaturo povas esas stacionara, anke la stando di morbi, di arti. V. exp.: Stacionara ne esas la sama ideo kam fixa: ol esas plu proxima ad konstanta, ma indikas konstanteso en movo, per quaza equilibro sempre ruptebla
stadi-o: (Gr. measure and place for gymnastic contests) stadium.
stagn-ar: (intr.) to stagnate (of liquids); be at a standstill
-anta: stagnant. Ex.: Stagno di aquo od stagnanta aquo. (fig.) Mea aferi, komerco stagnas.
stakis-o: (bot.) hedge-nettle, wound-wort (genus: Stachys; cf. vulnerario).
stamp-o: (tr.) to stamp: imprint on the surface of something
stand-ar: (intr.) to be in a certain state, relative condition; to be in good or bad health
-o: state, stand, condition: state of being, manner of existing
stang-o: bar (of wood or metal), rod, pole; leg (of a table); stem (of a candlestick, etc); stock (of a key, nail, anchor)
stapl-o: distributing point for goods, as a seaport or large inland city, staple-mart or entrepot.
starch-ar: (tr.) to (stiffen with) starch; (fig.) to stiffen
-ivo: starch (for linen). Def.: Rigidigar per amilo.

start-ar: (tr., intr.) to start: set going, cause to act (as a machine, train, sport). Ex.: Me startas la motoro. La motoro startas facile. On povas startar la motoro di automobilo sen departigar la veturo. Starto di konkurso.
starter-o: starter (of a race). Def.: Ta qua direktas, imperas la departo; IV-338.
statut-o: statute, written decree or law; by-law; article (of association; cf. lego)
steb-ar: (tr.) to quilt, to (pad and) stitch; to stitch (with a machine)
-mashino: sewing machine. V.exp.: Stebar esas sutar per mashino, quo ne esas propre sutado, nam mashino uzas generale du fili, e la sutado nur un; II-646.
stek-ar: (tr.) to stick: thrust point in, drive in (by point); (hort.) to propagate by cuttings or slips (cf. spros-ifar)
-ajo: (hort.) slip, cutting. Def.: Enirigar ulo en ulo per la pinto. Ex.: Stekar paliso en la sulo.
-izar: to star: stud, cover (ulo) with stars
stenogfraf-ar: (tr.) to take down (ulo) in short-hand
stentor-o: (antiq.) Stentor: a person with a powerful voice
-ala: stentorian: extremely loud. Ex.: Stentorala voco.
stereotip-ar: (tr.) to stereotype; (fig.) to fix firmly or unchangeably; (cf. klishar)
steril-a: sterile, barren, unfruitful; (fig.) fruitless, vain; (cf. arida)
-skarabeo: (ent.) coprophagan; dung-beetle. Def.: La dungo formacita ek la exkrementi di animali (mixita kun palio); VI-248.
stern-ar: (tr.) to lay (ulu, su) down at full length.
stertor-ar: (intr.) to have a death rattle; to have a rattle in the throat (from respiratory trouble).
stift-o: peg: small pin of wood or metal used for fastening hinges, frames, clocks, etc.
stigmat-o: brand (of a hot iron); (bot.) stigma; scar of a wound (cf. cikatro); (pl. theol.) stigmata (of Christ); (entom.) stigmati (on the tracheæ); (fig.) stigma: mark of infamy

-izar: to mark with a brand or with scars; (fig.) to set a mark of disgrace on (ulu, ulo). Ex.: La stigmato di puniso, di la variolo, di vicio, sur la korpo di Francisko di Assisi. Variolo (e metafore, krapulado) stigmatizas la vizajo. Me stigmatizas ta aserto kom mentio.
stil-o: (lit., artist) style, tone, manner; diction: selection of words (cf. diciono); (bot. and antiq.) style
-oida: (anat.) styloid. Ex.: Moblaro segun la stilo di Louis XIV. Stilo moderna, historiala. Ta auturo havas bona stilo.
stilistik-o: stylistics. Def.: Cienco o teorio di stilo; IV-707.
stimular: (tr.) to stimulate, rouse, excite; to spur on, incite; to goad (oxen); (cf. ecitar)

-ivo, -ilo: stimulant, stimulus; (fig.) goad, spur. Ex.: Intereso stimulas la mento. Lua indolenteso bezonas stimulivo. Porciono stimulanta. Stimul-ilo por bovuli. Stimulita da hungro. Ant.: stupor-igar.
stipendi-o: (in public schools or colleges) exhibition, scholarship, bursary (in Scotland): a sum of money granted to pay, wholly or in part, the expenses of a pupil’s education
-o, -uro: stipulation. Ex.: Stipular garantio. Stipuluro di kontrato.
stiv-ar: (tr., nav.) to stow (a cargo), trim (a hold)
stof-o: stuff, fabric, tissue, cloth: any woven fabric
stoik-a: (philos. and fig.) stoic(al): unaffected by passion
-eso, -ismo: (quality, doctrine) stoicism. Ex.: Stoika vertuo. Zeno esis stoiko e docis stoikismo. Ica homo manifestas stoikeso. Stoikala doktrino.
stok-o: (com.) stock. Def.: Quanto de komercaji o pekunio disponebla da vendisto. Ex.: Stoko de frumento. Stoko en magazino. Stoko de oro en banko.
ston-o: pebble, small stone, loose rock (cf. petro, roko)
-oza: full of (small) stones, pebbly, flinty (of roads, etc.)
-izar: to macadamize, gravel, ballast: cover with small stones
stop-ar: (tr.) to stop up, choke up, stuff up (a hole, bottle, etc.; cf. obstruktar, obturar)
stor-o: roller-blind, spring-blind or curtain (cf. jelozio, persieno).
storax-o: (bot., pharm.) storax. Def.: Speco di balzamio; IV-707.

stoter-ar: (tr., intr.) to stammer, stutter, lisp from natural defect). V. exp.: Balbutado eventas che l’infanti, pro ne-habileso, o che l’adulti pro pavoro od altra emoco; kontre ke stoterado esas konstanta defekto di pronuncado; IV-518.
-eto: small s.; lane (in town); alley, court
strand-ar: (intr., also fig.) to strand: run aground or on shore: -igar: to run (a ship, boat) aground, to beach.

strangular: (tr.) to strangle, choke, stifle, throttle (ulu); (cf. asfixiar, sufokar, garot-agar); Def.: Mortigar per presar la trakeo; perdigar, haltar la respirado. Ex.: Li strangulis per kordo. Il mortis pro stranguleso. (fig.) strangular ula cienco, ula arto.
stranj-a: strange, unusual, uncommon, odd, singular, queer (cf. baroka)

-ajo: a strange thing, oddity, curiosity. Def.: Qua esas kontre kustumo, ordinara experienco, kustumala ordino, la komuna raciono. Ex.: Stranja dicajo, bruiso, aranjo, vivo. Esas stranja ke il ne ja advenas. La stranjeso di lua vestaro, di lua konduto.
stranjer-a: foreign, not native; (fig.) extraneous (jur.) irrelevant

-ajo: an extraneous body; (chem., surg.) a foreign substance. Def.: Qua esas de altra naciono; qua ne apartenas ad korpo. Ex.: Stranjera lando; linguo, milito, aferi, relati. Trovar ulo stranjera (kontre-natura) en korpo. Argumento stranjera (ne-apartenanta, ne aplikebla) a la kazo, proceso, temo. Note: The E. word «stranger» is ordinarily to be translated by ne-konocato: He is a stranger to me: me tote ne konocas il: il esas ne-konocata da me.
stras-o: strass: a brilliant glass used for artificial gems; a paste (diamond).
-isto: strategist. Ex.: Napoleon esis maestro do strategio. Jomini esis strategiisto. Strategiala pozicino.
strek-o: stroke, dash (as of a pen); (print.) dash; (geom.) a straight line
strid-ar: (intr.) to produce a strident noise, to creak
-anta: strident, shrill, creaking, grating. Def.: Produktar sono akra e penetranta. Ex.: Cikadi, gondo-bendi stridas. Voco stridanta.
strig-o: barn-, white-, screech-owl (genus: Strix flammea). Def.: Noktala raptema ucelo di qua la facio esas ornita per plumoza koliaro kompleta; IV-296.
strik-ar: (intr., of workmen) to strike, to go on strike, quit work: -anto: striker.
-eso: strictness. Def.: Des-ampla; IV-434. Ex.: Strikta senco, obligo, devo, en aferi. To esas strikte vera. Strikte parolanta.
strok-o: indicates a single movement, an elementary, sudden act: stroke, coup, feat; (in game) move; (fencing) thrust; (of dice) throw; (rowing) stroke; (of whips) smack
-ar: to do the act called for by the ideas above defined
strop-o: (nav.) strop, strap, sling (for a block, or piece of cargo)
-izar, -ligar: to strop (a block); to sling (casks, etc.).
struktur-o: structure: manner of building, construction, form; (fig.) disposition, arrangement. Ex.: Ta edifico havas stabila strukturo. La strukturo di la vivanta korpo, di poemo.
strum-o*: goitre, wen in the throat
student-o, -ulo, -ino: student; undergraduate; (cf. lern-anto). Ex.: Studento pri lego. Medicin-studento.
studi-ar: (tr., intr.) to study (ulo, pri ulo); (cf. lernar)
stul-o: chair: seat with back; (cf. tabureto, benko)

-ajo: silly thing; foolish act; absurdity. V. exp.: Stulta expresas ideo min forta kam stupida. Stupideso esas kompleta manko di inteligenteso. Stulteso esas plu juste manko di sagaceso, di judikado; II-711. Ant.: saja. I
stump-o: stump (of tree, limb, column, cabbage, etc.); core (of an apple)
-ita: stunted. Def.: Impedar la kresko e developo di ulu, ulo; IV-512.
stup-o: tow; (tech.) packing (of a piston, etc.)
-izar: to stop or cover with tow or oakum; (nav.) to calk (caulk); (tech.) to pack (a piston, etc.)
-igar: to make (ulu) s.; stultify, besot, dull. Ex.: Homi obtuza e stupida. Mieno stupida. Mala traktado stupidigas infanto. V. exp.: vid. stulta. Ant.: inteligenta.

sturm-o: storm, with thunder and lightning, thunderstorm; (fig.) tumult. V. exp.: Sturmo; mala vetero konsistanta ek fulmini, tondri, akompanata o sequata generale da pluvo o grelo. Tempesto: mala vetero konsistanta ek granda vento, qua sur la maro efektigas ondegi danjeroza por la navigado, e qua ofte akompanesas da pluvo. L’unesma fenomeno povas eventar sen vento; la duesma konsistas esence en vento, e povas eventar, sive sen pluvo o grelo, sive sen ula elektrala fenomeno; VIII-198.
stuv-o: a stove or room used to produce hot air for drying, or hot vapo(u)r for sweating; sweating room; hot-air bath; vapo(u)r-bath; drying-room

-agar: to dry or heat in a slow, moist heat; (med.) to foment (a wound); (cf. furnelo). V. exp.: On stufas koquajo en irga vazo klozita, e ne en stuvo. Existas stuvi humida e sika, t.e. kun o sen aquo-vaporo; II-648.
su: (reflex. Pronoun, 3rd person, singular or plural; acc.: sun): self, oneself, himself, herself, itself, themselves
sub: (prep.) under, below, beneath; lower in place or rank; denoting subordination, dependence
-eso: suddenness. Def.: qua esas tote ne-previdita. Ex.: Subita morto, chanjo di la vetero.
-ajo: sublime object. Ex.: Sublima abnego, genio.
-ato: a sublimate. Def.: Vaporigar ulo e lore rikondensar ol a stando solida.
submis-ar: (tr.) to reduce (ulu) to a state of submission, dependence, to subdue, subjugate

-ita: subdued, subjugated. Ex.: Submisar la rebeli, sua pasioni. Me submisas me a vua decido. La submiso di la urbo. Ica populo submisesas (facis sua submiso) ed esas nun en (stando di) perfekta submiseso.
submision-ar*: (intr.) to (make a) tender (por, pri) (a contract, loan)

-anto, -into: party making tender, contract. V. exp.: Submisionar esas: propozar su por entraprezar ula laboro (generale publika), aceptante la kondicioni anuncita da la labor-donanto, e demandante ula preco. Generale, plura entraprezisti esas invitata submisionar samtempe per letri siglita e sekreta, ed on adjudikas l’entraprezo a ta qua demandas la minima preco. To esas speco di auciono, o prefere, inversajo di auciono: vice vendar a la maxim-ofranto, on «kompras» de la minim-demandanto; VI-385.
subordin-ar*: (tr.) to (make) subordinate, subject (ulu, ulo, ad ulu, ulo)

-ite: subordinately. Ex.: La guvernerio subordinas la civitani a la  judiciisti. La legi subordinas la civitani a la judiciala oficisti. Subordinar sua volo ad altru. Mantenar subordineso en la armeo. Propoziciono subordinita. La chefo fidas a lua subordinati (od inferiori, od imperati).
suborn-ar: (tr.) to suborn: induce or instigate (ulu, uli) to do an evil deed, by bribes or the like; to bribe, tamper with; (cf. seduktar, koruptar)
subrog-ar: (tr., jur.) to surrogate, subrogate, substitute.
subsidi-ar: (tr.) to subsidize: grant a subsidy to (ulu)
-o: subsidizing, subsidy; sum granted. Ex.: Subsidiar paketboto. La subsidiajo esis 50 mili, ma mem ca subsidio ne esis suficanta.
-ala: substantial (cf. esenco). Exd.: Substanci korpala, metala, liquida. Esis multa vorti ma nula substanco en la diskurso. Indemno substancala. Griza substanco di la cerebro.
-igar: to substantivize: to convert into, or use as, a substantive.
substituc-ar: (tr.) to substitute: put in place of another (ulu ad ulu, ulo ad ulo) (jur.) to entail (an estate)

-ato: a substitute. V. exp.: A remplasas (E.: takes the place of) B = A okupas (provizore o definitive) la loko (ofico, funciono, rolo) di B.  A remplas-eskas = A prenas (komencas okupar la loko di B, pozas su od aparas en la loko di B.  C remplas-igas B per A = C pozas (o produktas) A en la loko antee okupita da B. En la sama kazo, C substitucas A a B, od, C remplasigas B per A (E. puts A in place of B). Praktikal regulo: Omnafoye kande la propoziciono kontenas tri termini, on devas uzar remplas-igar o substitucar, ne remplasar. Uzez la prepoziciono «ad» kun substitucar, ne «per». Uzez «per» kun remplas-igar. (Substitucar un kozo ad ultra; remplas-igar un kozo per altra; do, en la pasivo: remplasata da … remplasigata per … e substitucata a ….. ); III-102. V-283; kp. suplantar, suplear.
substitut-o: (jur.) deputy magistrate, surrogate. V. exp.: Substituto esas la nomo di ofico di persono; por la kozi ni havas surogato; IV-583.
subtil-a: (physical) subtile: not dense or gross; (mental) subtile, subtle: keen, sharp, acute

-igar: to subtilize: render fine or ethereal; to draw subtle distinctions in, refine into niceties. Ex.: Subtila veneno, polvo. Subtila intelekto, mento. La subtilaji di metafiziko. Troa subtileso nocas argumento.
subvencion-ar: (tr.) to grant a subvention to, subsidize
-o: subvention: government aid or bounty; (cf. subsidiar). Ex.: Subvenciono di teatro di la stato.
subvers-ar: (tr.) to subvert: overturn from the foundation: bring to ruin or destrucion, as by moral or political force; (cf. renversar)
-anta, -iva, -ema: subversive. Ex.: Ta doktrino subversas la principi di etiko. Subverso di la stato per anarkio. Doktrino subversiva.
suced-ar: (tr., intr.) to succeed: came after, follow in order, (cf. sequar; sucesar)
-ar (od, inter-sequar) l’una l’altra: to succeed, follow one another. Ex.: Jorno sucedas la nokto. La sucedado di nia idei. Louis XII esis la sucedanto di Charles VIII. Chapitri sucedanta.
suces-ar: (intr.) to succeed: accomplish one’s purpose, be successful
suci-ar: (tr.) to care about: be concerned, solicitous, anxious about (ulu, ulo)
-ifar: to perspire, be in a sweat
sufic-ar: (intr.) to suffice, be sufficient (ad, por)
-as: (impers.) it is sufficient; that is enough; that will do

-ante: sufficiently. Ex.: Cent franki suficos a me. Suficajo de frumento.Kapaceso suficanta. Esar suficante klara. To suficas a me, equivalas: me konsideras, aceptas to kom suficanta. V. exp: vid. saciar, sat.
-igar: to suffix: annex at the end of a word.
sufl-ar: (intr.) to blow (wind, etc.); (tr.) to blow: force wind or breathe upon; (theat.) to prompt (a speaker); (chess, checkers) to huff
sufok-ar: (tr., intr.) to suffocate, stifle, smother, choke; (fig.) to check, subdue; (cf. strangular)

-anta, -iva: suffocating, stifling. Ex.: La nutristino sufokas la dormanta infanto. Sufokar la karbonfairo. Sufokar sua singluti. Me sufokis pro irocego, pro la varmegeso. Astmo donas la sento di sufoko. Aero sufokanta. V. exp.: vid. asfixiar.
sufr-ar: (tr., intr.) to suffer (from), be afflicted with; (cf. dolorar, subisar, tolerar)
sufraji-o*: (R.C. rel.) suffrage: a short prayer.
sufuzion-o: (med.) suffusion: extravasation of some humour.
sug-ar: (tr.) to suck (candy, etc., ulo de ulo)
sugest-ar: (tr.) to suggest, intimate (ulo ad ulu)
-anta, -iva: suggestive. Ex.: To sugestis ideo a me. Sugesto hipnotala. Sugestiva penso. Lu mem ne sugestetis la ago a me.
suk-o: juice: sap (of vegetables) the water (of fruit)
sukomb-ar: (intr.) to succumb (ad), to yield, get worsted. Ex.: Sukombar a tento, a doloro, sub la pezajo.
-izar: to s.; put s. in or on; to sweeten
sukus-ar: (tr.) to cause violent vibrations in, to shake, shake off, jerk, jog, jostle, jolt; (cf. agitar, ocilar, shancel-igar, tremar)
-ope: by shakes, jerks. Ex.: Sukusar arboro, tablo, sua kapo. Sukusado la polvo de la vesto. Sukusado di veturo sur voyo aspera.
sulk-o: (also fig.) furrow (as made by plow); ship’s track
sum-o: (math.) sum, amount, total; (cf. toto, agreg-ajo)
-e: (fig.) finally, on the whole, after all
-igar: to sum up, cast up, totalize
-igo: summing up. Def.: Rezultajo di la adiciono di plura nombri o quanti. Ex.: La sumo di la unaji. Sumigar du nombri.
sumari-a: (adj.) summary. Def.: Dic-esas pri agi facita rapide, sen tempo-perdo o neutila formulaji. V-623. Ex.: Sumaria judiko.
sumn-ar: (tr.) to summon, call authoritatively upon
-o: summons, Def.: Demandar impereme o postular segun yuro e legala formi; III-417. Ex.: Sumnar debanto pagar. Sumnar fortreso kapitulacar.
suol-o: sole (of boots, shoes) (cf. plando); a sort of horn under a horse’s hoof
supe-ar: (intr.) to sup, take a (midnight) supper; (noktomezala) -o: (midnight) supper
super: (prep., elevation) over, above (but not in contact with; cf. sur); (of degree) over, more than, greater than, superior to
-igar: to make (ulu) c., to puff up
-esar, -eskar: to be, become c. V. exp.: Superbeso produktas ecesiva su-estimo
-ajo: (object) superfluity; overplus, (work of) superogation. Def.: Qua esas troa. Ex.: Ornivi, regreti superflua. Superflueso de vorti. Esas superfluaji en ta verko.
-eso: superiority. Ex.: La arki-episkopo esas la superioro di (od esas superiora ad) la episkopo, e do havas superioreso. V. exp.: vid. alta. Ant.: inferiora.
-eso: s. service or time; state of being a s. Def.: Employato quan on admisas exter rango, por vartar ordinara employo; IV-584.
supin-o: (gram.) supine: verbal noun, similar to the English verbals in -ing.

suplant-ar: (tr.) to supplant (a rival, etc.). V. exp.: B supleas A kande lu okupas la loko (ofico, funciono, rolo) di A nur provizore, ne kun la sama yuri o grado. B suplantas A kande lu privacas A de lua loko por remplasar lu permanante; kp. Substitucar.
suple-ar: (tr.) to supply: make up, make good (the defficiency), furnish (what is wanted); to take the place of, the duty of (temporarily)
-anto: substitute, assistant, deputy. Ex.: Lua laborego supleas (E. makes up for) (manko di) talento. Cadie Sro. X. supleos vu. V. exp.: vid. suplantar.
-e: in addition, by way of s.
suplik-ar: (tr.) to supplicate, humbly beseech, entreat, beg (ulu pri, por ulo). Def.: Pregar ulu kun insistemeso e submiseso. V. exp.: vid. implorar.
suport-ar: (tr., lit. and fig.) to support: bear the weight of; (cf. sustenar, tolerar)

-anto: (person) supporter, upholder. Ex.: La pilastri qui suportas la vulto esas suportili. Suportar la spensi di familio. Suportar (E. bear) la koldeso, la doloro. Esar sen suporto, sen helpo, sen amiki. Suportanti di la guvernerio. V. exp.: Suportar esas portar kozo sen movo, tale ke ol ne falez; ma portar uzesas generale kun movo. Metafore, suportar uzesas en senco vicina di tolerar; IV-162
supoz-ar: (tr.) to suppose, assume (ulo, pri ulo)
supr-e: on top, overhead, above, aloft, on high; upwards, upstairs (cf. supere)
-a: top, of or relating to what is highest up in space or degree
supres-ar: (tr.) to suppress, do away with
-ajo: what is suppressed. Def.: Impedar existar o (jurnali, e.c.) aparar. Ex.: Supresar sedicio, libro, imposto. Supreso di pruvo di krimino. V. exp.: vid. abolisar.
sur: (prep.) on, upon: above and in contact with the upper part of something; resting on the top of (cf. super, an); (arith.) divided by
supin-o: (gram.) supine: verbal noun, similar to the English verbals in -ing.

suplant-ar: (tr.) to supplant (a rival, etc.). V. exp.: B supleas A kande lu okupas la loko (ofico, funciono, rolo) di A nur provizore, ne kun la sama yuri o grado. B suplantas A kande lu privacas A de lua loko por remplasar lu permanante; kp. Substitucar.
suple-ar: (tr.) to supply: make up, make good (the defficiency), furnish (what is wanted); to take the place of, the duty of (temporarily)
-anto: substitute, assistant, deputy. Ex.: Lua laborego supleas (E. makes up for) (manko di) talento. Cadie Sro. X. supleos vu. V. exp.: vid. suplantar.
-e: in addition, by way of s.
suplik-ar: (tr.) to supplicate, humbly beseech, entreat, beg (ulu pri, por ulo). Def.: Pregar ulu kun insistemeso e submiseso. V. exp.: vid. implorar.
suport-ar: (tr., lit. and fig.) to support: bear the weight of; (cf. sustenar, tolerar)

-anto: (person) supporter, upholder. Ex.: La pilastri qui suportas la vulto esas suportili. Suportar la spensi di familio. Suportar (E. bear) la koldeso, la doloro. Esar sen suporto, sen helpo, sen amiki. Suportanti di la guvernerio. V. exp.: Suportar esas portar kozo sen movo, tale ke ol ne falez; ma portar uzesas generale kun movo. Metafore, suportar uzesas en senco vicina di tolerar; IV-162
supoz-ar: (tr.) to suppose, assume (ulo, pri ulo)
supr-e: on top, overhead, above, aloft, on high; upwards, upstairs (cf. supere)
-a: top, of or relating to what is highest up in space or degree
supres-ar: (tr.) to suppress, do away with
-ajo: what is suppressed. Def.: Impedar existar o (jurnali, e.c.) aparar. Ex.: Supresar sedicio, libro, imposto. Supreso di pruvo di krimino. V. exp.: vid. abolisar.
sur: (prep.) on, upon: above and in contact with the upper part of something; resting on the top of (cf. super, an); (arith.) divided by
-ega, stone surda: stone-deaf, deaf as a post.
sur-dento: tooth grown over another, projecting tooth.
-ala: superficial: relating to the s.; (fig.) specious (plan, judgement, reasoning; cf. ne-profunda, ne-serioza)
surkrut-o: sauerkraut. Def.: Kaulo fermentacinta; II-711.
surmen-ar: (tr.) to overdrive, drive beyond one’s strength, overtax, overstrain (super-charjar, fatigar). Ex.: Surmenar kavalo. Surmenar sua forteso per laborado, sua mento per studiado.
surogat-o: (of things) substitute: that which is put in place of another thing; (med.) succedaneum
supriz-ar: (tr.) to surprise, take by s., take unawares, to come or fall upon suddenly and unexpectedly, overtake suddenly; (cf. astonar, kaptacar)
-anta: surprising. Ex.: Surprizar furtero, la enemiko. Mi-voye la pluvo surprizis ni. Li timas surpriz-atako da la enemiko. Donar surpriz-buxo a la puero.
survey-ar: to keep an eye on, superintend, look after, watch over, inspect

-anto, -ero, -isto: inspector, overseer, superintendent. Def.: Sorgar afero, tasko, ulo, kun partikulareso e autoritato. Ex.: Generalo devas surveyar omno. Surveyar la afero e la laboristi en fabrikerio. Surveyar la konduto di ulu. Surveyo di lernanti o karcerani.
suskript-ar: (tr., intr.) to subscribe: contribute a definite sum to an undertaking; (cf. signatar, subskribar)
-o: subscription: act of contributing (N.B. not to a newspaper, cf. abono); the consent in writing
-ajo: subscription: amount contributed. Ex.: Me suskriptas cent franki kom yarala kontributo ad ca entraprezo. Me abonas ta revuo ed anke suskriptas pekunio por la mantenokaso.
suspekt-ar: (tr.) to suspect: hold in suspicion, to distrust; doubt the hono(u)r, fidelity or sincerity of; to imagine guilty; (cf. des-fidar, konjektar)
-indo: a suspect. Ex.: Suspektar ulu pri krimino, pri herezio. Ta suspekto esas male fondita. Lu mem suspektas sua amiki.
suspend-ar: (tr., phys. sense) to suspend, hang up: fix (ulo) on high and leave hanging; (cf. pendar, akrochar)
suspens-ar: (tr.) to suspend (functionaries, judgement, privileges, work) (cf. suspendar, halt-igar, interruptar). Def.: Revokar dum tempo; VI-163.
susten-ar: (tr., phys. and fig.) to sustain, bear, uphold; prevent from falling (cf. sub-tenar, suportar, mantenar, helpar, defensar)
sustracion-ar: (tr., arith.) to subtract, deduct (ulo, de ulo). Ant.: adicionar.
sustrakt-ar: (tr.) to abstract, appropriate (fraude); purloin, steal, embezzle (money, etc.). Def.: Deprenar o furtar ulo per habileso o per fraudo.
susur-ar: (tr., intr.) to whisper, murmur or mutter (words); (fig.) to whisper, sough (of the wind)
-anta, -ema; -anto, -emo: whisper-ing, -er. Def.: Parolar nelaute; (fig.) facar duranta nelauta bruiso, ex, «la vento susuras en l’arbori;» IV-600.
-eso: sovereignty. Ex.: Autoritato suverena. En demokratio, la populo havas la suvereneso.
fa: (mus.) fa: fourth note of the diatonic scale.
-uro: object made, -erio: factory, works, mills. (cf. manufakturo)
fac-ar: (tr., lit. and fig.) to make (a concrete object); to do, perform (a certain act)
-igar: to cause (ulu) to make (ulo); to have (ulo) done (da ulu); (cf. igar)
-izar: to put f.s on, cut with f.s
faci-o: (gen.) front part or view (of anything); (cf. vizajo, averso)
«facies»: (anat., geol., biol.) facies: general aspect or appearance of anything.
facil-a: easy (to do), facile, not difficult
facin-ar: (tr.) to fascinate. Ex.: L'amoro facinas la okuli. On dicas ke la serpento facinas sua viktimi.
facion-ar: (intr.) to be on sentry duty, mount guard

fak-o: anything portioned off, as a compartment, division (in a desk), stall (in a stable); branch, proper office, province, department, speciality (in a business, profession, government, field of knowledge)
-eto: pigeon-hole; small specialty of duty, in research
faktori-o: (com.) factory: trading agency. Def.: Kontoro di agenti di kompanio komercala en lando stranjera.
«faktotum»: factotum: a doer of all kinds of work.
fakultat-o: faculty, power of doing anything; (of a university) faculty
-inta: fallen, -igar: to cause to fall, to fell, (ulo, ulu)
falc-o: (carp.) check, rebate, ledge (of a door or shutter). Def.: Speco de kanelo en la kadro di pordo, por recevar la bordo di ca pordo; V-621.
falch-ar: (tr.) to mow down (with a scythe); (fig.) to cut down, destroy
fald-ar: (tr.) to fold (a letter, etc.) (cf. plisar)
fali-ar: (tr., intr.) to fail, miscarry, miss (an aim), not to succeed; (com.) to fail, to become insolvent without implication of disgrace; (cf. bankrotar)
-igar: to cause to miss, to fail; to frustrate
fals-a: false, imitating in order to deceive as, f. hair, teeth, windows, signatures, money, jewels, drugs, etc.; not genuine, spurious
falv-a: fallow, fawn-colored, tawny, of a yellowish-brown color, pale red
-izar: to cover with fame, render illustrious.
famin-o: famine. V. exp.: Ne esas hungro, mem general, ma manko di la maxim necesa nutrivi en tota lando o populo; IV-10; (cf. indijar).
-eskar: to become a f., infatuated (cf. fol-eskar). Ex.: Fanatika zelo, doktrini, homi.

fanfaron-ar: (intr.) to bluster, boast, brag, swagger, bluff. V. exp.: Fanfaronar esas exajerar sua avantaji, sua forteso, e.c., per paroli od altra signi, por trompar la ceteri. Ostentar esas montrar ed expozar kun afektaco e superbeso sua avantaji, precipue la luxo, richaji, belaji, por ecitar l'admiro di la ceteri; II
fang-o: mud, mire, watery dirt as on streets, etc.
fantasmagori-o: phantasmagoria, dissolving view. Def.: Arto produktar fantomi, t.e. ombri od imaji iluzioniganta; IV
fantastik-a: fantastical, fanciful. Def.: Qua relatas kozi od enti nereala o neposibla; IV
fantazi-ar: (tr.) to have a fancy for (ulu, ulo), to have an idea an inclination (facar ulo); agar segun sua -o: to act according to one's fancy
fantom-o: phantom, shade, ghost, specter, apparition; (fig.) something unreal
faradiz-ar*: (tr., med.) to faradize, to stimulate with faradic electric currents.
farandol-o: farandole, a dance of Provence.
farb-o: paint, artificial coloring matter (cf. fardo, pigmento)
farcin-o: (vet.) farcin, farcy, a form of glanders.
fard-o: paint (for face or body); (theat.) make-up
farm-ar: (tr.) to farm (land taken on lease)
fars-o: (cook.) farce: stuffing, forcemeat; (theat. and fig.) farce.
fasad-o: facade, the front or chief face of a building.
fask-o: bundle, a number of things of a certain length, put together; sheath; stack; bunch; (opt.) pencil (of luminous rays); (antiq.) fasces
-igar, -ifar: to bundle up, stack, put in sheaves.
-o, -uro: the build, fashion, make, cut, workmanship. Def.: Laborar ula materio por fabrikar objekto definita (fasono di vesto, di juvelo); IV-165.
fatig-ar: (tr.) to fatigue, tire, weary; (cf. tedar, enoyar)
fatu-a: foppish (in dress); self-conceited, fatuous (in mind)
fauc-o: (anat. and fig.) (exterior) throat, gullet, fore part of neck (cf. guturo); (geog.) space from which something has been gouged, defile, ravine, deep glen

-ala: (anat.) jugular. Def.: Indikas l'extera ed avana parto di la kolo (do anke la laringo, ma extere vidata); e, pro ke ta parto formacas kava profilo (inter la mandibulo o mentono e la pektoro), la vorto fauco uzesas per metaforo internaciona por expresar multa formi kava, en tekniko, en geografio (montala fauco), e.c.; III-165. IL
favor-ar: (tr.) to favor, treat or regard with kindness, befriend
febl-a: (lit. and fig.) feeble, weak, faint; (cf. debila, frajila)
-ajo: a weak object or spot, foible
feder-ar: (tr.) to (con-)federate, federalize, ally, form an alliance (of states, nations; cf. aliancar)
fek-o: feces, excrement (of man or animal)
-ifar: to void the bowels, defecate (cf. kakar)
fekund-a: fecund, prolific (of living beings only; cf. fertila)
-igar: to make f., impregnate. V. exp.: vid. fertila. Ant.: ne-fekunda, sterila.
fel-o: hide, pelt, fell, skin detached from body and dressed; (cf. furo).
felg-o: felly, outer rim of wheel
felp-o: (fabric) a kind of plush, shag, velveteen.
femin-a, -ala: she, feminine (N.B. applied chiefly to animals to distinguish sex); (cf. hom-in-a, -ala)
fend-ar: (tr.) to split (lengthwise), slit, cleave; (cf. krevis-ar); (fig.) to rend (the heart)
fenomenologi-o*: phenomenology, description, history, or explanation of phenomena.
-a, -ala, -oza, -atra: of, relating to iron; ferrous, ferruginous
-izar: to put iron on (ulo), to bind, fit, hoop (with iron)
ferm-a: firm: solid, stable, fixed, compact, stout; (cf. solida, stabila); (fig.) which does not tremble, steady, steadfast, bold, resolute

-eskar: to become firm, strong, established, settled. -e: firmly, steadily; (interj.) hold fast; do not flinch! Ex.: Ferma tero. Stacar ferme. Karno ferma. Parolar en tono ferma. Fermigar sua rezolvo. Ant.: mola, shancel-anta, vacil-anta, febla.
ferment-o: a ferment (as yeast, leaven); (fig.) which excites or gives rise to.
fermentac-ar: (intr.; also fig.) to ferment; (of dough) to rise.
feroc-a: ferocious. Def.: Sovaja, kruela e violentoza; III
-igar: to fertilize. V. exp.: Fertila ne esas la sama ideo kam fekunda: ento fekunda genitas ento simila a su
fervor-ar: (intr.) to be fervent, be earnest, eager, zealous; (cf. ardorar, zelar)
fest-ar: (intr.) to observe a holiday; (rel.) to keep a feast
festin-ar: (tr., intr.) to feast, eat sumptuously, banquet
fi!: fie! shame! faugh! ugh! pish! phew!
fiakr-o: hackney-coach, cab, four-wheeled public carraige
fial-o: vial. V. exp.: vid. botelo.
fianc-ar: (tr.) to betroth, affiance, pledge in marriage
-igar: to thread out (ulo); -eskar: to become fibrous.
fibul-o: (antiq.) fibula, a buckle or clasp (cf. peroneo); -izar: (surg.) to infibulate.
fid-ar: (intr.) to trust, put one’s trust (in); rely (upon); put confidence (ad ulu, ulo); (cf. konfidar); o-: confidence, reliance, faith
fideikomis-o: (jur.) a trust (of an estate or property)
-eso: fidelity, fealty, allegiance (cf. vasal-eso, devot-eso, loyal-eso); -o-juro: oath of allegiance
fier-a: proud, proper sense of self-respect or self-esteem
figur-o: (also geom. rhet.) figure, outside form, shape of a body; appearance, representation
-izar: to figure, form into a determinate shape, represent (in picture) or statuary
figurant-o, -ulo, -ino: (theat.) figurant, accessory dancer or character.
fiktiv-a: fictitious, imaginary, not real. Ex. Fiktiva persono, valoro.
-igar: (tr.) to spin (ulo), to make into threads
filament-o*: filament (of plants, of nerves, etc.)
filas-o: tow, harl (of flax, hemp, for spinning). V. exp.: La materio ek qua on filifas. Filaso ne esas stupo; nam on ne povas filigar stupo; III
filet-o: fillet, chine (of beef, fish); thread (of a screw, worm)
-izar: to cut a thread on. Ex.: Fileto de soleo. Skrub-fileto.
-ala: philharmonic (society, etc.). Def. Amo pasionoza por muziko.
-eso: filiation, relations of children to parents
filoxer-o: (ent. genus) phylloxera, plant lice (cf. afidio).
filtr-ar: (tr., intr.) to filter, strain, percolate
fin-ar: (tr., intr.) to finish, to end, leave off, to have done, come to an end
-igar: to finish (ulo), to cause to end, put an end to, terminate
-eskar: to draw to, to approach the end
fing-ar: (tr.) to feign, sham, pretend, (cf. simular)
-o, -uro: dissimulation; false appearance, pretence, sham; figment
-ita: feigned, fictitious. Def.: Simular por trompar. Ex.: Fingar joyo, maladeso. Il fingis amorar me.
finis-ar: (tr., tech.) to finish off (an article), to put the finishing touches to (ulo)
-limar: (tr.) to finish off (ulo) with a file. Def.: Finisado esas la lasta laboro, quan on facas pri ula material produkturo, por ke ol havez sua definitiva forma ed aspekto; VI-383.
-ar: (intr.) to (make a) f. Def.: Simulita atako. Termino teknikal di la skerm-arto, uzata anke metafore; V-484, 676.
firmament-o: (lit. and fig.) firmament. Def.: L'antiqua nociono di la cielo (kom solida vulto); V-484.
fisk-o: fisc: state or royal treasury; an exchequer
fit-ar: (intr.) -igar (tr.): (mechan., also of garments) to fit: suit as to shape, size
-igar: to fix, fasten (ulo), to appoint (a day)
fiziognomoni-o*: physiognomics: art of reading character.
fiziokrati-o: physiocracy: economic doctrine of Quesnay
flad-o: flawn, a sort of flat custard cake.
