-izar: to dress with f.s. Def.: Flago esas insigno (generale min granda kam standardo), qua indikas la lojeyo, navo o loko di ula chefo o di ula establisuro: ex. la Reda Kruco; III-31.
flagr-ar: (intr., chem.) to deflagrate: to blaze suddenly, flare up; (fig.) to be flagrant, flame into notice, be notorious
flak-o: small pool, puddle (of water, blood, etc.)
flam-o: flame, blaze, flash, flare; (fig.) flame (of passion), ardour, warmth (of affection)
-agar: (tr.) to pass (ulo) over a fire, to singe
flan-ar: (intr.) to lounge, saunter, loiter, stroll
flanj-o: flange (of a tube). Def.: Diskatra, salianta parto di tubi, stangi, e.c., qua uzesas por ligar li per skrubi; III-82. V. exp. vid. rebordo.
flank-o: side (of body); flank (of enemy); breast (of ship)
-e: at or from the side, flank
-umar: (tr.) to be on the f. of (ulo)
-apogar: (tr.) to prop up (ulo) on one side
-izar: (milit., arch.) to f., cover the f. of (ulo, per)
flar-ar: (tr.) to smell, scent (an odour, an object; cf. odorar)
-achar: to f. servilely, fawn upon, toady to (ulu)
flatu-ar: (intr.) to break wind, -(ad)o: breaking wind, flatus, poop
flech-o: (weapon) arrow; (arch.) spire; (fort.) bonnet, fleche, simple redan; (geom.) absciss (of a curve); (trig.) versed sine
fleg-ar: (tr) to nurse, care for (sick person, child; cf. sorgar)
-eyo sick-ward, place for nursing. V. exp.: vid. suciar.
fleret-o: (fencing-) foil. Def.: Speco di espado tenua e flexebla por skermado (generale kun butono ye la fino); IV
flex-ar: (tr., intr.) to bend (out of the straight), bow, flex
flirt-ar: (intr.) to flirt, coquet, make love in a trifling manner
-izar: to spangle. Def.: Ronda plaketo quan on sutas exemple sur vesto por igar ol brilanta; VI
flog-ar: to flog, whip, lash, flagellate, scourge (cf. verg-agar): -ilo: whip, lash.
flok-o: flake (as of snow); flock: lock of wool or hair; tuft
flor-o: flower, bloom, blossom; (fig.) flower (of speech), prime (of life), bloom (of innocence), etc.
-ifar: to bloom, blossom, be in flower
-eto: a small f. V. exp.: Floto indikas «ensemblo de navi» naviganta kune e komandata da un chefo
flotac-ar: (intr.) to float, to be afloat on the surface of a liquid
-igar: to (cause to) float, waft, raft (wood, etc.)
flotili-o: (nav.) flotilla. Def.: Floto (ne flot-eto) de mikra navi; VI
flu-ar: (intr.) to flow, run, glide (of liquids, elec.)
flug-ar: (intr.) to fly (in air), fly about, be wafted (by wind)
-folio: loose or detached sheet of paper
fluid-a: fluid, having parts freely mobile, separate and penetrable, as water, vapor, and air
-eso: fluidity. V. exp.: Fluido esas gaso o liquido; IV-162; (cf. liquida).
fluktu-ar: (intr.) to fluctuate, waver, float, move to and fro; (fig.) to be irresolute
fluvi-o: (large) river, a large stream of water flowing into the sea; (fig.) copious flow, torrent
flux-o: rise of tide, high, flood-tide
fol-a: mad, crazy, mentally deranged; (fig.) foolish, nonsensical, senseless
-eta: (fam.) cracked, touched (in the head); mad after, infatuated, doting on; (cf. dementa)
-igar: to make (ulu) crazy, to make some one foolish
foli-o: (bot.) leaf; thin sheet of something; folio: page number (folio 12 = pagino 12 of a sheet of which the reverse side is blank)
-ifar, -eskar: to produce l.s, break forth in l.
-umar: to turn over the leaves of a book.
folieton-o: feuilleton, literary part of a F. newspaper

folklor-o: folklore. Def.: Ico esas nek populala literaturo, nek populala tradicionaro, ma l'ensemblo di la verki, rakonti, kanti, kustumi qui naskis de la populo e karakterizas ol, e lua studiado: VII-279.
foment-ar: (tr., med.) to foment, apply warm lotions to; (fig.) to encourage, stir up.
fond-ar: (tr.) to found, establish (ulo, sur ulo); (cf. establisar)
-ajo, -uro: that which is founded, establishment, foundation (cf. fundamento). Ex.: Il fondis sua sistemo sur fakti nekontestebla. Fondar komercala firmo, imperio, religio.
fonograf-ar: (tr.) to record (ulo) on a phonograph
font-o: (pr. and fig.) font, spring: natural source (cf. fonteno)
-aquo: spring-water. Ex.: La fonti di Nil. Acensar rivero til la fonto. La fonto di lo bona e di lo mala. Laboro esas la fonto di richaji. Recevar novaji de bona fonto.
forc-o: (mechan.) force. Ex.: La forci natural esas l'aero, l'aquo, e.c. Forco centripetala.
forcat-o: galley-slave, convict (condemned to hard labor).
forceps-o: (surg.) forceps, an instrument used in midwifery (cf. pinc-eto).
forej-o: forage, fodder, food for beasts
forfet-o: contract, tender (at a stipulated price, whether the contractor lose or gain)
-ale: by contract, by the job, at a lump sum
fork-o: (agri.) pitchfork, hayfork, dungfork; (fig.) any two or three-pronged instrument
-anta, -iva: formative. Ex.: Formacar literi, nubi, triangulo, karaktero. Geologiala formacuro.
format-o: format, shape, size of a book.
-umar: (intr.) to swarm, teem, be full of (like ants)
-igar, -izar: to formulate, draw up in due form
foronomi-o*: phoronomics: geometry of kinematics. Def.: Geometrio di la movo, o cinematiko geometriala; III-263.
fors-ar: (tr.) to force, break open (a door, a lock), to compel (by mechanical means or power) ; (cf. koaktar).
forsan: (adv.) perhaps, may be, perchance. Ex.: Forsan il kredas lo. Forsan il venos, forsan no. Me ne savas precize quanta komizi laboras en ica kontoro; forsan tri o quar.
-eskar: to get s.; (of wind) to freshen
fortres-o: fortress, a large fort holding a garrison.; (fig.) a stronghold.
fortun-o: good fortune, good luck; (myth.) Fortuna
-oza: fortunate, lucky; (cf. hazard-oza). Def.: Bona chanco; V-492. Ant.: des-fortuno, des-felic-eso.
-eto: small hole; (of face or body) dimple
-ifar: to dig or make a pit. Def.: Kavajo o exkavajo plu o min larja e profunda (en tero).
fosat-o: ditch, trench; (milit.) moat. Def.: Foso longa o plu juste linea, qua formacas limito od obstaklo; IV
fost-o: post, a piece or timber set upright; stake (cf. paliso); jamb (of a door)
foy-o: time (in counting); occasion (repetition); turn (in series)
foyer-o: (theat.) foyer, lobby; (of the actors) green-room.
-igar: to make into or reduce to f.s.
frajil-a: (also fig.) fragile, brittle, easily broken or destroyed, not durable
frakas-ar: (tr.) to break to pieces, shatter, smash
-bruiso: crash (sound). (cf. ruptar). Ex.: Frakasar porcelana taso. Omna osti en lua korpo esis frakasata.
fram-o: (tech.) frame (work) (of a machine, wagon, etc.); chassis (of autom.); sash (of a window, etc.) N.B. not frame of picture; cf. kadro.
-izar: to cover with r.s; (fig.) to give a r. flavor to.
-atre, segun la Franca modo: in the F. fashion.
francisk-o: (French) battle-axe. Def.: Armo di l'antiqua Franki: hakilo kun du tranchivi; V
franciskan-o*: a Franciscan monk, gray friar.
frangul-o: (bot.) black alder tree, alder buckthorn Frangula (Rhamnus).
franj-o: fringe, border of loose threads
-izar: to f. (ulo): adorn, trim with a f.
franjipan-o: frangipane, jasmine perfume, also a liquor.
Franko: member of a former German people.
frankolin-o: (orni.) francolin: a species of partridge (genus: Pternistes).
frap-ar: (tr.) to strike, knock, hit, slap, rap; (fig.) to make an impression on (ulu)
fraud-ar: (tr., intr.) to defraud; cheat (in play)
fray-o: spawn, eggs of fish and also of frogs
fremis-ar: (intr.) to shudder, quiver, tremble (from passion; cf. tremar)
-igar: to cause to shudder. Ex.: On fremisas de (pro) hororo, iraco, de multa pasioni.
-ala: (gram.) frequentative. V. exp.vid. ofta. Ant. rara, ecept-a, -ala, unika.
frequent-ar: (tr.) to frequent, visit often, haunt; attend (a school)
fresh-a: fresh, recently made, gathered, done, obtained; not stale; sound, not impaired by time
frez-ar: (tr., tech.) to countersink; to widen, chamfer the upper part of a hole
friabl-a: friable. Def.: Qua esas facile reduktebla a pulvero.
friand-a: (of objects) dainty, nice, toothsome, savory
-ajo: titbit, dainty morsel, sweetmeat, table delicacy
-o: rubbing, friction. V. exp. vid. frotar.
-izar: (tr.) to refrigerate, preserve bt cooling, -iz-(ad)o: refrigeration
frip-o, -i: worn-out, old clothes or apparel, frippery, trumpery
-isto: old clothes dealer; second hand dealer.
frist-o: (jur.) fixed space of time; (legal) term; respite, delay, postponement. Def.: Tempo - quanto grantenda o grantita por efektigar ulo; VI
frivol-a: (of persons) frivolous, light-minded; (of things, acts) trifling, futile, petty
friz-ar: (tr., intr.) to curl, frizzle (the hair of the head, beard, mustache, etc.)
frog-o: frog: coarse braid or gallon crossing the breasts of a coat. (Not amphib. cf. rano).
frok-o: (monk's) cowl, hood (cf. kapuco); (in an extensive sense) (monk's) frock, gown
frol-ar: to graze, touch slightly in passing, brush past. Ex.: La kuglo frolis mea kapo.
frond-o: a sling ( as for throwing stones); (surg.) a sling (as used for arm) (cf. sharpo)
front-o: (anat.) forehead; (fig.) the fore part of anything
frontier-o: frontier. Def.: Limito inter du landi; II
frontispic-o: (book) frontispiece. Def.: Ilustruro qua opozesas (E. faces) a titul-pagino di libro e libro-parto; IV
fronton-o: (arch.) fronton, pediment; -eto: a little pediment over a door or window. Def.: Arkitektural ornivo triangula o mi-cirkla super la enireyo di edifico.

frot-ar: (tr., household term) to rub, scrub, shine up; polish (ulo) by rubbing; wax and polish (a floor, furniture) (cf. polisar). V. exp.: Frotar esas ekonomiala ago: on frotas parqueto, mobli, etc. Fricionar havas teknikala senco, sive en medicino, sive en mekaniko; II
frugal-a: frugal; (cf. spar-ema) Ex.: Frugala homo. Frugaleso di repasto.
-izar: to sow (ulo) with w., cover with w.
frust-a: worn out, defaced, corroded (of coins), weather-beaten (of statues)
frustr-ar: (tr.) to deprive unjustly (ulu, de ulo), to defraud; (N.B. not E. frustrate; cf. deceptar, fali-igar, van-igar). Def.: Privacar neyuste o neloyale; III
fudro: ton, large cask. Def.: Tre granda barelo (de 800 litri e plu multo); V
fug-ar: (tr., intr.) to flee (from), run away
-igar: to put (ulu) to flight, drive away, rout
-anto, -ero: fugitive, runaway. Ex.: Ni fugas de la enemiko. Ni fugigas la enemiko. Tempo fugas. La fugo ad Egiptia. Fuganta sklavo. Ca vivo esas fuganta (E. transient).
fuk-o: (bot.) fucus, sea-weed, kelp. Def.: Ordinara genero di algo.

ful-ar: (tr.) to tread (grapes), trample on (ulo); to full (cloth) (cf. tramplar). Def.: Pedo-presar (ulo) o marchar sur (ulo); (fig.) specala maniero traktar drapi; VI-114. Ex.: Fular la vitberi. La kavali fulis la gazono e la flori.
fulgur-ar: (intr.) to fulgurate, flash as or like lightning (cf. fulminar)
fulmin-ar: (tr., intr.) to fulminate, to lighten; to thunder and lighten; to flash; to blast (ulu); (fig.) to thunder forth (menaces, excommunication, etc. kontre ulu)
-izar: to cover with s.; to s. dry
funcion-ar: (intr.) to function (all senses): to function, act (kom), to perform the duties, fill an office, to work properly (of machinery, etc.); (cf. agar, laborar)
-igar: to make work, set going, put in play

fund-o: bottom, lowest part of something hollow, as b. of a vase, a well; that which stands at the bottom, as a liquid at the bottom of bottles; ground, solid substance under water, as of sandy b.; (fig.) basis, essential part
-e: at bottom, in the main, in reality
fundament-o: (pr. and fig.) that on which anything rests; foundation, groundwork, underpinning; (fig.) basis, ground; (cf. fond-uro, basamento)
-izar: to lay the f.s of (ulo). Ex.: La fundamento di edifico. La fundamenti di la universo, di la homala vivo, di la arti; Lua sistemo esas fundamentale nejusta.

funest-a: baleful, disastrous, distressing, pernicious, malign. Def.: Expresas ideo plu forta kam nociva, ma ne esas exakte nek sempre mortigiva; signifikas kauzo od okaziono di nefeliceso; IV-267. Ex.: Funesta evento, novajo, pasiono, milito. Ant.: favoroza.
fung-o: (also med.) (bot.) fungus, mushroom, (edible or poisonous as toadstool)
funikular-a: funicular, dependent upon the tension of a cord, cable
fuort-o: fort, fortified point, stronghold; (cf. fortreso).
furet-o: (zool.) ferret; (Putorius Furo); (fig.) ferret(er), inquisitive person
furgon-o: closed van or goods wagon (cf. kamiono); (milit.) baggage cart, ammunition wagon. Def.: Kargoveturo qua esas konstitucita ek kestego klozita en qua on inkluzas la vari; IV-291.
furi-ar: (intr.) to be in a state of extreme anger, momentary madness, immoderate passion
furnel-o: stove (for heating or cooking); kitchen-range
furnis-ar: (tr.) to furnish, supply (ulo ad ulu)
-anto, -ero, -isto: furnisher, purveyor; (theat.) property-man. Ex.: Furnisar pano, mobli, informo. V. exp.: On provizas ulu per ulo; on furnisas ulo ad ulu; kp. livrar.
-fabrikar: to make worthless merchandise, shoddy goods.
fust-o: (arch.) fust: shaft of a column; (of a cannon) chase.
fuze-o: rocket (as in fireworks); fuse (to a bomb, etc.)
fuzel-o: (geom.) spindle: a solid generated by the revolution of a curved line about its base; a fusiform figure
ced-ar: (tr.) to cede, yield (up); give (up); to assign (property);(cf. alienar)
cedrat-o: (fruit) cedrate: a kind of citron (cf. citrono)
cel-ar: (tr.) to hide, secrete, conceal, keep secret; -ita: hidden, clandestine
celebr-ar: (tr.) to celebrate, commemorate. Ex.: Celebrar mariajo, funero, jubileo, aniversario, meso; (III-199).
celul-o: cell: small room in convent, prison, etc.; small cavity (as in a honey-comb)
cement-o: cement: kind of mortar for building, as Portland c.
-izar: to c.; (of teeth) to fill a cavity with c.
cementac-ar: (tr., metall.) to cement: to convert iron into steel, to case-harden
cens-o: »cense«: amount of taxes, income, which entitles a person to vote
cent-o: one hundred; (in reckoning interest or fractional parts) cent.
-imo: a hundredth part (for other derivatives cf. duo)
centrifug-ar: (tr.) to act on something by centrifugal force
-ala: centrifugal. Def.: Agar, traktar per centrifugala forco; IV
centuri-o: (Rom. hist.) century: division of 100 men.
ceremoni-o: ceremony, formalities prescribed by authority or etiquette
cerizlaur-o: cherry-laurel, laurel-cherry; laurel bay, (Cerasus (prunus) laurocerasus).
cern-ar: (tr., milit., and fig.) to make a circle or ring around, encircle, to beset on all sides, besiege, beleaguer, blockade, invest, hem in; to cut or dig around (a tree)
-igar: to certify: make certain, assure, guarantee
ceruz-o: ceruse: white-lead. Def.: Sub-karbato di plombo, uzata kom farbo blanka; IV
ces-ar: (tr., intr.) to cease; to come to an end, leave off, stop
-igar: to put a stop or an end to, discontinue
-e: besides, moreover, for that matter, in other respects
chagren-ar: (intr.) to grieve, to have sorrow
-anta: sorrowful, sad. Ant. chagreno: joyo, gayeso.

chalenj-o: challenge-cup (N.B. not the E. »challenge« (cf. defio). Def.: (Premio en) konkurso en qua la premio ne donesas, ma prestesas dum tempo a la vinkinto, til ke altra partiso vinkas ica e konquestas la premio; VII-198.
chamad-o: chamade: trumpet or drum signal for parley.
chamar-o: (coat) polonaise. Def.: Speco di redingoto kun transversa kordoni avane, polona vesto de revolucional epoko dil XIX yarcento; V-222.
chambr-o: chamber, room; (fig.) a house of parliament
chanc-o: (good or bad) chance, luck, fortune; possibility
chanfren-o: face of a horse (or other animal, from ears to nostrils). Def.: Avana parto di kapo di kavalo; VII-198.
chanj-ar: (tr., intr.) to change, shift; (cf. kambiar, permutar, alterar)

-ebla, -ema: changeable, mutable, fickle. Def.: Substitucar ula kozo ad altra en un sama loko o funciono, anke prenar un kozo vice altra, o pos altra; VII-203. Ulo chanjas, kande, restante la sama esence, ol recevas altra stando, figuro, o qulaeso; III-37. Ex.: Me chanjas mea vesti. Me chanjas la tapiso. El chanjas sua kofio. On chanjas sua fako, vagono, treno, lojeyo (co nule signifikas ke on alteras ta kozi o transformas li; on livas li generale nealterita). Ant.: mantenar, restar, konservar.
chant-o: the small side or edge of a large flat body
chap-o: ferrule, cap; (ch. vest) cope; (arch.) coping.
chapel-o: hat (with brim all around, for man or woman)
char-o: (antiq.) chariot; (modern) a two wheeled cart or a four wheeled ornamented car
-eto: any light two wheeled cart, jaunting-car, cariole
chariot-o: good van, truck: four-wheeled sided wagon for carrying goods
-agar: to cart, truck. Def.: Kargo-veturo kun quar roti; IV
charj-ar: (tr.) to load, burden (somebody or something with something), to load (a gun), lade (a vehicle)
charm-ar: (tr.) to charm: delight, captivate, enchant; (cf. ravisar, facinar, sorcar)
charnir-o: hinge (of a door, a box, etc.); (mechan.) joint (as compasses)
chart-o: charter: document granting special rights or privileges.
chast-a: chaste: untainted by lewdness; (fig.) refined, pure (in taste, style)
che (prep) at, to, in (somebody's house, home, or place), with (to indicate customs)
-ala: chief's, relating to the leader; chief
-esar: to be chief, be in command
chelat-o: (helmet) sallet. Def.: Speco di kasko uzata en la mezepoko e 16a yarcento; IV
-eskar: to become, grow dearer. Def.: Multe kustanta; IV
cherp-ar: (tr.) to draw liquids; (cf. rakar); (fig.) to take, borrow. Ex.: Cherpar aquo de fonto, de rivero. Cherpar vino de barelo. La autoro cherpas peco de altra autoro.
chevron-o: (arch.) chevron (fig.) any inverted V-shaped object, as a rafter.
chifr-ar: (tr.) to write in secret cipher (cf. kriptografar)
chik-a: chic, stylish and original, natty, smart
-eso: chic, knack, skill, address (in doing anything); originality and taste (as in dress).
chinion-o: chignon: back hair of a woman.
chip-a: cheap, low (in price). Def.: Poke kustanta; IV-690. Ant.: chera.
chom-ar: (tr., intr.) to be out of work, to suspend work on, to rest from work
-eso: (state) cessation or want of work. Ex.: On chomas la sundii. La laboristi chomas pro blokal exkluzo.
chopin-o: a beer glass (containing about a pint); (fig.) a pint
chose-o: roadway, causeway, travelling part (for horses, carriages, etc.).
cibol-o: (bot.) cibol, a kind of onion. (Allium fistulosum).
cicisbe-o: cicisbeo. Def.: Amoranto di siorino, qua esas quaze oficale agnoskata e servas el publike; V-621.
cifr-o: digit (1, 2, 3, 4; I, II, III, etc.)
-eto: small number at side of a larger number, as 32. Def.: Tipo o signo qua reprezentas nombro (Araba o Romana).
cikatr-o: scar, cicatrice: mark remaining from wound or ulcer
ciklon-o: cyclone, tornado, typhoon; a violent rotary wind.
cikut-o: (bot. tree or poison) hemlock (Conium maculatum and species of Cicuta).
cinabr-o: cinnabar, (in the Fine Arts) vermilion
cindr-o: ash(es), cinders (of coal); embers (of wood); dust: remains of the dead; (cf. eskarbilo
-igar: to reduce (ulo) to ashes, incinerate (cf. kremacar
cinem-o: popular abbr. for cinematografilo or, more especially a moving-picture theater, cinema, picture-house.
cinematograf-ar: (tr., intr.) to show moving pictures
cintil-o: spark (of fire); sparkle (of anything shining or vivid)
-ifar: to emit sparks, to shine brightly, glitter, glisten, sparkle, flash, twinkle, scintillate.
cipo: (arch.) cippus: small pillar or column.
ciprin-o: (ich.) cyprinoid, scientific name for the carp: genus: Cyprinus.
circinata: circinate, rolled up like a young fern leaf.
cirkond-ar: (tr.) to surround, embrace, encompass (cf. cernar)
-anti: (fig.) confidants, friends, relations; Ex.: Me vidas oldi cirkondita da infanti.
-e: cautiously. V. exp.: Cirkonspekta ne esas simple prudenta, ma predenteso desfidema, qua »regardas cirkum su«, konsideras omna lateri od elementi ante decidar od agar; III
cirkonstanc-o: circumstance: a fact, occurence, or condition attending something else
cirkonvolucion-o*: cirkumvolution; that which is rolled around something (cf. parafrazo).
cirkuit-o: circuit: circumference, compass; roundabout way; (Eng. and U.S.) circuit (of judges)
cirkul-ar: (intr.) to circulate: to move around, to flow in a circuitous channel; (of money, etc.) to pass from hand to hand
-igar: to cause to c., move around; (money) put into circulation, issue. Ex.: La sango cirkulas en la korpo. La tero cirkulas cirkum la suno. Cirkulado di idei.
cirkum, -e: (prep., adv.) around, about, roundabout (place, time, quantity); (cf. proxim)
-ajo, -aji: surroundings, environment, frame, setting; (cf. medio) -irar: (tr., intr.) to go or wind around (as an obstacle)
-lekar: to lick around (one's chops), (fig). to gloat over
-vicina, -jac-anta: circumjacent. Ex.: Vu mustas vartar cirkume un horo. Vi departos cirkum tri kloki. El spensis cirkume duadek dollar-i. Me promenis en la tre interesant cirkumajo.
civil-a: civil: pertaining to a citizen and his rights (not milit., or criminal) lay (opposed to ecclesiastical)
-eso: civilization: state of advancement in the arts and sciences (cf. kulturo).
-ala: civic. V. exp.: Civismo esas devoteso di homo a sua sam-civitani o sam-statani
civit-o: city: the older, most ancient part of a town (cf. urbo)
